name: День захисника України
generalDescription: Присвячена вшануванню мужності та героїзму, нескореності й волелюбності борців за національну справу усіх поколінь та Дню захисника України. Це свято за історичною традицією відзначається 14 жовтня - у день Покрови Пресвятої Богородиці, за яким закріпилася ще й друга назва - Козацька Покрова, воно асоціюється з такими поняттями, як військова честь, звитяга, мужність та лицарство. Образ Божої Матері, яка тримає білу довгу покрову, став своєрідним оберегом України, символом її споконвічного прагнення до встановлення злагоди і миру.
averseDescription: На аверсі монети на тлі орнаменту розміщено: постать Пресвятої Богородиці, під омофором якої козаки (ліворуч) та сучасні воїни-захисники (праворуч); малий Державний Герб України (ліворуч); угорі півколом написи: УКРАЇНА, 2015, П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ - та логотип Монетного двору Національного банку України (праворуч).
reverseDescription: На реверсі монети на тлі камуфляжу (використано тамподрук) стилізовано зображено тризуб - Знак Княжої Держави Володимира Великого, угорі написи півколом: ЗА ЧЕСТЬ! ЗА СЛАВУ! ЗА НАРОД!

name: PIDHIRTSI CASTLE
generalDescription: The commemorative coins is dedicated to Pidhirtsi Castle, a historical and architectural masterpiece of the seventeenth century, one of the most beautiful Ukrainian castles in the Renaissance style.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, there is the legend УКРАЇНА (UKRAINE) under which there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine; below, the face value: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias); in the center, there is a conventionalized Baroque cartouche featuring the castle plan. On the German silver coin, below, there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint to the left.
reverseDescription: On the reverse, there is depicted Pidhirtsi Castle, in the foreground, there are horsemen; against a smooth background, there are the legends: ПІДГОРЕЦЬКИЙ ЗАМОК (PIDHIRTSI CASTLE) (above, in a semicircle), XVII cт. (17th century) (below).

name: OLESHKY SANDS
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Oleshky sands, a unique natural object and one of the largest expanses of sand in Europe of at least 150 km in length and 30 km in width (Kherson oblast).
averseDescription: Obverse: against the matte background of a desert landscape with person`s footsteps (to the left) there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) under which there is the legend: УКРАЇНА (UKRAINE); to the right, there is the year of issue - 2015; below, there is the face value - 2/ГРИВНІ (2/hryvnias) and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the matte background of a desert landscape there is depicted a lizard; above, there is the semicircular legend: ОЛЕШКІВСЬКІ ПІСКИ (OLESHKY SANDS).

name: PIDHIRTSI CASTLE
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Pidhirtsi Castle, a historical and architectural masterpiece of the seventeenth century, one of the most beautiful Ukrainian castles in the Renaissance style.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, there is the legend УКРАЇНА (UKRAINE) under which there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine; below, the face value: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias); in the center, there is a conventionalized Baroque cartouche featuring the castle plan.
reverseDescription: On the reverse, there is depicted Pidhirtsi Castle, in the foreground, there are horsemen; against a smooth background, there are the legends: ПІДГОРЕЦЬКИЙ ЗАМОК (PIDHIRTSI CASTLE) (above, in a semicircle), XVII cт. (17th century) (below).

name: OLESHKY SANDS
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Oleshky sands, a unique natural object and one of the largest expanses of sand in Europe of at least 150 km in length and 30 km in width (Kherson oblast).
averseDescription: Obverse: against the matte background of a desert landscape with person`s footsteps (to the left) there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) under which there is the legend: УКРАЇНА (UKRAINE); to the right, there is the year of issue - 2015; below, there is the face value - 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the matte background of a desert landscape there is depicted a lizard; above, there is the semicircular legend: ОЛЕШКІВСЬКІ ПІСКИ (OLESHKY SANDS).

name: Терезки
generalDescription: Присвячена дітям, які народилися під сузір`ям Терезів.
averseDescription: На аверсі монети розміщено: угорі малий Державний Герб України, написи: угорі півколом - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ, унизу - номінал ДВІ ГРИВНІ та стилізовану композицію - на тлі зіркового неба зображення знаків зодіаку, під якими на місяці солодко спить дитина; рік карбування монети 2015 та логотип Монетного двору Національного банку України (праворуч), позначення металу, проби та маси Ag 925/7,78 (ліворуч).
reverseDescription: На реверсі монети зображено стилізовану композицію - ліворуч на матовому тлі символ знака зодіаку Терезів, у центрі над травою - терези на яких сидять іграшки: лялька (ліворуч) та ведмежатко (праворуч), угорі напис - ТЕРЕЗКИ.

name: 400 років Національному університету `Києво-Могилянська академія`
generalDescription: Присвячена одному з найстаріших вищих навчальних закладів України, заснованому в 1615 році як Київська братська школа. Важко переоцінити роль Києво-Могилянської академії в історії України, бо вона справила величезний вплив на розвиток освіти, науки, культури, суспільної свідомості, сприяла піднесенню інтелектуального рівня нації тощо. За свою вікову історію академія та її випускники відігравали визначальну роль на багатьох етапах історичного розвитку України.
averseDescription: На аверсі монети розміщено: угорі - малий Державний Герб України, праворуч від якого: напис УКРАЇНА та рік карбування 2015; у центрі на дзеркальному тлі - герб Києво-Могилянської академії, обрамлений стрічкою із девізом університету латиною: TEMPUS FUGIT, ACADEMIA SEMPITERNA (`Час плинний - академія вічна`); під гербом - номінал ДВІ ГРИВНІ; ліворуч над стрічкою - логотип Монетного двору Національного банку України.
reverseDescription: На реверсі монети на тлі староакадемічного (Мазепинського) корпусу зображено фрагмент гравюри - три спудеї із сувоями в руках та розміщено написи: КИЄВО-МОГИЛЯНСЬКА АКАДЕМІЯ (угорі по колу), 400 РОКІВ (над будівлею), унизу на тлі стилізованого барокового орнаменту - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/УНІВЕРСИТЕТ.

name: 400 років Національному університету `Києво-Могилянська академія`
generalDescription: Присвячена одному з найстаріших вищих навчальних закладів України, заснованому в 1615 році як Київська братська школа. Важко переоцінити роль Києво-Могилянської академії в історії України, бо вона справила величезний вплив на розвиток освіти, науки, культури, суспільної свідомості, сприяла піднесенню інтелектуального рівня нації тощо. За свою вікову історію академія та її випускники відігравали визначальну роль на багатьох етапах історичного розвитку України.
averseDescription: На аверсі монети розміщено: угорі - малий Державний Герб України, праворуч від якого: напис УКРАЇНА та рік карбування 2015; у центрі на дзеркальному тлі - герб Києво-Могилянської академії, обрамлений стрічкою із девізом університету латиною: TEMPUS FUGIT, ACADEMIA SEMPITERNA (`Час плинний - академія вічна`); під гербом - номінал П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ.
reverseDescription: На реверсі монети на тлі староакадемічного (Мазепинського) корпусу зображено фрагмент гравюри - три спудеї із сувоями в руках та розміщено написи: КИЄВО-МОГИЛЯНСЬКА АКАДЕМІЯ (угорі по колу), 400 РОКІВ (над будівлею), унизу на тлі стилізованого барокового орнаменту - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/УНІВЕРСИТЕТ.

name: Іван Карпенко-Карий
generalDescription: Присвячена 170-річчю від дня народження одного з фундаторів українського професійного театру, драматурга, актора, режисера, громадського і культурного діяча Івана Карповича Карпенка-Карого (Тобілевича), який подарував майстрам сцени і глядачам справжні драматургічні перлини. П`єси, створені ним, становлять цілу епоху в українській драматургії.
averseDescription: На аверсі монети розміщено: угорі малий Державний Герб України, напис півколом НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ; у центрі стилізовану композицію: на сцені, увінчаній символом театру - масками комедії та трагедії, зображено фрагмент спектаклю, з рампи звисає картуш із написами `Хазяїн`, `Сто тисяч` як символ безкінечного таланту Карпенка-Карого; унизу - номінал 2 ГРИВНІ, рік карбування монети 2015 (праворуч) та логотип Монетного двору Національного банку України (ліворуч).
reverseDescription: На реверсі монети зображено композицію, що символізує режисерський та акторський таланти Івана Карпенка-Карого: він - ляльковод з ляльками своїх героїв, праворуч - його родинний хутір; угорі півколом напис ІВАН КАРПЕНКО-КАРИЙ, та роки життя 1845 - 1907 (ліворуч).

name: Oleksandr Murashko
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 140th anniversary of birth of Oleksandr Murashko, a painter, pedagogue and public figure who managed to combine the best achievements of the French Impressionism, elements of Art Nouveau and Saint Petersburg Academy of Arts school, having created a unique artistic style. Being one of the most significant `Europeans` in Ukrainian pictorial art of the time, he had a solid artistic education, dreamed of turning Kyiv into a great art center and of opening the Academy of Arts in it.
averseDescription: Obverse: to the left there is depicted the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the face value 2/ГРИВНІ (2/hryvnias) thereunder, bowl-shaped inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), the issue year - 2015 and the mark of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine (below); in the center there is the conventionalized composition: Oleksandr Murashko in the process of painting `The Annunciation` in his workroom.
reverseDescription: On the reverse: Oleksandr Murashko is depicted beside the easel in the workroom. The painter is holding a palette in his left hand, in his right hand he is holding a brush when painting the `Girl in a Red Hat` picture; to the right there is the inscription: ОЛЕКСАНДР МУРАШКО (Oleksandr Murashko) (bowl-shaped inscription) and the years of birth and death 1875 -/1919.

name: 475th Anniversary of the First Record of the City of Ternopil
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the picturesque administrative center of the respective oblast, located on the Seret River (Dniester tributary) - Ternopil, first mentioned in the charter of Sigismund I, a King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania, provided to Jan Tarnowski for the establishment of the city.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, against the background of the ornament, there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) underneath; in the center, against the smooth background, there is a panorama of modern Ternopil with the city`s coat of arms above; below: there is the issue year - 2015 and the semicircular inscription П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hrynias) and the mark of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine to the right.
reverseDescription: On the reverse: against the smooth background there are the inscriptions ТЕРНОПІЛЬ/ПЕРША ПИСЕМНА ЗГАДКА (Ternopil/the first record) with Jan Tarnowski`s portrait underneath against the background of the conventionalized sealed scroll; to the right of the portrait there is the ancient castle with the inscriptions ЯН ТАРНОВСЬКИЙ/1540 (Jan Tarnowski/1540) - to the right and ТЯRNOPOLIE - to the left.

name: 475th Anniversary of the First Record of the City of Ternopil
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the picturesque administrative center of the respective oblast, located on the Seret River (Dniester tributary) - Ternopil, first mentioned in the charter of Sigismund I, a King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania, provided to Jan Tarnowski for the establishment of the city.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, against the background of the ornament, there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) underneath; in the center, against the smooth background, there is a panorama of modern Ternopil with the city`s coat of arms above; below: there is the issue year - 2015 and the semicircular inscription ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse: against the smooth background there are the inscriptions ТЕРНОПІЛЬ/ПЕРША ПИСЕМНА ЗГАДКА (Ternopil/the first record) with Jan Tarnowski`s portrait underneath against the background of the conventionalized sealed scroll; to the right of the portrait there is the ancient castle with the inscriptions ЯН ТАРНОВСЬКИЙ/1540 (Jan Tarnowski/1540) - to the right and ТЯRNOPOLIE - to the left.

name: 75 Years of the Chernivtsi Oblast
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the land which combines historical destinies of Northern Bukovina and a part of Bessarabia located in the south west of Ukraine at the foothills of the Carpathians down the Dniester and the Prut Rivers. This region is rich in recreational resources; there is economic potential for the development of interregional and international cooperation. This picturesque part of Ukraine is abundant in places fit for multi-purpose tourism, mass educational rest and recreation: there is a great number of protected areas, numerous historical and cultural monuments and mineral water springs.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscriptions: above - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below - П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias); to the right there is the mark of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine; above there is depicted the Three Holy Hierarchs Church, the Residence of Bukovinian Metropolitans against the background of the Khotyn Fortress; in the foreground there is depicted the composition: on the hill, there are sheep and the musician playing the trembita; there are stylized elements below the composition: fragments of the musical notation of the song `Chervona Ruta` (Red Rue), Bukovinian ornamentation and a flower; to the right above the trembita there is the year of issue - 2015.
reverseDescription: On the reverse: there is depicted the oblast coat of arms, along the coin circumference there are the legends: above - ЧЕРНІВЕЦЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Chernivtsi Oblast), below - ЗАСНОВАНА У 1940 РОЦІ (established in 1940).

name: Volodymyr the Great, Grand Duke of Kyiv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Volodymyr the Great, Grand Duke of Kyiv, an outstanding statesman and political figure, an architect of Ukraine-Rus, a medieval European state, and commemorates the millennium from the date of his repose.
averseDescription: Obverse: there is depicted the following: to the left - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine); to the right - the issue year 2015, the face value - 20/ГРИВЕНЬ (20/hryvnias); in the center there is depicted `sriblianyk` (silver coin), one of the first coins minted in the Kyivan state, below- the fragment of ancient Kyiv (local gilding) in which development Volodymyr Sviatoslavovych invested great effort; to the right and to the left there is a conventionalized composition of hills with names of the tribes once inhabiting this territory.
reverseDescription: On the reverse: in the center there is depicted Volodymyr the Great, Grand Duke of Kyiv (local gilding), holding the cross in one hand and the church model in the other; around him there are four medallions with conventionalized representations of the duke`s acts of founding the state: coins mintage, joining new territories and protection of state borders, economic development and trade, Christianization of the people and establishment of Christianity as the state religion; to the duke`s left and right there are the stylized inscriptions КИЇВСЬКИЙ КНЯЗЬ, ВОЛОДИМИР ВЕЛИКИЙ (Grand Duke of Kyiv, Volodymyr the Great).

name: The Dormition Cathedral in the City of Volodymyr-Volynskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Dormition Cathedral, an Old Rus architectural monument, built by Prince Mstyslav Iziaslavovych in 1156-1160 in the city of Volodymyr - the center of Volynian Principality, the city of chronicle writing (currently - the city of Volodmyr-Volynskyi). The Cathedral was a unique center of spiritual and community life in Volyn, burial place of princes, boyars and bishops, one of the pages of the Old Rus architectural heritage.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the issue year - 2015, the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (to the left) with the inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) below; the face value - 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (to the right) with a mark of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine below. The main obverse composition is the conventionalized fragment of icon-stand and the Cathedral Holy doors.
reverseDescription: On the reverse: there is depicted the Dormition Cathedral (to the right), in the middle distance above there is the conventionalized scene of its foundation, to the left - the inscription УСПЕНСЬКИЙ/ СОБОР/ХІІ ст. (Dormition/ Cathedral/ХІІ century); below there is the decorative ornament with the inscription ВОЛОДИМИР-ВОЛИНСЬКИЙ (Volodymyr-Volynskyi) against its background.

name: Andrei Sheptytskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 150th anniversary of the birth of Andrei Sheptytskyi (his unreligious name being Roman-Maria-Aleksander), a prominent cleric, political and public figure, philanthropist and the Metropolitan of the Ukrainian Greek Catholic Church, who contributed to the national self-preservation of the Ukrainian people. Sheptytskyi`s self-sacrificing work reaching out for mutual understanding in the Christian world and building peace between the Eastern and Western Churches, his ecumenical ideas were well in advance of his time.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is depicted the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the center - the composition with clerical attributes; below - the face value 2/ГРИВНІ (2/hryvnias) and the issue year - 2015; there is the mark of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine (to the right).
reverseDescription: On the reverse: there is depicted Andrei Sheptytskyi sitting in an armchair with a book on his laps; there is a miter to the left; to the right there are semicircular inscriptions: МИТРОПОЛИТ АНДРЕЙ ШЕПТИЦЬКИЙ (Metropolitan Andrei Sheptytskyi) (below) and 1865 - 1944 (above).

name: Petro Prokopovych
generalDescription: The coin commemorates the 240th anniversary of the birth of Petro Prokopovych, the inventor of the world`s first moveable-frame beehive, the founder of the national science of beekeeping and rational apiculture in Europe. Petro Prokopovych designed the frame as a separate moveable part of the beehive which made it possible to harvest pure honey without damaging the bees. This represented a landmark in the history of beekeeping.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (the National Bank of Ukraine); to the left - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine; there is depicted the following conventionalized composition: in the center there is Petro Prokopovych`s frame hive with the bees flying out of it, an ancient hive and bee cells (to the left); below against the lustreless background there is engraved the face value - 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias), to the left - the legend 2015 (the coin issue year); to the right on the lustre surface there is the mark of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the reverse: there is depicted Petro Prokopovych`s portrait with the following inscriptions below: ПЕТРО/ПРОКОПОВИЧ (PETRO/PROKOPOVYCH), 1775/1850; to the right there are depicted the bee cells with the bee on them.

name: Kyiv Funicular
generalDescription: The coin commemorates Kyiv funicular, one of the symbols of Kyiv, historical monument that is very popular among residents and visitors of the city, a specialized transport means built in 1905. Originally it was called Mykhailivskyi Mekhanichnyi Pidyom (St. Michael`s Mechanical Lift) and was one of the examples of innovative solutions to engineering challenges.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the center there is depicted a modern view of Kyiv funicular (main entrance on Poshtova Square); to the left below there is a floral ornament - conventionalized chestnut-tree leaves; to the right - the legend 2015 (the coin issue year), the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint, semicircular inscription of the coin face value - П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse: there is depicted a design of the city from early ХХ century in a modernist style: against the background of the landscape of Kyiv there is depicted the funicular, in the foreground - a man and a woman (to the right) and a floral ornament - conventionalized chestnut-tree leaves (to the left), above there are the inscriptions 110/РОКІВ, КИЇВСЬКОМУ/ФУНІКУЛЕРУ (110/YEARS, KYIV/FUNICULAR)

name: 70 Years of Victory. 1945 - 2015
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 70th anniversary of the victory over Nazism in Europe and perpetuate the act of bravery of the Ukrainian nation, its significant contribution to the victory of the anti-Hitler coalition in World War II. From the first days of the war and until October 1944, the territory of Ukraine was the central part of the entire European theater of military operations in World War II and suffered enormous human and material losses.
averseDescription: Obverse of the 5-hryvnia coin: above there is the semicircular inscription УКРАЇНА (UKRAINE) under which there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized composition symbolizing life - a family tree with a bird sitting in the nest of viburnum branch against the background thereof; to the right - there is the year of issue - 2015, below - the face value 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias), to the left - the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin: there is the following conventionalized composition: a soldier`s helmet and red poppy flowers - as symbols of remembrance; to the left there is the inscription - 1945, to the right - 2015; there are triangles, symbolizing candle flames, above there is the semicircular inscription - 70 РОКІВ ПЕРЕМОГИ (70 Years of Victory). There is a pad printing technique used on the 5-hryvnia coin.

name: 150 Years of the Odesa Illia Mechnikov National University
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 150th Anniversary of one of the oldest educational establishments of Ukraine, which ranks high in the educational system formation, development of research and culture in Ukraine and has a strong international reputation.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) underneath; the conventionalized composition symbolizing science fields and an educational process; in the centre there is the face value 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) and the issue year 2015 (below).
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the dark background there is depicted Odesa Illia Mechnikov National University and along the coin circumference there is the inscription ОДЕСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМЕНІ І. І. МЕЧНИКОВА (Odesa Illia Mechnikov National University), below against the relief background there is inscribed 1865, the year of the establishment of the university.

name: 150 Years of the Odesa Illia Mechnikov National University
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 150th Anniversary of one of the oldest educational establishments of Ukraine, which ranks high in the educational system formation, development of research and culture in Ukraine and has a strong international reputation.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) underneath; the conventionalized composition symbolizing science fields and an educational process; in the centre there is the face value 2/ГРИВНІ/2015 (2/hrynias/2015) and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the dark background there is depicted Odesa Illia Mechnikov National University and along the coin circumference there is the inscription ОДЕСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМЕНІ І. І. МЕЧНИКОВА (Odesa Illia Mechnikov National University), below against the relief background there is inscribed 1865, the year of the establishment of the university.

name: 120 Years of Kharkiv Zoo
generalDescription: The coin commemorates one of the oldest zoos in Europe, which performs cultural and educational functions and is the an architectural landmark of Kharkiv. The zoo is located in the city center, occupying the an area of 22 hectares and comprising about 400 species of fish, amphibians, reptiles, birds and mammals. Among them, there are 145 rare and endangered species listed in the International Red List of Threatened Species and the Red List of Threatened Species of Ukraine. In 1925, Kharkiv Zoo was the first in Ukraine to buy for its collection the a representative of one of the largest animals in the world - the elephant.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), the conventionalized composition: animals in the zoo meeting young visitors at the entrance; below - the legend 2015 (the coin issue year), the coin face value 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias); the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (to the right).
reverseDescription: On the reverse: in the centre against the background of the conventionalized image of the city of Kharkiv there are depicted the elephant holding the a flower in its trunk and the inscriptions ХАРКІВСЬКИЙ ЗООПАРК (Kharkiv Zoo) (semicircular, above) and 120/років (120/years)(below).

name: Yakiv Hnizdovskyi
generalDescription: The coin commemorates the centenary of birth of Yakiv Yakovych HNIZDOVSKYI (alias Jacques Hnizdovsky, Jakub Gniazdowski, Jakiv Hnizdovskij), an outstanding master of visual arts in Ukrainian Diaspora, painter and graphic artist, sculptor, art historian and critic, a master of multifaceted talent having an innovative approach to the creative work, who has resuscitated the woodcarving art. The multifarious and extremely rich artistic heritage of this singular master, including hundreds of pictorial and graphic works, woodcuts, sculptural compositions, tapestries, interesting research works in the history of arts, has enriched the treasure-house of Ukrainian and world art.
averseDescription: Obverse: on the obverse of the coin there are depicted: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); to the right - the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint, the legend 2015 (the coin issue year) and the coin face value 2 / ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnias), in the centre there is depicted the conventionalized work of Ya. Hnizdovskyi `Sunflower` (1974).
reverseDescription: On the reverse: in the centre there is depicted the work of Yakiv Hnizdovskyi `Self-Portrait` (1981); to the left there is the inscription of years of his life 1915/1985, below there is the inscription ЯКІВ ГНІЗДОВСЬКИЙ (Yakiv Hnizdovskyi) (to the right).

name: Mykhailo Verbytskyi
generalDescription: The coin commemorates the 200th anniversary of the birth of Mykhailo Mykhailovych VERBYTSKYI, a Ukrainian composer, public figure, chorus conductor, priest of the Ukrainian Greek Catholic Church and the author of music of the national anthem of Ukraine.
averseDescription: The coin obverse bears: the legend УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) above, the conventionalized composition: against the background of the national flag of Ukraine the anthem lines ЩЕ НЕ ВМЕРЛА УКРАЇНИ/І СЛАВА, І ВОЛЯ,/ЩЕ НАМ, БРАТТЯ/МОЛОДІЇ,/ УСМІХНЕТЬСЯ/ДОЛЯ. (Yet not died (has) of Ukraine / both glory, and freedom / still upon us, brothers / brave, / shall smile / the fate.) with the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine thereunder and images of people singing the anthem to the left and right thereof; the coin face value 2/ГРИВНІ (2/hryvnias) below with the coin issue year indication 2015 to the right and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint to the left thereof.
reverseDescription: Reverse bears Mykhailo Verbytskyi`s portrait with the flower ornament pattern, image of the lyre, to the left of the portrait, and the conventionalized representation of the musical notation thereunder; indication of the years of his life: 1815 (to the left) and 1870 (to the right); the bow-shaped inscription МИХАЙЛО ВЕРБИЦЬКИЙ (Mykhailo Verbytskyi) to the right beneath.

name: Euromaidan
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the protest actions that took place in Ukraine and were full of the aspiration for changes, for the European direction of our country development.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse, against the embossment background, being a conventionalized image of the wavering flag, there are: the inscription Україна (Ukraine) above with the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine to the left thereof; the coin face value 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) and issue year 2015 indication (to the left); the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (below); in the centre, within the square formed by the inscription quoting Article 5 of the Constitution of Ukraine: НОСІЄМ СУВЕРЕНІТЕТУ/І ЄДИНИМ ДЖЕРЕЛОМ/ВЛАДИ В УКРАЇНІ/Є НАРОД (THE BEARERS OF SOVEREIGNTY / AND THE ONLY SOURCE / OF POWER IN UKRAINE / ARE ITS PEOPLE) there is a fragment representing the viche (popular assembly).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the symbolic composition: against the background of the European Union flag the clenched hand is holding the State Flag of Ukraine (the flags are represented with use of pad printing); to the left there is the legend ЄВРОМАЙДАН (Euromaidan).

name: Heavenly Hundred
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is consecrated to the memory of the heroes that have become a symbol of the dignity; each of them has accomplished a feat having risen in rebellion against the violence and injustice, having sacrificed the most valuable - the life - for the new reviving Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are depicted: above, against the background of the pavement, the inscription Україна (Ukraine) with the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine thereunder; put on the pavement carnations that symbolize the heroes` blood shed and the inscription ГЕРОЇ/НЕ ВМИРАЮТЬ! (Heroes / don`t die!); against the smooth background to the left there are the coin face value 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) and issue year 2015 indication, to the right - the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the composition: the candles whose flames rise against the background of the blue and yellow (pad printing used) State Flag of Ukraine and symbolize the heroes` souls; above, against the smooth background, there is the legend: НЕБЕСНА/СОТНЯ (heavenly hundred).

name: Revolution of Dignity
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the civic spirit and patriotism manifested by the citizens of Ukraine of all nationalities aspiring to develop and strengthen the democracy, its constitutional principles, human rights and liberties.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse, against the background of the bell, there are: the inscription Україна (Ukraine) above with the image of a participant in the events thereunder; against the embossment background of the coin representing the flame there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (to the right) and the coin face value 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) and issue year 2015 indication with the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (to the left).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the composition in the form of the cross representing a moment of the events - opposition offering (pad printing used); above there is the inscription РЕВОЛЮЦІЯ/ГІДНОСТІ (revolution / of dignity).

name: Pisces (Little Fish)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the children born under the sign of Pisces.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the coin face value ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) under the conventionalized composition - against the background of the sky of stars there are the images of Zodiac signs with the child that is enjoying a balmy sleep thereunder; the coin issue year indication 2015 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint are to the right, while to the left there is the indication of metal, its fineness and weight Ag 925/7,78.
reverseDescription: Reverse bears the conventionalized composition: to the left, on the lusterless surface, there is the sign of Pisces; in the center there are depicted two fishes; above there is the inscription РИБКИ (little fishes).

name: Halshka Hulevychivna
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the famous figure of national and cultural revival of Ukraine of late XVIth - early XVIIth century - Elizabeth (Halshka) Vasilivna Hulevychivna, who descended from a noble family of Volhynia and was one of the founders of Kyiv Brotherhood Epiphany Monastery and its school for children. For this purpose she donated her country estate with plot of land in Podil district of Kyiv in 1615. This was the beginning of the Kyiv Brotherhood School (later Kyiv Mohyla Academy).
averseDescription: Obverse: on the obverse of the coins there are depicted: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine to the right; and the conventionalized composition representing the transfer of land, - against the background of the page with Halshka Gulevychivna`s autograph there are depicted a pen (top) and a seal (below), to the right there are the coin face value 2 / ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnias), coin issue year indication 2015 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the conventionalized composition: above there is facade of the building, which began the history of Kyiv Brotherhood School, below there are the inscriptions ГАЛШКА/ГУЛЕВИЧІВНА (Halshka Gulevychivna) and years of her life 1575/1642, to the left there are depicted Halshka Gulevychivna and children.

name: Aquarius (Little Water Carrier)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the children born under the sign of Aquarius.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the coin face value ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) under the conventionalized composition - against the background of the sky of stars there are the images of Zodiac signs, Moon and Sun; the coin issue year indication 2015 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint are to the right, while to the left there is the indication of metal, its fineness and weight Ag 925/7,78.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the conventionalized composition: to the left, on the lusterless surface, there is the sign of Aquarius; in the center there is depicted a boy on the grass; above there is the inscription ВОДОЛІЙЧИК (little water carrier).

name: Year of the Goat
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Year of the Goat according to a calendar of Chinese origin, which is based on the twelve-year orbit of Jupiter, the largest planet in the Solar System.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ (National Bank/of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre, within a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation pattern, there is the coin face value 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ Hryvnias); below there is the year indication 2015, as well as the indications of the metal and its fineness Ag 925, coin weight in fineness 15,55 g and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint mark.
reverseDescription: Reverse: within a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation pattern there is depicted in a technique of a cheap popular print a goat (the goat`s eye is represented by a blue cubic zirconium oxide of 1.25 mm diameter). Both above and below this composition there is a depiction of contour figures of all 12 symbols of the Oriental calendar.

name: Vasyl Lypkivskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 150th anniversary of the birth of Vasyl Kostiantynovych LYPKIVSKYI, an outstanding cleric and educationalist, reformer, the first Metropolitan of the Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church, gifted preacher, publicist, writer, translator.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is the composition: within the crown of thorns symbolizing Vasyl Lypkivskyi`s tragic destiny there is the conventionalized image of the Gospel against the background of Saint Sophia`s cathedral in Kyiv, whose provost was the Metropolitan, the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (to the right), coin issue year indication 2014 and face value ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) below.
reverseDescription: Reverse bears Vasyl Lypkivskyi`s portrait with indications of the years of his life 1864 and 1937 on either side thereof and the semicircular inscription above МИТРОПОЛИТ ВАСИЛЬ ЛИПКІВСЬКИЙ (Metropolitan Vasyl Lypkivskyi).

name: 75 Years of the Rivne Oblast
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the region that musters more than 600 explored mineral deposits, being the basalt and amber ones unique among them. Rivnenshchyna means a unique ensemble of castles, picturesque landscapes, substantial forestlands. The Rivne Oblast is situated on the north-west of Ukraine and characterized by an advantageous geographical setting and developed transportation system; in its industry the production of linen, non-woven fabrics, particle boards, plywood, chemical fertilizers and energy is dominant.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the semicircular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there is the conventionalized composition: the images of the Saint George Friary on the Cossacks` Tombs with the coin issue year indication 2014 thereunder, a fragment of the Dubno Castle (to the right), the conventionalized image of the Ostroh Bible, against the background of the ornamental composition of flowers, and the Peaceful Atom symbol.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Oblast coat of arms with the semicircular inscriptions: РІВНЕНСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Rivne Oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1939 РОЦІ (established in 1939 year) below.

name: 75 Years of the Ternopil Oblast
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the land with unique and inimitable landscapes, highlands, rivers, waterfalls, caves. The National Nature Park `Kremenetski Hory` and `Medobory` Nature Preserve are the gems of the nature reserves of the region. The Ternopil Oblast occupies the western part of the Podolian Upland and is situated on the important transportation crossroads from Eastern to Central and Western Europe, which is conducive to development of the business undertakings. The Oblast economy is mainly of agrarian and industrial character, being the natural building materials predominant among its mineral resources.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the semicircular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there is the conventionalized composition: the images of Maria`s Spiritual Centre of Zarvanytsia with the coin issue year indication 2014 to the right thereof, towers of the Chervonohorod Castle (thereunder), vytynanka (art form of paper cutting) and the short-eared owl (against the background of a kylym carpet fragment).
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Oblast coat of arms with the semicircular inscriptions: ТЕРНОПІЛЬСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Ternopil Oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1939 РОЦІ (established in 1939 year) below.

name: 75 Years of the Lviv Oblast
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to one of the largest cultural, educational, industrial and agrarian regions on the west of Ukraine. L`vivshchyna is a substantial European road junction. It is the land of the main European watershed separating the drainage basins of the Baltic and Black Seas, and innumerable resources of healing mineral waters form a special wealth of the historical land of Halych. In the Oblast there are situated the following well-known health resorts: Truskavets, Morshyn, Shklo, Nemyriv, Skhidnytsia.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the semicircular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there is the conventionalized composition: the images of the `Apostolos` (Acts and Epistles) book, the first book printed in Ukraine (Lviv, 1574), with the coin issue year indication 2014 to the left thereof, and, against the background of mountains, a mineral water pump room, the Olesko Castle, oil well pumpjack and the cezve with a cup (beneath).
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Oblast coat of arms with the semicircular inscriptions: ЛЬВІВСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Lviv Oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1939 РОЦІ (established in 1939 year) below.

name: 75 Years of the Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a picturesque region, rich in woods, healing mineral waters, natural resources (fuel and energy, chemical, building materials), with various vegetal and animal life. The Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast is situated on the South-West of Ukraine, at the interface of two large natural regions - the East European Plain and Eastern Carpathians. Just at that spot there are situated the highest point of Ukraine the Mount Hoverla (2061 metres) and the following well-known ski resorts: Yaremche, Mykulychyn, Sheshory, Vorokhta, Yablunytsia.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the semicircular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there is the conventionalized composition: the images of a wooden church against the background of the Mount Hoverla, the Pysanka Museum in the city of Kolomyia, oil well pumpjack, coin issue year indication 2014 (in the centre), snowboarder and the edelweiss flower.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Oblast coat of arms with the semicircular inscriptions: ІВАНО-ФРАНКІВСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1939 РОЦІ (established in 1939 year) below.

name: 75 Years of the Volyn Oblast
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the land of eternal woods and hundreds of heavenly clear streams and lakes including the Lake of Svitiaz, the deepest lake in Ukraine. Volyn is also rich in various mineral resources and raw materials. The Volyn Oblast is situated in the North-West part of Ukraine, within the basin of the Prypiat River tributaries and upper reaches of the Western Bug River, on the important transport crossroads, which is conducive to the development of international relations.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the semicircular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there is the conventionalized composition: the images of a Lutsk High Castle tower, the Assumption Cathedral in the city of Volodymyr-Volynskyi, an island on the lake of Svitiaz with the coin issue year indication 2014 thereunder, as well as the swan (above) and grain ears with the flax flowers (beneath).
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Oblast coat of arms with the semicircular inscriptions: ВОЛИНСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Volyn Oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1939 РОЦІ (established in 1939 year) below.

name: Ostap Vyshnia
generalDescription: The coin commemorates the 125th anniversary of the birth of Ostap Vyshnia (vyshnia is Ukrainian for cherry; real name - Pavlo Hubenko), a prominent Ukrainian writer and humorist who excelled at satirical articles and cartoons.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is the composition representing the popular `Cherry Smiles` storybook adored by readers: the shotgun that is loaded with two cherries and the hat full of them; to the left there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; the coin issue year indication 2014 is to the right; below there is the coin face value ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse bears Ostap Vyshnia`s portrait with representations of heroes of his works around him and the bow-shaped inscription ОСТАП ВИШНЯ (Ostap Vyshnia), above to the right, and indication of the years of his life 1889/1956, to the left.

name: 70th Anniversary of Ukraine`s Liberation from Fascist Invaders
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the liberation of Ukraine where heavy fighting took place between the USSR and Nazi Germany and its allies. Ukraine was hit badly during the war, which resulted in cities and villages being destroyed, left the economy in a shambles, and cost the lives of millions. Military operations lasted 40 months in Ukraine. Consisting of 11 strategic and 23 army group operations, the battle of Ukraine ended on October 28, 1944, when Ukraine was completely cleared of Hitler`s forces.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, with the legend УКРАЇНА/20 ГРИВЕНЬ/2014 (UKRAINE/20 HRYVNIAS/2014) below it. In the center, there are verses from a poem by Pavlo Tychyna: Я ЄСТЬ НАРОД,/ЯКОГО ПРАВДИ СИЛА/НІКИМ ЗВОЙОВАНА ЩЕ НЕ БУЛА./ЯКА БІДА МЕНЕ,/ЯКА ЧУМА КОСИЛА! -/А СИЛА ЗНОВУ РОЗЦВІЛА…/ПАВЛО ТИЧИНА (I am the people/whose power of truth/has not been conquered by anyone,/Despite all plagues/the power blossomed again…/Pavlo Tychyna.) To the right of the verses, there is a bunch of wild cornflowers, ears of wheat, and poppies, executed in pad print. On the silver coin, there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: to the right, against the background of a map of Ukraine, there is a stylized composition of two women symbolizing sorrow and happiness. There are the following legends: 28/ЖОВТНЯ/1944, 22/ЧЕРВНЯ/1941 (28/OCTOBER/1944, 22/JUNE/1941) to the left, and ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ/УКРАЇНИ/ВІД ФАШИСТСЬКИХ/ЗАГАРБНИКІВ (LIBERATION/OF UKRAINE/FROM FASCIST INVADERS) below it.

name: 70th Anniversary of Ukraine`s Liberation from Fascist Invaders
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the liberation of Ukraine where heavy fighting took place between the USSR and Nazi Germany and its allies. Ukraine was hit badly during the war, which resulted in cities and villages being destroyed, left the economy in a shambles, and cost the lives of millions. Military operations lasted 40 months in Ukraine. Consisting of 11 strategic and 23 army group operations, the battle of Ukraine ended on October 28, 1944, when Ukraine was completely cleared of Hitler`s forces.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, with the legend УКРАЇНА/5 ГРИВЕНЬ/2014 (UKRAINE/5 HRYVNIAS/2014) below it. In the center, there are verses from a poem by Pavlo Tychyna: Я ЄСТЬ НАРОД,/ЯКОГО ПРАВДИ СИЛА/НІКИМ ЗВОЙОВАНА ЩЕ НЕ БУЛА./ЯКА БІДА МЕНЕ,/ЯКА ЧУМА КОСИЛА! -/А СИЛА ЗНОВУ РОЗЦВІЛА…/ПАВЛО ТИЧИНА (I am the people/whose power of truth/has not been conquered by anyone,/Despite all plagues/the power blossomed again…/Pavlo Tychyna.) To the right of the verses, there is a bunch of wild cornflowers, ears of wheat, and poppies, executed in pad print. On the silver coin, there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: to the right, against the background of a map of Ukraine, there is a stylized composition of two women symbolizing sorrow and happiness. There are the following legends: 28/ЖОВТНЯ/1944, 22/ЧЕРВНЯ/1941 (28/OCTOBER/1944, 22/JUNE/1941) to the left, and ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ/УКРАЇНИ/ВІД ФАШИСТСЬКИХ/ЗАГАРБНИКІВ (LIBERATION/OF UKRAINE/FROM FASCIST INVADERS) below it.

name: 500 Years of the Battle of Orsha
generalDescription: The coin commemorates the victory the Grand Duchy of Lithuania achieved over the Russian army (then the army of Moskovy) in the battle of Orsha (today a city in Belarus), fought in 1514. This victory was of great international importance, as it halted the advance of the army of the Grand Prince of Moscow Vasili III of Russia. The army of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, consisting of Polish, Lithuanian, Ukrainian and Belorussian troops, was commanded by Prince Konstanty Ostrogski of Lithuania.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, with the legend УКРАЇНА (UKRAINE), with the coin issue year 2014 and face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (FIVE HRYVNIAS) below it. In the center, there is a composition of four swords that stand for the military unity of the Polish, Lithuanian, Ukrainian, and Belorussian peoples. At the crossing point of the swords there is an oak leaf wreath symbolizing military glory and victory. On the coin`s right, there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a symbolic composition of the battle, for which were used stylized fragments of the painting `The Battle of Orsha` by an unknown apprentice of artist Lucas Cranach the Elder. On the coin`s right, there is an image of Prince Konstanty Ostrogski and the following stylized legends: БИТВА/ПІД/ОРШЕЮ (BATTLE/OF/ORSHA) above to the left, and 500/РОКІВ (500/YEARS) below to the right.

name: 700 Years of Ozbek Han Mosque and Madrasa
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the oldest Muslim educational and religious monuments connected with the history and culture of the Crimean Tatar people, i.e. the Ozbek Han mosque and madrasa built on the territory of the town of Staryi Krym (Eski Q?r?m) in the early XIVth century.
averseDescription: The obverse of the coin bears: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin issue year 2014 indication (thereunder, to the left); in the centre, against the background of a conventionalized ornamental pattern, the face value: 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin there is depicted the Ozbek Han Mosque against the background of a conventionalized ornamental pattern with the inscription 700/РОКІВ (700/years) to the left of the image and the semicircular inscriptions (in Crimean Tatar and Ukrainian respectively) ESKI QIRIM. ?ZBEK HAN CAMISI VE MEDRESE (Staryi Krym, Ozbek Han`s mosque and madrasa) and МЕЧЕТЬ ХАНА УЗБЕКА І МЕДРЕСЕ (Mosque of the Han Ozbek and madrasa).

name: 700 Years of Ozbek Han Mosque and Madrasa
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the oldest Muslim educational and religious monuments connected with the history and culture of the Crimean Tatar people, i.e. the Ozbek Han mosque and madrasa built on the territory of the town of Staryi Krym (Eski Q?r?m) in the early XIVth century.
averseDescription: The obverse of the coin bears: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin issue year 2014 indication (thereunder, to the left); in the centre, against the background of a conventionalized ornamental pattern, the face value: 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) together with the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin there is depicted the Ozbek Han Mosque against the background of a conventionalized ornamental pattern with the inscription 700/РОКІВ (700/years) to the left of the image and the semicircular inscriptions (in Crimean Tatar and Ukrainian respectively) ESKI QIRIM. ?ZBEK HAN CAMISI VE MEDRESE (Staryi Krym, Ozbek Han`s mosque and madrasa) and МЕЧЕТЬ ХАНА УЗБЕКА І МЕДРЕСЕ (Mosque of the Han Ozbek and madrasa).

name: Cyclamen coum (Kuznetzovii)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Cyclamen coum (a sowbread variety), an endangered relict perennial. This tender plant with lilac-pink flowers and rounded leaves resembling those of the water-lily is on Ukraine`s list of endangered species.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin, within the wreath formed by images of some flora and fauna species, there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/БАНК/УКРАЇНИ/2/ГРИВНІ/2014 (National / Bank / of Ukraine / 2 / hryvnias / 2014). In addition the obverse of the latter coin bears the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coins there is depicted Cyclamen coum (Kuznetzovii) (it is coloured on the German silver coin thanks to the use of pad printing) together with the inscriptions ЦИКЛАМЕН КОСЬКИЙ (КУЗНЕЦОВА) (above) and CYCLAMEN COUM MILL. S. L. (below)

name: Cyclamen coum (Kuznetzovii)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Cyclamen coum (a sowbread variety), an endangered relict perennial. This tender plant with lilac-pink flowers and rounded leaves resembling those of the water-lily is on Ukraine`s list of endangered species.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin, within the wreath formed by images of some flora and fauna species, there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/БАНК/УКРАЇНИ/10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2014 (National / Bank / of Ukraine / 10 / hryvnias / 2014).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin there is depicted Cyclamen coum (Kuznetzovii) (it is coloured on the German silver coin thanks to the use of pad printing) together with the inscriptions ЦИКЛАМЕН КОСЬКИЙ (КУЗНЕЦОВА) (above) and CYCLAMEN COUM MILL. S. L. (below)

name: Nicholas Roerich
generalDescription: The coin commemorates the 140th anniversary of the birth of Nicholas Roerich (Nikolai Konstantinovich Rerikh), a world-famous artist, philosopher, scholar, archaeologist, explorer, who made a substantial contribution to the treasure house of the world science and culture having elaborated the first international Treaty on the Protection of Artistic and Scientific Institutions and Historic Monuments known as the Roerich Pact. Nicholas Roerich was connected with Ukraine by various intercommunications - from his delight in Taras Shevchenko`s creative work up to the monumental mosaic compositions spiritualizing the orthodox churches.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is the conventionalized image: the Protecting Veil of the Blessed Virgin Mary, the mosaic by Nicholas Roerich`s sketch in the church of the village of Parkhomivka in the Kyiv Oblast; to the left there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; below there are the coin face value 2 / ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnias) and the coin issue year indication 2014.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the background of the conventionalized image of mountains there is the portrait of Nicholas Roerich holding `Kobzar`, one of his most favourite books; above there is the semicircular inscription МИКОЛА РЕРІХ (Nicholas Roerich); to the right there is the indication of the years of his life 1874/1947.

name: On Motifs of O.P.Dovzhenko`s Works
generalDescription: The coin has been struck to commemorate the 120th anniversary of birth of Oleksandr Petrovych Dovzhenko, whose name has taken its place in history of the Ukrainian and world culture as the name of the founder of the Ukrainian national school of cinematography, a filmmaker of genius, writer of great originality and artist, whose movie `Earth` is considered one of the best 12 films in the world.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ (National / Bank / of Ukraine) and the coin issue year indication 2014 thereunder to the right; lower there is the conventionalized composition: on the motion picture film there are the pictures from the movies `Earth`, `Chronicle of Flaming Years` and `Zvenyhora`; beneath there is the coin face value 20 ГРИВЕНЬ (20 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there are represented: Oleksandr Dovzhenko`s portrait (to the left); the diagonal inscription ОЛЕКСАНДР ДОВЖЕНКО (Oleksandr Dovzhenko); to the right, against the background of the motion picture film, there are indicated the years of his life 1894/1956; above there are the conventionalized images of the birds embodying the poetic fancies of the artist.

name: Virgo (Little Girl)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the children born under the sign of Virgo.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the coin face value ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) under the conventionalized composition - against the background of the sky of stars there are the images of Zodiac signs, Moon and Sun; the coin issue year indication 2014 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint are to the right, while to the left there is the indication of metal, its fineness and weight Ag 925/7,78.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the conventionalized composition: to the left, on the lusterless surface, there is the sign of Virgo; in the center there is depicted a little girl on the grass; above there is the inscription ДІВЧАТКО (little girl).

name: 180 Years of Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 180th anniversary of Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv, one of the oldest and largest education establishments of Ukraine. The University is a center of education and science where the traditions are kept up and multiplied, new ideas are fostered, national intelligentsia is formed and freedom-loving spirit is supported.
averseDescription: Obverse: on the obverse of the coin there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre - the conventionalized composition - against the background of portraits of the outstanding personalities connected with the foundation and activities of the Kyiv University there is the figure of St. Volodymyr; below - the coin face value: 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias); to the left there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; to the right - the coin issue year indication 2014.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the reverse of the coin, on the mirror surface, there is depicted the building of Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv (on the German silver coin it is red, pad printing used), the monument to Taras Shevchenko; below there are the legends 180/РОКІВ, 1834, 2014 (180/years, 1834, 2014); above, along the coin edge, there is the inscription КИЇВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМЕНІ ТАРАСА ШЕВЧЕНКА (Kyiv National University named after Taras Shevchenko).

name: 180 Years of Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 180th anniversary of Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv, one of the oldest and largest education establishments of Ukraine. The University is a center of education and science where the traditions are kept up and multiplied, new ideas are fostered, national intelligentsia is formed and freedom-loving spirit is supported.
averseDescription: Obverse: on the obverse of the coin there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre - the conventionalized composition - against the background of portraits of the outstanding personalities connected with the foundation and activities of the Kyiv University there is the figure of St. Volodymyr; below - the coin face value: 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias); to the left there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; to the right - the coin issue year indication 2014.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the reverse of the coin, on the mirror surface, there is depicted the building of Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv (on the German silver coin it is red, pad printing used), the monument to Taras Shevchenko; below there are the legends 180/РОКІВ, 1834, 2014 (180/years, 1834, 2014); above, along the coin edge, there is the inscription КИЇВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМЕНІ ТАРАСА ШЕВЧЕНКА (Kyiv National University named after Taras Shevchenko).

name: John James Hughes
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a British mining engineer, metallurgist, businessman, founder of the metal works, around of which the settlement of Yuzivka (till 1924) appeared, now - the city of Donetsk.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine); in the center there is the conventionalized composition representing the works; to the right there is the coin issue year indication 2014, to the left - the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; below there is the coin face value 2 / ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is John James Hughes` portrait with the conventionalized inscription ДЖОН / ДЖЕЙМС / ЮЗ (John / James / Hughes) and indication of the years of his life 1814-1889.

name: Leo (Little Lion)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the children born under the sign of Leo.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the coin face value ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) under the conventionalized composition - against the background of the sky of stars there are the images of Zodiac signs with the child that is enjoying a balmy sleep thereunder; the coin issue year indication 2014 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint are to the right, while to the left there is the indication of metal, its fineness and weight Ag 925/7,78.
reverseDescription: Reverse bears the conventionalized composition: to the left, on the lusterless surface, there is the sign of Leo; in the center there is depicted a little lion on the grass; above there is the inscription ЛЕВЕНЯТКО (lion cub).

name: Cancer (Little Crayfish)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the children born under the sign of Cancer
averseDescription: On the obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the coin face value ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) under the conventionalized composition - against the background of the sky of stars there are the images of Zodiac signs with the child that is enjoying a balmy sleep thereunder; the coin issue year indication 2014 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint are to the right, while to the left there is the indication of metal, its fineness and weight Ag 925/7,78.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the conventionalized composition: to the left, on the lusterless surface, there is the sign of Cancer; in the center there is depicted a little crayfish on the grass; above there is the inscription РАЧОК (little crayfish).

name: 220 Years of the City of Odesa
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the leading industrial, scientific and cultural centers of our country, to the hero city of Odesa, often called the southern sea-gate of Ukraine, a pearl of great worth on the Black Sea shore. The territory of the city of our time had been populated in days gone by; here existed ancient settlements of different tribes and peoples, and at the end of the 18th century the port and the city came into existence on the place of the town of Hac?bey.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coins there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); to the left - the coin issue year indication 2014 with the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint thereunder on the German silver coin; the conventionalized composition representing the monument to the Duc de Richelieu against the background of the Potemkin Stairs (to the right), Odesa National Academic Theatre of Opera and Ballet (to the left) with the conventionalized image of waves thereunder; below - the coin face value: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) on the German silver one.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coins there are depicted: a fragment of the panorama of the Odesa bay and city from the 19th century lithography with the image of the sailing-vessel in the foreground; the Coat of Arms of Odesa to the left with the inscriptions: 1794 over it and ОДЕСА (Odesa) to the right.

name: 220 Years of the City of Odesa
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the leading industrial, scientific and cultural centers of our country, to the hero city of Odesa, often called the southern sea-gate of Ukraine, a pearl of great worth on the Black Sea shore. The territory of the city of our time had been populated in days gone by; here existed ancient settlements of different tribes and peoples, and at the end of the 18th century the port and the city came into existence on the place of the town of Hac?bey.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); to the left - the coin issue year indication 2014; the conventionalized composition representing the monument to the Duc de Richelieu against the background of the Potemkin Stairs (to the right), Odesa National Academic Theatre of Opera and Ballet (to the left) with the conventionalized image of waves thereunder; below - the coin face value: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coins there are depicted: a fragment of the panorama of the Odesa bay and city from the 19th century lithography with the image of the sailing-vessel in the foreground; the Coat of Arms of Odesa to the left with the inscriptions: 1794 over it and ОДЕСА (Odesa) to the right.

name: Anna Yaroslavna
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Anna Yaroslavna (Anne of Rus), a Kyiv princess, the middle daughter of the grand prince Yaroslav the Wise. In the late forties of the 11th century she married the king Henry I of France (house of Capet) and, after his death, became the queen regent of their underage son; she participated actively in the government of the country and was in fact the reigning queen. The beautiful, highly educated and wise woman excited admiration of her contemporaries and meritoriously represented Kyiv Rus, a developed power that was held in esteem and played an important role in the international relations of the countries of Europe and the Middle East.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) with the inscription АННА/ЯРОСЛАВНА (Anna/Yaroslavna) thereunder and the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine to the left; in the center there is the conventionalized figure of the Kyiv princess Anna against the background of the image of Saint Sophia`s Cathedral of Kyiv; below there are the coin face value 2 / ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnias), coin issue year indication 2014 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (to the left).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the conventionalized image of Anna as a queen of France against the background of St.Vincent Abbey church; above there is her conventionalized Cyrillic signature; below there are the inscriptions ХІ ст. (XI century) and КОРОЛЕВА/ФРАНЦІЇ (queen/of France).

name: Gemini (Little Twins)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the children born under the sign of Gemini.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the coin face value ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) under the conventionalized composition - against the background of the sky of stars there are the images of Zodiac signs, Moon and Sun; the coin issue year indication 2014 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint are to the right, while to the left there is the indication of metal, its fineness and weight Ag 925/7,78.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the conventionalized composition: to the left, on the lusterless surface, there is the sign of Gemini; in the center there are depicted a twin girl and boy on the grass; above there is the inscription БЛИЗНЯТКА (little twins).

name: Taurus (Little Bull)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the children born under the sign of Taurus.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the coin face value ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) under the conventionalized composition - against the background of the sky of stars there are the images of Zodiac signs with the child that is enjoying a balmy sleep thereunder; the coin issue year indication 2014 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint are to the right, while to the left there is the indication of metal, its fineness and weight Ag 925/7,78.
reverseDescription: Reverse bears the conventionalized composition: to the left, on the lusterless surface, there is the sign of Taurus; in the center there is depicted a little bull on the grass; above there is the inscription ТЕЛЯТКО (calf).

name: Volodymyr Serhieiev
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 100th anniversary of the birth of Volodymyr Hryhorovych SERHIEIEV (Vladimir G.Sergeyev), an academician of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, the chief designer of spacecraft and missile control systems and director of the Scientific Production Association `Electrical Appliance` (NPO `Electroprylad` or `Electropribor`, now `Khartron`), twice Hero of Socialist Labour.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: above the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine); in the center there is the conventionalized composition: against the background of the printed circuit board of a micromodule there is depicted the Mir space station complex; to the right there is the coin issue year indication 2014, to the left - the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint, below there is the coin face value 2 / ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are Volodymyr Serhieiev`s portrait, an image of the reusable launch space system Energia-Buran, the semicircular inscription ВОЛОДИМИР СЕРГЄЄВ (Volodymyr Serhieiev) to the left and indication of the years of his life 1914/2009 to the right.

name: 70 Years of the Kherson Oblast
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an industrial and agrarian region of Ukraine washed by the Black Sea and Sea of Azov. The land of Kherson has unique steppe biosphere reserves and very long history; it is a land of Cossack glory, the cradle of our shipbuilding.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the semicircular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath and the coin issue year indication 2014 under the coat of arms; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there is a gate of the Kherson fortress, one of the oldest structures of the city of Kherson; to the right there is depicted the Adziogol Lighthouse built according to design of Vladimir Shukhov, an engineer and scholar; over the gate there is depicted a vessel as a symbol of the port and shipbuilding; to the left - three dolphins, below - gifts of the Kherson Oblast fields: water melon, tomato, grape, wheatears.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Oblast coat of arms with the semicircular inscriptions: ХЕРСОНСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Kherson Oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1944 РОЦІ (established in 1944 year) below.

name: 75 Years of the Zaporizhia Oblast
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the most developed industrial regions situated on the south-east of our country, which on the south is washed by the Sea of Azov. It is the land of founders of the state of Ukrainian Cossacks, the real knights of spirituality.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the semicircular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there is depicted the Dnieper Hydroelectric Station (DniproHES) dam whose erection some time gave an impetus to very rapid development of industry of the region; over it there is indicated the coin issue year 2014 with the regional symbols around the dam: airplane (motor industry), steel-teeming ladle (metallurgy of ferrous metals), sunflower and wheatears (agriculture) as well as the atom for peace emblem (nuclear-power engineering).
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Oblast coat of arms with the semicircular inscriptions: ЗАПОРІЗЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Zaporizhia Oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1939 РОЦІ (established in 1939 year) below.

name: Aries (Little Ram)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the children born under the sign of Aries.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the coin face value ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) under the conventionalized composition - against the background of the sky of stars there are the images of Zodiac signs with the child that is enjoying a balmy sleep thereunder; the coin issue year indication 2014 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint are to the right, while to the left there is the indication of metal, its fineness and weight Ag 925/7,78.
reverseDescription: Reverse bears the conventionalized composition: to the left, on the lusterless surface, there is the sign of Aries; in the center there is depicted a little ram on the grass; above there is the inscription ЯГНЯТКО (lamb).

name: 200th Anniversary of T.H.Shevchenko`s Birth
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the bicentenary of birth of Taras Hryhorovych SHEVCHENKO, an outstanding son of the Ukrainian people, poet of genius, artist, thinker that has made an inestimable contribution to the spiritual treasury of humankind. The great Kobzar`s talent has climbed the heights of Ukrainian and world culture, the vigour of its national phenomenality diffuses far beyond the ambit of literature and art.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coins: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the center (on the silver coin - within the circle formed by the lines from the poem `Muse` ...ВНОЧІ, І ВДЕНЬ, І ВВЕЧЕРІ, І РАНО ВИТАЙ ЗО МНОЮ І УЧИ, УЧИ НЕЛОЖНИМИ УСТАМИ СКАЗАТИ ПРАВДУ. (… At night, and by day, and in the evening, and early in the morning soar with me and teach, teach by unlying mouth to say the truth), against the background of the rushnyk (embroidered towel) there is depicted a conventionalized allegorical embodiment of the master`s talent - two Muses, those of poetry and pictorial art; below there are the coin issue year indication 2014, facsimile signature of T.H.Shevchenko and bow-shaped face value: П`ЯТДЕСЯТ ГРИВЕНЬ (fifty hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of 50 hryvnia coin divided into two parts (above the surface is smooth, below - in relief), which symbolizes the poet`s tortuous destiny, there is a series of T.H.Shevchenko`s self-portraits forming a circle and illustrating different periods of the master`s life and his talent; in the center, on the smooth surface, there are the lines ДОЛЯ/…МИ НЕ ЛУКАВИЛИ З ТОБОЮ,/МИ ПРОСТО ЙШЛИ; У НАС НЕМА/ЗЕРНА НЕПРАВДИ ЗА СОБОЮ. (Destiny / …we have not been sly, you and me / we simply walked; we have not / a granule of falsehood after us.); below, on the relief surface, there is the inscription ТАРАС/ШЕВЧЕНКО (Taras / Shevchenko) and to the left there is the indication of the years of his life 1814/1861.

name: 200th Anniversary of T.H.Shevchenko`s Birth
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the bicentenary of birth of Taras Hryhorovych SHEVCHENKO, an outstanding son of the Ukrainian people, poet of genius, artist, thinker that has made an inestimable contribution to the spiritual treasury of humankind. The great Kobzar`s talent has climbed the heights of Ukrainian and world culture, the vigour of its national phenomenality diffuses far beyond the ambit of literature and art.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coins: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine, against the background of the rushnyk (embroidered towel) there is depicted a conventionalized allegorical embodiment of the master`s talent - two Muses, those of poetry and pictorial art; below there are the coin issue year indication 2014, and bow-shaped face value: П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias); below on the rushnyk there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of 5 hryvnia coin there is T.H.Shevchenko`s portrait together with the inscriptions: above - СВОЮ УКРАЇНУ ЛЮБІТЬ… (love your Ukraine), below - ТАРАС/ШЕВЧЕНКО/ 1814 - 1861 (Taras / Shevchenko); to the right and left there are vegetable ornamental patterns.

name: Yevhenii Berezniak
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 100th anniversary of birth of Yevhenii Stepanovych Berezniak, a Hero of Ukraine, the military intelligence agent who saved the city of Krak?w (Republic of Poland) from the fascist invaders, a Candidate of Education, author of many scientific works.
