averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is a conventionalized image of the cathedral towers and other buildings of Krak?w; to the right there is the coin face value 2 / ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnias) with the coin issue year indication 2014, to the left - the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a portrait of Yevhenii Berezniak against the background of the conventionalized map of Krak?w; to the left there are the inscriptions 1914/2013/ ЄВГЕНІЙ/БЕРЕЗНЯК/`ПАРОЛЬ/DUM SPIRO` (1914/2013 / Yevhenii / Berezniak / `password / dum spiro`).

name: Korsun-Shevchenkovsky Offensive
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the offensive operation of the 1st and 2nd Ukrainian fronts on January 24 - February 17, 1944, when Hitler`s army groupings were destroyed in the Korsun Pocket, creating favorable conditions for the complete liberation of Right-Bank Ukraine.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the center there is the composition symbolizing the victory: figures 1944 (gilded on the silver coin) with the image of salute fireworks over them; under them there is depicted the laurel branch with the ribbon and star; to the right, over the star, there is the coin issue year indication 2014; below there is the bow-shaped legend of the coin face value: on the silver coin - ДВАДЦЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (twenty hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the conventionalized composition: in the center, against the background of the map, there is depicted the entrance gate of the palace ensemble in the city of Korsun-Shevchenkivskyi; along the coin circumference there are depicted the arrows symbolizing the offensive of Soviet troops all over the encirclement of the enemy alignment with the inscriptions: to the right, above - 70 років (70 years) and, the bow-shaped one below - КОРСУНЬ-ШЕВЧЕНКІВСЬКА БИТВА (Korsun-Shevchenkivskyi Battle).

name: Korsun-Shevchenkovsky Offensive
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the offensive operation of the 1st and 2nd Ukrainian fronts on January 24 - February 17, 1944, when Hitler`s army groupings were destroyed in the Korsun Pocket, creating favorable conditions for the complete liberation of Right-Bank Ukraine.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the center there is the composition symbolizing the victory: figures 1944 with the image of salute fireworks over them; under them there is depicted the laurel branch with the ribbon and star; to the right, over the star, there is the coin issue year indication 2014; below there is the bow-shaped legend of the coin face value: П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias); to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the conventionalized composition: in the center, against the background of the map, there is depicted the entrance gate of the palace ensemble in the city of Korsun-Shevchenkivskyi; along the coin circumference there are depicted the arrows symbolizing the offensive of Soviet troops all over the encirclement of the enemy alignment with the inscriptions: to the right, above - 70 років (70 years) and, the bow-shaped one below - КОРСУНЬ-ШЕВЧЕНКІВСЬКА БИТВА (Korsun-Shevchenkivskyi Battle).

name: Liberation of Nikopol from the Fascist Invaders
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 70th anniversary of liberation of the city of Nikopol, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, from the fascist invaders on February 8, 1944, as a result of the Nikopol-Krivoi Rog offensive executed by troops of the 3rd and 4th Ukrainian Fronts.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ (National / Bank / of Ukraine); in the centre - the dynamic composition representing the offensive with participation of the tank units; below - the coin face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) with the coin issue year indication 2014 and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint thereunder.
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the mirror-finished background there is depicted the composition: a ribbon-formed star with the inscription 70/років (70/years) and a laurel branch; also there are the circumscription ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ НІКОПОЛЯ ВІД ФАШИСТСЬКИХ ЗАГАРБНИКІВ (Liberation of Nikopol from the fascist invaders) and the legend 1944 (below).

name: XXII Olympic Winter Games
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a sporting event that is important to the entire world - the XXII Olympic Winter Games, which are scheduled to take place in Sochi (Russia), and to participation of the national team of Ukraine therein. History of the Olympic Movement in Ukraine started in 1952 when our athletes as members of the Soviet Union team for the first time took part in the Games of the XV Olympiad in Helsinki. Since then Ukraine has been developing and strengthening its positions - our sportsmen and sportswomen have won 620 medals. The Olympic Movement in Ukraine is coordinated by the National Olympic Committee of Ukraine established on December 22, 1990. Support to the participation of Ukrainian athletes in the Olympics, popularization of mass sports and healthy lifestyle, strengthening of the international cooperation in sports are the main objective of its activities.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of blue and yellow corresponding to the national colours of the Ukrainian Olympic team (pad printing) there is a conventionalized image of mountains with the following legends thereunder: 2014 (coin issue year to the left), in the centre ЗИМОВІ/ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ/ІГРИ (Winter / Olympic / Games) and the bow-shaped coin face value below: ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias), to the right, there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the images of a biathlete (in the foreground) and representatives of winter sports (along the circumference).

name: XXII Olympic Winter Games
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a sporting event that is important to the entire world - the XXII Olympic Winter Games, which are scheduled to take place in Sochi (Russia), and to participation of the national team of Ukraine therein. History of the Olympic Movement in Ukraine started in 1952 when our athletes as members of the Soviet Union team for the first time took part in the Games of the XV Olympiad in Helsinki. Since then Ukraine has been developing and strengthening its positions - our sportsmen and sportswomen have won 620 medals. The Olympic Movement in Ukraine is coordinated by the National Olympic Committee of Ukraine established on December 22, 1990. Support to the participation of Ukrainian athletes in the Olympics, popularization of mass sports and healthy lifestyle, strengthening of the international cooperation in sports are the main objective of its activities.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of blue and yellow corresponding to the national colours of the Ukrainian Olympic team (pad printing) there is a conventionalized image of mountains with the following legends thereunder: 2014 (coin issue year to the left), in the centre ЗИМОВІ/ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ/ІГРИ (Winter / Olympic / Games) and the bow-shaped coin face value below: ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the images of a biathlete (in the foreground) and representatives of winter sports (along the circumference).

name: 75 Years of the Sumy Oblast
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an agro-industrial region situated in the north-eastern part of Left-Bank Ukraine. Sumshchyna is a natural treasury of interminable meadows, clear waters and abundant forests, a land of glorious history and Cossack traditions.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the semicircular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there are depicted the Saviour`s Transfiguration Cathedral, Sumy Pavilion, sabre and powder horn, grain ears; to the right there is the coin issue year indication 2014.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Oblast coat of arms with the semicircular inscriptions: СУМСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Sumy Oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1939 РОЦІ (established in 1939 year) below.

name: 75 Years of the Kirovohrad Oblast
generalDescription: 75 Years of the Kirovohrad Oblast
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the semicircular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there are depicted M.L.Kropyvnytskyi Kirovohrad Academic Ukrainian Theatre of Music and Drama (the theatre of coryphaei) with the coin issue year indication 2014 thereunder, V.G.Shukhov hyperboloid structure tower, Atoms for Peace symbol, seed drill, grain ears and sunflower.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Oblast coat of arms with the semicircular inscriptions: КІРОВОГРАДСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Kirovohrad Oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1939 РОЦІ (established in 1939 year) below.

name: 60 Years of the Cherkasy Oblast
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the picturesque Cossack land on the Dnieper River banks, the birthplace of Bohdan Khmelnytskyi and Taras Shevchenko. This Oblast having a strong economic potential is famous for its chernozem (black earth) as well as for its multicoloured rushnyks (embroidered towels) and is often named `the Heart of Ukraine`.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the semicircular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there are depicted the church in the village of Subotiv, gazebo in the Sofiivka Park, kobza and wheatears; over them there is indicated the coin issue year 2014.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Oblast coat of arms with the semicircular inscriptions: ЧЕРКАСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Cherkasy Oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1954 РОЦІ (established in 1954 year) below.

name: 1120 Years of the City of Uzhhorod
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Uzhhorod, the administrative center of the Zakarpattia Oblast, a picturesque city situated on both banks of the Uzh River which arose as a fortress and has witnessed many historical events in Zakarpattia.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); thereunder is the inscription on the ribbon УЖГОРОДСЬКИЙ ЗАМОК (Uzhhorod Castle); in the center there is depicted the Uzhhorod Castle encircled with walls with a branch of the Japanese cherry against the background thereof; to the left there is the coin issue year indication 2013; below there is the coin face value: ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: represents the city panorama with the pedestrian bridge over the Uzh River framed in the Japanese cherry branches; above, to the left, there is the coat of arms of Uzhhorod; below there is the inscription 1120/РОКІВ УЖГОРОД (1120/years Uzhhorod).

name: 1120 Years of the City of Uzhhorod
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Uzhhorod, the administrative center of the Zakarpattia Oblast, a picturesque city situated on both banks of the Uzh River which arose as a fortress and has witnessed many historical events in Zakarpattia.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); thereunder is the inscription on the ribbon УЖГОРОДСЬКИЙ ЗАМОК (Uzhhorod Castle); in the center there is depicted the Uzhhorod Castle encircled with walls with a branch of the Japanese cherry against the background thereof; to the left there is the coin issue year indication 2013; below there is the coin face value: П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias); to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: represents the city panorama with the pedestrian bridge over the Uzh River framed in the Japanese cherry branches; above, to the left, there is the coat of arms of Uzhhorod; below there is the inscription 1120/РОКІВ УЖГОРОД (1120/years Uzhhorod).

name: 900th Anniversary of the Tale of Bygone Years
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 900th anniversary of compilation of the first edition of the chronicle Tale of Bygone Years (the Primary Chronicle), the most eminent monument of the Kyiv Rus annals. This unique monument of the Old Rus annals created in the beginning of the 12th century contains data on the origin and resettlements of East Slavonians, formation of the Kyiv power, its first princes, elucidates political, military and dynastic events, and is a treasury of documents, traditions, legends and so on.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, against the background of conventionalized wooden buildings of an Old Rus city, there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there are depicted Khoryv, Shchek, Kyi and their sister Lybid, who, according to the legends, were the founders of Kyiv; below there are the coin face value 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias) and issue year indication 2013.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears a conventionalized composition of a battle scene with the image of Nestor the Chronicler in the middle; above there is the legend ПОВІСТЬ/ МИНУЛИХ ЛІТ/ ХІІ СТ. (Tale / of Bygone Years / XII century).

name: Catherine`s Glory Ship of the Line
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 230th anniversary of launch of the 66-gun ship of the line `Catherine`s Glory`, the flagship of the Black Sea Fleet, at the Kherson Admiralty Shipyard. During the years of activity of the Kherson Admiralty, that was in 1778-1827 one of the most important centres of shipbuilding on the south of Russia, 34 ships of the line and 16 frigates were launched from its slipways.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is depicted the wind rose as a symbol of the sea travels with a conventionalized vegetal ornamentation patterns and sailing vessels to the left and right thereof; between them there is the coin issue year indication 2013; below there is the face value: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias) on the silver coin or 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) on the German silver one; on the latter, to the right, there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the mirror surface background there is depicted a ship with sails set; to the left there is the semicircular inscription `СЛАВА КАТЕРИНИ`/ЛІНІЙНИЙ КОРАБЕЛЬ (`Glory of Catherine` / line-of-battle ship).

name: Catherine`s Glory Ship of the Line
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 230th anniversary of launch of the 66-gun ship of the line `Catherine`s Glory`, the flagship of the Black Sea Fleet, at the Kherson Admiralty Shipyard. During the years of activity of the Kherson Admiralty, that was in 1778-1827 one of the most important centres of shipbuilding on the south of Russia, 34 ships of the line and 16 frigates were launched from its slipways.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is depicted the wind rose as a symbol of the sea travels with a conventionalized vegetal ornamentation patterns and sailing vessels to the left and right thereof; between them there is the coin issue year indication 2013; below there is the face value: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias); to the right, there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the mirror surface background there is depicted a ship with sails set; to the left there is the semicircular inscription `СЛАВА КАТЕРИНИ`/ЛІНІЙНИЙ КОРАБЕЛЬ (`Glory of Catherine` / line-of-battle ship).

name: Year of the Horse
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Year of the Horse according to a calendar of Chinese origin, which is based on the twelve-year orbit of Jupiter.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ (National Bank / of Ukraine) thereunder; within a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation pattern there is the face value 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias); below there is the coin issue year indication 2014, as well as the indications of the metal and its fineness Ag 925, coin weight in fineness 15.55 g and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint mark.
reverseDescription: Reverse: within a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation pattern there is depicted in a technique of a cheap popular print a horse (the horse`s eye is represented by a brown cubic zirconium oxide). Both above and below this composition there is a depiction of contour figures of all 12 symbols of the Oriental calendar.

name: Mykola Amosov
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Mykola Mykhailovych Amosov, a legend of the world science, distinguished scholar in the area of medicine and biocybernetics, public figure, Academician of the National Academy of Sciences and Academy of Medical Sciences of Ukraine, the founder and director of the Institute of Cardiovascular Surgery. Mykola Amosov has saved thousands of people owing to his big love for them and sense of responsibility for their lives.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is depicted the heart surrounded by a conventionalized image of the electrocardiogram; to the right there is the coin issue year indication 2013 and below - the semicircular face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears Mykola Amosov`s portrait; above there is the inscription МИКОЛА АМОСОВ (Mykola Amosov), to the left - years of his life 1913/2002.

name: Borys Hrinchenko
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 150th anniversary of birth of Borys Dmytrovych HRINCHENKO, a poet and prose writer, translator and literary critic, the author of basic research works in ethnography, linguistics, study of literature and pedagogy, historical sketches, first textbooks of Ukrainian language and literature, compiler of the explanatory dictionary of Ukrainian language in 4 volumes, one of the organizers and leaders of the Prosvita Society.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is a book image decorated with flower ornament; on the book pages there are the writer`s statement …УКРАЇНА. В ЦЬОМУ СЛОВІ ДЛЯ МЕНЕ ВСЕ. (…Ukraine. In this word (there is) for me everything.) and a pen; below there are the coin face value 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias), coin issue year indication 2013 (to the right) and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a portrait of Borys Hrinchenko to the left and right of which within the flower ornament there are indicated the years of his life 1863 and 1910; below there is the inscription БОРИС ГРІНЧЕНКО (Borys Hrinchenko).

name: 100 Years of P.I.Tchaikovsky National Music Academy of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the centenary of P.I.Tchaikovsky National Music Academy of Ukraine being a leading centre of the music education not only in Ukraine, but also worldwide. Such outstanding composers as Pyotr Tchaikovsky, Sergei Taneyev, Sergei Rachmaninoff took part in foundation of the establishment. During the century of its activities the Academy being the successor of P.I.Tchaikovsky Kyiv State Conservatory has trained many outstanding masters of the national and world culture.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the conventionalized composition representing a grand piano, treble clef and staff there is P.I.Tchaikovsky`s portrait; thereunder is the coin face value: 5 гривень (5 hryvnias); below there is the coin issue year indication 2013.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the mirror-finished background there is depicted the building of the Opera Studio of the National Music Academy of Ukraine with the legend 100 РОКІВ (100 years) and a laurel branch thereunder; there is also the circumscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНА МУЗИЧНА АКАДЕМІЯ УКРАЇНИ ІМЕНІ П.І.ЧАЙКОВСЬКОГО (National Music Academy of Ukraine named after P.I.Tchaikovsky).

name: 100 Years of P.I.Tchaikovsky National Music Academy of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the centenary of P.I.Tchaikovsky National Music Academy of Ukraine being a leading centre of the music education not only in Ukraine, but also worldwide. Such outstanding composers as Pyotr Tchaikovsky, Sergei Taneyev, Sergei Rachmaninoff took part in foundation of the establishment. During the century of its activities the Academy being the successor of P.I.Tchaikovsky Kyiv State Conservatory has trained many outstanding masters of the national and world culture.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the conventionalized composition representing a grand piano, treble clef and staff there is P.I.Tchaikovsky`s portrait; thereunder is the coin face value: 2 гривні (2 hryvnias), to the right, there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; below there is the coin issue year indication 2013.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the mirror-finished background there is depicted the building of the Opera Studio of the National Music Academy of Ukraine with the legend 100 РОКІВ (100 years) and a laurel branch thereunder; there is also the circumscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНА МУЗИЧНА АКАДЕМІЯ УКРАЇНИ ІМЕНІ П.І.ЧАЙКОВСЬКОГО (National Music Academy of Ukraine named after P.I.Tchaikovsky).

name: Battle of the Dnieper
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the offensive operations of September-December of 1943. These events became the accomplishment of the radical turn in the Great Patriotic War, i.e. of the battle of the Dnieper, in the course of which the city of Kyiv, the capital of Ukraine, was liberated. The battle became the culmination in the liberation of Ukraine, had a significant influence on the subsequent course of the military operations and was conducive to the defeat of the fascist invaders.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is the composition symbolizing the victory: the figures 1943 (gilded on the silver coin) with the image of fireworks above and a laurel wreath, ribbon and star below; to the right over the star there is the coin issue year indication 2013; below there is the bow-shaped inscription: П`ЯТДЕСЯТ ГРИВЕНЬ (fifty hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a conventionalized dynamic composition consisting of the images of an offensive combat wherein different arms participate - tanks, infantry, artillery, aviation, Dnieper Military Flotilla and so on; the mirror-finished part of the reverse symbolizes the Dnieper river; above there is the inscription БИТВА / ЗА ДНІПРО (Battle / of the Dnieper).

name: Battle of the Dnieper
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the offensive operations of September-December of 1943. These events became the accomplishment of the radical turn in the Great Patriotic War, i.e. of the battle of the Dnieper, in the course of which the city of Kyiv, the capital of Ukraine, was liberated. The battle became the culmination in the liberation of Ukraine, had a significant influence on the subsequent course of the military operations and was conducive to the defeat of the fascist invaders.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is the composition symbolizing the victory: the figures 1943 with the image of fireworks above and a laurel wreath, ribbon and star below; to the right over the star there is the coin issue year indication 2013; below there is the bow-shaped inscription: П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias); to the right, there is the National Bank of Ukraine Mint mark.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a conventionalized dynamic composition consisting of the images of an offensive combat wherein different arms participate - tanks, infantry, artillery, aviation, Dnieper Military Flotilla and so on; the mirror-finished part of the reverse symbolizes the Dnieper river; above there is the inscription БИТВА / ЗА ДНІПРО (Battle / of the Dnieper).

name: Nestor Makhno
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Nestor Ivanovych MAKHNO, the leader of peasant insurrectional movement in the south of Ukraine, personifying a type of the popular hero engendered by the throes of revolution. His talent for organization and military abilities do not admit of doubt, the tactics of insurrectional guerrilla warfare elaborated by him have become a subject of the science of warfare research.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin issue year indication 2013 thereunder; in the centre there are the images of tachanka (horse-drawn machine gun platform) in relief and horses (dark in colour); thereunder are the coin face value 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint mark (to the left).
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears a portrait of Nestor Makhno (to the left) and wheatears with the inscriptions between them ЗЕМЛЯ / ВОЛЯ / НАРОДНА / ВЛАДА (land / liberty / people`s / power) (to the right); in between there is the vertical inscription НЕСТОР МАХНО (Nestor Makhno) with indication of the years of his life 1888/1934 to the left thereof.

name: Olha Kobylianska
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 150th anniversary of birth of a renowned Ukrainian authoress, one of the most educated women of the 19th century who fought for the women`s rights and, by means of her works, according to Dmytro Pavlychko`s statement, `created an entire encyclopedia of the feminine soul`. Olha Yulianivna KOBYLIANSKA is an impressive figure in the Ukrainian prose, astute psychologistic writer, artist of a lyrically romantic turn of mind whose artistic legacy has enriched the spiritual treasury of our people.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) with the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint mark thereunder; to the left there is represented a fragment of Olha Kobylianska`s letter to Lesya Ukrainka against the background whereof there are depicted an inkpot and a pen; below there is the legend 2 ГРИВНІ / 2013 (2 hryvnias / 2013).
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the background of the fragment of Olha Kobylianska`s letter to Lesya Ukrainka (to the left) there is a portrait of the penwoman with indication of the years of her life 1863/1942; above there is the semicircular inscription ОЛЬГА КОБИЛЯНСЬКА (Olha Kobylianska).

name: Breakthrough of the German Defensive Line Wotan by the Soviet Army and Liberation of Melitopol
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 70th anniversary of the Melitopol Offensive Operation resulting in the breakthrough of the German defensive line Wotan by the Soviet Army, to the event that became the start of defeat of the enemy and liberation of the South-East part of Ukraine together with Crimea from the fascist invaders.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscriptions thereunder: to the left - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and to the right - 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ/2013 (5/ hryvnias/2013); in the centre there is depicted a group of soldiers in the course of an attack; to the right thereof is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; below there is the inscription ПРОРИВ РАДЯНСЬКИМИ ВІЙСЬКАМИ / НІМЕЦЬКОЇ ЛІНІЇ ОБОРОНИ / ВОТАН (Breakthrough by Soviet Army / in the German defensive line / Wotan).
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the mirror-finished background there is depicted the composition: a star with the inscription 70/років (70/years) and a laurel branch; also there are the circumscription ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ МЕЛІТОПОЛЯ ВІД ФАШИСТСЬКИХ ЗАГАРБНИКІВ (Liberation of Melitopol from the fascist invaders) and the legend 1943 (below).

name: Liberation of Donbas from the Fascist Invaders
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 70-th anniversary of liberation of the region of Donbas. Thanks to the decisive actions of the Southwestern and Southern Fronts troops many towns, villages and industrial facilities of Donbas were saved. Donetsk (Stalino) was liberated on September 8, 1943, and the whole region of Donbas - on September 22, 1943.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) with the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine thereunder to the right; in the centre there is depicted a memorial to the liberator warriors with its name thereunder МЕМОРІАЛЬНИЙ КОМПЛЕКС `САВУР-МОГИЛА` (Memorial complex `Savur-Mohyla`); below there are the coin issue year indication 2013 (to the left) and face value: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) together with the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (to the right).
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the mirror-finished background there is depicted the composition: a star with the inscription 70/років (70/years) and a laurel branch; also there are the circumscription ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ ДОНБАСУ ВІД ФАШИСТСЬКИХ ЗАГАРБНИКІВ (Liberation of Donbas from the fascist invaders) and the legend 1943 (below).

name: Liberation of Donbas from the Fascist Invaders
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 70-th anniversary of liberation of the region of Donbas. Thanks to the decisive actions of the Southwestern and Southern Fronts troops many towns, villages and industrial facilities of Donbas were saved. Donetsk (Stalino) was liberated on September 8, 1943, and the whole region of Donbas - on September 22, 1943.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) with the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine thereunder to the right; in the centre there is depicted a memorial to the liberator warriors with its name thereunder МЕМОРІАЛЬНИЙ КОМПЛЕКС `САВУР-МОГИЛА` (Memorial complex `Savur-Mohyla`); below there are the coin issue year indication 2013 (to the left) and face value: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the mirror-finished background there is depicted the composition: a star with the inscription 70/років (70/years) and a laurel branch; also there are the circumscription ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ ДОНБАСУ ВІД ФАШИСТСЬКИХ ЗАГАРБНИКІВ (Liberation of Donbas from the fascist invaders) and the legend 1943 (below).

name: 150th Anniversary of the National Philharmonic Society of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 150th anniversary of one of the oldest concert music performance societies of our country. Such outstanding artists and liberal-minded public figures as the composer M.Lysenko, folklorist M.Rihelman, amateur composer P.Seletskyi and many others helped give birth to the then Kyiv Philharmonic Society in 1863.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); thereunder is the image of Lysenko Colonnaded Hall as seen from the stage, where a grand piano is depicted; to the right there is the coin issue year indication 2013; below there is the coin face value: 2 гривні (2 hryvnias), to the right, there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the dark background there is depicted the building of the former Merchants Assembly (1882), where from 1944 up to date the National Philharmonic Society of Ukraine is located; below there are its emblem and the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНА/ФІЛАРМОНІЯ/УКРАЇНИ/150 РОКІВ (National / Philharmonic Society / of Ukraine / 150 years).

name: 150th Anniversary of the National Philharmonic Society of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 150th anniversary of one of the oldest concert music performance societies of our country. Such outstanding artists and liberal-minded public figures as the composer M.Lysenko, folklorist M.Rihelman, amateur composer P.Seletskyi and many others helped give birth to the then Kyiv Philharmonic Society in 1863.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); thereunder is the image of Lysenko Colonnaded Hall as seen from the stage, where a grand piano is depicted; to the right there is the coin issue year indication 2013; below there is the coin face value: 5 гривень (5 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the dark background there is depicted the building of the former Merchants Assembly (1882), where from 1944 up to date the National Philharmonic Society of Ukraine is located; below there are its emblem and the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНА/ФІЛАРМОНІЯ/УКРАЇНИ/150 РОКІВ (National / Philharmonic Society / of Ukraine / 150 years).

name: House of a Poet (on the occasion of the Centenary of M.Voloshin`s House)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the centenary of construction completion of the House of a Poet. In Koktebel, on the very shore of a picturesque bight, at the foot of the dateless extinct volcano Kara Dag, there is an unusual house preserving a lot of real objects and legends of the 20th century, founded by Maximilian Voloshin for communication and creative work. The House has been visited by representatives of many generations of the creative intellectuals.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); in the centre there is the image of the House of a Poet with the silhouettes of people before it representing the `hospitality spirit` of the good host`s residence; thereunder is the inscription БУДИНОК ПОЕТА М.ВОЛОШИНА (House of the poet M.Voloshin) with the coin issue year indication 2013 to the right thereof; below there are the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the coin face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the working artist`s silhouette against the background of the waterscape with the lines from his poem exposing the kernel of Maximilian Voloshin`s creative work of a poet and artist ДВЕРЬ ОТПЕРТА, / ПЕРЕСТУПИ ПОРОГ, / МОЙ ДОМ / РАСКРЫТ / НАВСТРЕЧУ / ВСЕХ ДОРОГ… (The door is open, / Cross the threshold, / My home / Is exposed / In advance / To every road…); below there is the legend ДО 100-РІЧЧЯ (on the occasion of the 100th anniversary).

name: 650th Anniversary of the First Record of the City of Vinnytsia
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Vinnytsia, an administrative and industrial center, one of the most fascinating cities of Podolia, situated on the banks of the Southern Bug River, which was first mentioned under 1363 as a fortress.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin issue year indication 2013 (thereunder to the left); to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there is a conventionalized image of one of the city adornments, the fountain, with its mirror reflection; below there is the legend 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: above there is the Coat of Arms of Vinnytsia; thereunder, against the background of the scroll, is depicted a conventionalized composition: the ink-pot with the quill, city architectures and the legend ВІННИЦЯ (Vinnytsia); below there is the inscription ПЕРША ПИСЕМНА ЗГАДКА/ 650/ РОКІВ (First record/650/years).

name: 650th Anniversary of the First Record of the City of Vinnytsia
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Vinnytsia, an administrative and industrial center, one of the most fascinating cities of Podolia, situated on the banks of the Southern Bug River, which was first mentioned under 1363 as a fortress.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin issue year indication 2013 (thereunder to the left); in the center there is a holographic image of one of the city adornments, the fountain, with its mirror reflection; below there is the legend 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: above there is the Coat of Arms of Vinnytsia; thereunder, against the background of the scroll, is depicted a conventionalized composition: the ink-pot with the quill, city architectures and the legend ВІННИЦЯ (Vinnytsia); below there is the inscription ПЕРША ПИСЕМНА ЗГАДКА/ 650/ РОКІВ (First record/650/years).

name: Nesterov`s Loop
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the centenary of performance of the loop-the-loop aerobatic maneuver known also as Nesterov`s loop. For the first time the maneuver was performed on August 27, 1913, by Pyotr Nesterov in the sky over Kyiv (Syrets military airfield) before numerous spectators` eyes. The event became de facto the beginning of aerobatics and substantial contribution to the aviation development.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above) with the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine to the left; in the centre, against the background of the decorative military map case with the flight plan, Pyotr Nesterov`s portrait and the coin issue year indication 2013 to the right thereof; below - the coin face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) and the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted a conventionalized composition of performance of the famous loop by Nesterov in a Nieuport monoplane; in the middle thereof - the inscription ПЕТЛЯ/1913/рік/КИЇВ/НЕСТЕРОВА (loop/1913/year/Kyiv/of Nesterov); below there are depicted the spectators as on the 1913 postcards from Kyiv.

name: World Rhythmic Gymnastics Championships
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the World Rhythmic Gymnastics Championships, a sports gala to be held in Ukraine for the first time. 289 gymnasts from 59 countries are to come to Kyiv to participate in the competition. The rhythmic gymnastics is one of the most attractive and exquisite sports receiving recognition all over the world and having many admirers everywhere.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), in the centre there is the Championships logo with the inscription 32nd WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS RHYTHMIC GYMNASTICS; below there are the coin issue year indication 2013 and the bow-shaped legend ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias); to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the image of a gymnast with ribbon and semicircular inscription ЧЕМПІОНАТ СВІТУ З ХУДОЖНЬОЇ ГІМНАСТИКИ (World Championships Rhythmic Gymnastics).

name: Liberation of Kharkiv from the Fascist Invaders
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 70-th anniversary of liberation of the city of Kharkiv from the fascist invaders on August 23, 1943, by the Steppe Front troops in co-operation with the Voronezh and Southwestern Fronts as a result of the successful counteroffensive of the Soviet Army in the direction of Belgorod and Kharkiv, which was the Battle of Kursk conclusion.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) with the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine thereunder to the left; in the center there is depicted the monument to the Liberator Warrior decorating the city; thereunder is indicated the coin issue year 2013; to the left there is the coin face value: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias); to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a composition: the star with the inscription 70/років (70/years) in the center with the laurel branch thereunder; the reverse bears the circumferential inscription ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ ХАРКОВА ВІД ФАШИСТСЬКИХ ЗАГАРБНИКІВ (Liberation of Kharkiv from the fascist invaders) and the legend 1943 (below).

name: Liberation of Kharkiv from the Fascist Invaders
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 70-th anniversary of liberation of the city of Kharkiv from the fascist invaders on August 23, 1943, by the Steppe Front troops in co-operation with the Voronezh and Southwestern Fronts as a result of the successful counteroffensive of the Soviet Army in the direction of Belgorod and Kharkiv, which was the Battle of Kursk conclusion.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) with the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine thereunder to the left; in the center there is depicted the monument to the Liberator Warrior decorating the city; thereunder is indicated the coin issue year 2013; to the left there is the coin face value: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias) on the silver coin.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a composition: the star with the inscription 70/років (70/years) in the center with the laurel branch thereunder; the reverse bears the circumferential inscription ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ ХАРКОВА ВІД ФАШИСТСЬКИХ ЗАГАРБНИКІВ (Liberation of Kharkiv from the fascist invaders) and the legend 1943 (below).

name: Ukrainian Vyshyvanka
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a bright, original and colourful element of Ukrainian traditional clothing, i.e. to the vyshyvanka (embroidered shirt) that reflects the embroidery traditions of each region of Ukraine by its decorative patterns and scale of colours.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); thereunder is represented a girl with the needle in hand embroidering a cloth, a part whereof is coloured (tampography); against the background of the cloth there is the coin face value indication: 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias) ; thereunder to the right is the coin issue year 2013.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is the coloured fragment of the vyshyvanka cloth: on the German silver coin the tampography is used, on the silver coin the image is holographic; above and below there are the semicircular inscriptions УКРАЇНСЬКА (Ukrainian) and ВИШИВАНКА (vyshyvanka) respectively.

name: Ukrainian Vyshyvanka
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a bright, original and colourful element of Ukrainian traditional clothing, i.e. to the vyshyvanka (embroidered shirt) that reflects the embroidery traditions of each region of Ukraine by its decorative patterns and scale of colours.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); thereunder is represented a girl with the needle in hand embroidering a cloth, a part whereof is coloured (tampography); against the background of the cloth there is the coin face value indication: 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) ; thereunder to the right is the coin issue year 2013. On the German silver coin, to the left, there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is the coloured fragment of the vyshyvanka cloth: on the German silver coin the tampography is used, on the silver coin the image is holographic; above and below there are the semicircular inscriptions УКРАЇНСЬКА (Ukrainian) and ВИШИВАНКА (vyshyvanka) respectively.

name: 1025th Anniversary of Christianization of Kyivan Rus
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the introduction of Christianity by Volodymyr the Great as the established religion, which was conducive to unification and consolidation of Kyivan Rus, literacy propagation, good prospects of economic and cultural relations, etc.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there are the coin issue year indication 2013 and the coin face value: П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias). There is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint to the right. In the center of the coin there is the composition consisting of the image of an encolpion (pectoral cross) and symbolic figures of the Four Evangelists: Matthew as an angel, Mark as a lion, Luke as an ox and John as an eagle. All the figures are winged and holding the Gospel.
reverseDescription: Reverse of 5 hryvnia coin bears a composition consisting of some figurines: Volodymyr the Great and Andrew the First-Called holding the Cross together with the Saints: Anthony and Theodosius of the Caves, Cyril and Methodius; above there is depicted the icon of the Blessed Virgin of Zymne with images of angels to the left and right thereof; below there is the semicircular legend 1025-РІЧЧЯ ХРЕЩЕННЯ КИЇВСЬКОЇ РУСІ (1025th Anniversary of Christianization of Kyiv Rus).

name: 1025th Anniversary of Christianization of Kyivan Rus
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the introduction of Christianity by Volodymyr the Great as the established religion, which was conducive to unification and consolidation of Kyivan Rus, literacy propagation, good prospects of economic and cultural relations, etc.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there are the coin issue year indication 2013 and the coin face value: СТО ГРИВЕНЬ (a hundred of hryvnias) on the gold coin. In the center of the coins there is the composition consisting of the image of an encolpion (pectoral cross) and symbolic figures of the Four Evangelists: Matthew as an angel, Mark as a lion, Luke as an ox and John as an eagle. All the figures are winged and holding the Gospel.
reverseDescription: Reverse of the 100 hryvnia coin bears a conventionalized composition - against the background of the Cross adorned with the grape-vine there are: the face of the Grand Duke Volodymyr the Great (to the left) and his signet (to the right); above there is the semicircular legend 1025-РІЧЧЯ ХРЕЩЕННЯ КИЇВСЬКОЇ РУСІ (1025th Anniversary of Christianization of Kyiv Rus).

name: 1025th Anniversary of Christianization of Kyivan Rus
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the introduction of Christianity by Volodymyr the Great as the established religion, which was conducive to unification and consolidation of Kyivan Rus, literacy propagation, good prospects of economic and cultural relations, etc.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there are the coin issue year indication 2013 and the coin face value: ДВАДЦЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (twenty hryvnias). In the center of the coins there is the composition consisting of the image of an encolpion (pectoral cross) and symbolic figures of the Four Evangelists: Matthew as an angel, Mark as a lion, Luke as an ox and John as an eagle. All the figures are winged and holding the Gospel.
reverseDescription: Reverse of the 20 hryvnia coin bears a composition consisting of some figurines: Volodymyr the Great and Andrew the First-Called holding the Cross together with the Saints: Anthony and Theodosius of the Caves, Cyril and Methodius; above there is depicted the icon of the Blessed Virgin of Zymne with images of angels to the left and right thereof; below there is the semicircular legend 1025-РІЧЧЯ ХРЕЩЕННЯ КИЇВСЬКОЇ РУСІ (1025th Anniversary of Christianization of Kyiv Rus).

name: Centenary of the Kyiv Research Institute of Forensic Science
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the oldest state establishments of Ukraine for forensics which started its activities in 1913 as the Office for Forensics attached to the Prosecutor of the Kyiv Court, which is called now Kyiv Research Institute of Forensic Science. Having behind a hundred years of history the institute has become one of the leading institutions of forensics where highly skilled legal experts work.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legends НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is indicated the coin issue year 2013, to the left there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center there is the Institute emblem.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears the Institute building image with the legend 100/РОКІВ (100/years) and the circular inscription КИЇВСЬКИЙ НАУКОВО-ДОСЛІДНИЙ ІНСТИТУТ СУДОВИХ ЕКСПЕРТИЗ (Kyiv Research Institute of Forensic Science).

name: World Youth Championship in Athletics
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the most prestigious sport forum of the world among the young athletes, i.e. the World Youth Championship in Athletics to be held in the city of Donetsk, which will facilitate strengthening of our country image in the world athletic community. The IAAF World Youth Championships in Athletics are held biennially and in the course of them the birth of new stars of the track-and-field athletics happens.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the coin issue year indication 2013 thereunder and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), in the centre there is the image of the `Olimpiyskyi` Stadium in Donetsk with conventionalized images of the running tracks and the inscription thereunder ОЛІМПІЙСЬКИЙ СТАДІОН / м.ДОНЕЦЬК (Olimpiyskyi Stadium / city of Donetsk); below there are the coin face value 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint mark.
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears a dynamic composition of girl athletes in motion; above there is the legend ЮНАЦЬКИЙ / ЧЕМПІОНАТ СВІТУ / З ЛЕГКОЇ АТЛЕТИКИ / ДОНЕЦЬК 2013 (Youth / Championship of the World / in Track-and-Field Athletics / Donetsk 2013.

name: Maternity
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the maternity, a timeless value of the humanity, a well of life, a symbol of holiness, eternity, warmth and affection. In the art this grand and everlasting subject is one of the oldest in the world culture.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the center there is depicted a baby carriage (carrycot) as a symbol of childhood and life immortality; thereunder are the coin issue year indication 2013 and the semicircular face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: bears a conventionalized image of the Mother holding the Baby in her arms and the bow-shaped legend МАТЕРИНСТВО (maternity). The Mother`s image is full of warmth, motherliness, care and affection.

name: 75 Years of the Luhansk Oblast
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a region that is named the eastern gate of the country where live the people fond of their land who can work, where are almost a half of Ukraine`s high-quality coal resources, fertile black earth and immense steppe.
averseDescription: Obverse: bears the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legends НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) beneath; to the right there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; in the center, against the background of the Sun, there is depicted an industrial landscape; in the foreground there are represented a marmot, feather grass, grain ears and sunflower; under the composition there is indicated the coin issue year 2013.
reverseDescription: Reverse: represents the oblast coat of arms and bears two semicircular inscriptions - ЛУГАНСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Luhansk oblast) above and ЗАСНОВАНА У 1938 РОЦІ (established in 1938 year) below.

name: The House with Chimeras
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a building designed in the early 20th century by a prominent architect, engineer, traveler and businessman Vladyslav Horodetskyi whose 150th birth anniversary it also commemorates. Unusual in artistic design and new in style, the house features sculptures in the form of mythical creatures and hunting scenes.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin issue year indication 2013 (thereunder to the right); against the background of the House with Chimeras there is a portrait with the bow-shaped inscription thereunder В.ГОРОДЕЦЬКИЙ (V.Horodetskyi); to the left there are the architect`s years of life 1863-1930; above them there is the coin face value: 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias) on the silver coin together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint mark.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the background of the House with Chimeras contours there is a fragment of a sculptural composition in relief embellishing the House fa?ade; to the left there is the architect`s facsimile signature (vertically); to the right there is the semicircular inscription БУДИНОК З ХИМЕРАМИ (house with chimeras).

name: The House with Chimeras
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a building designed in the early 20th century by a prominent architect, engineer, traveler and businessman Vladyslav Horodetskyi whose 150th birth anniversary it also commemorates. Unusual in artistic design and new in style, the house features sculptures in the form of mythical creatures and hunting scenes.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin issue year indication 2013 (thereunder to the right); against the background of the House with Chimeras there is a portrait with the bow-shaped inscription thereunder В.ГОРОДЕЦЬКИЙ (V.Horodetskyi); to the left there are the architect`s years of life 1863-1930; above them there is the coin face value: 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) on the German silver coin (together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint mark).
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the background of the House with Chimeras contours there is a fragment of a sculptural composition in relief embellishing the House fa?ade; to the left there is the architect`s facsimile signature (vertically); to the right there is the semicircular inscription БУДИНОК З ХИМЕРАМИ (house with chimeras).

name: The Great Bustard
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the great bustard, one of the largest birds in Ukraine. This disappearing species from the gruiformes order is on the Ukrainian and European Red List of Threatened Species as a worldwide endangered species.
averseDescription: Obverse: within the wreath formed by images of some flora and fauna species there are located the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the legends: on the silver coin НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/БАНК/УКРАЇНИ/10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2013 (National/Bank/of Ukraine/10/hryvnias/2013) together with the indications of the metal and its fineness Ag 925 and the coin weight in fineness 31,1; on the silver coin there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on both coins there is the great bustard image and the legends: above - ДРОХВА (great bustard) and, below against the background of grass - OTIS TARDA.

name: The Great Bustard
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the great bustard, one of the largest birds in Ukraine. This disappearing species from the gruiformes order is on the Ukrainian and European Red List of Threatened Species as a worldwide endangered species.
averseDescription: Obverse: within the wreath formed by images of some flora and fauna species there are located the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the legends: on the German silver coin НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/БАНК/УКРАЇНИ/2/ГРИВНІ/2013 (National/Bank/of Ukraine/2/hryvnias/2013); on the German silver coin there is the mark of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the German silver coin there is the great bustard image and the legends: above - ДРОХВА (great bustard) and, below against the background of grass - OTIS TARDA. The German silver coin was fabricated with making use of the pad printing.

name: 1 000 Years of the Liadova Cave Monastery
generalDescription: The coin has been struck to commemorate the millennium of the Liadova Cave Monastery of Beheading of St. John the Baptist founded by Anthony of the Caves. It is one of the oldest orthodox monasteries and is often called Podolian Athos. The monastery lies on the left bank of the Dniester River near the village of Liadova, which is surrounded by unique natural sites in the middle reaches of the Dniester.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, there is the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (NATIONAL BANK OF UKRAINE); to the right, there is the Small National Coat of Arms of Ukraine, the coin`s issue year 2013, and a stylized composition with Antony of the Caves in the center, against the background of wing-like cliffs; beneath, there is an Old Rus ornament and the semicircular legend ДВАДЦЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (TWENTY HRYVNIAS).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a composition consisting of a stylized fragment of the Cave Monastery, a cross procession of monks and pilgrims, a pigeon (to the left, above), and rays symbolizing the Holy Spirit. There is the circular legend ЛЯДІВСЬКИЙ СВЯТО-УСІКНОВЕНСЬКИЙ СКЕЛЬНИЙ МОНАСТИР (LIADOVA CAVE MONASTERY OF BEHEADING OF ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST).

name: Volodymyr Vernadsky
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Volodymyr Ivanovych Vernadsky, a world-famous scientist in the area of natural history, mineralogist, crystallographer, the founder of geochemistry, biogeochemistry and radiogeology, a thinker, philosopher, the first president of the Ukrainian Academy of Sciences and founder of the first research library in Ukraine.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is a composition whose constituents mirror the scientist`s view of life: the terrestrial globe, crystal lattice of silicon, human figurine and burst of light symbolizing the new life birth; below there are the coin face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) and issue year indication 2013.
reverseDescription: Reverse: in the foreground to the right there is a portrait of Volodymyr Ivanovych Vernadsky; to the left above there is depicted the terrestrial globe with the scholar`s dictum `ЦАРСТВО МОЇХ ІДЕЙ ПОПЕРЕДУ` (The realm of my ideas is yet to come) and his years of life 1863/1945 thereunder; below there is the inscription В. І. ВЕРНАДСЬКИЙ (V.I.Vernadsky).

name: 200 Years of Semen Hulak-Artemovsky
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the bicentenary of birth of Semen Hulak-Artemovsky, a Ukrainian composer, opera artist, brilliant actor, the author of the first Ukrainian opera `Zaporozhets za Dunaiem` (A Zaporozhian (Cossack) beyond the Danube, meaning in exile) belonging to the golden pool of the national musical heritage as well as to the 150th anniversary of the first performance of the opera. It is an outstanding accomplishment of the composer incarnating the national peculiarities of the Ukrainian folklore and everyday life of the epoch. Semen Stepanovych Hulak-Artemovsky was as well the author of the opera word book and the first performer of the role of Karas.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is the conventionalized composition depicting Odarka and Ivan Karas, the opera central figures, against the background of the mosque image; in the foreground there is a rural view - thatched cabins, fence, mallows; the legends - 2013 to the right, ДВАДЦЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (twenty hryvnias) semicircular below.
reverseDescription: Reverse: within a baroque flower ornamental pattern there is a portrait of S.Hulak-Artemovsky with the quill in his hand; to the right of him there are depicted Oksana and Andrii, opera protagonists; to the left, over the lyre, there is depicted a woman personifying a Muse of the singer and composer; above there are the inscriptions: the semicircular СЕМЕН ГУЛАК-АРТЕМОВСЬКИЙ (Semen Hulak-Artemovsky) and 200/років (years).

name: The Year of the Bat
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the year of the bat. All 26 bat species registered in Ukraine are listed in the Red Book of Ukraine and protected by the Ukrainian law. Being the only true flying mammals, chiroptera, or bats, play an important role in keeping the eco-system in equilibrium.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, there is an image of the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the following circumferential legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); to the right there is the coin`s year of issue - 2012; to the left there is the logo of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine; in the center, against a relief background, there is a smooth image of the bat; below there is the coin`s face value - 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a symbolic composition consisting of a bat against the background of a stylized image of the terrestrial sphere, and, on the right, the scircumpherential legend ВСЕСВІТНІЙ РІК КАЖАНА (the year of the bat).

name: The Year of the Snake
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the year of the snake according to a calendar of Chinese origin, which is based on the twelve-year orbit of Jupiter, the largest solar planet.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, there is an image of the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine; in the middle, there is a stylized ornament and the following legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (National Bank/ of Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnias); below, against a smooth background, there is the coin issue year - 2013, metal fineness - Ag 925, coin weight - 15.55 (to the left), and the logo of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine (to the right).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is an image of the snake done in a lubok style and surrounded by a stylized floral ornament (the snake has a green eye). Above and below the composition, there are silhouettes of all 12 animals that represent the Chinese (oriental) calendar.

name: 75 Years of the Zhytomyr Oblast
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Zhytomyrshchyna, an old region situated in the centre of Ukraine on the border of the Forest Steppe and Polissia (Polesia). The economic potential basis of the Zhytomyr Oblast is diversified agriculture (cultivation of the grain crops, hop, flax) as well as production of porcelain and faience. The region is also rich in such natural resources as granite, ilmenite, quartzite, marble, etc.
averseDescription: Obverse: there is an image of the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) and the following circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above) and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) (below); in the center there is a conventionalized composition consisting of a decorative plate, hop and flax cones, a monument to Serhii Koroliov, and a water tower; to the right of the tower is the coin issue year - 2012 and the logo of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is an image of the oblast`s coat of arms and the following circumferential legends: ЖИТОМИРСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Zhytomyr oblast) (above), ЗАСНОВАНА У 1937 РОЦІ (created in 1937) (below).

name: 75 Years of the Mykolaiv Oblast
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the land of shipbuilders, mechanicians and grain-growers situated in the steppe zone in the south of Ukraine, within the lower-Southern-Buh-river basin. The economic potential of the Mykolaiv Oblast is based on power generation, shipbuilding and agro-industry.
averseDescription: Obverse: there is an image of the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, above, and the coin issue year - 2012 thereunder; there are the following circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above) and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) (below); in the center there is a composition consisting of a ship, an amphora, an ancient coin and a bunch of sunflowers, grapes and ears of wheat; to the right of the bunch there is the logo of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is an image of the oblast`s coat of arms and the following circumferential legends: МИКОЛАЇВСЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Mykolaiv oblast) (above), ЗАСНОВАНА У 1937 РОЦІ (created in 1937) (below).

name: The Sterlet
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the sterlet, an endangered species of sturgeon. This bottom-dwelling fish is usually found in deep river basins with clean flowing water, and tends to live alone or in small groups. The sterlet is in Ukraine`s Red List of Threatened Species.
averseDescription: Obverse: within the wreath formed from the images of different species of the flora and fauna there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК /УКРАЇНИ/ 2/ ГРИВНІ/ 2012 (National / Bank / of Ukraine / 2 / hryvnias / 2012, below there is the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is the image of sterlet together with the inscriptions: below, against the light background imitating the sandy bottom, СТЕРЛЯДЬ ПРІСНОВОДНА (Sterlet of fresh-waters) and above ACIPENSER RUTHENUS.

name: The Sterlet
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the sterlet, an endangered species of sturgeon. This bottom-dwelling fish is usually found in deep river basins with clean flowing water, and tends to live alone or in small groups. The sterlet is in Ukraine`s Red List of Threatened Species.
averseDescription: Obverse: within the wreath formed from the images of different species of the flora and fauna there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК /УКРАЇНИ/ 10/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2012 (National / Bank / of Ukraine / 10 / hryvnias / 2012) together with the indications of the metal and its fineness Ag 925 and the coin weight in fineness 31,1); below there is the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is the image of sterlet together with the inscriptions: below, against the light background imitating the sandy bottom, СТЕРЛЯДЬ ПРІСНОВОДНА (Sterlet of fresh-waters) and above ACIPENSER RUTHENUS.

name: Zhovkva Synagogue
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a monument of the Judaic sacral architecture and the defensive works, i.e. the Zhovkva Synagogue built in 1692 in the style of Renaissance. It is one of the largest Renaissance defensive structures in Europe.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the coin centre, within the circle, there is depicted a fragment of the synagogue building facade, to the right and left whereof conventionalized ornamental patterns are; the coin issue year indication 2012 is to the right; below there are the legends: ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias) on the silver coin; the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint is to the left of the coin centre.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the background of the conventionalized decorative building plan there is depicted the synagogue; above there is the inscription СИНАГОГА в м. ЖОВКВА (synagogue in the city of Zhovkva).

name: Architectural Monuments of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a monument of the Judaic sacral architecture and the defensive works, i.e. the Zhovkva Synagogue built in 1692 in the style of Renaissance. It is one of the largest Renaissance defensive structures in Europe.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the coin centre, within the circle, there is depicted a fragment of the synagogue building facade, to the right and left whereof conventionalized ornamental patterns are; the coin issue year indication 2012 is to the right; below there is the legend: П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) on the albata coin; the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint is to the left of the coin centre.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the background of the conventionalized decorative building plan there is depicted the synagogue; above there is the inscription СИНАГОГА в м. ЖОВКВА (synagogue in the city of Zhovkva).

name: Kacha - a Phase of the National Aviation History
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the centenary of the urban-type settlement of Kacha, 28 km distant from Sevastopol (to the north), which is the cradle of the national aviation. Here the first rules of flying and airmanship were set, the first high-skilled national personnel for aviation was trained, the first military aircrafts soared into the sky, the aerobatics were performed and so on.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, there is an image of the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the following semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/БАНК/УКРАЇНИ (National/ Bank/of Ukraine); to the left there is the coin issue year - 2012 with the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine beneath it; in the center there is the coat of arms of Kacha; to the right, against a map of the airfield, the is the following legend: 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a symbolic composition: against a background of stars, a winged man holds a plane in outstretched arms; below the composition there is the following legend: КАЧА - ЕТАП ІСТОРІЇ/ВІТЧИЗНЯНОЇ АВІАЦІЇ (Kacha - a stage in the history of/domestic aviation); above the composition there is the following legend: 1912 - 2012.

name: Ukrainian Lyric Song
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Ukrainian lyric song, melodious, affecting and touching, enriched with visual epithets, combining the joy and tranquil melancholy, celebrating the love and human relations, imbuing with its beauty and energy; it may be termed the treasury and soul of our people.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); thereunder is depicted a periwinkle flower wreath with ribbons, in the centre whereof are the coin face value 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) on the German silver coin and the coin issue year indication 2012. On the German silver coin to the left of the wreath, over the ribbons, there is the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: within a conventionalized circle of small countryside houses, fences and flowers, against the dark background, there are depicted a girl with a shoulder-yoke and a young man; along the coin edge, against the light background, there are conventionalized periwinkle flowers; below there is the legend УКРАЇНСЬКА/ЛІРИЧНА ПІСНЯ (Ukrainian/Lyric Song).

name: Ukrainian Lyric Song
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Ukrainian lyric song, melodious, affecting and touching, enriched with visual epithets, combining the joy and tranquil melancholy, celebrating the love and human relations, imbuing with its beauty and energy; it may be termed the treasury and soul of our people.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); thereunder is depicted a periwinkle flower wreath with ribbons, in the centre whereof are the coin face value 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias) on the silver coin and the coin issue year indication 2012.
reverseDescription: Reverse: within a conventionalized circle of small countryside houses, fences and flowers, against the dark background, there are depicted a girl with a shoulder-yoke and a young man; along the coin edge, against the light background, there are conventionalized periwinkle flowers; below there is the legend УКРАЇНСЬКА/ЛІРИЧНА ПІСНЯ (Ukrainian/Lyric Song).

name: 500 Years of the Town of Chyhyryn
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the town of Chyhyryn. Founded at the beginning of the 16th century on the border to the Wild Fields, the town had already Magdeburg Rights conferred on it by 1592. The town witnessed various historical events; it functioned as the capital of the Hetmanate (a Ukrainian Cossack State); served as headquarters for the Chyhyryn regiment; and also was the first hetman residence. Chyhyryn, and its rich history, have always attracted the attention of historians, writers, poets and artists, which have left us accounts of their travels, poetry and works of art.
averseDescription: Obverse: above, against a smooth background, there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the following legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/БАНК/УКРАЇНИ (National/ Bank/of Ukraine) thereunder; to the right, against a background showing part of the plan of Chyhyryn Fortress, is the wall of Doroshenko`s Stronghold; to the left there is a conventionalized ornament and the following legends: face value - 5 ГРИВЕН (5 hryvnias), year of issue - 2012, and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a panoramic view of the city; above - the Coat of Arms of Chyhyryn and the following legend: 500 років/ ЧИГИРИН (500 years/ CHYHYRYN) thereunder.

name: Mykhailo Kravchuk
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Mykhailo Pylypovych KRAVCHUK, a mathematician, educator and public figure, who was a member of the Ukrainian Academy of Sciences, author of basic research works in algebra, analysis, linear transformation theory, function theory, etc. Thanks to his wide range of scientific interests and scientific results Mykhailo Kravchuk came into prominence not only in Ukraine, but also beyond.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), in the centre there is a part of one of M.P.Kravchuk`s formulae with his utterance in the middle thereof МОЯ ЛЮБОВ - УКРАЇНА І МАТЕМАТИКА (My love - Ukraine and mathematics), below there are the coin face value - ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias), issue year indication - 2012 and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the background of numbers personifying the mathematician`s activities there are his portrait and legends: МИХАЙЛО/КРАВЧУК (Mykhailo/Kravchuk) and to the right 1892/1942 (years of his life).

name: 1 800 Years of the Town of Sudak
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Sudak, one of the oldest towns in Ukraine. Known from the third century AD, the town has been named Sogdia, Soldaia and Surozh - in Old Rus records. The town offers unique recreational opportunities and boasts picturesque scenery as well as architectural monuments, such as the remains of the Genoese fortress, which was built in the 14th-15th centuries.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin issue year indication 2012 (thereunder to the right), lower there is a fragment of the XVth century relief depicting St. George, which was found in the Genoese fortress during excavation; to the right and left there is depicted a conventionalized grape-vine against the background of the wall; below there is the legend 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias) on the silver coin (together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a conventionalized picture of the town with its beaches as seen from the fortress wall (to the left) and to the right, against the background of the sea, there are the inscription СУДАК/1800/РОКІВ (Sudak/1800/years) and the coat of arms of the town.

name: 1 800 Years of the Town of Sudak
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Sudak, one of the oldest towns in Ukraine. Known from the third century AD, the town has been named Sogdia, Soldaia and Surozh - in Old Rus records. The town offers unique recreational opportunities and boasts picturesque scenery as well as architectural monuments, such as the remains of the Genoese fortress, which was built in the 14th-15th centuries.
