averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin issue year indication 2012 (thereunder to the right), lower there is a fragment of the XVth century relief depicting St. George, which was found in the Genoese fortress during excavation; to the right and left there is depicted a conventionalized grape-vine against the background of the wall; below there is the legend 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) on the German silver coin together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a conventionalized picture of the town with its beaches as seen from the fortress wall (to the left) and to the right, against the background of the sea, there are the inscription СУДАК/1800/РОКІВ (Sudak/1800/years) and the coat of arms of the town.

name: Antiquity Navigation
generalDescription: The commemorative coins continue the `Maritime History of Ukraine` series reflecting the history of navigation and shipbuilding on the territory of our country. The shipbuilding being one of the major productive industries of the ancient Greek towns on the northern coast of the Black Sea contributed greatly to the technological advance of the then society being conducive to development of mathematics, construction engineering, natural sciences, etc. The Southern Crimea was during almost two millennia a node of the seaborne trade and intensive navigation.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) with the coin issue year indication 2012 thereunder; against the background of the conventionalized map there are depicted the wind rose as a symbol of sea voyages (to the left) and an ancient coin of the Bosporan Kingdom (to the right); below there are the meander and the coin face value: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias) on the silver coin (together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo).
reverseDescription: Reverse: on both coins to the left there is a conventionalized image of the prora, i.e. the ship bow, often depicted on the ancient Greek and Roman coins as a seafaring symbol; to the right above there is depicted an ancient sailing ship and below, on the wide meander, there is the conventionalized inscription АНТИЧНЕ/СУДНОПЛАВСТВО (Antiquity/navigation).

name: Antiquity Navigation
generalDescription: The commemorative coins continue the `Maritime History of Ukraine` series reflecting the history of navigation and shipbuilding on the territory of our country. The shipbuilding being one of the major productive industries of the ancient Greek towns on the northern coast of the Black Sea contributed greatly to the technological advance of the then society being conducive to development of mathematics, construction engineering, natural sciences, etc. The Southern Crimea was during almost two millennia a node of the seaborne trade and intensive navigation.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) with the coin issue year indication 2012 thereunder; against the background of the conventionalized map there are depicted the wind rose as a symbol of sea voyages (to the left) and an ancient coin of the Bosporan Kingdom (to the right); below there are the meander and the coin face value: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) on the German silver one (together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo).
reverseDescription: Reverse: on both coins to the left there is a conventionalized image of the prora, i.e. the ship bow, often depicted on the ancient Greek and Roman coins as a seafaring symbol; to the right above there is depicted an ancient sailing ship and below, on the wide meander, there is the conventionalized inscription АНТИЧНЕ/СУДНОПЛАВСТВО (Antiquity/navigation).

name: Paralympic Games
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 2012 Summer Paralympic Games (the 14th Paralympics) to be held in London, the home of the world Paralympic movement, as well as to this movement in Ukraine backed by the National Sports Committee for the Disabled of Ukraine, Ukrainian Center of Physical Training and Sports for the Disabled `Invasport` and others, whose rate of development is among the highest in the world.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine), the city panorama of London against the background whereof there is, to the left, the Paralympic Torch with conventionalized ornamental patterns to the left and right of it; to the right there is the legend ЛОНДОН (London) with another legend 2 ГРИВНІ / 2012 (2 hryvnias / 2012) and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo below.
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the dark background there is depicted a Paralympic athlete shooting a bow with the Ukrainian Paralympic Movement emblem above; to the right, against the light background, there is the bow-shaped inscription XIV ПАРАЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ (XIVth Paralympic Games).

name: Furrier
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the oldest crafts, i.e. processing of skins and fabrication of fur clothing, the trade of furrier. The silver coin has been produced with application of greening (patina making) technology.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two little birds and (to the left and right of them) the Ukrainian traditional clothing - kozhukhs (coats), shapkas (hats), keptars (jerkins); below there are the legends: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2012 (10 hryvnias) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on both coins against the background of leather laid along there is depicted the furrier at work; above against the conventionalized background there is the inscription КУШНІР (Furrier). To the left and right of the central composition there are conventionalized ornamental patterns.

name: Furrier
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the oldest crafts, i.e. processing of skins and fabrication of fur clothing, the trade of furrier.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two little birds and (to the left and right of them) the Ukrainian traditional clothing - kozhukhs (coats), shapkas (hats), keptars (jerkins); below there are the legends: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2012 (5 hryvnias) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on both coins against the background of leather laid along there is depicted the furrier at work; above against the conventionalized background there is the inscription КУШНІР (Furrier). To the left and right of the central composition there are conventionalized ornamental patterns.

name: Yeletskyi Holy Dormition Cloister
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an architectural complex, the Yeletskyi Holy Dormition Cloister. Founded in the 11th century, the cloister belongs to one of the oldest buildings in Ukraine and features the stone Dormition of the Theotokos Cathedral as its major structure.
averseDescription: Obverse: there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) and the semicircular legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and ЄЛЕЦЬКИЙ СВЯТО-УСПЕНСЬКИЙ МОНАСТИР (Yeletskyi Holy-Dormition Cloister) beneath; in the centre there is depicted the main building of the cloister, i.e. Holy Dormition Cathedral with the inscription XI-XVIII ст. (centuries) against the background thereof; to the left of the cathedral there is the coin face value - 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) on the German silver one; to the right there is 2012 (coin issue year). Thereunder, there is the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on both coins there is a conventionalized image of the Mother of God icon on the spruce tree according to a legend about the cloister foundation with the semicircular inscription ОБРАЗ ПРЕСВЯТОЇ БОГОРОДИЦІ ЄЛЕЦЬКОЇ (Image of the Blessed Theotokos of Yeletskyi) above on the ribbon and a conventionalized ornamental pattern below.

name: Yeletskyi Holy Dormition Cloister
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an architectural complex, the Yeletskyi Holy Dormition Cloister. Founded in the 11th century, the cloister belongs to one of the oldest buildings in Ukraine and features the stone Dormition of the Theotokos Cathedral as its major structure.
averseDescription: Obverse: there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) and the semicircular legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and ЄЛЕЦЬКИЙ СВЯТО-УСПЕНСЬКИЙ МОНАСТИР (Yeletskyi Holy-Dormition Cloister) beneath; in the centre there is depicted the main building of the cloister, i.e. Holy Dormition Cathedral with the inscription XI-XVIII ст. (centuries) against the background thereof; to the left of the cathedral there is the coin face value - 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias) on the silver coin; to the right there is 2012 (coin issue year).
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the coin there is a conventionalized image of the Mother of God icon on the spruce tree according to a legend about the cloister foundation with the semicircular inscription ОБРАЗ ПРЕСВЯТОЇ БОГОРОДИЦІ ЄЛЕЦЬКОЇ (Image of the Blessed Theotokos of Yeletskyi) above on the ribbon and a conventionalized ornamental pattern below.

name: Games of the XXX Olympiad
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an important sporting event, the Games of the XXX Olympiad, which are scheduled to take place in 2012 in London.
averseDescription: Obverse: on the coin above there is depicted the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine together with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); the city panorama against the background whereof to the left there is a conventionalized image of the Olympic Torch with the legend ЛОНДОН (London) to the right; below there is the legend 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2012 (10 / hryvnias / 2012) on the silver coin together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the coin there are depicted: located in the form of semicircle silhouettes of representatives of different sports and a gold stater of Philip II who took part in Olympic Games together with the legends ІГРИ ХХХ

name: Games of the XXX Olympiad
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an important sporting event, the Games of the XXX Olympiad, which are scheduled to take place in 2012 in London.
averseDescription: Obverse: on the coin above there is depicted the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine together with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); the city panorama against the background whereof to the left there is a conventionalized image of the Olympic Torch with the legend ЛОНДОН (London) to the right; below there is the legend 2 / ГРИВНІ / 2012 (2 / hryvnias / 2012) on the German silver one together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the coin there are depicted: located in the form of semicircle silhouettes of representatives of different sports and a gold stater of Philip II who took part in Olympic Games together with the legends ІГРИ ХХХ

name: 80th Anniversary of Donetsk Oblast
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 80th anniversary of Donetsk oblast - the mighty industrial heart of the state, the land with unique natural resources and a high industrial potential, where talented and hardworking people live.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); beneath there is indicated the coin face value ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias); to the left there is the coin issue year 2012. In the center there is depicted a fragment of the Donetsk oblast flag against the background of the oblast outline map.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there are depicted figures of a metallurgist, miner and agricultural workwoman against the background of the oblast industrial landscape; to the right - the Holy Transfiguration Cathedral in the city of Donetsk; above there is the semicircular inscription ДОНЕЦЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Donetsk Oblast) with the coat of arms of the oblast and legend 80 РОКІВ (80 years) thereunder.

name: 200 Years of the Nikitsky Botanical Garden
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the oldest scientific research institutions of our country - the Nikitsky Botanical Garden that was founded in 1812 on the Cape Martian close to Yalta. The Garden is a unique collection of the local and world flora, a paragon of the landscape architecture, a sui generis museum under the open sky with about 20 thousand species of plants from different areas of the globe.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre, against the background of a conventionalized ornamental pattern of flowers and leaves, there is a portrait bust of the founder and first director of the garden with indication of his name thereunder ХРИСТІАН СТЕВЕН (Christian Steven); below there are the coin issue year indication 2012 and the crescent-like legend - П`ЯТДЕСЯТ ГРИВЕНЬ ( fifty hryvnias) on the silver coin
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin there are depicted: a pond with a fountain in the middle; against the background of waterscape, in the middle distance, a garden part with a pavilion; against the background of the pond below - the legend НІКІТСЬКИЙ / БОТАНІЧНИЙ САД / 1812-2012 (Nikitsky / Botanical Garden / 1812-2012).

name: 200 Years of the Nikitsky Botanical Garden
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the oldest scientific research institutions of our country - the Nikitsky Botanical Garden that was founded in 1812 on the Cape Martian close to Yalta. The Garden is a unique collection of the local and world flora, a paragon of the landscape architecture, a sui generis museum under the open sky with about 20 thousand species of plants from different areas of the globe.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre, against the background of a conventionalized ornamental pattern of flowers and leaves, there is a portrait bust of the founder and first director of the garden with indication of his name thereunder ХРИСТІАН СТЕВЕН (Christian Steven); below there are the coin issue year indication 2012 and the crescent-like legend -П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) on the white copper one. On the latter, to the left, there is the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin there are depicted: a pond with a fountain in the middle; against the background of waterscape, in the middle distance, a garden part with a pavilion; against the background of the pond below - the legend НІКІТСЬКИЙ / БОТАНІЧНИЙ САД / 1812-2012 (Nikitsky / Botanical Garden / 1812-2012).

name: Sydir Kovpak
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Sydir Artemovych Kovpak, a famous son of the Ukrainian people, military leader and statesman, twice Hero of the Soviet Union, which in 1941-1945 was the commander of the Putyvl partisan unit and allied partisan units of Sumy region.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: to the left, against the dark background, the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder, below - the coin face value and issue year 2 ГРИВНІ/2012 (2 hryvnias/2012) and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo; in between there are a laurel branch and two Gold Star medals of the Hero of the Soviet Union; to the right, against the light background, there are a conventionalized image of the book cover, inscription `Від Путивля / до Карпат` (from Putyvl / to the Carpathians) and Kovpak`s facsimile signature.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is a portrait of Sydir Kovpak against the background of a map together with the legends to the left: Сидір Ковпак (Sydir Kovpak) - bow-shaped, and 1887-1967 - his life years.

name: UEFA EURO 2012TM Poland - Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship, which is to take place in Ukraine and Poland in 2012. The coin, together with another one, comprises a set of two commemorative coins enclosed in a capsule.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (to the right); beneath the Coat of Arms there is the legend 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2012 (10/hryvnias/2012) with the Henri Delaunay Cup placed thereunder against the background of conventionalized ornament consisting of Euro-2012-related graphic characters. Below there is the legend indicating the coin`s metal, fineness - Ag 925, weight in fineness - 31.1 g and the logotype of the NBU Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted an image of a football player and part of a ball; to the left there is the legend УЄФА ЄВРО 2012™ УКРАЇНА - ПОЛЬЩА (UEFA EURO 2012™ Poland - Ukraine).

name: Malva
generalDescription: The commemorative coin continues the `Smallest Gold Coin` series and is dedicated to one of the Ukrainian symbols, the malva (mallow), the flower which represents love to one`s homeland and people.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the circle of beads there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, above it - 2012 (the coin issue year); between the circle and the coin edge there are the semicircular legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) underneath, as well as Au 999,9 (coin metal and its fineness) to the left and the coin weight in fineness - 1,24 with the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint to the right of the Coat.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the malva picture together with the legends: МАЛЬВА (malva) to the left and MALVA to the right.

name: 350 Years of the City of Ivano-Frankivsk
generalDescription: The commemorative coins is dedicated to the 350th anniversary of Ivano-Frankivsk (till 1962 - Stanislav), an oblast center of Ukraine, located at the foot of the Carpathian mountains in the interfluve of the rivers Bystrytsia-Nadvirnianska and Bystrytsia-Solotvynska (Dniester-river basin). The city is mentioned for the first time in written sources under 1662, when the Magdeburg rights were granted to it.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is depicted the building of Ratusha (City Hall), to the left whereof there are the coat of arms of the city and legend 1662; below there is the indication of the coin issue year 2012; to the right of Ratusha image there is indicated the denomination - 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias). On the 5 hryvnia coin, below to the left, there is the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the coin there is depicted one of the oldest architectural monuments of the city - the Church of Virgin Mary; the city coat of arms is above together with the inscription ІВАНО-ФРАНКІВСЬК/350 РОКІВ (Ivano-Frankivsk/350 years) thereunder.

name: 350 Years of the City of Ivano-Frankivsk
generalDescription: The commemorative coins is dedicated to the 350th anniversary of Ivano-Frankivsk (till 1962 - Stanislav), an oblast center of Ukraine, located at the foot of the Carpathian mountains in the interfluve of the rivers Bystrytsia-Nadvirnianska and Bystrytsia-Solotvynska (Dniester-river basin). The city is mentioned for the first time in written sources under 1662, when the Magdeburg rights were granted to it.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is depicted the building of Ratusha (City Hall), to the left whereof there are the coat of arms of the city and legend 1662; below there is the indication of the coin issue year 2012; to the right of Ratusha image there is indicated the denomination - 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias)
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the coin there is depicted one of the oldest architectural monuments of the city - the Church of Virgin Mary; the city coat of arms is above together with the inscription ІВАНО-ФРАНКІВСЬК/350 РОКІВ (Ivano-Frankivsk/350 years) thereunder.

name: Petro Kalnyshevskyi
generalDescription: The 10 hryvnia coin is dedicated to Petro I. Kalnyshevskyi, a politico-military and public figure of the 18th century. He was a military judge and the last Kosh Otaman of Zaporizhian Sich, who during the Russian-Turkish War of 1768 - 1774 proved himself to be a prominent military leader.
averseDescription: Obverse: there is depicted the common composition for the series embodying the idea of Ukraine`s integrity: the heraldic figures of the Archangel Michael and the crowned lion (symbols of the cities of Kyiv and Lviv) holding the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the coin issue year - 2012 over it; above there is the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below -10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the background of a stone wall there is depicted a conventionalized portrait of Petro Kalnyshevskyi and the circular inscriptions: ОСТАННІЙ КОШОВИЙ ОТАМАН ЗАПОРОЗЬКОЇ СІЧІ ПЕТРО КАЛНИШЕВСЬКИЙ (THE LAST KOSH OTAMAN OF THE ZAPORIZHIAN SICH PETRO KALNYSHEVSKYI), with his years of life 1691/1803 indicated on the right.

name: Glassblower
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the glassblowing, i.e. glass production known as early as in the Kyiv Rus epoch. After many centuries of development the glassblowing has reached a high artistic level. Especially ingenuous were flasks, very small casks, large bottles, quart bottles and differently shaped vessels in the form of cockerels, birds, teddy-bears, etc. The silver coin has been produced with application of greening (patina making) technology.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two little birds and (to the left and right of them) different glassblowing products - glass household stuff; below there are the legends: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2012 (10 hryvnias) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted a glassblower fabricating a vessel. Above, there is the legend ГУТНИК (glassblower). To the left and right of the central composition there are ornamental flower patterns.

name: Glassblower
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the glassblowing, i.e. glass production known as early as in the Kyiv Rus epoch. After many centuries of development the glassblowing has reached a high artistic level. Especially ingenuous were flasks, very small casks, large bottles, quart bottles and differently shaped vessels in the form of cockerels, birds, teddy-bears, etc.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two little birds and (to the left and right of them) different glassblowing products - glass household stuff; below there are the legends: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2012 (5 hryvnias) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted a glassblower fabricating a vessel. Above, there is the legend ГУТНИК (glassblower). To the left and right of the central composition there are ornamental flower patterns.

name: Oleksa Novakivskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Oleksa Kharlampiiovych NOVAKIVSKYI (1872-1935), an artist, educator, one of the most famous Ukrainian colorist painters, who founded an art school in Lviv. His works feature a virtuoso manner of painting, full brush, seminal expressivity.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the bow-shaped legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) to the right; in the centre there is depicted an architectural monument, i.e. the building where the painter dwelt and worked; beneath there are the coin face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) and issue year 2012.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a conventionalized portrait of the painter representing a fragment of O.Novakivskyi`s work `Self-portrait with the wife` of 1910; above there is the semicircular inscription ОЛЕКСА НОВАКІВСЬКИЙ (Oleksa Novakivskyi) and 1872/1935 to the left below (years of his life).

name: Yevhen Hrebinka
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Yevhen Pavlovych Hrebinka, a poet, prose-writer, author of numerous fables, who introduced into Ukrainian literature, inter alia, such romantic genres as romances, songs, etc., including nonpareil patterns of amorous poetry.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); lower there is a conventionalized composition in the centre whereof there is depicted a horseman; to the right there is a fragment of a manuscript page and below - a goose-quill; thereunder there is the coin face value 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) and to the left - the coin issue year - 2012.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a portrait of Yevhen Hrebinka to the right whereof, against the background of a conventionalized manuscript page, indicated are his years of life - 1812/1848; to the left there is the legend ЄВГЕН/ГРЕБІНКА (Yevhen/Hrebinka).

name: UEFA Euro 2012TM Final Tournament. City of Kyiv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship, some final matches whereof are to take place in Kyiv. The coin is an officially licensed product of UEFA Euro 2012™.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the map of Ukraine with the legend КИЇВ (Kyiv) there is the image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo with the inscriptions thereunder UEFA/EURO 2012TM/POLAND-UKRAINE; to the right - the coin issue year 2011, the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the bow-shaped face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a conventionalized panorama of the city and Olympic Stadium there are depicted figurines of two players with the ball in motion; above there is the Coat of Arms of Kyiv, below - the inscription ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР ЧЕМПІОНАТУ ЄВРОПИ / З ФУТБОЛУ / 2012р. (Final tournament of the championship of Europe / of football / 2012 year).

name: UEFA Euro 2012TM Final Tournament. City of Kharkiv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship, some final matches whereof are to take place in Kharkiv. The coin is an officially licensed product of UEFA Euro 2012™.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the map of Ukraine with the legend ХАРКІВ (Kharkiv) there is the image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo with the inscriptions thereunder UEFA/EURO 2012TM/POLAND-UKRAINE; to the right - the coin issue year 2011, the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the bow-shaped face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a conventionalized panorama of the city there are depicted figurines of two players with the ball in motion; to the right there is a conventionalized image of the Metalist Stadium; above there is the Coat of Arms of Kharkiv, below - the inscription ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР ЧЕМПІОНАТУ ЄВРОПИ / З ФУТБОЛУ / 2012р. (Final tournament of the championship of Europe / of football / 2012 year).

name: UEFA Euro 2012TM Final Tournament. City of Lviv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship, some final matches whereof are to take place in Lviv. The coin is an officially licensed product of UEFA Euro 2012™.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the map of Ukraine with the legend ЛЬВІВ (Lviv) there is the image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo with the inscriptions thereunder UEFA/EURO 2012TM/POLAND-UKRAINE; to the right - the coin issue year 2011, the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the bow-shaped face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a conventionalized panorama of the city there are depicted: a figurine of the football player with the ball in motion (to the left), a conventionalized image of the Arena Lviv Stadium (to the right), above - the Coat of Arms of Lviv; below - the inscription ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР ЧЕМПІОНАТУ ЄВРОПИ / З ФУТБОЛУ / 2012р. (Final tournament of the championship of Europe / of football / 2012 year).

name: UEFA Euro 2012TM Final Tournament. City of Donetsk
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship, some final matches whereof are to take place in Donetsk. The coin is an officially licensed product of UEFA Euro 2012™.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the map of Ukraine with the legend ДОНЕЦЬК (Donetsk) there is the image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo with the inscriptions thereunder UEFA/EURO 2012TM/POLAND-UKRAINE; to the right - the coin issue year 2011, the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the bow-shaped face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the conventionalized background of the Donbass Arena Stadium there is depicted a figurine of the goal-keeper with the ball in motion; above there is the city panorama and Coat of Arms of Donetsk; below - the inscription ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР ЧЕМПІОНАТУ ЄВРОПИ / З ФУТБОЛУ / 2012р. (Final tournament of the championship of Europe / of football / 2012 year).

name: UEFA Euro 2012TM Final Tournament
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship - to be hosted by Poland and Ukraine in 2012. The coin is an officially licensed product of UEFA Euro 2012™.
averseDescription: Obverse: on the obverse of the coin there are depicted: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, the map of Europe with the inscriptions КИЇВ (Kyiv) and WARSZAWA (Warsaw) against the background whereof there is the image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo with the inscriptions thereunder UEFA/EURO 2012TM/POLAND-UKRAINE; to the left listed are the years of the previous European Football Championships starting from 1960; to the right there are the coin face value and issue year 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2011 (5/hryvnias/2011) the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the coin reverse there is a conventionalized composition - the Olympic Stadium where the tournament final is to take place with the numerals 2012, against the background whereof there are figurines of football players in motion; under the composition there is the inscription ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР ЧЕМПІОНАТУ ЄВРОПИ / З ФУТБОЛУ / 2012р. (Final tournament of the championship of Europe / of football / 2012 year); above there is the Coat of Arms of Kyiv.

name: UEFA European Football Championship - 2012 Final Tournament
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship - to be hosted by Poland and Ukraine in 2012.
averseDescription: Obverse: on the obverse of the coin there are depicted: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, the map of Europe with the inscriptions КИЇВ (Kyiv) and WARSZAWA (Warsaw) against the background whereof there is the enameled image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo in colour; under the map there is indicated the coin face value 500/ГРИВЕНЬ (500/hryvnias); along the coin circumference there are depicted silhouettes of architectural monuments of the cities, where the final tournament matches are to take place, and figurines of football players together with indication of the match dates.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the coin reverse there is a conventionalized composition of the football match: in the foreground there is depicted a figurine of a football player with the ball in motion; in the background - figurines of two players and goalkeeper`s silhouette; there are the legends: ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР (final tournament) above to the left and ЧЕМПІОНАТ/ЄВРОПИ /З ФУТБОЛУ/2012 р. (Championship / of Europe / of football / 2012 year) below to the right.

name: The Year of the Dragon
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the year of the Dragon according to the calendar of the Chinese origin based on the twelve-year cycle of the Jupiter.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ (National Bank/of Ukraine) thereunder; within a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation pattern there is the coin face value 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ Hryvnias); below there is the coin issue year indication 2012, as well as the indications of the metal and its fineness Ag 925, coin weight in fineness 15,55 g and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: Reverse: within a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation pattern there is depicted in a technique of a cheap popular print a dragon (the dragon`s eye is represented by an orange zirconia of 1.5 mm diameter). Both above and below this composition there is a depiction of contour figures of all 12 symbols of the Oriental calendar.

name: UEFA Euro 2012TM Final Tournament
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship - to be hosted by Poland and Ukraine in 2012.
averseDescription: Obverse: on the obverse of the coin there are depicted: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, the map of Europe with the inscriptions КИЇВ (Kyiv) and WARSZAWA (Warsaw) against the background whereof there is the holographic image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo with the inscriptions thereunder UEFA/EURO 2012TM/POLAND-UKRAINE; to the left listed are the years of the previous European Football Championships starting from 1960; to the right there are the coin face value and issue year 20/ГРИВЕНЬ/2011 (20/hryvnias/2011).
reverseDescription: Reverse: on the coin reverse there is a conventionalized composition - the Olympic Stadium where the tournament final is to take place with the numerals 2012, against the background whereof there are figurines of football players in motion; under the composition there is the inscription ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР ЧЕМПІОНАТУ ЄВРОПИ / З ФУТБОЛУ / 2012р. (Final tournament of the championship of Europe / of football / 2012 year); above there is the Coat of Arms of Kyiv.

name: UEFA Euro 2012TM Final Tournament. City of Kharkiv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship, some final matches whereof are to take place in Kharkiv.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the map of Ukraine with the legend ХАРКІВ (Kharkiv) there is the holographic image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo with the inscriptions thereunder UEFA/EURO 2012TM/POLAND-UKRAINE; to the right - the coin issue year 2011 and the bow-shaped face value ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a conventionalized panorama of the city there are depicted figurines of two players with the ball in motion; to the right there is a conventionalized image of the Metalist Stadium; above there is the Coat of Arms of Kharkiv, below - the inscription ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР ЧЕМПІОНАТУ ЄВРОПИ / З ФУТБОЛУ / 2012р. (Final tournament of the championship of Europe / of football / 2012 year).

name: UEFA Euro 2012TM Final Tournament. City of Kyiv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship, some final matches whereof are to take place in Kyiv.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the map of Ukraine with the legend КИЇВ (Kyiv) there is the holographic image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo with the inscriptions thereunder UEFA/EURO 2012TM/POLAND-UKRAINE; to the right - the coin issue year 2011 and the bow-shaped face value ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a conventionalized panorama of the city and Olympic Stadium there are depicted figurines of two players with the ball in motion; above there is the Coat of Arms of Kyiv, below - the inscription ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР ЧЕМПІОНАТУ ЄВРОПИ / З ФУТБОЛУ / 2012р. (Final tournament of the championship of Europe / of football / 2012 year).

name: UEFA Euro 2012TM Final Tournament. City of Donetsk
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship, some final matches whereof are to take place in Donetsk.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the map of Ukraine with the legend ДОНЕЦЬК (Donetsk) there is the holographic image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo with the inscriptions thereunder UEFA/EURO 2012TM/POLAND-UKRAINE; to the right - the coin issue year 2011 and the bow-shaped face value ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the conventionalized background of the Donbass Arena Stadium there is depicted a figurine of the goal-keeper with the ball in motion; above there is the city panorama and Coat of Arms of Donetsk; below - the inscription ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР ЧЕМПІОНАТУ ЄВРОПИ / З ФУТБОЛУ / 2012р. (Final tournament of the championship of Europe / of football / 2012 year).

name: UEFA Euro 2012TM Final Tournament. City of Lviv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an important sporting event - the final tournament of the 2012 UEFA European Football Championship, some final matches whereof are to take place in Lviv.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the map of Ukraine with the legend ЛЬВІВ (Lviv) there is the holographic image of the official UEFA Euro 2012 logo with the inscriptions thereunder UEFA/EURO 2012TM/POLAND-UKRAINE; to the right - the coin issue year 2011 and the bow-shaped face value ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a conventionalized panorama of the city there are depicted: a figurine of the football player with the ball in motion (to the left), a conventionalized image of the Arena Lviv Stadium (to the right), above - the Coat of Arms of Lviv; below - the inscription ФІНАЛЬНИЙ ТУРНІР ЧЕМПІОНАТУ ЄВРОПИ / З ФУТБОЛУ / 2012р. (Final tournament of the championship of Europe / of football / 2012 year).

name: International Year of Forests
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the International Year of Forests, i.e. 2011, declared such by the United Nations. The forests are a type of natural landscapes with corresponding vegetation, fauna, microorganisms, depending upon one another in their evolution. They are a component of the national natural resources of the country, ponderable for the life harmony of human beings.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there are depicted two birds sitting among branches in a conventionalized nest the centre whereof is like the Earth. The composition symbolizes the humankind life - the Earth is the home for people as the nest is the home for birds. Below there are the legend 2011 (the coin issue year) and the semicircular inscription П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there are depicted hand-like branches extending to the Sun; along the coin circumference there are the legends МІЖНАРОДНИЙ РІК ЛІСІВ (International Year of Forests) above and ЗБЕРЕЖЕМО ЗАРАДИ ЖИТТЯ ((We shall) salvage for the sake of the life) below.

name: International Year of Forests
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the International Year of Forests, i.e. 2011, declared such by the United Nations. The forests are a type of natural landscapes with corresponding vegetation, fauna, microorganisms, depending upon one another in their evolution. They are a component of the national natural resources of the country, ponderable for the life harmony of human beings.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is depicted a conventionalized tree in blossom having arm-like branches and the heart; to the right - the legend 2011 (the coin issue year); below there are the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the semicircular inscription П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there are depicted hand-like branches extending to the Sun; along the coin circumference there are the legends МІЖНАРОДНИЙ РІК ЛІСІВ (International Year of Forests) above and ЗБЕРЕЖЕМО ЗАРАДИ ЖИТТЯ ((We shall) salvage for the sake of the life) below.

name: 150 Years of Ukrainian Railroads
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 150th anniversary of Ukrainian railroads whose operation began with the arrival of the Yaroslav passenger train in Lviv from Peremyshl (Przemysl). The rail transport is the most instrumental in the transportation system of Ukraine. At present, there are six territorial railroad companies operational in Ukraine.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ (National / Bank / of Ukraine); against the dark background there is depicted a modern high-speed train of the Ukrainian Railways and a part of the rail track; to the left indicated is the coin face value 20/ГРИВЕНЬ (20/hryvnias) and to the right - the coin issue year 2011.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted one of the first trains of the Ukrainian railroads; above there is the semicircular inscription УКРАЇНСЬКА ЗАЛІЗНИЦЯ (Ukrainian Railways) with the logotype of the Ukrainian Railways (Ukrzaliznytsia) company thereunder; below there is the inscription 150 РОКІВ (150 years).

name: 20th Anniversary of the CIS
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the regional organization whose participating countries are former republics of the Soviet Union.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine), below - the coin issue year and face value 2011/ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2011/two hryvnias) and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo; in the centre there is depicted the National Flag of Ukraine (the decoration element - enamel) within the conventionalized viburnum (kalyna) wreath.
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the light background there is depicted the emblem of the Commonwealth of Independent States with the legend 20/РОКІВ (20/years) thereunder; above there is the semicircular inscription СПІВДРУЖНІСТЬ НЕЗАЛЕЖНИХ ДЕРЖАВ (Commonwealth of Independent States).

name: Dniprova Chaika
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 150th anniversary of birth of Dniprova Chaika (the pen name of Liudmyla Oleksiivna Vasylevska meaning the Gull of the Dnieper). She wrote quite a lot of short stories and poems as well as librettos of many children`s operas set to music by M.Lysenko, including such as `Koza-Dereza` (Naughty Little Goat), `Pan Kotskyi` (Skilful Puss), `Winter and Spring`.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); lower there is a conventionalized composition symbolizing Dniprova Chaika`s creative work and representing a girl near the sea; below there is the legend indicating the coin face value and issue year П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ /2011 (five hryvnias / 2011).
reverseDescription: Reverse: against the dark background there are a portrait of the authoress and the inscription ЛЮДМИЛА ВАСИЛЕВСЬКА (Liudmyla Vasylevska) to the left as an arch; under the portrait there are the legends ДНІПРОВА / ЧАЙКА (Dniprova / Chaika) and 1861/1927 (her life years); to the right against the light background there are the lines from Dniprova Chaika`s verse `The Star` `…Тої зірки, / того світу / Повік не забуду!` (That star, / that light / (I shall) never forget) together with the conventionalized image of the gull thereunder.

name: Mykhailo Yangel
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Mykhailo Kuzmych (Mikhail Kuzmich) YANGEL, an outstanding scientist in the area of mechanics, designer of space missiles, founder of a scientific design school of missilery.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); lower there is a conventionalized composition representing the shot of the first `Kosmos` launch vehicle and the first artificial satellite developed by the OKB-586 Design Bureau (nowadays Pivdenne (Yuzhnoye) Design Bureau); to the right indicated are the coin face value and issue year 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2011 (5/hryvnias/2011).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a portrait of Mykhailo Yangel; to the left thereof there is the inscription 1911-/1971 (Yangel`s life years); to the right there is the inscription МИХАЙЛО ЯНГЕЛЬ (Mykhailo Yangel).

name: The Millennial Anniversary of Saint Sophia Cathedral Foundation
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Saint Sophia cathedral founded in the 11th century, which has played a weighty part in the development and formation of the city of Kyiv as a spiritual, cultural and political centre. The Saint Sophia of Kyiv has always excited admiration thanks to its majesty and still deeply impresses as an outstanding monument of architecture and mural painting. Decoration element - local gilding (gold weight in fineness not less than 0.000634 g)
averseDescription: On the obverse above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of the cupolas of Saint Sophia cathedral there is depicted a miniature model of its XIth century design; the coin face value 50/ГРИВЕНЬ (50 hryvnias) is indicated above against the background of the ornamental pattern used in the murals of the cathedral; below there is indicated the coin issue year 2011.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is the conventionalized composition representing a part of the mural decorations near the cathedral main altar - the XIth century mosaics `Eucharist` and `Orans`; above there is the conventionalized inscription ТИСЯЧОЛІТТЯ СОФІЇ КИЇВСЬКОЇ (Millennium of Sophia of Kyiv). The Blessed Virgin`s outer garment (omophor, pallium) is gilded.

name: Hryhorovych-Barskyi Family
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a well-known Ukrainian family; Vasyl Hryhorovych-Barskyi, a traveller and writer, Ivan Hryhorovych-Barskyi, an outstanding architect and engineer who worked in Kyiv, and other known public figures of Kyiv descended from the family.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below - the coin denomination 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias); in the centre there is depicted the Fountain of Samson, located in the Podil raion of the city of Kyiv, surrounded with eight-point stars often used by Ivan Hryhorovych-Barskyi as architectural trim (Baroque style); to the right - the coin issue year 2011.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are depicted the coat of arms of Hryhorovych-Barskyi family, a conventionalized family tree with the cartouches wherein there are: a drawing of the traveler Vasyl Hryhorovych-Barskyi as he portrayed himself (to the left) and St. Nicholas Church on the Shore in Kyiv erected from the design by Ivan Hryhorovych-Barskyi (to the right); along the coin edge there are bow-shaped inscriptions: above - РІД ГРИГОРОВИЧІВ-БАРСЬКИХ (family of Hryhorovych-Barskyis), to the left - ВАСИЛЬ (Vasyl) 1701-1747, and to the right - ІВАН (Ivan) 1713-1785; below there is the family motto ТРУД МОЯ СИЛА (Labour (is) my force).

name: 20 Years of Independence of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 20th anniversary of Ukraine`s independence. On August 24, 1991, Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine approved the Act of Declaration of Independence of Ukraine that opened a new era in the development of Ukraine as a sovereign state.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine in the centre and the cruciform image of rushnyks (Ukrainian embroidered decorative towels); between the rushnyks there are portraits of the most outstanding personalities of different epochs of our history together with the legends: ЯРОСЛАВ МУДРИЙ, ТАРАС ШЕВЧЕНКО, МИХАЙЛО ГРУШЕВСЬКИЙ, БОГДАН ХМЕЛЬНИЦЬКИЙ; below against the background of a rushnyk there is indicated the coin minting year 2011 and the semicircular inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above) and coin denomination (below): П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the 5 hryvnia coin there is depicted a conventionalized wreath of viburnum fruits and leaves together with the legend: 20 РОКІВ / НЕЗАЛЕЖНОСТІ / УКРАЇНИ / 24 СЕРПНЯ / 1991 Р. (20 years / of independence / of Ukraine / 24 August / 1991 year) in the centre thereof.

name: 20 Years of Independence of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 20th anniversary of Ukraine`s independence. On August 24, 1991, Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine approved the Act of Declaration of Independence of Ukraine that opened a new era in the development of Ukraine as a sovereign state.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine in the centre and the cruciform image of rushnyks (Ukrainian embroidered decorative towels); between the rushnyks there are portraits of the most outstanding personalities of different epochs of our history together with the legends: ЯРОСЛАВ МУДРИЙ, ТАРАС ШЕВЧЕНКО, МИХАЙЛО ГРУШЕВСЬКИЙ, БОГДАН ХМЕЛЬНИЦЬКИЙ; below against the background of a rushnyk there is indicated the coin minting year 2011 and the semicircular inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above) and coin denomination (below): П`ЯТДЕСЯТ ГРИВЕНЬ (fifty hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin of 50 hryvnia denominations there is a conventionalized wreath formed by viburnum fruits and leaves; in the centre thereof the legend: 20 РОКІВ / НЕЗАЛЕЖНОСТІ / УКРАЇНИ (20 years / of independence / of Ukraine); there are four ornamental rhombuses with the images of an airplane, combine harvester, ship and mine between them, which symbolize different branches of the economy; under the circle there is the inscription: 24 СЕРПНЯ / 1991 Р. (24 August / 1991 year).

name: 20 Years of Independence of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coins isdedicated to the 20th anniversary of Ukraine`s independence. On August 24, 1991, Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine approved the Act of Declaration of Independence of Ukraine that opened a new era in the development of Ukraine as a sovereign state.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine in the centre and the cruciform image of rushnyks (Ukrainian embroidered decorative towels); between the rushnyks there are portraits of the most outstanding personalities of different epochs of our history together with the legends: ЯРОСЛАВ МУДРИЙ, ТАРАС ШЕВЧЕНКО, МИХАЙЛО ГРУШЕВСЬКИЙ, БОГДАН ХМЕЛЬНИЦЬКИЙ; below against the background of a rushnyk there is indicated the coin minting year 2011 and the semicircular inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above) and coin denomination (below): on the gold coin - 100 ГРИВЕНЬ (100 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin of 100 hryvnia denominations there is a conventionalized wreath formed by viburnum fruits and leaves; in the centre thereof the legend: 20 РОКІВ / НЕЗАЛЕЖНОСТІ / УКРАЇНИ (20 years / of independence / of Ukraine); there are four ornamental rhombuses with the images of an airplane, combine harvester, ship and mine between them, which symbolize different branches of the economy; under the circle there is the inscription: 24 СЕРПНЯ / 1991 Р. (24 August / 1991 year).

name: Hopak
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Hopak, a Ukrainian folk dance, the performance whereof includes various steps of choreographic improvisation. The dance may be solitary, couple or group one. The Hopak quite often happens to be of a majestic, heroic character.
averseDescription: Obverse: there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular description НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), a couple caught up in the stylized swirl of a dance and the following legends beneath: ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias), as well as the issue year - 2011.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted a dancing Cossack with a sable to whose left there is stylized ornament.

name: Hopak
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Hopak, a Ukrainian folk dance, the performance whereof includes various steps of choreographic improvisation. The dance may be solitary, couple or group one. The Hopak quite often happens to be of a majestic, heroic character.
averseDescription: Obverse: there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular description НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), a couple caught up in the stylized swirl of a dance and the following legends beneath: П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) as well as the issue year - 2011 (to the right). On the 5 hryvnia coin there is the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted a dancing Cossack with a sable to whose left there is stylized ornament.

name: ST. ANDREW`S CHURCH
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an architectural pearl of Kyiv built in the middle of the XVIIIth century in the style of Baroque to a design by prominent architect F.B.Rastrelli, i.e. to the St. Andrews Church. The church`s sophisticated outlines, clear-cut proportions, splendid harmony of forms and surrounding landscape won it general recognition and fame.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the three-line legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; lower there is depicted a fragment of Baroque embossment on which an emphasis was put in decoration of the interior of the church; beneath there are the coin face values and issue year: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2011 (5 hryvnias) Lower there is the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there are the St.Andrew`s Church image and legends: КИЇВ (Kyiv) against the background of the church, АНДРІЇВСЬКА ЦЕРКВА (St. Andrew`s Church) to the left, semicircular, and XVIII ст. (XVIII century) to the right, vertical.

name: ST. ANDREW`S CHURCH
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an architectural pearl of Kyiv built in the middle of the XVIIIth century in the style of Baroque to a design by prominent architect F.B.Rastrelli, i.e. to the St. Andrew`s Church. The church`s sophisticated outlines, clear-cut proportions, splendid harmony of forms and surrounding landscape won it general recognition and fame.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the three-line legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; lower there is depicted a fragment of Baroque embossment on which an emphasis was put in decoration of the interior of the church; beneath there are the coin face values and issue year: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2011 (10 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there are the St.Andrew`s Church image and legends: КИЇВ (Kyiv) against the background of the church, АНДРІЇВСЬКА ЦЕРКВА (St. Andrew`s Church) to the left, semicircular, and XVIII ст. (XVIII century) to the right, vertical.

name: Scythian Gold. The Deer
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a Scythian jewelry artifact, the gold plate depicting a deer (turn of the 7th-6th centuries BC) from a kurhan (burial mound) near the village of Syniavka (Cherkasy Oblast).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the circle of beads there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, above it - 2011 (the coin issue year), on the left Au 999,9 (coin metal and its fineness) and on the right - the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the coin weight in fineness - 1,24; between the circle and the coin edge there are the semicircular legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) underneath.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the deer figurine with the semicircular inscription thereunder СКІФСЬКЕ ЗОЛОТО (Scythian Gold).

name: 800 years of the City of Zbarazh
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the city of Zbarazh located on the Hnizna-river (Dniester-river basin) in Ternopil Oblast. It was mentioned for the first time under 1211, when it formed a part of the principality of Galicia (Halych)-Volhynia and was one of the most fortified centres of the local appanage principalities. The city also became well-known owing to the events in the period of the liberation war of the Ukrainian people of 1648-1654.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); there is depicted the cartouche bearing the Jerusalem cross extant on a wall of the Saviour`s Transfiguration Church of the city of Zbarazh; under the cartouche there is the legend 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ/2011 (5/hryvnias) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint to the right.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted, in the foreground, the Main Entrance Tower of the Zbarazh Castle with the inscriptions: to the left ЗБАРАЖ (Zbarazh) and below 800/РОКІВ (800/years); to the right of the tower there is depicted the coat of arms of the city; in the background there are the most remarkable architectural monuments of the city centre.

name: 15 Years of the Constitution of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 15th anniversary of adoption of the Fundamental Law of Ukraine by Verkhovna Rada (parliament) of Ukraine. The Law determines the socio-political order and polity of Ukraine, rights, freedoms and duties of its citizens.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); below there are the coin issue year and face value 2011/П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) with the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint to the right; in the centre there is the National Flag of Ukraine (decoration element - enamel) within a conventionalized viburnum wreath.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted a book of `ОСНОВНИЙ ЗАКОН УКРАЇНИ` (Fundamental Law of Ukraine) against the background of the Verkhovna Rada building where the Constitution was adopted; in the foreground there is depicted a laurel branch. The coin reverse bears the inscriptions: the semicircular above 15 РОКІВ КОНСТИТУЦІЇ УКРАЇНИ (15 years of the Constitution of Ukraine) and below to the left 28 ЧЕРВНЯ / 1996 РОКУ (28 June / 1996 year).

name: The 50th Anniversary of Establishment of the Taras Shevchenko National Prize of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 50th anniversary of establishment of the Taras Shevchenko National Prize of Ukraine, the highest award in Ukraine in the fields of literature and arts, journalism and opinion journalism, the most prestigious honours for the creative works regarded as major contributions to the Ukrainian culture. The Prize is awarded annually in the following nominations: artistic literature, documentary and scientifically critical literature, music, fine arts, theatre and modern visual arts.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); below there are the coin face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) and issue year 2011 with the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint to the right; in the centre there is the composition symbolizing the nominations of the Taras Shevchenko National Prize of Ukraine - an open book, quill, palette, brushes together with the lines from Taras Shevchenko`s poem `I mertvym, i zhyvym...` (`To the Dead and the Living...`) `... Учітесь, читайте, / І чужому научайтесь, / Й свого не цурайтесь` (...Learn, read, / Both foreign study, / And (our) own don`t shun.) and his signature.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are: a portrait of T.H.Shevchenko (to the right), the inscription (to the left) 50/ РОКІВ/ НАЦІОНАЛЬНА/ ПРЕМІЯ/ УКРАЇНИ/ ІМЕНІ/ ТАРАСА/ ШЕВЧЕНКА (50/ years/ National / Prize/ of Ukraine / named after/ Taras/ Shevchenko) and a conventionalized branch (beneath).

name: The Kobzar`s Going to His Last Home (on the occasion of the 150th Anniversary of T.H.Shevchenko`s Re
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 150th anniversary of Taras Hryhorovych Shevchenko`s death and his reburial in Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); the monument fixed up on Taras Shevchenko`s grave; to the right there are the lines from his poetry: `...ЩОБ ЛАНИ / ШИРОКОПОЛІ / І ДНІПРО, І КРУЧІ / БУЛО ВИДНО, / БУЛО ЧУТИ, / ЯК РЕВЕ / РЕВУЧИЙ.` (So that the fields, the boundless steppes, The Dnieper`s plunging shore My eyes could see, my ears could hear, The mighty river roar) with T.Shevchenko`s signature; below to the right there is a conventionalized image of the Dnieper-river with the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint over it, to the left there is the legend 5 ГРИВЕНЬ/2011 (5 hryvnias / 2011).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are: a conventionalized sketch of T.H.Shevchenko`s reburial route from Saint Petersburg to Kaniv (to the right), bas-relief of Taras Shevchenko`s portrait on the cross fixed up on Chernecha Hill after the reburial (to the left) and the inscriptions 8-22/ТРАВНЯ/1861 РОКУ (8-22/of May/1861 year) (over the portrait) and ОСТАННІЙ ШЛЯХ КОБЗАРЯ (Last path of the Kobzar) (bow-shaped, above).

name: Oleksandr Bohomolets
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 130th anniversary of birth of Oleksandr Bohomolets, the founder of the Ukrainian school of pathophysiology, a statesman and public figure, who devoted his life to selfless work in the area of biology and medicine.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the background of an electrocardiogram fragment there are depicted hands of a child and an adult extending to one another, which symbolizes one of the areas of activities of the scientist on whose initiative in 1941 the first in the world clinic for fighting the premature senescence was founded, on the basis whereof later on established was the Gerontology Institute; to the right, against the dark background, there are the coin face value 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) and issue year 2011.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a portrait of Oleksandr Bohomolets with the vertical inscription to the left ОЛЕКСАНДР/БОГОМОЛЕЦЬ/1881-1946 (Oleksandr/Bohomolets) and the scholar`s signature.

name: Heorhii Berehovyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Heorhii Berehovyi (Georgy Beregovoy), a Space Pilot of the USSR who piloted the Soyuz 3 spacecraft that for the first time in the history of astronautics attempted to dock with an unmanned spacecraft, a twice Hero of the Soviet Union, Honoured Test Pilot of the USSR, Director of the Gagarin Centre for Cosmonaut Training.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); lower there is a conventionalized composition representing the launch of Soyuz 3 spacecraft, flying to dock with the unpiloted Soyuz 2 spacecraft in the Earth`s shade, together with the following legends: `Союз 3` (Soyuz 3)/26-30.10.1968 to the left; 2011 to the right (indication of the coin issue year) and 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias) below (the coin face value).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a portrait of Heorhii Berehovyi with his signature against the portrait background; to the right thereof there is an image representing the conventionalized launch of a carrier rocket with the inscription 1921-/1995 (Berehovyi`s life years); above there is the semicircular inscription ГЕОРГІЙ БЕРЕГОВИЙ (Heorhii Berehovyi).

name: Peresopnytsia Gospels
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the outstanding monument of the spiritual culture and writing of Ukrainian people of the middle of the XVIth century, i.e. Peresopnytsia Gospels. The Peresopnytsia Gospels are in matter the four canonical Gospels of the New Testament. The manuscript is the first known example of vernacular Ukrainian language, which survives to this day. In 1561 at the monastery of Holy Virgin (Nativity of the Theotokos) in Peresopnytsia the work upon the Gospels was ended. The text had been translated by Hryhorii, the archimandrite of the Peresopnytsia Monastery, and written by the scribe Mykhailo Vasyl`ovych, a son of an archpriest from Sianik. The Peresopnytsia Gospels are a national relic and the Presidents of Ukraine on the Inauguration Day solemnly swear on them allegiance to the Ukrainian people.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below - the coin face value ДВАДЦЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (twenty hryvnias) and issue year indication 2011 (to the right); against the background of cross-shaped ornamental stripes there is the iconographic conventionalized figure of the Peresopnytsia Gospels maker.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there are depicted four miniatures of the initial illustrations of each Gospel; between them there are the legends: above 1556/рік (1556/year), i.e. the year of work start; below 1561/рік (1561/year), i.e. the year of work finish; in the middle there is the conventionalized inscription ПЕРЕСОПНИЦЬКЕ ЄВАНГЕЛІЄ (Peresopnytsia Gospels).

name: Smith
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the smithcraft, i.e. treatment of iron by the hot forging techniques. As early as in the Xth-XIIth centuries the skills of smiths reached such a high level that some of the iron treatment methods and processes for manufacture of tools and household goods have remained practically unchanged to this day.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two little birds and (to the left and right of them) different smithcraft products - Old Rus arms and household stuff; below there is the legend: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2011 (5 hryvnias) (on the German silver one) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on both coins there is depicted a smith at work. Above, there is the legend КОВАЛЬ (smith). To the left and right of the central composition there are ornamental patterns.

name: Smith
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the smithcraft, i.e. treatment of iron by the hot forging techniques. As early as in the Xth-XIIth centuries the skills of smiths reached such a high level that some of the iron treatment methods and processes for manufacture of tools and household goods have remained practically unchanged to this day.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two little birds and (to the left and right of them) different smithcraft products - Old Rus arms and household stuff; below there is the legend: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2011 (10 hryvnias) (on the silver coin) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted a smith at work. Above, there is the legend КОВАЛЬ (smith). To the left and right of the central composition there are ornamental patterns.

name: On Motifs of Lesya Ukrainka`s Work ``The Forest Song``
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 140th anniversary of birth of Lesya Ukrainka, a Ukrainian poetess, playwright and public figure, as well as to the centenary of writing her drama `The Forest Song`. Lesya Ukrainka`s multifaceted talent has revealed itself in the most diverse spheres of the literary work - she has been a lyric poet, playwright, prose writer, literary critic and publicist, translator and specialist in folklore. One of the most remarkable dramatical pieces of Lesya Ukrainka is `The Forest Song`, an extravaganza drama, based on the rich Volhynian folklore and written in rhythmically beautiful verses; it asserts the human dream, winged sentiments, triumph of amenities of the life over the spiritual impoverishment.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); to the left there is a portrait of Lesya Ukrainka with indication of her life years 1871/1913 and a gilded quill pen with the inscription ЛЕСЯ/УКРАЇНКА (Lesya/Ukrainka) thereover; to the right there is depicted a viburnum branch with the coin issue year indication 2011; below there is the coin face value ДВАДЦЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (twenty hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: in the foreground there is a lyric representation of Mavka holding in hand a willow branch being a part of `a century-old heavily wooded forest`; in the dark background there is depicted Lukash who, leaning against a birch tree, is playing the sopilka whose sounds awaken Mavka. Below to the right there is the legend ЛІСОВА / ПІСНЯ (forest / song).

name: Pavlo Tychyna
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 120th anniversary of birthday of Pavlo Hryhorovych TYCHYNA, a Ukrainian poet, translator, statesman and public figure. Pavlo Tychyna, an Academician of the Academy of Sciences of the UkrSSR, a laureate of the USSR State Prize and T.H.Shevchenko State Prize of the UkrSSR, Minister of Education of the UkrSSR (1943-1948), Chairman of the Supreme Soviet of the UkrSSR (1953-1959), had multidimensional creative interests: he played a few musical instruments and produced pictures - survived have been his self-portrait and various landscapes designed with a pencil, watercolors, oil, charcoal.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and lines from a P.Tychyna`s poem written in 1942 (thereunder): `І кричу я: Україно! / Потім стану й прислухаюсь. / Чути... здалеку: - Тримаюсь! / Хмарко! Ластівко! Калино! / І в той бік я повертаюсь.` (`And call I yelling: Ukraine! / Then stop and listen. / It is hearable... from afar: I`m holding out! / Cloudlet! Swallow! Kalyna (Viburnum opulus)! (Help!) / And towards that direction I turn.`); below there is Tychyna`s picture of his parents` homestead together with the mallow flowers to the left thereof; to the right there is indicated the coin issue year 2011 and, below, the face value П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a portrait of Pavlo Tychyna against the background of bookshelves; below there is the conventionalized inscription ПАВЛО ТИЧИНА (Pavlo Tychyna) and his life years 1891-1967.

name: 350 Years of the Ivan Franko National University of Lviv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin continues the `Higher Education Establishments of Ukraine` series and is dedicated to one of the oldest universities in Eastern Europe, a strong centre of science and education - the Ivan Franko National University of Lviv founded in 1661. With the University connected are activities of many famous scientists and schools of science which have made a considerable contribution to the development of Ukrainian and world science and culture.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); in the centre, against the background of the conventionalized document on foundation of the University, there is the allegorical group of statuary symbolizing the education; the face value (below, bow-shaped) and mintage year (to the right): on the German silver one - ДВІ ГРИВНІ, 2011 (two hryvnias) together with the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the main university building erected in the second half of the XIX-th century. Over the edifice there is the Coat of Arms of the University and the semicircular inscription: ЛЬВІВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ / ІМ. ІВАНА ФРАНКА (Lviv National University / named after Ivan Franko); below - 350 РОКІВ (350 years).

name: 350 Years of the Ivan Franko National University of Lviv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin continues the `Higher Education Establishments of Ukraine` series and are dedicated to one of the oldest universities in Eastern Europe, a strong centre of science and education - the Ivan Franko National University of Lviv founded in 1661. With the University connected are activities of many famous scientists and schools of science which have made a considerable contribution to the development of Ukrainian and world science and culture.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); in the centre, against the background of the conventionalized document on foundation of the University, there is the allegorical group of statuary symbolizing the education; the face value (below, bow-shaped) and mintage year (to the right): on the silver coin - П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ, 2011 (five hryvnias) together with the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the main university building erected in the second half of the XIX-th century. Over the edifice there is the Coat of Arms of the University and the semicircular inscription: ЛЬВІВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ / ІМ. ІВАНА ФРАНКА (Lviv National University / named after Ivan Franko); below - 350 РОКІВ (350 years).

name: The Year of the Cat (Rabbit, Hare)
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the year of the Cat (Rabbit, Hare) according to the calendar of the Chinese origin based on the twelve-year cycle of the Jupiter.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ (National Bank/of Ukraine) thereunder; within a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation pattern there is the coin face value 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ Hryvnias); below there is the coin issue year indication 2011, as well as the indications of the metal and its fineness Ag 925, coin weight in fineness 15,55 g and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: Reverse: within a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation pattern there is depicted in a technique of a cheap popular print a cat (the cat`s eyes are represented by green alpinites). Both above and below this composition there is a depiction of contour figures of all 12 symbols of the Oriental calendar.

name: Ivan Fedorov
