generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Ivan Fedorov, a prominent figure in the culture of East Slavs, well-known printing pioneer, engineer and inventor, engraver, foundry work master, who produced the first printed books in Ukraine - `Apostol` (Acts and Epistles of the Apostles) in 1574, `Azbuka` (an Alphabet book for East Slavs) in the same year, the Ostroh Bible in 1581.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre against the background of the quill pen there is depicted the matrix plate of a page from the `Apostol` book; beneath there are the coin face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) and issue year 2010.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a conventionalized portrait of Ivan Fedorov; to the left of the portrait there is depicted his imprint, to the right - his life years 1510/1583; above there is the semicircular conventionalized inscription ІВАН ФЕДОРОВ (Ivan Fedorov).

name: Cossack Boat
generalDescription: The commemorative coins start the `Maritime History of Ukraine` series that will reflect the history of navigation and shipbuilding on the territory of our country and are dedicated to the rowing boats of the XVIII-th century; such boats formed the basis of the Cossack flotillas. In the National Reserve `Khortytsia` there are kept such vessels that in the first half of the XVIIIth century formed part of the Dnieper flotilla and in the last ten years were found at the Dnieper bottom and recovered.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is a composition divided by the undulating stripe bearing the inscription МОРСЬКА ІСТОРІЯ УКРАЇНИ (Maritime History of Ukraine) in two parts: the upper one bears the image of the wind rose symbolizing the sea travels and the lower - the seal of Zaporozhian Host; over the stripe to the right there is indicated the coin issue year 2010; below there are the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the coin face value: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) on the German silver coin.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on both coins there are depicted the Cossack boat of the first half of the XVIIIth century under sail and the gull symbolizing the element of water (to the left), as well as the legends: КОЗАЦЬКИЙ ЧОВЕН (Cossack boat) above and XVIII ст. (XVIII century) below.

name: Cossack Boat
generalDescription: The commemorative coins start the `Maritime History of Ukraine` series that will reflect the history of navigation and shipbuilding on the territory of our country and are dedicated to the rowing boats of the XVIII-th century; such boats formed the basis of the Cossack flotillas. In the National Reserve `Khortytsia` there are kept such vessels that in the first half of the XVIIIth century formed part of the Dnieper flotilla and in the last ten years were found at the Dnieper bottom and recovered.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is a composition divided by the undulating stripe bearing the inscription МОРСЬКА ІСТОРІЯ УКРАЇНИ (Maritime History of Ukraine) in two parts: the upper one bears the image of the wind rose symbolizing the sea travels and the lower - the seal of Zaporozhian Host (gilded on the 20 hryvnia coin); over the stripe to the right there is indicated the coin issue year 2010; below there are the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the coin face value: 20/ГРИВЕНЬ (20 hryvnias) on the silver coin.
reverseDescription: Reverse: on both coins there are depicted the Cossack boat of the first half of the XVIIIth century under sail and the gull symbolizing the element of water (to the left), as well as the legends: КОЗАЦЬКИЙ ЧОВЕН (Cossack boat) above and XVIII ст. (XVIII century) below.

name: Island of Khortytsia in the Dnieper - the Cradle of Ukrainian Cossacks
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a unique monument of the nature, history and archaeology - the island of Khortytsia that always was in the sphere of military and economic interests of the Zaporozhian Cossacks and was their basic fortified settlement. Zaporozhian Sich on the island of Khortytsia is often mentioned in the folk tales and songs written down in the XVIIIth - XIXth centuries. The singularity of Khortytsia consists in a rare combination of various natural complexes on the same territory - the alluvial plain forests and meadows, steppes, rocky cleavages of granites, gullies, oak woods, lakes, etc. Here situated is the National Reserve `Khortytsia`.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is depicted a fragment of the National Historico-Cultural Heritage Site `Zaporizka Sich`; in the foreground there is a gilded composition representing a bandura and Cossacks` weapons and power insignia, to the left whereof there is the coin face value 50/ГРИВЕНЬ (50 hryvnias) and to the right the issue year 2010.
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the background of ornamental stripe there is depicted the dovbysh (Cossack drummer) beating the kettledrum used among the Cossacks at the time of celebrations and big events in Cossacks` life; to the right there are the lines of Taras Shevchenko`s poem `I mertvym, i zhyvym...` (`To the Dead and the Living...`): У нас воля виростала / Дніпром умивалась, / У голови гори слала, / Степом укривалась! / ТАРАС ШЕВЧЕНКО (The liberty grew up among us / Washing itself in the Dnieper water, / The mountains pillowed its head, / And it covered itself with the steppe! / TARAS SHEVCHENKO); over the stripe there is a conventionalized image of the island with the inscription Острів Хортиця на Дніпрі - колиска українського козацтва (Island of Khortytsia in the Dnieper - the cradle of Ukrainian Cossacks); below the image, to the right, there is the legend ЗАПОРІЖЖЯ / XVI-XVIII ст. (ZAPORIZHIA / XVI-XVIII cent.).

name: Potter
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the pottery that was one of the most important types of economic activities and artistic culture of Ukrainians; the pottery during many centuries was before others among the peasantry crafts and absorbed the technical skills and artistic traditions existing since the Neolithic Age.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two little birds and (to the left and right of them) different potteries; below there are the legends: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (5 hryvnias) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted a potter at work against the background of conventionalized potteries. Above, there is the legend ГОНЧАР (potter). To the left and right of the central composition there are ornamental flower patterns.

name: Potter
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the pottery that was one of the most important types of economic activities and artistic culture of Ukrainians; the pottery during many centuries was before others among the peasantry crafts and absorbed the technical skills and artistic traditions existing since the Neolithic Age.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two little birds and (to the left and right of them) different potteries; below there are the legends: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (10 hryvnias) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted a potter at work against the background of conventionalized potteries. Above, there is the legend ГОНЧАР (potter). To the left and right of the central composition there are ornamental flower patterns.

name: Tarnovskyi Family
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the prominent Cossack Starshyna (officership) families which became renowned for its art patronage and charity and from which famous Cossack Hetmanate figures descended: sotnyks (commanders of hundred men) and polkovnyks (colonels). A member of the family was Vasyl Tarnovskyi whose unique collection made it possible to establish the Ukrainian Antiquity Museum in the City of Chernihiv.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); beneath there is the coin issue year - 2010 and face value: ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias); there is depicted the Tarnovskyi`s family nest, a mansion in Kachanivka, with the legend: КАЧАНІВКА/ ЧЕРНІГІВЩИНА (Kachanivka/ Chernihiv Oblast) below it.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there are portrayed the most celebrated family representatives: in the center against the ornamental background there is the figure of Vasyl (the younger) with his years of life 1838 - 1899 beneath it; to the left and right there are the portraits with the legends: ГРИГОРІЙ/ 1788 - 1853 (Hryhorii / 1788 - 1853) and ВАСИЛЬ/ 1810 - 1866 (Vasyl/ 1810 - 1866); above there is the family`s coat of arms and semicircular legend: РІД ТАРНОВСЬКИХ (Tarnovskyi Family).

name: Johann Georg Pinzel
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Johann Georg Pinzel, a renowned sculptor of the middle of the 18th century who worked with wood and stone, a representative of the Late Baroque and Rococo and the founder of the Lviv School of Sculptors. He is shrouded in mystery as very little is known about his personage which was consigned to oblivion for 200 years. Only in recent decades, the heritage of the Master, who is named the Slavic Michelangelo by contemporary European art critics, has attracted experts and admirers` remarkable attention. In 2011, his works will be on exhibition at the Louvre. The ensemble of stone carvings for the Buchach City Hall and Church altar in Horodenka, the stone figure on the parapet of the St. Yura Cathedral in Lviv, great altar in the village of Hodovytsi and altar in the Parochial Church in the town of Monastyryska are just some of the Master`s great works of art.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine against the matt background and semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); against the smooth background there is `the standard for Baroque beauty` - the Buchach City Hall to the left and right whereof there is the legend: 2010 / БУЧАЧ; 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/ТЕРНОПІЛЬЩИНА (2010 / Buchach; 5/hryvnias/Ternopil Oblast).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is the composition portraying the Master with tools in his hands standing before the sculpture of the Angel impressed by the product of his chisel; there is the circular legend: ІОАНН ГЕОРГ ПІНЗЕЛЬ, бл. 1710 - 1761 (Johann Georg Pinzel, circa 1710 - 1761).

name: Hetman Danylo Apostol
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the eminent military and political figures and statesmen of Ukraine of the 18th century, hetman of the Left-Bank Ukraine who made a substantial contribution to the streamlining of local self-governance, court system restructuring, land tenure regulation and trade development.
averseDescription: Obverse: there is depicted the common composition for the series embodying the idea of Ukraine`s integrity: the heraldic figures of the Archangel Michael and the crowned lion (symbols of the cities of Kyiv and Lviv) holding the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the coin issue year - 2010 over it; above there is the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below -10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/hryvnias).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is a portrait of Danylo Apostol against the background of drapery, to the left there is the coat of arms; beneath there is the two-line legend: ДАНИЛО АПОСТОЛ (Danylo Apostol) with the years of life 1654 - 1734 to the left and right whereof.

name: Chervona Kalyna
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the best-loved plants of Ukrainians being the subject of many folk songs, i.e. to Chervona (red with regard to the fruit ) Kalyna (European cranberrybush) that has become the national symbol of Ukraine.
averseDescription: Obverse: within the circle of beads there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, above it - 2010 (the coin issue year); between the circle and the coin edge there are the semicircular legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) underneath, as well as Au 999,9 (coin metal and its fineness) on the left and on the right - the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the coin weight in fineness - 1,24.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted a branch of European cranberrybush and are inscribed the semicircular legends: КАЛИНА ЧЕРВОНА - VIBURNUM OPULUS.

name: Ukrainian Medical Association
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the centenary of the first nonprofit professional organization of health care providers founded in Lviv, i.e. the Ukrainian Medical Association. After resumption of its activities in 1990 under the name of All-Ukrainian Medical Association it is a united national professional organization incorporating all medical practitioners of Ukraine. The All-Ukrainian Medical Association has become a member of main European and world organizations of health care professionals.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin issue year 2010 thereunder; in the centre there is depicted the logo of the All-Ukrainian Medical Association within the conventionalized plant ornament; below there are the coin face value 2/ГРИВНІ (2/hryvnias) and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo (to the right).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the emblem of the Ukrainian Medical Association in Lviv (where the first professional organization of medical practitioners was founded) with the semicircular legends: УКРАЇНСЬКЕ ЛІКАРСЬКЕ ТОВАРИСТВО (Ukrainain Medical Association) above and 100 РОКІВ (100 years) below.

name: 125 Years of the National Technical University ``Kharkiv Polytechnic Institute``
generalDescription: The commemorative coin ``125 Years of the National Technical University ``Kharkiv Polytechnic Institute`` continues the `Higher Education Establishments of Ukraine` series and is dedicated to one of the oldest technical universities where the well-known schools of mechanics, physics, materials science, aviation, nuclear physics, tank building, tractor construction, turbo sets, etc. emerged and developed, i.e. to the National Technical University ``Kharkiv Polytechnic Institute``.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above), the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), a conventionalized image of the main building (to the right) against the background whereof there are depicted the symbols of science with the face value: on the German silver coin - 2/ ГРИВНІ (2/hryvnias); to the left there are depicted the radio telescope (the glory of the research-and-development plant of the university) and the book, being the knowledge symbol, with the coin issue year indication 2010 thereunder. On the 2 hryvnia coin there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (below).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coins there are depicted the university buildings with the portrait of V.L.Kyrpychov, the founder and first director of the Kharkiv Polytechnic Institute, against the background of one of them, and the legends: 125 років (years) below and НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ ТЕХНІЧНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ``ХАРКІВСЬКИЙ ПОЛІТЕХНІЧНИЙ ІНСТИТУТ`` (National Technical University ``Kharkiv Polytechnic Institute``) circular.

name: 125 Years of the National Technical University ``Kharkiv Polytechnic Institute``
generalDescription: The commemorative coin ``125 Years of the National Technical University ``Kharkiv Polytechnic Institute`` continues the ``Higher Education Establishments of Ukraine`` series and is dedicated to one of the oldest technical universities where the well-known schools of mechanics, physics, materials science, aviation, nuclear physics, tank building, tractor construction, turbo sets, etc. emerged and developed, i.e. to the National Technical University ``Kharkiv Polytechnic Institute``.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above), the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), a conventionalized image of the main building (to the right) against the background whereof there are depicted the symbols of science with the face value: on the silver coin - 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/hryvnias); to the left there are depicted the radio telescope (the glory of the research-and-development plant of the university) and the book, being the knowledge symbol, with the coin issue year indication 2010 thereunder.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin there are depicted the university buildings with the portrait of V.L.Kyrpychov, the founder and first director of the Kharkiv Polytechnic Institute, against the background of one of them, and the legends: 125 років (years) below and НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ ТЕХНІЧНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ``ХАРКІВСЬКИЙ ПОЛІТЕХНІЧНИЙ ІНСТИТУТ`` (National Technical University ``Kharkiv Polytechnic Institute``) circular.

name: Weaver
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the weaving that was one of the most important economic activities of Ukrainian peasantry households and an element of the art and culture of Ukrainians. On the territory of Ukraine from the earliest times processed have been the fibres from flax, hemp and wool.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two cockerels and (to the left of them) the spinning wheel, and (to the right) - weaving products; below there is the legend: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (5 hryvnias) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted a woman working at the loom. Above, against the background of a conventionalized linen, there is the legend ТКАЛЯ (woman weaver). To the left and right of the central composition there are ornamental flower patterns.

name: Weaver
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the weaving that was one of the most important economic activities of Ukrainian peasantry households and an element of the art and culture of Ukrainians. On the territory of Ukraine from the earliest times processed have been the fibres from flax, hemp and wool.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two cockerels and (to the left of them) the spinning wheel, and (to the right) - weaving products; below there is the legend: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (10 hryvnias) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is depicted a woman working at the loom. Above, against the background of a conventionalized linen, there is the legend ТКАЛЯ (woman weaver). To the left and right of the central composition there are ornamental flower patterns.

name: 925 years of the City of Lutsk
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the oldest cities of Ukraine mentioned for the first time in the Hypatian Codex under 1085. Lutsk was the capital of an appanage principality forming a part of Volhynia and later on of Galicia (Halych)-Volhynia. The city is beautified by an outstanding architectural monument of Volhynia, the masonry High Castle founded by Lubart (Liubartas), the last prince of Galicia-Volhynia, in the XIV-th century.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); there is depicted the Main Entrance Tower of the Castle being the most prominent landmark of the city; to the left there is the coin face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias); the coin issue year indication 2010 and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint are on the right.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the city panorama as it is viewed from the height of the Castle Main Entrance Tower; over it there is the Coat of Arms of the city; below, against the dark background, there are the legends: 925/РОКІВ/ЛУЦЬК (925/years/Lutsk).

name: SPAS
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the major Orthodox feasts - the Transfiguration of Jesus (in common parlance - Spas, i.e. the Savior`s Feast) when grapes, apples, honey and other food are blessed by sprinkling with holy water.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is the composition symbolizing the Savior`s Feast and consisting of an honeycomb frame against an amulet bunch of flowers with a sunflower above; to the left and right thereof there are depicted conventionalized cornucopias replete with apples, pears, grapes, etc.; below there is the legend: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (5 hryvnias) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is the multi-figure composition of peasants in preparation for the act of blessing the gifts of nature with holy water; below there is a beehive; above there are the symbol of the Transfiguration of Jesus and the bow-shaped inscription СВЯТО СПАСА (Feast of Spas).

name: The Bosporan Kingdom
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Bosporan Kingdom (VI-th century B.C. - IV-th century A.D.), one of the ancient states on the Northern coast of the Black Sea, which originated from a league of Greek colonies, the cities on the shores of the Strait of Kerch, with its capital in Panticapaeum, and regularly minted its coins.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the coin issue year 2010 thereunder and semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), beneath - the coin face value 100/ГРИВЕНЬ (100 hryvnias); in the centre there is a fragment of Panticapaeum ruins against the background of reconstructed appearance of the city with sphinxes to the left and right thereof.
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the dark background there is depicted a sailing vessel with images of dolphins and decorative meander lines, symbolizing the water, thereunder; to the left and right of the vessel there are depicted fragments of buildings of the city; above, against the light background, there is depicted a gold coin, i.e. Panticapaeum stater with the legend БОСПОРСЬКЕ ЦАРСТВО (Bosporan Kingdom) thereunder.

name: SPAS
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the major Orthodox feasts - the Transfiguration of Jesus (in common parlance - Spas, i.e. the Savior`s Feast) when grapes, apples, honey and other food are blessed by sprinkling with holy water.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is the composition symbolizing the Savior`s Feast and consisting of an honeycomb frame against an amulet bunch of flowers with a sunflower above; to the left and right thereof there are depicted conventionalized cornucopias replete with apples, pears, grapes, etc.; below there is the legend: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (10 hryvnias) together with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is the multi-figure composition of peasants in preparation for the act of blessing the gifts of nature with holy water; below there is a beehive; above there are the symbol of the Transfiguration of Jesus and the bow-shaped inscription СВЯТО СПАСА (Feast of Spas).

name: 20th Anniversary of Approval of the Declaration of State Sovereignty of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 20th anniversary of approval by the Verkhovna Rada of the Ukrainian SSR of the political and legal document that proclaimed the national state sovereignty of Ukraine as the supremacy, self-dependence, plenitude and indivisibility of the powers of the state within its territory and its independence and equality in the foreign relations.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine), below - the coin issue year and face value 2010/ДВІ/ГРИВНІ (2010/two/hryvnias) and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo; in the centre there is depicted the National Flag of Ukraine (the decoration element - enamel) within the conventionalized viburnum wreath.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the blank map of Ukraine against the uneven relief background symbolizing the arduous path to the country sovereignty; there are the legends: in the centre, against the background of the map: 16 липня/1990 року (16 July/1990 year), above, the semicircular one: ДЕРЖАВНИЙ СУВЕРЕНІТЕТ УКРАЇНИ (State sovereignty of Ukraine) and below, the bow-shaped one: ДЕКЛАРАЦІЯ (declaration).

name: 600 Years of the Battle of Grunwald
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to one of the greatest battles in medieval Europe, i.e. the Battle of Grunwald that occurred in July of 1410 between the crusader knights of the Teutonic Order and united army of the Kingdom of Poland and Grand Duchy of Lithuania including among others troops from Ukrainian lands.
averseDescription: Obverse: above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the coin face value indication 20 / ГРИВЕНЬ (20 hryvnias) thereunder; against the background of the laurel wreath, there is the composition of three armoured hands lying on the sword, which symbolizes the knightly sworn brotherhood and oath of the warriors upon arms before the battle; to the right - the coin issue year 2010.
reverseDescription: Reverse: there is the composition in the form of diagonal - against the light background (above and below) there are depicted warriors taking the offensive; against the dark background there are the inscriptions: to the left above ГРЮНВАЛЬДСЬКА (Grunwald), to the right below БИТВА (battle), in the centre 600 РОКІВ (600 years).

name: Zymne Holy Mountain Cloister of the Dormition
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to one of few constructions of the military defense which survive to this day, i.e. Zymne Holy Mountain Cloister of the Dormition whose main erection is the Dormition Cathedral (1495). Decoration elements of the icon: 3 brilliants of total weight 0.015 carat minimum, 2 sapphires (of orange colour) of total weight 0.012 carat minimum, local gilding (weight of gold in fineness 0.00068 g minimum).
averseDescription: Obverse: on the coin obverse there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above; the coin issue year 2010 and the face value 20 ГРИВЕНЬ (20 hryvnias) below; the central part of the miracle-working icon within its revetment supported by angels. Under the icon there is the conventionalized inscription ЗИМНЕНСЬКА ІКОНА ПРЕСВ. БОГОРОДИЦІ (Zymne icon of the Blessed Mother of God).
reverseDescription: Reverse: there are depicted the cloister buildings located on a hill; above there is the semicircular conventionalized inscription ЗИМНЕНСЬКИЙ СВЯТОГІРСЬКИЙ УСПЕНСЬКИЙ МОНАСТИР (Zymne Holy-Mountain Dormition Cloister). Below, against the landscape background, the legend СЕЛО ЗИМНЕ, ВОЛИНЬ (village of Zymne, Volhynia).

name: Stipa Ucrainica
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the feather grass Stipa ucrainica, a sui generis symbol of the Ukrainian steppe flora, included in the Red List of Threatened Species of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine within the ornamental wreath formed by images of some species of flora and fauna together with the legends: on the silver coin - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК / УКРАЇНИ /10 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2010 (National / Bank/ of Ukraine / 10 /hryvnias) as well as the indications of the coin metal and its fineness - Ag 925 and the coin weight in fineness 31,1; there is also the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the feather grass with two bow-shaped inscriptions: КОВИЛА УКРАЇНСЬКА above and STIPA UCRAINICA (the same in Latin) below.

name: Stipa Ucrainica
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the feather grass Stipa ucrainica, a sui generis symbol of the Ukrainian steppe flora, included in the Red List of Threatened Species of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine within the ornamental wreath formed by images of some species of flora and fauna together with the legends: on the German silver coin - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК / УКРАЇНИ / 2 / ГРИВНІ / 2010 (National / Bank/ of Ukraine / 2 / hryvnias); there is also the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the feather grass with two bow-shaped inscriptions: КОВИЛА УКРАЇНСЬКА above and STIPA UCRAINICA (the same in Latin) below.

name: Ivan Kozhedub
generalDescription: The commemorative coin `Ivan Kozedub` with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to Ivan Mykytovych Kozhedub, a famous son of Ukrainian people, fighter ace, Hero of the Soviet Union on three occasions, Marshal of Aviation.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: above - the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine), below - the coin face value 2/ГРИВНІ (2/hryvnias) and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo, to the left - the coin issue year 2010; in the centre there is depicted searchlighted La-7 aircraft (side number 27), which was piloted by I.M.Kozhedub.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is Ivan Kozhedub`s portrait against the background of a conventionalized airfield with an aircraft thereon; under the aircraft there is the inscription ІВАН/КОЖЕДУБ/1920/1991 (Ivan/Kozhedub).

name: Zarvanytsia - Maria`s Spiritual Centre
category: Rebirth of the Christian Spirituality in Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin continues the `Rebirth of the Christian Spirituality in Ukraine` series and is dedicated to one of the old pilgrimage places - Maria`s Spiritual Centre in the village of Zarvanytsia (Ternopil Oblast), whose origination is tied in with the legendary apparition of a wonderworking icon of the Mother of God. To date Zarvanytsia is one of the most respected places of penitential sojourn.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); beneath there are indicated the coin face value and mintage year 10 ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (10 hryvnias). In the center there is depicted the wonderworking icon of Our Lady of Zarvanytsia, to the right and left whereof - the angels from the iconostasis.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the impressive architectural ensemble of the cathedral of Our Lady of Zarvanytsia with its bell tower and inscriptions: МАРІЙСЬКИЙ ДУХОВНИЙ ЦЕНТР (Maria`s Spiritual Centre), semicircular above, and с. ЗАРВАНИЦЯ/ТЕРНОПІЛЬСЬКА ОБЛ. (village of Zarvanytsia / Ternopil oblast) below.

name: 165 Years of the Lviv Polytechnic National University
generalDescription: The commemorative coins continue the `Higher Education Establishments of Ukraine` series and are dedicated to one of the oldest universities of technological development having glorious history, i.e. the Lviv Polytechnic National University that is a vigorous centre of science and education, a generator of ideas and inventions.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); the allegorical sculptures that symbolize sciences and arts and are located on the university main building; the coin face value and mintage year: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (5 / hryvnias / 2010) on the silver coin; and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the main university building erected in the last third of the XIX-th century from the design by the architect Julian Zachariewicz. Over the edifice there is the bow-shaped inscription LITTERIS*ET*ARTIBUS (for sciences and arts) existing on the building itself. There are also the circular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ `ЛЬВІВСЬКА ПОЛІТЕХНІКА` (National University `Lviv Polytechnic`) and the legend 165/РОКІВ (165/years) below.

name: 165 Years of the Lviv Polytechnic National University
generalDescription: The commemorative coins continue the `Higher Education Establishments of Ukraine` series and are dedicated to one of the oldest universities of technological development having glorious history, i.e. the Lviv Polytechnic National University that is a vigorous centre of science and education, a generator of ideas and inventions.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); the allegorical sculptures that symbolize sciences and arts and are located on the university main building; the coin face value and mintage year: 2/ГРИВНI/2010 (2 / hryvnias / 2010) on the German silver coin; and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the main university building erected in the last third of the XIX-th century from the design by the architect Julian Zachariewicz. Over the edifice there is the bow-shaped inscription LITTERIS*ET*ARTIBUS (for sciences and arts) existing on the building itself. There are also the circular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ `ЛЬВІВСЬКА ПОЛІТЕХНІКА` (National University `Lviv Polytechnic`) and the legend 165/РОКІВ (165/years) below.

name: Ukrainian Ballet
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Ukrainian ballet known all over the world thanks to many original and unique talents of its performers. Ukrainian by birth Serge Lifar named the Ukrainian ballet `the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Ukraine which has discovered to the world the magnanimous generosity and elevated artistic beauty of our talented people`.
averseDescription: On the coin observe above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), beneath - the coin face value 50/ГРИВЕНЬ (50 hryvnias) and the coin issue year 2010; indication of the metal and its fineness Au 900, weight in fineness 15,55, and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (to the right); to the left there is a conventionalized image of the drop-curtain and to the right there are depicted the pointe shoes.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a relief image of the ballerina against the man-dancer`s silhouette; to the left, against the background of conventionalized strips, there is the horizontal inscription УКРАЇНСЬКИЙ/БАЛЕТ (Ukrainian/Ballet).

name: Bee
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the bee personifying wisdom, prolificacy and diligence.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the circle of beads there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, above it - 2010 (the coin issue year), on the left Au 999,9 (coin metal and its fineness) and on the right - the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the coin weight in fineness - 1,24; between the circle and the coin edge there are the semicircular legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) underneath.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the bee with the semicircular inscriptions - above БДЖОЛА (Bee) and APIS MELLIFERA beneath.

name: Mykola Pyrohov
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Mykola Ivanovych PYROHOV (1810-1881), a scientist, surgeon, pedagogue and public figure (transliteration from Russian - Nicolay Ivanovich PIROGOV). His innovative scientific works have become the base for the applied anatomy and operative surgery, while his contribution to the development of medicine was marked with a clever combination of the science and practice. Whole life of the great scientist was selfless service to people.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); within the circle formed by beads there is depicted the sepulchral church erected over the scientist`s tomb; beneath there is the coin issue year indication 2010 and bow-shaped inscription П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Mykola Pyrohov having surgical instruments in his hands, to the left whereof 1810/1881 (the years of life) and the bow-shaped legend МИКОЛА ПИРОГОВ (Mykola Pyrohov) below.

name: 3rd Centenary of the Constitution of Pylyp Orlyk
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a monument of Ukrainian politico-legal thought of the XVIII-th century - Pacta et Constitutiones Legum Libertatumque Exercitus Zaporoviensis (Pacts and Constitutions of Rights and Freedoms of the Zaporizhian Host) known as well as the Constitution of Pylyp Orlyk. It was the first European constitution of the modern type. It was adopted on April 5 (16), 1710, when electing Pylyp Orlyk as the Hetman of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above; beneath there are indicated the coin face value and mintage year 10 ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (10 hryvnias). In the center there is depicted the conventionalized composition - the Cossack starshyna (senior officials) headed by the Hetman (to the left) and Cossacks (to the right), which symbolizes the approval of the Constitution.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Pylyp Orlyk having a quill pen in hand against the background of a conventionalized sheet of the Constitution. To the left there are the inscriptions КОНСТИТУЦІЯ ПИЛИПА ОРЛИКА (Constitution of Pylyp Orlyk; semicircular) and 300/РОКІВ (300 years).

name: The First Centenary of Ice Hockey in Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to the hundredth anniversary of ice hockey in Ukraine. The date of publication of the Official Ice Hockey Rules in Ukrainian under the editorship of I.Boberskyi in 1910 has been chosen the terminus a quo for the ice hockey history in Ukraine. At that date the ice hockey was one of the most popular winter sports in Lviv.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above, the goaltender and interlacing of the geometrical lines representing the skate tracings, which makes the composition more dynamic; the coin face value and issue year 2/ГРИВНІ/2010 (2/hryvnias) are indicated below.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are depicted: in the foreground an ice-hockey player of nowadays, in the background - the players of the 20th century beginning against the background of conventionalized towers of Lviv where the first hockey matches took place.

name: Yevhen Paton
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Yevhen Oskarovych PATON (1870-1953), a world-famous scientist, founder of Ukrainian schools of bridge engineering and electric welding, outstanding engineer and pedagogue. On his initiative established was the Electric Welding Laboratory under the Academy of Sciences of Ukraine which in 1934 was reorganized into the Electric Welding Institute whose director and research manager Yevhen Paton was continuously to the end of his life.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the composition symbolizing the scholar`s activity in the bridge engineering which represents the Paton Bridge, the first fully welded bridge in Europe, the footbridge over Petrovska Alley and conventionalized Whatman`s paper sheet (to the left); beneath there is the inscription 5 ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (5 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Yevhen Paton, to the right whereof there is the conventionalized image of electric arc scintillation that appears during the welding; below there are the inscriptions: ЄВГЕН/ПАТОН/1870-1953 (Yevhen/Paton).

name: Oksana Petrusenko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Oksana Andriivna PETRUSENKO (1900-1940), an outstanding Ukrainian opera artist, one of the best performers of romances and Ukrainian folk song singers, which had a uniquely expressive voice of a large range and was very gifted with dramatics.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is depicted a poppy flower against the background of the stave with music notation forming a circle; in the centre there is the legend 5 ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (5 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Oksana Petrusenko dressed in a Ukrainian national costume, to the right whereof there are the inscriptions: the bow-shaped ОКСАНА ПЕТРУСЕНКО (Oksana Petrusenko) and 1900/1940 (the years of her life).

name: 165th Anniversary of the Astronomical Observatory of Kyiv National University
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the oldest actively operating scientific, educational and cultural institutions of Ukraine. Therein for the first time the geographic coordinates of Kyiv were precisely determined, and in the period of 1845-1884, before the Greenwich Meridian was chosen as the zero-longitude reference line, the Kyiv Meridian passed thereat.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); the observatory building erected after the plans of V.Beretti together with the pavilion through which the Kyiv Meridian passed; thereunder there are the inscriptions АСТРОНОМІЧНА ОБСЕРВАТОРІЯ / КИЇВСЬКОГО НАЦІОНАЛЬНОГО / УНІВЕРСИТЕТУ / ІМЕНІ ТАРАСА ШЕВЧЕНКА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ/2010 (Astronomical Observatory / of the Kyiv National / University / named after Taras Shevchenko, 5 hryvnias / 2010) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (to the right).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are depicted: a unique specimen of the astronomical equipment, i.e. the meridian circle installed in 1872; conventionalized night sky and the semicircular legend to the left КИЇВСЬКИЙ МЕРИДІАН - 1845 (Kyiv Meridian - 1845).

name: IVAN PULIUI
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Ivan Pavlovych PULIUI (another spelling - Pulyui) (1845-1918), an inventor and physicist, who discovered the peculiar properties of the cathode rays, later on rediscovered by Wilhelm Conrad R?ntgen and named after him, before the latter. Ivan Puliui was the author of nearly 50 research and popular-science works on physics and electrical engineering written in Ukrainian, German and English. In addition, he was proficient in ancient languages and left a large heritage in the area; together with P.Kulish and I.Nechui-Levytskyi he participated in translation of the Bible into Ukrainian.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); the composition staple is represented by one of the first (made before 1895) Puliui`s X-ray photographs of a jewelry; below there are bow-shaped inscriptions of the coin face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) and issue year 2010.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Ivan Puliui, to the left whereof there are the inscriptions: above ІВАН/ПУЛЮЙ/1845-1918 (Ivan/Puliui) and below - one of his sayings: `...НЕМА/БІЛЬШОГО ГОНОРУ/ДЛЯ ІНТЕЛІГЕНТНОГО/ЧОЛОВІКА,/ЯК БЕРЕГТИ СВОЮ І/НАЦІОНАЛЬНУ ЧЕСТЬ/ТА БЕЗ НАГОРОДИ/ВІРНО ПРАЦЮВАТИ/ДЛЯ ДОБРА СВОГО/НАРОДУ, ЩОБ/ЗАБЕЗПЕЧИТИ/ЙОМУ КРАЩУ/ДОЛЮ`. (`...There is no/greater honour/for an intelligentsia/professional/than to keep intact his own and/national honour/and without recompense/to devotedly work/for the welfare of his/people, in order/to ensure/their better destiny`.).

name: XXI Olympic Winter Games
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to an important event of the international sports life, i.e. the XXI-st Olympic Winter Games in the city of Vancouver (Canada).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below - a winter composition symbolizing the motion, the coin issue year 2010 (to the right) and the coin denomination 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias) - against the relief background downmost.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse above there is depicted a conventionalized holographic snowflake with the numerals XXI thereon and images of different sports representatives surrounding the snowflake: of biathlon, freestyle skiing, figure skating, speed skating, etc. together with the legends ЗИМОВІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ/ВАНКУВЕР 2010 (Winter Olympic Games/Vancouver 2010).

name: Year of the Tiger
generalDescription: The commemorative coin continuing the `Chinese Calendar` series is dedicated to the year of the Tiger according to the Chinese calendar based on the twelve-year cycle of the Jupiter, the largest planet of the Solar system.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine; below there are the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ (National Bank/of Ukraine), the coin face value 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ Hryvnias) within a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation pattern as well as indications of the coin issue year 2010, metal and its fineness Ag 925, weight in fineness 15,55 g and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted in a technique of a cheap popular print a tiger within a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation pattern (tiger`s eyes are represented by citrines of 0.007 carat each). Both above and below this composition there is a depiction of contour figures of all 12 symbols of the Oriental calendar.

name: Cartwright
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the profession of a woodcraftsman occupied in production of wheels, sledges, carts, shaft bows, etc. The craft has been known in Ukraine since a great while ago and was among the most widespread ones.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two cockerels and (to the right and left of them) products of the cartwright craft - carts, yokes, wheels, sledges, yoke locking pins. The ornamental central part of the obverse contains the following legend: 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2009 (10 hryvnias) (on the silver coin.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted a woodcraftsman hewing wood to make a cart detail. Above, against the background of a conventionalized board, there is the legend СТЕЛЬМАХ (Cartwright). To the left and right of the central composition there are ornamental patterns.

name: Cartwright
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the profession of a woodcraftsman occupied in production of wheels, sledges, carts, shaft bows, etc. The craft has been known in Ukraine since a great while ago and was among the most widespread ones.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the conventionalized legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; in the centre there are depicted in a conventionalized manner two cockerels and (to the right and left of them) products of the cartwright craft - carts, yokes, wheels, sledges, yoke locking pins. The ornamental central part of the obverse contains the following legend: 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2009 (5 hryvnias) (on the German silver one).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted a woodcraftsman hewing wood to make a cart detail. Above, against the background of a conventionalized board, there is the legend СТЕЛЬМАХ (Cartwright). To the left and right of the central composition there are ornamental patterns.

name: Scythian Gold. The Wild Boar
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a jewelry artifact of the steppe Scythia - the gold figurine of the wild boar (end of the 4th century B.C.) from Khomyna Mohyla kurhan near the village of Nahirne, Dnipropetrovsk oblast`.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the circle of beads there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, above it - 2009 (the coin issue year), on the left Au 999,9 (coin metal and its fineness) and on the right - the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the coin weight in fineness - 1,24; between the circle and the coin edge there are the semicircular legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) underneath.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the wild boar figurine with the semicircular inscription thereunder СКІФСЬКЕ ЗОЛОТО (Scythian Gold).

name: 70th Anniversary of Zaporizhzhia Oblast Creation
generalDescription: The commemorative coin `70th Anniversary of Zaporizhzhia Oblast Creation` with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to Zaporizhzhia Oblast whose economic potential base is formed by a huge industrial complex and famous fertile chernozems (black soils), a land of rich history, one of the centres of Zaporizhian Cossacks` formation.
averseDescription: On the obverse there is depicted the Coat of Arms of Zaporizhzhia Oblast to the left whereof there is the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo; also there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above, ornamental patterns formed by oak leaves, the coin issue year 2009 and face value ДВІ/ГРИВНІ (two/hryvnias) below.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is a composition: in the foreground, against the background of conventionalized Dnieper`s waves, there are depicted a stone baba (kurhan stele), charactersistic for the steppe part of Ukraine, and a cannon of Zaporizhian Sich epoch; in the background - DniproHES dam; above there is the semicircular inscription ЗАПОРІЗЬКА 1939 ОБЛАСТЬ (Zaporizhzhia 1939 Oblast) and thereunder - ornamental patterns formed by oak leaves.

name: 75 Years of Kyiv Academic Operetta Theatre
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 75th anniversary of Kyiv Academic Operetta Theatre. It successfully stages classical operettas, contemporary and classical musicals, embraces various creative experiments. The Operetta Theatre walls cherish the memory of outstanding personalities that created and fostered Ukrainian theatre art.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above), the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), the coin face value and issue year 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2009 (10 hryvnias) below, and in the centre - a dance scene against the dark background with conventionalized picture of light beams.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the theatre building fa?ade together with silhouettes of operetta characters copied from old theatre bills (over the building) and the inscriptions КИЇВСЬКИЙ АКАДЕМІЧНИЙ ТЕАТР ОПЕРЕТИ (Kyiv academic theatre of operetta) (above, semicircular) and 75/РОКІВ (75/years) underneath.

name: Kost` Levytskyi
generalDescription: The commemorative coin with the face value of 2 hryvnias has been issued in pursuance of the President of Ukraine`s Decree `On Commemoration of Outstanding Figures of the Ukrainian People`s Republic and West Ukrainian People`s Republic` № 793 of May 16, 2005, and is dedicated to a Ukrainian legal expert, public and state figure, head of the Government of the West Ukrainian People`s Republic - Kost` Levytskyi.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine in the centre, the coin issue year indication 2009 thereunder, two semicircular inscriptions - Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above and ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) below together with the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is a portrait of Kost` Levytskyi, indication of the years of his life 1859-1941 (to the right) and the semicircular legend КОСТЬ ЛЕВИЦЬКИЙ (Kost` Levytskyi) to the left.

name: Galagan Family
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a well-known family of the Galagans, at first high rank Cossacks and later noblemen, whose representatives became famous as public figures and patrons of arts promoting development of the Ukrainian culture and enlightenment. The famous Pavlo Galagan College was established thanks to Hryhorii Galagan`s efforts.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre there is depicted the family estate of the Galagans in Sokyryntsi; below - the coin denomination and issue year 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2009 (10 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the background of the College building there are depicted some representatives of the Galagan family, namely Kateryna (to the left), Hryhorii (to the right) and Pavlo (his portrait is above within the locket); lower there is the family coat of arms; the coin has the following legends: the semicircular one above КАТЕРИНА 1826-1896 ПАВЛО 1853-1869 ГРИГОРІЙ 1819-1888 (Kateryna Pavlo Hryhorii); under the building - КОЛЕГІЯ/ПАВЛА ҐАЛАҐАНА (College/of Pavlo Galagan) and below - РІД ҐАЛАҐАНІВ (family of the Galagans).

name: 225 Years of Lviv National Medical University
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the oldest medical universities in Ukraine - Lviv National Medical University that in 1998 was named after Danylo Halytskyi (Daniel of Galicia). The University is associated with the work of many famous scientists, origination and development of more than 20 scientific schools.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the coin face value 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ hryvnias), and in the centre, against the dark background, there are the initial lines of the Hippocratic Oath in Latin; under them on the left - the coin issue year indication 2009 and, to the right, the university emblem.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the university building amid the legends: above 225/РОКІВ (225/years), below ІМЕНІ/ДАНИЛА/ГАЛИЦЬКОГО (named after/Danylo/Halytskyi) and the circular inscription ЛЬВІВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ МЕДИЧНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ (Lviv National Medical University).

name: Bohdan-Ihor Antonych
generalDescription: The commemorative coin `Bohdan-Ihor Antonych` with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to to a poet being simultaneously a romanticist and a thinker, who has enriched the Ukrainian literature with philosophical lyrics and religious cosmic objects. Bohdan-Ihor Antonych`s poetry has played an important role in development of the Ukrainian literary modernism.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) to the left, the coin issue year 2009 below and the coin face value 2/ГРИВНІ (2/hryvnias) in the centre; to the left and right of the face value, diagonally, there is a composition representing in a conventonalized form figurative interpretation of Antonych`s poetry components (cosmic - to the right, vegetative - to the left) with the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logo.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is Bohdan-Ihor Antonych`s portrait against the background of a vegetative pattern; to the right 1909/1937 (years of his life) and beneath the semicircular legend БОГДАН-ІГОР АНТОНИЧ (Bohdan-Ihor Antonych).

name: International Year of Astronomy
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the International Year of Astronomy, i.e. 2009, proclaimed by United Nations. Four hundred years ago Galileo Galilei for the first time made use of the telescope to observe objects of the Universe. Yurii Drohobych (Kotermak, circa 1450 - 1494) was a well-known scientist - an astronomer, humanistic thinker, person of encyclopaedic knowledge, whom Ukraine is proud of. He was born and grew up in the city of Drohobych. In 1481-1482 he was the rector of University of Bologna. His work IUDICIUM PRONOSTICON ANNI 1483 CURRENTIS (Prognostic Estimation of the Year 1483) was the first printed book of a Ukrainian author.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); a composition symbolizing the Cosmos: to the left there is the image of Urania, the patroness of astronomy, one of the nine Muses in the Greek mythology, and the cosmic space together with a fragment of a scheme showing the motion of solar system planets; below there are the coin issue year 2009, logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the coin face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) on the conventionalized scroll.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are: Yurii Drohobych`s portrait (to the right) with his life years ca 1450 - 1494 thereunder, the International Year of Astronomy logo (to the left) with the legend МІЖНАРОДНИЙ/РІК/АСТРОНОМІЇ (International/year/of astronomy) thereunder; below there are depicted artifacts of cosmic space researchers.

name: International Year of Astronomy
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the International Year of Astronomy, i.e. 2009, proclaimed by United Nations. Four hundred years ago Galileo Galilei for the first time made use of the telescope to observe objects of the Universe. Yurii Drohobych (Kotermak, circa 1450 - 1494) was a well-known scientist - an astronomer, humanistic thinker, person of encyclopaedic knowledge, whom Ukraine is proud of. He was born and grew up in the city of Drohobych. In 1481-1482 he was the rector of University of Bologna. His work IUDICIUM PRONOSTICON ANNI 1483 CURRENTIS (Prognostic Estimation of the Year 1483) was the first printed book of a Ukrainian author.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); a composition symbolizing the Cosmos: to the left there is the image of Urania, the patroness of astronomy, one of the nine Muses in the Greek mythology, and the cosmic space together with a fragment of a scheme showing the motion of solar system planets; below there are the coin issue year 2009, logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the coin face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) on the conventionalized scroll.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are: Yurii Drohobych`s portrait (to the right) with his life years ca 1450 - 1494 thereunder, the International Year of Astronomy logo (to the left) with the legend МІЖНАРОДНИЙ/РІК/АСТРОНОМІЇ (International/year/of astronomy) thereunder; below there are depicted artifacts of cosmic space researchers.

name: Holy Spirit Church in Rohatyn
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an outstanding example of Ukrainian wooden temples of old types - Holy Spirit Church in Rohatyn (1598). Its iconostasis being now in a good state of preservation has extraordinarily high artistic value. The temple is a monument that has immortalized the talent of masters from Halychyna for architecture, carving and icon painting.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); the conventionalized image of the 16th century icon of the temple - `Descent of the Holy Spirit upon the Apostles` - with the candelabra to the right and left thereof; below - the coin issue year 2009 and the face value 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the church with the legends: ЦЕРКВА/СВЯТОГО/ДУХА/XVI/СТ. (Church/of Holy/Spirit/XVI/century) above and РОГАТИН (Rohatyn) below, embowed.

name: Volodymyr Ivasiuk
generalDescription: The commemorative coin `Volodymyr Ivasiuk` with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to Volodymyr Mykhailovych Ivasiuk - a composer, poet, singer, one of the pioneers of Ukrainian pop music. In the 1980-90-ies Volodymyr Ivasiuk became a symbol of Ukrainian renascence and his works were widely acclaimed not only in Ukraine but also abroad.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the inscription thereunder Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above, the composition representing a conventionalized flower of Chervona Ruta (a flower of the Ukrainian legends related to Ivan Kupala (St.John the Baptist) Day) against the background of an ornamental pattern (to the left), electric musical instruments (to the right) and the coin face value and issue year 2/ГРИВНІ/2009 (2/hryvnias/2009) below.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are Volodymyr Ivasiuk`s portrait amid the viburnum leaves against the background of a conventionalized vinyl record and the inscriptions: the semicircular ВОЛОДИМИР ІВАСЮК (Volodymyr Ivasiuk) and 1949-1979 - years of his life.

name: Ivan Kotliarevskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Ivan Petrovych Kotliarevskyi (1769-1838), an outstanding Ukrainian writer, public figure, the first classicist of modern Ukrainian literature, author of the famous works - the poem `Eneida` (Aeneid), the play `Natalka Poltavka` (Natalka from Poltava) and the vaudeville `Moskal-Charivnyk` (The Muscovite-Sorcerer).
averseDescription: On the obverse above there is the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is the coin face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias), and in the centre - the conventionalized composition representing Aeneas, a boat, a fragment of a column from Troy and an helmet with the coin issue year indication 2009 thereunder.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is a portrait of Ivan Kotliarevskyi; to the left and right thereof there are lines from T.Shevchenko`s poem `To Kotliarevskyi`s Imperishable Memory` ...Поки сонце з неба сяє, Тебе не забудуть! (While the sun in the sky shines, You will not be forgotten!) and semicircular inscriptions ІВАН КОТЛЯРЕВСЬКИЙ (Ivan Kotliarevskyi) above and 1769-1838 (years of his life) below.

name: 220 Years of the City of Mykolaiv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin continues the `Ancient Cities of Ukraine` series and is dedicated to the city of Mykolaiv, a pride of shipbuilders, an important shipbuilding, industrial, administrative and cultural centre of Southern Ukraine situated on the left bank of the Southern Buh Lyman (estuary).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the sea gull depicted thereunder; the composition: the Varvarivskyi Bridge and a cruiser built in Mykolaiv; below there is an anchor pictured being a city coeval made in 1789, under it there are the coin issue year 2009, semicircular legend П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are depicted the frigate `Saint Nicholas`, the first ship built at Mykolaiv shipyard, against the background of architectural monuments of the city, i.e. Mykolaiv Astronomical Observatory and the building of the Staff of the Black Sea Fleet Commander-in-Chief; above there is the city coat of arms with the inscription МИКОЛАЇВ (Mykolaiv) thereunder; below there is the inscription РІК ЗАСНУВАННЯ/1789 (year of foundation/1789)

name: Nikolay Bogolyubov
generalDescription: The jubilee coin of 2 hryvnia face value is dedicated to the 100th anniversary of birthday of Nikolay Bogolyubov (Ukr. Mykola Boholiubov), one of the promoters of modern fundamental science, the founder of the nonlinear mechanics and statistical physics schools. Nikolay Bogolyubov`s extraordinary talent for science has made important discoveries possible in different branches of world science. The Theoretical Physics Institute of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine is named for him.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are depicted a diagram and formula fragments from the theory of nonlinear oscillations and theoretical physics, against the dark background above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logotype; below against the light background there are the face value 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) beneath and coin issue year 2009 (to the left).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the centre there is a portrait of N.Bogolyubov, against the light background there is a formula fragment; below against the dark background there are the semicircular legend МИКОЛА БОГОЛЮБОВ (Mykola Boholiubov) and years of his life 1909 (to the left) and 1992 (to the right).

name: 60 Years of the Council of Europe
generalDescription: The jubilee coin of 5 hryvnia face value is dedicated to an intergovernmental regional organization whose purpose is development of cooperation between the member countries on the basis of common principles and ideals as well as support of their economic and social progress. Ukraine became a member of the Council of Europe in November of 1995.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the inner circle framed by five-pointed stars there is depicted the map of Europe, under the upper star there is indicated the coin issue year 2009; on the outer ring there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine above and semicircular legends НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the inner circle there are the logotype of the Council of Europe and the inscription 1949/РІК (1949/year); on the outer ring there are the inscriptions COUNCIL OF EUROPE, CONSEIL DE EUROPE, РАДА ЄВРОПИ (below).

name: On Motifs of N.V.Gogol`s Work `Evenings on a Farm Near Dykanka
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the creative work of N.Gogol (Ukr. - Mykola Hohol) who made a poetical image of the Ukrainian people and with an extraordinary artistic skill exposed the original Ukrainian character with the sense of humour habitual for it. The lyrical representation of Ukraine made by him in `Evenings on a Farm Near Dykanka` will always remain an integral part of the European literature. The subject of one of the most outstanding stories of this collection, i.e. `Christmas Eve`, is the leitmotif of the coin composition.
averseDescription: On the obverse there is a circular grotesque composition `the story-teller and listeners` consisting of `Evenings on a Farm Near Dykanka` characters; in its centre there is a portrait of N.Gogol with a quill pen in the hand; above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); beneath there is the legend 50 ГРИВЕНЬ (50 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is a circular grotesque composition illustrating the `Christmas Eve` story; in the centre there is the Christmas Star with the candle in the middle thereof whose flame is imitated by the yellow sapphire. Under the Star there is the semicircular inscription НІЧ ПЕРЕД РІЗДВОМ (Night before Christmas).

name: Bokorash
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the profession of the timber-floater or raftsman (in Ukrainian vernacular - bokorash) which required uncommon strength and skill. The logging was carried out in Polesia (Polissia) and in the Carpathians where this craft was widespread till the 50-ies of the last century.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there are depicted the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the conventionalized inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder, conventionalized images of two birds in the centre and Carpathian landscapes to the left and to the right with spruces, cottages and logs; below there are the legends: on the silver coin 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2009 (10 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin there is depicted the figure of a bokorash with a tsapyna (pole) in the hands which is directing the raft downstream, on either side of him there are traditional Carpathian ornamental patterns; above, against the background in the form of a log butt end there is the legend БОКОРАШ (Bokorash).

name: Bokorash
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the profession of the timber-floater or raftsman (in Ukrainian vernacular - bokorash) which required uncommon strength and skill. The logging was carried out in Polesia (Polissia) and in the Carpathians where this craft was widespread till the 50-ies of the last century.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there are depicted the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) with the conventionalized inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder, conventionalized images of two birds in the centre and Carpathian landscapes to the left and to the right with spruces, cottages and logs; below there are the legends: on the German silver coin 5/ГРИВЕНЬ/2009 (5 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin there is depicted the figure of a bokorash with a tsapyna (pole) in the hands which is directing the raft downstream, on either side of him there are traditional Carpathian ornamental patterns; above, against the background in the form of a log butt end there is the legend БОКОРАШ (Bokorash).

name: Chersonesos Taurica
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the ancient monument - Chersonesos Taurica (peninsula of the Tauri in Greek), a city-state on the south-western coast of Crimea established in 422 - 421 B.C. which struck own coins. The history of Chersonesos Taurica is subdivided into two periods: the antique (from the foundation to the 4th century A.D.) and the medieval one (5th-15th centuries). During two millennia, in the period of prosperity of ancient Greece, Rome and Byzantium, Chersonesos was an important commercial and cultural centre on the Crimean peninsula playing a special role in the mutual relations of Byzantium and Kyiv Rus.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), beneath - the coin face value 100/ГРИВЕНЬ (100 hryvnias), indication of the metal and its fineness Au 900, weight in fineness 31,1 and the coin issue year 2009 to the right, in the coin centre, above, there are depicted a fragment of an ancient structure and the signal bell tower, below, against the background of the meander, there are ancient coins of Chersonesos and a lamp (5th-6th centuries A.D.).
reverseDescription: On the reverse in the foreground there are depicted the ruins of an ancient structure of Chersonesos, a basilica; in the background there is Saint Prince Volodymyr Cathedral built in the middle of the 19th century on the ruins of a medieval temple where the Prince Volodymyr is supposed to have been baptized; above there is the semicircular legend ХЕРСОНЕС ТАВРІЙСЬКИЙ (Chersonesos Taurica).

name: 70th Anniversary of Proclamation of the Republic of Carpatho-Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 1938-1939 events related to proclamation and armed defence of the Republic of Carpatho-Ukraine whose short existence period has become one of the brightest pages in the centuries-old struggle of the Carpathian Ukrainians for the Ukrainian statehood establishment.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are depicted carpets with the traditional Carpathian ornamentation patterns together with the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (above) and the semicircular legend Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) on the right; below there are the face value 20/ГРИВЕНЬ (20/Hryvnias) and the coin issue year 2009 together with the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the left).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted a Transcarpathian holding a flag with the coat of arms of Carpatho-Ukraine; there are the legend: 70/РОКІВ (70/YEARS) under the flag and the semicircular inscription on the left: ПРОГОЛОШЕННЯ КАРПАТСЬКОЇ УКРАЇНИ (Proclamation of the Carpathian Ukraine).

name: 350-th Anniversary of the Battle of Konotop
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 350th anniversary of victory of the army under the command of Ivan Vyhovskyi, a Hetman of Ukraine, in the battle of Konotop in June of 1659.
averseDescription: On the obverse against the background of the wing (an allegory of the victory) the images of Hetman`s Insignia, Cossack arms and a bandura are depicted, above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the semicircular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below - the coin denomination and issue year 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2009 (10 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse in the centre there is the equestrian figure of Ivan Vyhovskyi with the sabre in hand; behind the figure, as the background, there are depicted the Cossack host in a fighting formation (at his left), conventionalized contour image of Konotop fortifications (to the right) and thrown down banners (on the right below); above there is the semicircular inscription: ПЕРЕМОГА В КОНОТОПСЬКІЙ БИТВІ (Victory in Konotop battle) and lower in two lines 350 РОКІВ (350 years).

name: International Year of Astronomy
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the International Year of Astronomy, i.e. 2009, proclaimed by United Nations. Four hundred years ago Galileo Galilei for the first time made use of the telescope to observe objects of the Universe. The International Year of Astronomy means peaceful global work with the purpose of exploring the enigmas of anthropogenesis and our Universe origin, i.e. the common heritage linking all earthlings. Astronomy is an important world outlook science and in such a way there is a good opportunity to conceive its role in development of the civilization.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there are the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine, the coin issue year indication 2009 and the legend in three lines: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; lower - a conventional design of Solar System in which the third from the Sun planet, i.e. Earth, is made of a blue topaz of 0.2 carat; against the background of orbits there is an armillary sphere, a classical astronomical instrument, that was used to determine the coordinates of celestial bodies, and the two-line inscription 100 ГРИВЕНЬ (100 hryvnias) thereunder.
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the raised background there are depicted: on the left - Galileo Galilei (above) and a conventionalized medieval miniature of starry sky observation (below); on the right - one of galaxies (above) and a radio telescope (below). Against the smooth background of the coin there are: the image of an observatory (below) and the inscriptions above: the bow-shaped МІЖНАРОДНИЙ (International), РІК (year) and (in the centre of the composition) АСТРОНОМІЇ (of astronomy), in which the Saturn image substitutes for the O letter.

name: 225 years of the City of Simferopol
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the capital of the Autonomous Republic of the Crimea, an administrative and cultural centre, the city of Simferopol (in Greek - city of common good). The city is situated in the Salhir River valley on the natural border between the mountainous and plain Crimea. The city development started in 1784, but a part of the valley where the city is located had been populated from the earliest times.
averseDescription: On the obverse there is depicted Simferopol`s main railway station being the `visiting card` of the city; above there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine and the legends thereunder: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias), 2009 and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the right).
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the background of the city development plan of 1768 there are depicted two architectural monuments of the XXth century beginning, the city coat of arms between them and the legends thereunder: 225/РОКІВ (years) within the laurel wreath and СІМФЕРОПОЛЬ (Simferopol) below, bow-shaped.

name: Symon Petliura
generalDescription: The commemorative coin `Symon Petliura` with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to Symon Vasyl`ovych Petliura, a statesman, politician and public figure, publicist, Tsentralna Rada member, the head of the Ukrainian General Army Committee, the General Secretary for Military Matters, the Holovnyi Otaman (Chief) of Military Forces of the Ukrainian People`s Republic (UPR), the Chairman of the UPR Directory.
