averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine with the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), two military men of the UPR period with a Ukrainian woman`s profile within the Ukrainian wreath, symbolizing the young state, between them, and the legend: 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) with the coin issue year 2009 and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (thereunder).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are Symon Petliura`s portrait, and the inscriptions: 1879 and 1926 - years of life, on the right and the left of the portrait, and beneath (bow-shaped) - СИМОН ПЕТЛЮРА (Symon Petliura).

name: Igor Sikorsky
generalDescription: The commemorative coin with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to Igor Ivanovich Sikorsky, a pioneer of aviation, designer of aircrafts and helicopters, an industrialist. When studying at the Kiev Polytechnic Institute (1907-1914) he set to work on development of the first helicopters to be. From 1910 Igor Sikorsky constructed aircrafts. The first multi-engine aircrafts in the world - `Le Grand`, `Ilya Muromets`, `Russky Vityaz` - were of his design. Being a native of Ukraine, Igor Sikorsky became well-known all over the world as one of the most famous aircraft designers.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the image of Ilya Muromets aircraft, as for its development in 1913 Sikorsky became well known all over the world; above, against the relief background, the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) and the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine thereunder, below - the coin issue year 2009, face value 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is a portrait of Sikorsky dressed in the airman uniform; to the right, against the background of Leonardo da Vinci`s drawing, there is the bow-shaped inscription: ІГОР СІКОРСЬКИЙ (Ihor Sikorskyi) together with indication of the years of his life: 1889-1972.

name: Borys Martos
generalDescription: The commemorative coin `Borys Martos` with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to Borys Mykolaiovych Martos, a Ukrainian economist, educational specialist, cooperative movement leader, statesman and public figure. Borys Martos was a leader of the Peasant Union and an author of the Ukrainian Tsentralna Rada draft of the Agrarian Law. From December of 1918 he was the Minister of Food Supply Affairs and in the period from April to August of 1919 - the Chairman of the Council of Ministers and Minister of Finance of the Ukrainian People`s Republic Directory.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small Coat of Arms of Ukraine (in the centre), the coin issue year 2009 (thereunder), the circumferential legends Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above and ДВІ ГРИВНІ (Two hryvnias) below together with the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are B.M. Martos` portrait, a part of the Great Coat of Arms of the Ukrainian People`s Republic (on the left) and the inscriptions: 1879/1977 - years of life, to the right of the portrait, and beneath (bow-shaped) - БОРИС МАРТОС (Borys Martos).

name: Turtle
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the turtle symbolizing longevity and wisdom.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the circle of beads there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, above it - 2009 (the coin issue year), on the left Au 999,9 (coin metal and its fineness) and on the right - the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint and the coin weight in fineness - 1,24; between the circle and the coin edge there are the semicircular legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) underneath.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a turtle and are the bow-shaped inscriptions: ЧЕРЕПАХА (Turtle) above and TESTUDINES beneath.

name: 60th Anniversary of T.H.Shevchenko National Museum
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to T.H. Shevchenko National Museum, one of the largest museums of Ukraine dealing with literature and art. Within the museum collection there are kept originals of Great Kobzar`s artistic works, manuscripts of his poetry, editions of Shevchenko`s writings issued in his lifetime with his autographs, photos, memorial objects, almost all editions of poet`s works, literature on studies of his creative work, etc.
averseDescription: On the obverse above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), in the centre - the composition consisting of museum exhibits, in the foreground whereof there are `Kateryna` painting and a bandura; on the right of them there are the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint, coin issue year 2009 and the bow-shaped legend 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) thereunder.
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the background of the building, an architectural monument of the first half of the 19th century, where the museum collection is located, there are T.H.Shevchenko`s portrait and inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ МУЗЕЙ (National Museum) above, ТАРАСА/ШЕВЧЕНКА/60/РОКІВ (of Taras/Shevchenko/60/years) against the relief background.

name: Ukrainian Pysanka
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to pysanka-making art (Easter egg decoration) being a striking example of creative work in Ukrainian traditional art and having peculiar ornamentation patterns and scales of colours in each ethnographic region of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 20 hryvnia coin: above there are the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below against the background of rushnyky (Ukrainian embroidered towels) there is the composition of a dish with the pysanky decorated with vegetational and geometrical ornamentation patterns peculiar to different regions of Ukraine; below there is the legend 20/ГРИВЕНЬ/2009 (20 hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the silver coin - the coin circumference is decorated with a pysanka-like ornamentation pattern whose inner contour line forms the egg in the middle whereof there is a composition - a woman (pysanka maker) ornamenting an egg and a sitting girl observing her; on the ornamental circumference there are the legends: УКРАЇНСЬКА (Ukrainian) on the left and ПИСАНКА (pysanka);

name: Ukrainian Pysanka
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to pysanka-making art (Easter egg decoration) being a striking example of creative work in Ukrainian traditional art and having peculiar ornamentation patterns and scales of colours in each ethnographic region of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 5 hryvnia coin: above against the dark background there are the Small National Emblem of Ukraine (on the left) and a fragment of a pysanka, below against the light background there are the coin face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) and issue year 2009 together with a fragment of a pysanka, the dark and light parts are separated by the conventionalized legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the German silver coin: below there is depicted an Easter still life - on the rushnyk (embroidered towel characteristic of Ukraine) there is a paska (Easter bread) with a candle thereon encircled with eggs; over them there is the conventionalized legend УКРАЇНСЬКА ПИСАНКА (Ukrainian pysanka); above there is a pysanka between the pysanka ornamentation patterns peculiar to Lemkivshchyna (Lemkos inhabited area), Bukovina, Hutsulshchyna (Hutsuls inhabited districts), etc.

name: Surb Khach Monastery
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the outstanding Armenian monuments in Crimea – Surb Khach (Holy Cross) Monastery established in the XIVth century.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: above - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the circumferential legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); in the centre – a Khachkar (cross-stone), that is located on the monastery territory, decorated with a vegetational ornamentation pattern, below – the coin issue year – 2009 and face value ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are depicted the monastery buildings with the legends: СТАРИЙ КРИМ/ВІРМЕНСЬКИЙ МОНАСТИР XIV ст. (STARYI KRYM / ARMENIAN MONASTERY OF XIV century) on the left and СУРБ ХАЧ (SURB KHACH) on the right.

name: Andrii Livytskyi
generalDescription: The commemorative coin “Andrii Livytskyi” with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to Andrii Mykolaiovych Livytskyi, a Ukrainian expert in law, statesman, public and political figure.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are: the Small State Emblem of Ukraine (in the centre), the coin issue year 2009 (thereunder), the circumferential legends Національний Банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above and ДВІ ГРИВНІ (Two hryvnias) below together with the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are A.M. Livytskyi’s portrait and the inscriptions: АНДРІЙ ЛІВИЦЬКИЙ (Andrii Livytskyi) – above (semicircular), 1879/1954 – years of life, to the right of the portrait, and beneath (semicircular) – ПРЕЗИДЕНТ УНР В ЕКЗИЛІ (President of the UPR (Ukrainian People’s Republic) in Exile).

name: 70th Anniversary of Proclamation of the Republic of Carpatho-Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 1938-1939 events related to proclamation and armed defence of the Republic of Carpatho-Ukraine whose short existence period has become one of the brightest pages in the centuries-old struggle of the Carpathian Ukrainians for the Ukrainian statehood establishment.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are depicted carpets with the traditional Carpathian ornamentation patterns together with the Small State Emblem of Ukraine (above) and the semicircular legend Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) on the right; below there are the face value 2/ГРИВНІ (2/Hryvnias) and the coin issue year 2009 together with the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the left).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a Transcarpathian holding a flag with the coat of arms of Carpatho-Ukraine; there are the legend: 70/РОКІВ (70/YEARS) under the flag and the semicircular inscription on the left: ПРОГОЛОШЕННЯ КАРПАТСЬКОЇ УКРАЇНИ (Proclamation of the Carpathian Ukraine).

name: Nikolai Gogol
generalDescription: The Jubilee coin is dedicated to the 200th anniversary of the birth of the outstanding writer who revealed to the world the singularity of Ukraine -Nikolai Vasilievich Gogol. N.Gogol was born in the village of Velyki Sorochyntsi (now in Poltava oblast) in the family of a writer.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below there are the coin face value and issue year - 5 ГРИВЕНЬ/2009 (5 hryvnias/2009) as well as the composition symbolizing two main subjects of Gogol`s creative work: that of Ukraine with its history, traditions, myths and the topic of the imperial capital city with its high life, etc.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Nikolai Vasilievich Gogol dressed in a cape and a vyshyvanka (embroidered shirt) embodying the land that had educated him. Above there is the semicircular inscription МИКОЛА ГОГОЛЬ (Nikolai Gogol in Ukrainian) and below 1809/1852 – years of his life.

name: SHOLEM ALEICHEM
generalDescription: The Jubilee coin is dedicated to 150th anniversary of Sholem Aleichem, the world known author, playwright and educator, whose works combine humor and lyricism
averseDescription: On the coin obverse: above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine with the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), in the centre - the conventionalized composition: against the background of book sheets - Sholem Aleichem`s personal signet with a fragmentary cartoon regarding his creative work (on the right), below there are the coin face value and issue year - 5 ГРИВЕНЬ/2009 (5 hryvnias/2009).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse: there are Sholem Aleichem`s portrait and inscriptions in circumference: above - МИР ВАМ (peace be with you), below – 1859-1916, on the right – ШОЛОМ-АЛЕЙХЕМ (Sholem Aleichem), on the left – РАБИНОВИЧ ШОЛОМ (Rabinovich Sholem), being the latter two stylized and in Ukrainian.

name: Pavlo Chubynskyi
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Pavlo Platonovych Chubynskyi, an ethnographer, folklorist, poet and public figure, who is the author of the Anthem of Ukraine `Ukraine`s glory hasn`t perished, nor her freedom…`. Pavlo Platonovych held deservedly an important position within the pleiad of the public figures and scientists of the second part of the XIX century, the Herculean efforts whereof made the national rebirth of Ukraine possible. As one of the founders of Ukrainian ethnographic science he was in charge of the ethnographic expeditions researching Ukraine, Russia and Moldavia.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are: the Small State Emblem of Ukraine (above) on the left and right hand side whereof there is conventionalized vegetable ornamentation with the composition symbolizing ethnographic researches of the scientist - folk musical instruments, the symbols of Hetman`s authority etc. - in the centre with the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above; the inscription 2/ ГРИВНІ/ 2009 (2/Hryvnias/2009) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (below).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is Pavlo Chubynskyi`s portrait within the ornamental frame together with the semicircular inscription ПАВЛО ЧУБИНСЬКИЙ (Pavlo Chubynskyi) (above) and the years of life 1839 (on the left), 1884 (on the right).

name: The Year of the Ox
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the year of the Ox, one of the animal-symbols of the Chinese calendar, which is based on the twelve year cycle of the Jupiter, the largest planet of the Solar system.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within a setting made of conventionalized vegetable ornamentation there are inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (National Bank /of Ukraine/ 5/ Hryvnias); above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, beneath: 2009, the coin issue year, as well as Ag 925, the designation of metal; 15,55g, its weight in fineness and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted an ox made in a technique of a cheap popular print within a vegetable ornamentation setting (an ox`s eyes are decorated with 0,01carat rubies). Both above and below this composition there is a depiction of contour figures of all 12 symbols of the Oriental calendar.

name: Maria Prymachenko
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Maria Ovksentiivna PRYMACHENKO, a distinctive painter, representative of the folk decorative painting, whose oeuvre belongs to unique phenomena in the world art. Her creative work has played an important role in the development of folk decorative painting of Ukraine, while her `animal series` have become an extraordinary phenomenon in the world art.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a composition: the Small National Emblem of Ukraine with the legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder, a conventionalized Prymachenko`s work `Cosmic Space Horse` of 1983, under it - the coin face value and issue year: 5 ГРИВЕНЬ/2008 (5 hryvnias/2008).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is Maria Prymachenko` portrait against the background of her 1991 work `Ukrainian Sunflower`, above it there is the arcuate inscription МАРІЯ ПРИМАЧЕНКО (Maria Prymachenko); on the left - the vertical legend indicating her life years 1908-1997.

name: Church Complex in the Village of Buky
category: Rebirth of the Christian Spirituality in Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to construction and consecration of the Orthodox Church Complex consisting of St.Eugene the Great Martyr Church, St.Daniel bell tower, St.Nicholas and St.Alexander chapels in the village of Buky (Skvyra raion, Kyiv oblast). The Ktitor (donator) of the Church Complex, Ivan Mykolaiovych SUSLOV, is a Christian and patriot, a recipient of Ukraine`s State Prize in Architecture.
averseDescription: On the obverse in the centre there is depicted the Grand Duke of Kyiv Volodymyr Sviatoslavovych with the cross and the church model in his hands; above and below him there are the semicircular inscriptions: along the inner circumference above – ВОЛОДИМИР ВЕЛИКИЙ (Volodymyr the Great), below – БУДІВНИЧИЙ ПРАВОСЛАВ’Я (Erector of the Orthodoxy); along the outer circumference above - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below – ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias); as well as the Small National Emblem of Ukraine (above), coin issue year – 2008 (on the left) and a conventionalized star (on the right).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted the Orthodox Church Complex whose dominant is St.Eugene the Great Martyr Church together with the legends: above the arcuate one УКРАЇНА/ВІДРОДЖЕННЯ ХРИСТИЯНСЬКОЇ ДУХОВНОСТІ (Ukraine/Rebirth of the Christian Spirituality); below under the conventionalized image of the Rostavytsia-river – ПРАВОСЛАВНИЙ ХРАМОВИЙ КОМПЛЕКС/ЦЕРКВА СВ. ЄВГЕНІЯ ВЕЛИКОМУЧЕНИКА/ОСВЯЧЕНА В 2007 РОЦІ/КИЇВШИНА/СКВИРА С.БУКИ (Orthodox Church Complex/Church of St.Eugene the Great Martyr/consecrated in 2007 year/Kyiv Oblast/ Skvyra vil. of Buky).

name: Vasyl Symonenko
generalDescription: The commemorative coin `Vasyl Symonenko` with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to Vasyl Andriiovych Symonenko, a poet, prose writer and journalist, who held deservedly an important position within the Pleiad of the `shestydesiatnyky` (sixtiers). The poet`s work played a significant role in the Ukrainian literature of the XXth century and is a model of high civic consciousness. A patriotism subject of love for Ukraine and Ukrainians bulked large therein.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are: the Small State Emblem of Ukraine (above) with the legend Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder; the face value 2/ГРИВНІ (2/Hryvnias) and the coin issue year 2008 (below); there is depicted the conventionalized composition illustrating Symonenko`s poem `Motherhood Swans` together with the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the left).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is Vasyl Symonenko`s portrait; on the right, against the background of willow leaves, there is the inscription ВАСИЛЬ СИМОНЕНКО/1935-1963 (VASYL SYMONENKO) together with two semicircular legends: МОЖНА ВСЕ НА СВІТІ ВИБИРАТИ, СИНУ, (POSSIBLE IS EVERYTHING IN THE WORLD TO CHOOSE, MY SON,) above and ВИБРАТИ НЕ МОЖНА ТІЛЬКИ БАТЬКІВЩИНУ (TO CHOOSE IS NOT POSSIBLE ONLY THE MOTHERLAND) below.

name: 975 Years of the City of Bohuslav
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Bohuslav, a picturesque city situated on the Ros River banks. Bohuslav, together with the cities of Korsun and Kaniv, was one of the most fortified boroughs on the southern border of the Kyiv Rus. Outstanding works of the Ukrainian folk poetry, such as the duma `Marusia Bohuslavka`, the ballad `In the borough of Bohuslav`, were dedicated to the city, life and fight of its population
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are: the Small National Emblem of Ukraine with the legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) thereunder and the conventionalized composition: the Cossack weapons and Hetman`s bunchuk (standard) on the left, a manuscript with a quill pen on the right, which symbolize the Cossack epoch and literary fame of the city; under them - the face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias), the coin issue year 2008 as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are depicted architectural monuments of the city centre and the bridge across the Ros River; above there are the semicircular inscription БОГУСЛАВ (Bohuslav) and the coat of arms of the city thereunder; beneath, against the background of stones, there is the legend 975 РОКІВ (Years).

name: 140 Years of Taras Shevchenko All-Ukrainian “Prosvita” Society
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a Ukrainian cultural and educational society founded in 1868 in Lviv by a group of Narodovtsi (patriotic liberal intelligentsia faction) whose main objective was promotion of education of Ukrainian people, strengthening of the Ukrainian national idea, development of the national culture, formation of the national consciousness, etc.
averseDescription: On the obverse within the central circle there is depicted the tree of life as an ornamental pattern with the year of issue thereunder; above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine; on the ring there is the circumferential inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ – П’ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (National Bank of Ukraine – Five hryvnias) – below
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are the emblem of the All-Ukrainian `Prosvita` (Enlightenment) Society and the circumferential inscription: ВСЕУКРАЇНСЬКЕ ТОВАРИСТВО ІМ. ТАРАСА ШЕВЧЕНКА - 140 РОКІВ (All-Ukrainian Society named after Taras Shevchenko - 140 years) - below.

name: Hryhorii Kvitka-Osnovianenko
generalDescription: The commemorative coin `Hryhorii Kvitka-Osnovianenko` with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to a writer, cultural and public figure, the founder of the household comedy genre in the Ukrainian literature of classics whose the most popular works are `Witch of Konotop`, `A Marriage Arrangement in Honcharivka`, `Khaliavskii the Gentleman`, `Shelmenko as Captain`s Batman`, etc
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are depicted: above - the Small State Emblem of Ukraine and the semicircular legend Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine), a townscape, typical for the Eastern Ukraine of the 19th century; below there are the inscription 2/ГРИВНІ (2/Hryvnias), the coin issue year 2008 (on the right) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the left).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are Kvitka-Osnovianenko`s portrait and the legends: ГРИГОРІЙ КВІТКА-ОСНОВ’ЯНЕНКО (Hryhorii Kvitka-Osnovianenko) above in a semicircle, and 1778-1843 below.

name: Hlukhiv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the past of the town of Hlukhiv closely related to the processes of statehood establishment and lawmaking. In 1708 the town became the residence of hetmans of Left-Bank Ukraine – I.Skoropadskyi, P.Polubotok, D.Apostol and K.Rozumovskyi. In Hlukhiv the 1st Lesser Rus Collegium (1722-1727), Hetman’s Board of Administration (1734-1750) and the 2nd Lesser Rus Collegium (1764-1782) resided, the General Host Chancellery, General Host Court and other state agencies operated
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine under which the coin issue year – 2008, the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), in the centre there are depicted the cannon and bell as widely produced in Hlukhiv, below – the coin face value 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias), indication of the metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 31.1 (on the left), and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the right).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a conventionalized panorama of the town, in the centre whereof there is the Kyiv Gate of the town fortress, above – the semicircular inscription ГЕТМАНСЬКА СТОЛИЦЯ (Hetman’s Capital), under which the coat of arms of the town and four portraits of the hetmans, under which the legends – ІВАН/СКОРОПАДСЬКИЙ (Ivan/Skoropadskyi), ПАВЛО/ПОЛУБОТОК (Pavlo/Polubotok), ДАНИЛО/АПОСТОЛ (Danylo/Apostol), КИРИЛО/РОЗУМОВСЬКИЙ (Kyrylo/Rozumovskyi); below, between the conventionalized ornamentation patterns, the legend ГЛУХІВ (Hlukhiv).

name: Millennium of Mintage in Kyiv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the first mintage of Kyiv Rus coins, i.e. zlatnyky and sriblianyky, at the end of 10th- early 11th centuries during the rule of the Kyiv Prince Volodymyr the Great.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are: the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), composition of the coins: zlatnyk (local gilding, gold weight in fineness – 0.0004 g) and sriblianyky (on the right), a part of the ancient Kyiv reconstruction model (on the left), under which indication of the metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 62.2, the coin face value – 20/ГРИВЕНЬ (20/hryvnias), the coin issue year - 2008 and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted a scene of mintage and the inscription ТИСЯЧОЛІТТЯ/МОНЕТНОГО КАРБУВАННЯ/У КИЄВІ (Millennium/ of coin mintage / in Kyiv).

name: 90th Anniversary of Establishment of the West Ukrainian People’s Republic
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Ukrainian state established on the Western Ukraine lands after disintegration of the Austro-Hungarian Empire comprising a considerable part of the Ukrainian lands – Halychyna (Eastern Galicia), Bukovina and Transcarpathia (Carpathian Ruthenia). On November 9, 1918, its government was formed – the State Secretariat of WUPR. The Law of November 13, 1918, secured the supremacy and sovereignty of the people.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of the flag there are: the semicircular inscription - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, under which - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, the coin face value – 2/ГРИВНІ (2/hryvnias); to the left – the lion (from the WUPR coat of arms); beneath, between the ornamentation patterns, the coin issue year - 2008 and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the right).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a group of the Ukrainian Sich Riflemen under the flag and the arc-forming legend 90 РОКІВ УТВОРЕННЯ (90 years of establishment of) and ЗУНР (WUPR).

name: Decennial of Entry of the Historical Centre of the City of Lviv in the UNESCO World Heritage List
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 10th anniversary of entry of the historical centre of the city of Lviv in the UNESCO World Heritage List. The first record of Lviv is dated 1256 and this year is supposed to be its foundation date. The city as if fascinates with its centuries-old history and beauty. Wonderful architectural monuments can be seen at every turn forming together one of the most beautiful historico-architectural complexes of Europe.
averseDescription: On the obverse there is depicted the decorative sculpture of the Glory from the facade of the Lviv State Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre of S.Krushelnytska; there are: above - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, the circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (ten hryvnias) below, indication of the metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 31.1 (on the left), coin issue year - 2008 and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the right).
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is depicted conventionalized composition consisting of five towers of the city of Lviv: Armenian Cathedral tower, Assumption Church tower, City Hall tower, Roman Catholic Cathedral tower and Bernardine monastery tower (from left to right), against the background of them there is the Coat of Arms of the city and the legends: 10 РОКІВ У РЕЄСТРІ СВІТОВОЇ СПАДЩИНИ ЮНЕСКО (10 years in the UNESCO World Heritage List), above as a semicircle, and ЛЬВІВ (Lviv) below.

name: In Honor of Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew I Visit to Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the visit of Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew I to Ukraine at the time of celebration of the 1020th anniversary of the Christianization of Kyiv Rus.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there are: the Small Emblem of Ukraine with the inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) under it and the inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК (National Bank) (above) and П’ЯТДЕСЯТ ГРИВЕНЬ (Fifty Hryvnias) (below) around the circle; in the circle against the background of Dnieper and the left-bank, the statue of Prince Volodymyr the Great, opened in Kyiv in 1853, is depicted; on the left there is the year of the coin issue 2008 specified on the ribbon.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin in the circle there is the portrait of the President of Ukraine Viktor Yuschenko holding the wreath with a lighted candle, light whereof is imitated by the hologram, and of Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew I with the inscription НА ЧЕСТЬ ВІЗИТУ В УКРАЇНУ ВСЕЛЕНСЬКОГО ПАТРІАРХА ВАРФОЛОМІЯ І (In Honor of Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew I Visit to Ukraine) around the circle.

name: On the Way to the Independence: Ukrainian-Swedish Politico-Military Alliances of the XVIIth – XVIIIt
generalDescription: The commemorative coin “On the Way to the Independence: Ukrainian-Swedish Politico-Military Alliances of the XVIIth – XVIIIth Centuries” is issued to commemorate the conclusion of Ukrainian-Swedish alliances, namely the Treaty of Korsun in 1657, Velyki Budyscha Pact of 1709 as well as the 300th anniversary of the events relative to the political and military actions of the Hetman Ivan Mazepa. These international treaties were intended to obtain the Ukrainian state independence
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are: the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the Small National Emblem of Ukraine above, the legend (denomination and the year of the coin issue) – 10/ГРИВЕНЬ/2008 (10/hryvnias/2008) and the conventionalized image of scrolls with seals as a symbol of Ukrainian-Swedish politico-military alliances beneath.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are, against the background of flags, the portraits of the most significant persons of the relevant historical period – the Hetmans Bohdan Khmelnytskyi and Ivan Mazepa, the Kings Charles XII and Charles X Gustav (from left to right).

name: 725 years of the City of Rivne
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the centre of the Rivne Oblast situated on the Ustia-river. Rivne was first mentioned in 1283 as a town of the Kingdom of Halych-Volhynia in connection with the battle between the armies of Leszek II the Black, a duke of Krakow (Cracow), and Vytenis, a Lithuanian prince
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the composition consisting of the historical and architectural monuments of the city, among them: the monument to Mariia Rivnenska Nesvytska, Church of the Assumption, Cathedral of the Intercession, etc., above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); the legend 5 ГРИВЕНЬ 2008 (5 hryvnias 2008) is thereunder, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the right).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a conventionalized parchment scroll with a scene of the battle between the Polish and Lithuanian armies with the record whereof the city chronology begins. To the left and right of the scroll there is a conventionalized ornamental pattern, above which there is the coat of arms of the city (at the left) and the legend 725/РОКІВ (725 years) (on the right); underneath there is the semicircular inscription ПЕРША ПИСЕМНА ЗГАДКА (first record).

name: Libra
generalDescription: Commemorative coins are dedicated to one of 12 Zodiac constellations – Libra
averseDescription: On the obverse in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the coin issue year: 2008, as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness – 15.55; there are circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse a conventionalized image of a man holding the balance (lat. Libra) with stars around it is depicted, to the left whereof above is the shape of constellation, below to the left – the Sign of Zodiac symbol is placed, on the right there is a stylized inscription: СУЗІР’Я/ТЕРЕЗІВ (Libra Constellation).

name: Libra
generalDescription: Commemorative coins are dedicated to one of 12 Zodiac constellations – Libra.
averseDescription: On the obverse there is a circle diagonally divided into sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2008 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; there are the circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse a conventionalized image of the balance (lat. Libra) with stars around it is depicted, and its Sign of Zodiac symbol under it.

name: 175 years of the State Arboretum “Trostianets
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a unique world-famous monument of landscape architecture of the XIXth century situated in the south-east part of the Chernihiv Oblast. The Arboretum was created thanks to the efforts of Ivan Mykhailovych Skoropadskyi and at his own expense using the methods of artificial terrain formation. The unique collections of introduced woody plants of the Arboretum have been included in the State Register of Scientific Importance Sites being the national patrimony of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are: the mirror image of swans against the background of wavy water, the face value 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) on the left above, the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) on the right, the coin issue year 2008 as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint beneath.
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse there is, against the background of a pond and a park images, the portrait bust of the arboretum founder with the legend ІВАН/СКОРОПАДСЬКИЙ (Ivan/Skoropadskyi)/1804-1887 thereunder, the inscription 175/РОКІВ (YEARS) is to the left and the crescent legends ДЕРЖАВНИЙ ДЕНДРОЛОГІЧНИЙ ПАРК (State Arboretum) on the left and ТРОСТЯНЕЦЬ (Trostianets) above.

name: Christianization of Kievan Rus
generalDescription: The commemorative coins “Christianization of Kievan Rus” are dedicated to the 1020th anniversary of the Christianization of Kievan Rus, which gained a footing for Christianity to become the state religion
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 5 hryvnia coin there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the circular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above) and П ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) (below), between them there is the year of coin issue 2008 (on the right), as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the left). In the coin center in the circle of conventionalized rays there is a cross and the semi-circular inscriptions ПРАВОСЛАВ’Я (Orthodoxy) (above) and ІЗ КИЄВА ПО ВСІЙ РУСІ (From Kyiv all over Rus) (below).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins there is a multi-figure composition of baptism with the inscription 988/РІК (988/YEAR) below and the semi-circular inscription – ХРЕЩЕННЯ КИЇВСЬКОЇ РУСІ (Christianization of Kievan Rus) above.

name: Nataliia Uzhvii
generalDescription: The commemorative coin “Nataliia Uzhvii” with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to one of the brightest stars of the Ukrainian cinema, a stage actress, who during her multiyear stage activity played more than 200 roles. Nataliia Mykhailivna Uzhvii in her scenic characters rendered the manysidedness and multidimensionality of the inner world of the woman; her creative work has enriched the national culture
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the theatre mask depicted; above - the semicircular legend Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) with the Small State Emblem of Ukraine and the coin issue year 2008 thereunder; below there are the inscription 2/ГРИВНІ (2/Hryvnias) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the circle formed by beads there is Nataliia Uzhvii’s portrait with the inscription thereunder: НАТАЛІЯ УЖВІЙ (NATALIIA UZHVII) 1898-1986.

name: Virgo
generalDescription: Commemorative coins are dedicated to one of 12 Zodiac constellations – Virgo.
averseDescription: On the obverse there is a circle diagonally divided into sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2008 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; there are the circumferential legends: Національний Банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 Гривні (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint
reverseDescription: On the reverse a conventionalized image of a virgin with stars around her is depicted, and the Sign of Zodiac symbol to the left of it.

name: Virgo
generalDescription: Commemorative coins are dedicated to one of 12 Zodiac constellations – Virgo.
averseDescription: On the obverse in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the coin issue year: 2008, as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness – 15.55; there are circumferential legends: Національний Банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 5 Гривень (5 hryvnias) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse a conventionalized image of a virgin with stars around it depicted, to the left whereof there is the contour of the constellation, above to the left – the Sign of Zodiac symbol is placed, on the right there is the stylized inscription: Сузір я Діви (Virgo Constellation).

name: Tereschenko Family
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to The commemorative coin “Tereschenko Family” with the face value of 10 hryvnias is dedicated to the famous Ukrainian Tereschenko family that has its origin in Hlukhiv, a renowned city of Ukrainian Cossackdom, and left a deep imprint on the history of Ukraine. The Tereschenkos have always adhered to the motto of their coat of arms – “Aspiring to the Public Benefit”, being well-known entrepreneurs and generous patrons of the arts.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) (above); under the inscription there are designation of the metal and its finenness – Ag 925, and the weight in fineness – 31.1 (on the right) as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the left). In the coin center there is placed the monogram with Mykola Tereschenko’s initials; beneath there are the face value of the coin and the year of its issue – 10 гривень/2008 (10 hryvnias/2008).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of symbolical attributes embodying activities of Tereschenko family representatives there are the portraits of such vivid personalities from the family as Artemii, Mykola, Varvara and Fedir; to the right there are the coat of arms of the family and the legend Родина Терещинків (family of the Tereschenkos).

name: Heorhii Voronyi
generalDescription: The commemorative coin “Heorhii Voronyi” with the face value of 2 hryvnias is dedicated to Heorhii Voronyi (spelled also as Georgy Voronoy or Georgi Voronoi), a great scientist, one of the most famous mathematicians of the world, which was born in 1868. Heorhii Feodosiiovych Voronyi has enriched mathematics with a number of important discoveries named after him. The range of use of his developments extends from the computer graphics to geometric simulation and artificial intelligence creation. Nowadays Voronyi’s works are used by specialists in different branches of learning from practically all countries of Europe, in USA, Canada, Japan, Australia, Hong Kong, New Zealand, etc.
averseDescription: On the obverse there is the conventionalized image of Voronoi diagram; the Small National Emblem of Ukraine (above); legends 2008/2 ГРИВНІ (2008/2 hryvnias), the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) on the left and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is Heorhii Voronyi’s portrait (on the left) and Voronoi diagram (on the right), indication of the years of his life: 1868/1908 and the bow-shaped inscription: ГЕОРГІЙ ВОРОНИЙ (Heorhii Voronyi).

name: Leo
generalDescription: These commemorative coins are dedicated to one of 12 Zodiac constellations – Leo.
averseDescription: On the obverse there is a circle diagonally divided into sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2008 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; there are the circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse a conventionalized image of a lion with stars around it is depicted, and its Sign of Zodiac symbol above it.

name: Leo
generalDescription: These commemorative coins are dedicated to one of 12 Zodiac constellations – Leo.
averseDescription: On the obverse in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the coin issue year: 2008, as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness – 15.55; there are circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse a conventionalized image of a lion with stars around it is depicted, to the left whereof is the shape of constellation, above the lion the Sign of Zodiac symbol is placed, on the right there is a stylized inscription: СУЗІР’Я/ЛЕВА (Leo Constellation).

name: Christianization of Kievan Rus
generalDescription: The commemorative coins “Christianization of Kievan Rus” are dedicated to the 1020th anniversary of the Christianization of Kievan Rus, which gained a footing for Christianity to become the state religion
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 100 hryvnia coin there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the circular inscriptions НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above) and СТО ГРИВЕНЬ (one hundred hryvnias) (below) placed against the background of conventionalized ornament, between them there is the year of coin issue 2008 (on the right), designation of metal and its finenness – Ag 999, weight in fineness – 1000, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the left). In the coin center in the circle of conventionalized rays there is a cross and the semi-circular inscriptions ПРАВОСЛАВ’Я (Orthodoxy)(above) and ІЗ КИЄВА ПО ВСІЙ РУСІ (From Kyiv all over Rus)(below).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins there is a multi-figure composition of baptism with the inscription 988/РІК (988/YEAR) below and the semi-circular inscription – ХРЕЩЕННЯ КИЇВСЬКОЇ РУСІ (Christianization of Kievan Rus) above.

name: Roman Shukhevych
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Roman Shukhevych, one of the outstanding leaders of the Ukrainian liberation movement of the 20 – 50s of the 20th century, a military and political figure. Roman Volodymyrovych Shukhevych (Taras Chuprynka) – a lieutenant-general and the commander-in-chief of the Ukrainian Insurgent Army (1943-1950) is a bright representative of generation of the stormy 1920 - 40s.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a composition: the conventionalized broken uphill road, against the background whereof there is the inscription - СЛАВА/ УКРАЇНІ! (Glorified be / Ukraine!); above – the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the semi-circular inscription - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), thereunder – the coin face value: П’ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias), the indication of metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 15.55 g; There is also placed the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Roman Shukhevych against the background of a conventionalized forest, which symbolizes military resistance to invaders and the national - liberation movement in Ukraine, and placed are the inscriptions: to the right -ГЕРОЯМ/СЛАВА! (Glorified be / the Heroes!); to the left -1907/ЛЬВІВ/1950/БІЛОГОРЩА (1907/ Lviv/ 1950/ Bilohorscha) and below, the bow-shaped – РОМАН ШУХЕВИЧ (Roman Shukhevych).

name: 850 years of Sniatyn
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Sniatyn, a picturesque town in the historical region of Pokuttia situated on the left bank of the Prut River and a district centre of the Ivano-Frankivsk oblast. For the first time Sniatyn was mentioned in 1158 as a town of the Principality of Halych (Galicia) in the Hypatian Chronicle; in 1448 the town was granted Magdeburg Rights.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the image of the horseman, the voivode Kostiantyn Siroslavovych, the town founder; on the right and on the left there is a conventionalized Pokuttian ornament; above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscription ???????????? ???? ??????? (National Bank of Ukraine); the legend 5 ??????? 2008 (5 hryvnias 2008) is below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint (on the right).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a conventionalized composition: to the left – the Town Hall building and the town coat of arms; to the right – a detail of the architectural design of the Town Hall building with the eagle sculpture; above there is the inscription ?????? (SNIATYN) and below – 850/????? (850 years).

name: Cancer
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Cancer constellation.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of the 5 hryvnia coin in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. On the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, on the right – the coin issue year: 2008, as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness – 15.55; there are circumferential legends: Національний банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 5 Гривень (5 hryvnias) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of the 5 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Cancer with stars around it is depicted, to the left whereof is the Sign of Zodiac symbol, on the right there is a stylized inscription: Сузір я Риб (Cancer constellation).

name: Cancer
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Cancer constellation
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of the 2 hryvnia coin there is a circle diagonally divided into sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2008 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; there are the circumferential legends: Національний Банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 Гривні (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of the 2 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Cancer with stars around it is depicted, to the right whereof – the Sign of the Zodiac symbol.

name: 225 Years to the city of Sevastopol
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the city of Sevastopol (from Greek - a city of glory), an important sea port and fortress which was founded in 1783 near Chersonesus, the former Greek settlement. It is the largest sea commercial port, fish port, as well as industrial, scientific, cultural and historical centre of the South of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of crossed anchors and a ship-gu symbolizing the city as a naval port and fortress, beneath the gun there are conventionalized bunches of grapes; above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National bank of Ukraine, below - ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2008 (Ten Hryvnia/2008), designation of the metal Ag 925 and 31,1, its weight in fineness; on both coins there is the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of the Grafska (earl) wharf (beneath), a fortification structure, above which there is

name: Swallow`s Nest
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Swallow`s Nest, one of the pearls of the Southern Crimea built in 1912 by the architectural engineer Sherwood.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there is a depiction of a sea wave and sea gull, above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National bank of Ukraine) and the following inscriptions: on the coin made of gold: 50/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2008 (50/ Hryvnia/ 2008), as well as designation of the metal Au 900 and its weight in fineness -15,55; on the silver coin - - 10 ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2008 (10 Hryvnia/2008), designation of the metal Ag 925 and 31,1, its weight in fineness; on both coins there is the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins against the background of a mountain and sea there is depicted the architectural monument - Swallow`s Nest resting on the rock and there is placed an inscription: ЛАСТІВЧИНЕ ГНІЗДО ( Swallow`s Nest) (on the left).

name: Swallow`s Nest
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Swallow`s Nest, one of the pearls of the Southern Crimea built in 1912 by the architectural engineer Sherwood.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin there is a depiction of a sea wave and sea gull, above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the semicircular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National bank of Ukraine) and the following inscriptions: on the coin made of gold: 50/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2008 (50/ Hryvnia/ 2008), as well as designation of the metal Au 900 and its weight in fineness -15,55; on the silver coin - - 10 ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2008 (10 Hryvnia/2008), designation of the metal Ag 925 and 31,1, its weight in fineness; on both coins there is the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins against the background of a mountain and sea there is depicted the architectural monument - Swallow`s Nest resting on the rock and there is placed an inscription: ЛАСТІВЧИНЕ ГНІЗДО ( Swallow`s Nest) (on the left).

name: Eurasian Black Vulture
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Eurasian black vulture (Falconiformes order, Accipitridae family), the sole species which in Ukraine nests only in the Southern Crimea. The natural habitat of this species covers Southern Europe and Asia (mountain regions). Black vulture is included to the Red Book of Ukraine and the European Red List of animals and plants under the danger of extermination.
averseDescription: On the coins obverse within framing of images made of some species of flora and fauna there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions: on the silver coin: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 10/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2008 (National bank of Ukraine/ 10/ Hryvnias/ 2008), as well as Ag 925, the designation of metal and 31,1g, its weight in fineness; on the German silver coin: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 2/ ГРИВНІ/ 2008 (National bank of Ukraine/ 2/ Hryvnias/ 2008). Furthermore, there is the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logotype on both coins.
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse there is a depiction of a black vulture with its baby bird in the nest and there are semicircular inscriptions: AEGYPIUS MONACHUS (above) and ГРИФ ЧОРНИЙ (Black vulture) (beneath).

name: Eurasian Black Vulture
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Eurasian black vulture (Falconiformes order, Accipitridae family), the sole species which in Ukraine nests only in the Southern Crimea. The natural habitat of this species covers Southern Europe and Asia (mountain regions). Black vulture is included to the Red Book of Ukraine and the European Red List of animals and plants under the danger of extermination.
averseDescription: On the coins obverse within framing of images made of some species of flora and fauna there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions: on the silver coin: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 10/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2008 (National bank of Ukraine/ 10/ Hryvnias/ 2008), as well as Ag 925, the designation of metal and 31,1g, its weight in fineness; on the German silver coin: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 2/ ГРИВНІ/ 2008 (National bank of Ukraine/ 2/ Hryvnias/ 2008). Furthermore, there is the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logotype on both coins.
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse there is a depiction of a black vulture with its baby bird in the nest and there are semicircular inscriptions: AEGYPIUS MONACHUS (above) and ГРИФ ЧОРНИЙ (Black vulture) (beneath).

name: Yevhen Petrushevych
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Yevhen Petrushevych (1863 – 1940), a Ukrainian lawyer, a figure of the Ukrainian national-liberation movement in Halychyna, one of the founders of the Western-Ukrainian Peoples Republic, chairman of the Ukrainian National Council, the parliament of the republic (actually, the WUPR president
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, underneath – 2008, the coin mintage year; around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two Hrivnias) (beneath) and the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Yevhen Petrushevych, on the right: 1863/1940, his years of life, on the left - the lion of Halych and beneath there is a semicircular inscription: ЄВГЕН ПЕТРУШЕВИЧ (Yevhen Petrushevych).

name: 600 Years to the city of Chernivtsi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the city of Chernivtsi, an administrative, economic and cultural centre, one of picturesque cities of Ukraine, which is located on both banks of the river Prut in the foothills of the Carpathian Mountains. The first written mention of Chernivtsi was found in the charter of a Moldavian landlord Oleksander Dobryi in 1408, though according to archeological data this settlement above the river Prut was founded much earlier.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of a fret lantern (on the right), one of the symbols of the city, a fragment of the conventionalized ornament (on the left), which decorates the roof of Chernivtsi university and above there are: the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2008 (National Bank of Ukraine/ 5/ Hryvnia/ 2008) and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a composition made of the outstanding historical and architectural monuments of the city and the inscription: ЧЕРНІВЦІ (Chernivtsi), beneath - 600/ років (600/ years).

name: 100 Years to Kyiv Zoo
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Kyiv Zoological gardens, founded in 1908. This zoo contains over 3500 species of animals and birds. Work on acclimatization of many animals is conducted here, great attention is paid to breeding of animals in captivity, especially, of rare endangered species.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a composition depicting a circle divided by the wind rose into four parts symbolizing classes of mammalian, birds, fishes and amphibious, which are represented in the zoo; above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (left, in semicircle), beneath: 2/ ГРИВНІ 2008 (2/Hryvnia 2008) and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a conventionalized inscription: ZOO, inside of which there is a depiction of a giraffe and inscriptions: 100/років (100 Years), КИЇВСЬКОМУ ЗООПАРКУ (to the Kyiv Zoo).

name: Annunciation
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Annunciation, one of the important Orthodox holidays, which is marked on April, 7
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a semicircular inscription - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), in the centre there is a conventionalized setting of the Gospel, on both sides of which there are lilies, associated with the Virgin Mary. There are also placed the inscriptions: 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 Hryvnia), 2008, the coins mintage year (beneath) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a multi-figured composition - a first spring round dance, above - there is the Annunciation scene and the semicircular inscription: БЛАГОВІЩЕННЯ (Annunciation).

name: Annunciation
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Annunciation, one of the important Orthodox holidays, which is marked on April, 7
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a semicircular inscription – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), in the centre there is a conventionalized setting of the Gospel, on both sides of which there are lilies, associated with the Virgin Mary. There are also placed the inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a multi-figured composition - a first spring round dance, above - there is the Annunciation scene and the semicircular inscription: БЛАГОВІЩЕННЯ (Annunciation).

name: Sydir Holubovych
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Sydir Holubovych (1873 – 1938), a Ukrainian political and public figure who in October 1918 was elected to the ZUNR Ukrainian National Council. Since January 1919 he was the head of the ZOUNR, ZUNR State Secretariat.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under which there is 2008, the coin mintage year, around the coin circumference there are the inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ (National/ Bank /of Ukraine) (above), 2/ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnia) (below) and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a portrait of Sydir Holubovych, on its right - 1873/1938, his years of life, on the left there are the inscriptions: ЗУNР (ZUNR) and semicircular inscription: СИДІР ГОЛУБОВИЧ (Sydir Holubovych) (below).

name: Skythian Gold (The Goddess Api)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an artefact of the Skythian culture - a lamina applique`s work of 6th century B.C. with the depiction of the Goddess Api, the Scythians` original mother.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within a bead circle there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, above which there is 2008, the coin mintage year; between the bead circle and the coin rim there are the inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), 2 ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnia) (below), as well as Au 999,9 , the designation of the metal (on the left), 1,24, its mass and the NBU Mint logotype (on the right).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a golden lamina applique` work as the Goddess Api with serpent-like legs and there is also a semicircular inscription: СКІФСЬКЕ ЗОЛОТО (Skythian Gold) (beneath).

name: Leo Landau
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Leo D.Landau (1908 – 1968), an outstanding physicist-theorist, the Nobel Prize laureate (1962), who made significant contribution to almost all fields of theoretical physics. He was the author of the classic work on diamagnetism of free electrons, theory of liquid helium superfluidity and many others. In the city of Kharkiv Leo D.Landau lead a theoretical department of the Ukrainian institute for Physics and Engineering, at the same time he headed chairs of theoretical physics in the Kharkiv Institute for Engineering and Mechanics and in the Kharkiv university, having established an advanced school of the Soviet theoretical physics
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is placed the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), in the middle of which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, a conventionalized composition: the distribution function of electrons and ions in the anisometric plasma against the background of the sun, below there are the inscriptions: 2 ГРИВНІ/ 2008 (2 Hryvnia/2008) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a portrait of Lev Landau and there are placed the inscriptions: ЛЕВ ЛАНДАУ (Leo Landau) (on the left), 1908 – 1968 (on the right)

name: Vasyl Stus
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Vasyl Stus (1938 – 1985), a public figure, translator, literary critic and poet of a tragic fate, whose works are translated into many languages of the world. A tireless fighter for human rights Vasyl Stus was a member ( in 1979 – 1980 - a chairman) of the Ukrainian Helsinki group for human rights observation
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the glass background there is a semicircular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ ((National Bank of Ukraine), under which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, a conventionalized composition symbolizing the way to the independence, below there are the inscriptions: 2008 / 2 ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnia/2008) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a portrait of Vasyl Stus against the background of Alla Horska conventionalized mosaics Woman-Bird, to the right of which there is the semicircular inscription: ВАСИЛЬ СТУС (Vasyl Stus

name: The Year of Rat
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Year of Rat, one of the animal-symbols of the Oriental calendar, which is based on the twelve months cycle of Jupiter, the largest planet of the Solar system.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within setting made of a conventionalized vegetable ornamentation there are inscriptions:НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (National Bank /of Ukraine/ 5/ Hryvnia); above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, beneath: 2008, the coin issue year, as well as Ag 925, the designation of metal; 15,55g, its weight in fineness and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a rat made in a technique of a cheap popular print within a vegetable ornamentation setting (a rat eye is decorated with 0,01carat diamond). Both above and below this composition there is a depiction of contour figures of all 12 symbols of the Oriental calendar.

name: 90th anniversary of the Forming of the first Government of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the first Government of Ukraine called the General Secretariat, that worked since June 15, 1917 to January 9, 1918. The General Secretariat Declaration developed under the chairmanship of Volodymyr Vinnychenko was the first document with a draft program for the Government. The First Universal (legal act) was assumed as the basis for drawing up the above-mentioned Declaration. It solemnly proclaimed a new social order of the free autonomous Ukraine in which `henceforth we ourselves shall arrange our life`.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within a cartouche there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, there is also placed a conventionalized composition made of fragment of banknotes of of those times, upon which there are symbols of the then branches of industry and culture of the state, as well as the inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/БАНК/УКРАЇНИ/2 ГРИВНІ/2007 (National/ Bank /of Ukraine/ 2 Hryvnias/2007). On the coin there is also depicted the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a portrait of Volodymyr Vinnychenko (on the right), a composition with a conventionalized ornament (on the left), there are placed the inscriptions: КИЇВ,/1917РІК/ ПЕРШИЙ/ УРЯД/ УКРАЇНИ/90 РОКІВ (Kyiv/ 1917 Year/ First/ Government/ of Ukraine) (on the left) and ВОЛОДИМИР/ ВИННИЧЕНКО/ ГОЛОВА/ УРЯДУ (Volodymyr / Vinnychenko / Chairman/ of the Government) (on the left).

name: Archer
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to Sagittarius constellation.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of the 2 hryvnia coin there is a circle diagonally divided into sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2007 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; there are the circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coinOn the reverse of the 2 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Archer with stars around it is depicted, among which – the Sign of Zodiac symbol.

name: Archer
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Archer constellation.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 5 hryvnia coin in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. On the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, on the right – the coin issue year: 2007, as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness – 15.55; there are circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the 5 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Scorpion with stars around it is depicted, to the left whereof is the constellation image and the Sign of Zodiac symbol, to the right there is a stylized inscription: СУЗІР’Я СТРІЛЬЦЯ (Archer Constellation).

name: Scorpion
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Scorpion constellation.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of the 5 hryvnia coin in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. On the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, on the right – the coin issue year: 2007, as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness – 15.55; there are circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin of the 2 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Pisces with stars around it is depicted, among which – the Sign of Zodiac symbol.

name: Scorpion
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Scorpion constellation.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 2 hryvnia coin there is a circle diagonally divided into sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2007 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; there are the circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the the 5 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Scorpion with stars around it is depicted, to the left whereof is the constellation image and the Sign of Zodiac symbol, to the right there is a stylized inscription: СУЗІР’Я СКОРПІОНА (Scorpion Constellation).

name: 200 Years of Crimean Resorts
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 200th anniversary of the Crimean scientific balneology that originated development of the Crimean balneal resources. One of the main therapeutic resources of the peninsula which attracted the attention both of medical scientists and state authorities are the Saky therapeutic muds whose medical properties started to be studied at the beginning of the XIXth century.
averseDescription: On the obverse there is the semi-circular legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), underneath – the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, the image of the modern sanatorium against the background of the Crimean picturesque nature, and inscriptions – 5 ГРИВЕНЬ / 2007 (5 hryvnias / 2007) – as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse to the left there is the image of the chemist Felix De Serra (in 1807 he analyzed Saky muds for the first time) against the background of the lake, above to the right – the pump-room), underneath there is the inscription – 1807 / РІК / САКСЬКІ ОЗЕРА (1807 / YEAR / SAKY LAKES) – as well as the emblem of the Autonomous Republic of Crimea. Above there is the semi-circular legend – ПОЧАТОК ОСВОЄННЯ КУРОРТІВ КРИМУ (Beginning in development of the Crimean resorts).

name: Holodomor – Genocide of the Ukrainian People
generalDescription: The coins have been issued to commemorate the victims of Holodomor (deliberately provoked famine in Ukraine in 1932 – 1933).
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins in the center there is the image of a girl with corn gleanings in hands standing in the stubble-field, on her both sides – the viburnum branches. There is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine on the left, the coin issue year: 2007 on the right and semi-circular legends: on the silver coin – ДВАДЦЯТЬ 20 ГРИВЕНЬ (twenty 20 hryvnias), the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness 62.2; on the German silver coin – П’ЯТЬ 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (Five 5 hryvnias), on both coins there is the semi-circular legend – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) – as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins against the background of candle lights there is the image of the cross with the stork inside and circumferential legends: ГОЛОДОМОР – ГЕНОЦИД УКРАЇНСЬКОГО НАРОДУ 1932 ПАМ’ЯТАЙМО! 1933 (Holodomor –Genocide of the Ukrainian People 1932 Remember! 1933).

name: The Famine - Genocide of the Ukrainian People
generalDescription: The coins are issued in commemoration of victims of 1932 – 1933 Famine.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin in the center there is the image of a girl with corn gleanings in hands standing in the stubble-field, on her both sides - the viburnum branches. There is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine on the left, the coin issue year: 2007, on the German silver coin - П`ЯТЬ 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (Five 5 hryvnias), there is the semi-circular legend - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) - as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins against the background of candle lights there is the image of the cross with the stork inside and circumferential legends: ГОЛОДОМОР – ГЕНОЦИД УКРАЇНСЬКОГО НАРОДУ 1932 ПАМ’ЯТАЙМО! 1933 (Holodomor –Genocide of the Ukrainian People 1932 Remember! 1933).

name: The Ostroh Bible
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Ostroh Bible (1581), a notable monument of book-printing - the first unabridged printed edition of the Bible in Old Church Slavonic. The prince Kostiantyn Ostrozkyi (Konstanty Ostrogski) was the initiator and Maecenas of the Ostroh Bible creation, who invited Ivan Fedorov (Fedorovych), a book-printer, to Ostroh to translate into reality his idea. The Bible of 1256 pages was printed in 1500 copies, which was a large edition for that time.
averseDescription: On the obverse there is a conventionalized fragment of the first page ornamental headpiece of the Ostroh Bible, which serves as the background for the Small National Emblem of Ukraine (above) and for the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) in the center. Below there is the face value and the coin mintage year - 100 ГРИВЕНЬ (100 Hryvnia) / 2007, designation of the metal Au 900, weight in fineness 31.1, and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there are conventionalized portraits of Ivan Fedorov and Kostiantyn Ostrozkyi holding the opened book and the conventionalized inscriptions: ОСТРОЗЬКА БІБЛІЯ (The Ostroh Bible) (above) and 1581(below).

name: Buhai
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a Ukrainian folk musical instrument made in a form of conical barrel (wooden cylinder). At one end a sheep membrane is stretched with a hole in this skin`s center. Through this hole a tuft of horse hair with a knot at one end is passed. Pulling of the horsehair makes a sound similar to the bull roar or bittern boom. This bass instrument is used by folk instrument groups to create funny effects.
averseDescription: Obverse is a relief surface imitating sound waves presented in a form of conventionalized floral baroque patterns. The following conventionalized inscriptions can be seen: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), under which to the left - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, 2007/ 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (2007/ 5 Hryvnia) (below) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is On the reverse there is a depiction of the musical instrument, around the coin circumference - a baroque pattern and the conventionalized inscription: БУГАЙ (Buhai).

name: Chumatskyi Shliakh
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Chumaky (sing. Chumak), the trade teamsters usual for Ukraine from the XVIIth to the middle of XIXth centuries, trafficking mainly in salt transported on oxen-driven carts. They were very popular among the Ukrainian people and even the Milky Way is called in Ukrainian Chumatskyi Shliakh (Chumaky`s Way). Their singular way of life and rich folklore attracted attention of many writers and artists. Among them: I. Kotliarevskyi, H. Kvitka-Osnovianenko, T. Shevchenko, Marko Vovchok, I. Nechui-Levytskyi, Panas Myrnyi, I. Aivazovsky, K. Trutovskyi, S. Vasylkivskyi and others.
averseDescription: On the obverse in the center there is the wheel (hologram) with the fire spiral around symbolizing the Galaxy. There is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine above, underneath there are the legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and 20 ГРИВЕНЬ (20 hryvnias) and the coin issue year: 2007 below, the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness 62.2 – as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse against the background of the night landscape there is the genre-piece: Chumaky`s carts, a Chumak with the tobacco-pipe, and the semi-circular legend - ЧУМАЦЬКИЙ ШЛЯХ (Chumatskyi Shliakh) below

name: Petro Hryhorenko
generalDescription: The jubilee coin is dedicated to Petro Hryhorenko (1907 – 1987) – a public and political figure, military theorist and famous advocate of human rights. Petro Hryhorenko was one of the founders of the Ukrainian Helsinki Group, he advocated return of the Crimean Tatars to their historical Motherland, the right of Ukraine and other peoples of the USSR for independence.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above against the glass background there is the arciform inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), underneath - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, 2 ГРИВНІ/2007 (2 Hryvnia/ 2007), below there is a symbolic composition: a sprout is breaking through a brick wall. To the left there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Petro Hryhorenko is portrayed as giving a speech, underneath - 1907/1987, his years of life, to the left there is the arciform inscription: ПЕТРО ГРИГОРЕНКО (Petro Hryhorenko).

name: Ivan Bahrianyi
generalDescription: The jubilee coin is dedicated to Ivan Bahrianyi - a Ukrainian publicist, poet, novelist and political figure. Ivan Pavlovych Bahrianyi (Lozoviahin) was an author of novels, plays, poems, essays, the `Fiery ring` story and the `Ave Maria` poem. Being subjected to repression and having served his sentence, he then emigrated to Germany where he organized Artistic Ukrainian Movement and founded Ukrainian revolutionary democratic party.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a strip with decorative pattern and the edge of a book against the background whereof there is the inscription: 2 / ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnia); above against the glass background there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, underneath - the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below to the left there is the coin issue year – 2007, and the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logotype
