reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Ivan Bahrianyi is portrayed, to the right there is a vertical inscription ІВАН БАГРЯНИЙ (Ivan Bahrianyi) and his years of life: 1906 (above) 1963 (below).

name: 1100-Years of the first written evidence of Chernihiv
generalDescription: The jubilee coin is dedicated to Chernihiv, one of the oldest cities of Ukraine, the first written mention whereof was made in 907. Chernihiv as the centre of an East Slavic tribe - Siverians since the late 9th century formed a part of the Kyivan Rus and was the second important and prosperous city after Kyiv.
averseDescription: On the obverse there are swords and a conventionalized fragment of a slate, found during archeological excavations on the territory of Chernihiv, above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, over which there is the semicircular inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below - 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 Hryvnias), and on the right - the coin issue year 2007, and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint
reverseDescription: On the reverse the following conventionalized composition is placed: the ancient Chernihiv burg is depicted behind the book lying open. Above the burg the city coat of arm is placed, against the book background - the inscription: 1100 / РОКІВ (1100 years), beneath - ЛІТОПИСНОМУ ЧЕРНІГОВУ (of the written evidence of Chernihiv).

name: Ivan Bohun
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the prominent military and political figures, a close associate of Bohdan Khmelnytskyi in the Uprising against the Polish rule in Ukraine, 1648 – 1654, elected the Kalnyk (Vinnytsia) polkovnyk – Ivan Bohun.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a composition within the necklace circlet, which embodies the idea of Ukraine`s integrity: the heraldic figures of the Archangel Michael and the crowned lion (symbols of the cities of Kyiv and Lviv) are holding the Small National Emblem of Ukraine. Above the composition there is the coin issue year - 2007, over the beads there is a semicircular conventionalized inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below - the coin face value -10 / ГРИВЕНЬ (10 Hryvnia), designation of the metal Ag 925, its weight in fineness - 31.1, and the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a battle scene is depicted to the right showing Cossacks in a defensive position, above which there is the inscription: XVII / ст.(17th century), to the left Ivan Bohun is portrayed in profile, underneath there is the conventionalized inscription: ІВАН / БОГУН (Ivan Bohun).

name: Orienteering
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the orienteering, which as a sport originated in Scandinavia more than 100 years ago. The coin was issued on the occasion of the World Orienteering Championship held in Kyiv in August 2007.
averseDescription: On the obverse against the glass background there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, under which there is the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), marking of sportsman`s route (on the right), the conventionalized depiction of the compass (on the left), below there is the coin face value - 2 ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnias), as well as the National Bank of Ukraine Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a running sportsman holding a map in his hand and the inscription: СПОРТИВНЕ (Sport) (horizontal) ОРІЄНТУВАННЯ (Orienteering) (vertical).

name: 120 Years of the Odesa State Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre
generalDescription: The coin is issued on the occasion of the 120th anniversary of the Odesa National Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre, a famous building which is a wide-known architectural monument built in the Viennese Baroque style according to the design project of architects Ferdinand Fellner and Hermann Helmer. The theatre was opened in 1887. The ceiling of the theatre hall was painted by the Vienna artist Franz Lefler with motives of Shakespeare`s plays. The theatre is famous not only due to its architecture but also due to its staging record.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 10 Hryvnia coin the theatre hall interior is depicted and the following inscriptions are placed: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК УКРАЇНИ/ 10 ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2007 (National Bank of Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnias/ 2007), to the left whereof there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, as well as designation of the metal Ag 925 and weight in fineness 31,1.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins the building of the Odesa State Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre is depicted, under which there is the inscription: 120 РОКІВ (120 Years), and one more around the coin circumference - ОДЕСЬКИЙ ДЕРЖАВНИЙ АКАДЕМІЧНИЙ ТЕАТ ОПЕРИ ТА БАЛЕТУ (Odesa State Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre).

name: 120 Years of the Odesa State Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre
generalDescription: The coin is issued on the occasion of the 120th anniversary of the Odesa National Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre, a famous building which is a wide-known architectural monument built in the Viennese Baroque style according to the design project of architects Ferdinand Fellner and Hermann Helmer. The theatre was opened in 1887. The ceiling of the theatre hall was painted by the Vienna artist Franz Lefler with motives of Shakespeare`s plays. The theatre is famous not only due to its architecture but also due to its staging record.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 5 Hryvnia coin a ballet scene is depicted, the Small National Emblem of Ukraine (above) and the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); below there is 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (5 Hryvnias) and the coin mintage year 2007. On both coins there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins the building of the Odesa State Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre is depicted, under which there is the inscription: 120 РОКІВ (120 Years), and one more around the coin circumference - ОДЕСЬКИЙ ДЕРЖАВНИЙ АКАДЕМІЧНИЙ ТЕАТ ОПЕРИ ТА БАЛЕТУ (Odesa State Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre).

name: Olena Teliha
generalDescription: The jubilee coin is dedicated to Olena Ivanivna Teliha (1906 - 1942), a talented poetess and public figure. Olena Teliha was a poetess who left not very extensive, but rather significant artistic heritage. She was an organizer and a head of the Union of Ukrainian writers in Nazies-occupied Kyiv, she edited the `Timpani` periodical, a literary and artistic supplement to the `Ukrainian Word` newspaper.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above against the glass background there is the arciform inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), under which there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the left - the coin face-value – 2 / ГРИВНІ (2/Hryvnias), beneath – cherry blossom in flames and the logotype of the NBU Mint and 2007, the coin mintage year, are placed.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Olena Teliha is portrayed. To the right there are the inscriptions: 1906/1942 and arciform ОЛЕНА ТЕЛІГА (Olena Teliha).

name: 75 Years of the Foundation of the Donetsk Oblast
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 75th anniversary of the Foundation of the Donetsk Oblast, situated in the South-East part of Ukraine. Availability in the Oblast of fuel and energy resources as well as mineral and raw material resources established conditions for industrial complex development with high concentration of the heavy industry branch, scientific and social infrastructure
averseDescription: On the obverse there is the image of miner’s head torch on the left illuminating the conventionalized outlines of industrial enterprises on the right, and there are the legends: against the mirror background above – the semi circumferential legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), underneath there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) 2007 inscription below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is the logotype of jubilee celebrations of the 75 anniversary of the foundation of the Donetsk Oblast, there are circumferential legends – ДОНЕЦЬКА ОБЛАСТЬ (Donetsk Oblast ) above, ЗАСНОВАНА У 1932 РОЦІ (Founded in 1932) below.

name: Oleh Olzhych
generalDescription: The jubilee coin is dedicated to the 100th anniversary of birth of Oleh Olzhych (Oleh Oleksandrovych Kandyba) – a poet, public figure and archeologist. During the World War II he headed a patriotic anti-fascist underground resistance group and was one of the organizers of the Ukrainian National Council in Kyiv (1941). In 1944, arrested by Gestapo men, he perished in a fascist concentration camp.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the glass background there are: above - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, thereunder – the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below to the right – 2 / ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias), the coin face value, beneath - the year of coinage: 2007, to the left there is a depiction of a chestnut leaf fallen on the block pavement and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Oleh Olzhych is portrayed, and the following inscriptions are placed: 1907 / 1944 (to the left) and ОЛЕГ ОЛЬЖИЧ (Oleh Olzhych).

name: XVI Annual Session of the Parliament Assembly of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Eu
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the meeting of XVI Annual Session of the Parliament Assembly of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe held in Kyiv on July 5-9, 2007.
averseDescription: On the obverse in the inner circle against the background of the conventionalized Ukrainian ornament there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, in the outer circle there are circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) below, the coin issue year: 2007 to the left, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint
reverseDescription: On the reverse in the inner circle there is the image of the emblem of the XVI Annual Session of the Parliament Assembly OSCE in Kyiv, in the outer circle there is the circumferential legend: XVI ЩОРІЧНА СЕСІЯ ПАРЛАМЕНТСЬКОЇ АСАМБЛЕЇ ОБСЕ (XVI Annual Session of the Parliament Assembly of the OSCE).

name: Ivan Ohiienko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Ivan Ohienko (1882 – 1972), an outstanding Ukrainian scientist, public and ecclesiastical figure. Ivan Ohienko - a philologist, literary critic, founder and rector of the Kamianetz-Podilskyi state university was a minister of education and a minister of religions of the Ukrainian National Republic. Ivan Ohiienko made a significant contribution to development of Ukrainian culture and linguistics.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the glass background there is the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), beneath there is a three line inscription: 2/ ГРИВНІ/ 2007 (2 Hryvnia, 2007), and four three-cornered sectors, which are decorated with vegetable ornament in Baroque style, as well as the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a portrait of Ivan Ohienko, at the left and at the right of it, in three-cornered segments there is inscribed: 1882 - 1972, his year of life, below there is a semicircular inscription: ІВАН ОГІЄНКО (Ivan Ohienko)

name: Pure water is source of life
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to water, one of the fundamental sources of life on the Earth. These coins have to attract attention of the society to economical treatment of natural resources, in particular, rivers, lakes and seas.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the internal ring there are depicted circles dispersing on the water surface from a drop of water, at the upper ring part - the next drop. Along the external ring there are depicted: the small National Emblem of Ukraine (on the left), 2007, the coin mintage year (on the right), the inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), the coin face value: on the precious metal coin - 20 ГРИВЕНЬ (20 Hryvnia); on the nonprecious metal coin - 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 Hryvnia) (below) and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the internal ring there is depicted a symbolic composition: a human being and waterfall. Along the external ring there is the inscription: ЧИСТА ВОДА – ДЖЕРЕЛО ЖИТТЯ (Pure water is a source of life)

name: Clear Water – a Spring of Life
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to one of the basics of life on Earth – Water. Their role is to attract attention of society to careful attitude towards the natural resources, in particular rivers, lakes, and seas.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins in the inner circle there are ripples dispersing from a drop on the water surface, above – one drop more. In the outer circle there are the Small National Emblem of Ukraine to the left and the coin issue year: 2007 to the right, the circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above; there is the denomination: 20 ГРИВЕНЬ (20 hryvnias) on the precious metal coin, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) on the non-precious metal coin below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins in the inner circle there is the symbolic composition – a man and waterfall are depicted. In the outer circle there is the circumferential legend ЧИСТА ВОДА – ДЖЕРЕЛО ЖИТТЯ (Clean water – the source of life).

name: 100 Years of JSC `Motor-Sich`
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the largest in the world and the only one in Ukraine enterprise involved in production, testing, maintenance in service and repair of 55 engine types and modifications for 61 kinds of airplanes and helicopters for different purposes, which are operated in 106 countries of the world - Zaporozhian open joint stock company `Motor-Sich`.
averseDescription: On the obverse against the Earth hemispheres there is the image of the Falcon, above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine with the circumferential legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) over it, to the left – the coin minting year 2007 and 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse the image of the aeroengine is depicted, above on the right there is the logotype JSC of “Motor-Sich” and the inscriptions: МОТОР СІЧ (Motor-Sich) above on the left and 100 РОКІВ (100 years) below.

name: 1100 Years of Perejaslav-Khmelnytskyi
generalDescription: The jubilee coin is dedicated to one of the oldest Ukrainian cities. It was mentioned for the first time in the text of Prince Oleh’s Treaty with the Byzantine Empire (907) as one of three oldest cities of the Ancient Rus. Since the 11th century this city was the centre of Pereiaslav Principality. In the late 15th- and during 16th centuries it played an important role in the formation of the Ukrainian Cossacks.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a conventionalized parchment with passages from `The Tale of Bygone Years`; against its background beneath and on the right there is the city seal of the first half of 17th century, above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, above which there is a semicircular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), beneath: 5 ГРИВЕНЬ / 2007 (5 Hryvnias/ 2007), as well as the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the composition depicting two historical stages of the city development: old Rus and Cossacks, between them: an Old Rus cathedral (beneath), the city coat of arms (above), as well as the inscriptions: ПЕРЕЯСЛАВ-ХМЕЛЬНИЦЬКИЙ (Perejaslav-Khmelnytskyi) (overhead) and 1100 (below).

name: Oleksander Liapunov
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 150th anniversary of birth of Oleksandr Liapunov (1857--1918) – a mathematician and mechanic, professor of the Kharkiv University (1885—1902) and an academician of the Petersburg Academy of Sciences from 1901, whose works were related to celestial mechanics, mathematics, physics and probability theory
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, under which the – inscription - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and geometric presentation of a celestial mechanics problem. Below there are inscriptions 2 ГРИВНІ / 2007 (2 hryvnias) and the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Oleksandr Liapunov is portrayed, to the right of the portrait there are the arciform inscriptions: ОЛЕКСАНДР ЛЯПУНОВ (Oleksandr Liapunov) / 1857 - 1918.

name: Marmot
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a rodent, which inhabits the Ukrainian steppes and since autumn till spring falls into hibernation hiding in a burrow. The time of marmot’s awakening is a sign of early or delayed spring.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, the coin issue year 2007, designation of Au 999,9 (on the left) and weight in fineness 1,24 and the NBU Mint logotype (on the right) are placed within the beads ring; between the beads ring and the coin rim there are inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), and 2 ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnias) (below)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a marmot is depicted and the following inscriptions are placed: MARMOTA BOBAK (on the left) and БАБАК (БАЙБАК) (Marmot) (on the right).

name: Les Kurbas
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is devoted to Les Kurbas (1887-1937), a prominent stage director, actor, educator, playwright and translator. Les (Oleksandr-Zenon) Stepanovych Kurbas was a theatre figure, whose creative work was influenced by expressionism and constructivism, the founder of the Ukrainian modern theatre “Berezil”.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the upper part the Small National Emblem of Ukraine is depicted, under which in the right part the inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) is placed against the glass background. Below, against the background of a conventionalized circle there are the inscriptions: 2 ГРИВНІ/ 2007 (2Hryvnia/ 2007) and the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Les Kurbas is portrayed against the conventionalized geometric decorative pattern used in poster design in the 20s of the XX century; above, to the left, there is the year of birth – 1887, below, to the right, the year of death – 1937, underneath – diagonal inscription – ЛЕСЬ КУРБАС (Les Kurbas).

name: Pisces
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Pisces constellation.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of the 2 hryvnia coin there is a circle diagonally divided into sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2007 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; there are the circumferential legends: Національний Банк України (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 Гривні (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of the 2 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Pisces with stars around it is depicted, among which – the Sign of Zodiac symbol.

name: Pisces
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Pisces constellation.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of the 5 hryvnia coin in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. On the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, on the right – the coin issue year: 2007, as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness – 15.55; there are circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of the 5 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Aquarius with stars around it is depicted, to the left whereof is the Sign of Zodiac symbol, to the right there is a stylized inscription: СУЗІР’Я РИБ (Pisces Constellation

name: Aquarius
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Aquarius constellation
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of the 5 hryvnia coin in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. On the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, on the right – the coin issue year: 2007, as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness – 15.55; there are circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of the 5 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Aquarius with stars around it is depicted, to the left whereof is the Sign of Zodiac symbol, on the right there is a stylized inscription: СУЗІР’Я ВОДОЛІЯ (Aquarius Constellation).

name: Aquarius
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Aquarius constellation.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of the 2 hryvnia coin there is a circle diagonally divided into sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2007 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; there are the circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of the 2 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Aquarius with stars around it is depicted, to the left whereof – the Sign of Zodiac symbol.

name: Capricorn
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Capricorn constellation
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of the 5 hryvnia coin in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. On the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, on the right – the coin issue year: 2007, as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and the coin weight in fineness – 15.55; there are circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of the 5 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Capricorn with stars around it is depicted, to the left whereof is the Sign of Zodiac symbol, on the right there is a stylized inscription: СУЗІР’Я КОЗЕРОГА (Capricorn Constellation).

name: Capricorn
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Capricorn constellation
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of the 2 hryvnia coin there is a circle diagonally divided into sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2007 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; there are the circumferential legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of the 2 hryvnia coin a conventionalized image of Capricorn with stars around it is depicted, to the right whereof – the Sign of Zodiac symbol.

name: Serhii Koroliov
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Serhii Koroliov (1907--1966), an outstanding scientist and engineer, the chief designer of ballistic and geophysical missiles, spacecrafts, satellite series, and the first automatic interplanetary station “Zond”.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the upper part the Small National Emblem of Ukraine is placed, under which there is an inscription “НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ” (National Bank of Ukraine) and a conventionalized image of a space rocket before launch. Below there are inscriptions 2 ГРИВНІ / 2007 (2 hryvnias / 2007) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Serhii Koroliov is portrayed surrounded by conventionalized stars, to the right of the portrait the years of his birth and death “1907 - / 1966” are placed, to the left of the portrait – his signature facsimile, below – the arciform inscription: “СЕРГІЙ КОРОЛЬОВ” (Serhii Koroliov).

name: Year of the Pig
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Year of the Pig – one of the years of the Chinese calendar based on the twelve-year cycle of the Jupiter
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin, bordered by a primitivism style vegetative ornament, there are the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА / 5 / ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine, 5 hryvnias); above – the Small National Emblem of Ukraine with the inscription over it: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below – the year of the coin issue – 2007, the indication of metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 15.55 and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin there is a lubok-print-like depiction of a pig surrounded by conventionalized vegetative ornaments. Above and below this composition there are small silhouettes of all 12 animal symbols of the Chinese calendar

name: Nestor - the Chronicler
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Nestor the Chronicler, a thinker and annalist, author of the first hagiographic works of the Ancient Rus, whose Primary Chronicle or `Tale of Bygone Years` (1113) became the acme of his creative work.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a conventionalized fragment of the Tale of Bygone Years page with its opening lines; the Small National Emblem of Ukraine is placed above in the centre of the coin, thereunder the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below there is the coin face value - 50 ГРИВЕНЬ (50 Hryvnias), the coin issue year - 2006, the metal and its fineness - Au 900, its weight in fineness - 15,55 g and the logotype of the National Emblem of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a conventionalized iconographic portrait of Nestor writing his chronicle, the vertical legend НЕСТОР-ЛІТОПИСЕЦЬ (Nestor - / the chronicler is placed to the right and the inscription: XI - XII ст. (centuries) is placed below

name: Tsymbaly
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to a stringed striking instrument, well known in Ukraine – tsymbaly (hammered dulcimer variety) consisting of a trapezoidal wooden frame with metal strings, which is played with two beaters (sticks or hammers) against the strings. The tsymbaly (pl.) have a reach musical palette and are used by folk instrumental ensembles (e.g. troisti muzyky – a sort of a consort of three instruments; troisti = triple).
averseDescription: On the obverse a fan-shaped relief on the coin represents symbolically a tsymbaly melody. There are a baroque decorative pattern and inscriptions in simulated Cossack script, above – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (The National Bank of Ukraine), below – 2006 / 5 / ГРИВЕНЬ (hryvnias) and the logotype of the NBU Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse there is a picture of tsymbaly circled by a baroque decorative pattern and inscriptions in simulated Cossack script—ЦИМБАЛИ (tsymbaly).

name: The Water Baptism
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to one of the important Orthodox holy days related to the Baptism of the Lord feast (observed together with the Epiphany or the Theophany) and celebrated on January 19.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins there is a composition of Ukrainian female adornments, held by doves, and a church chalice; there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine above; the inscriptions below say: on the silver coin – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК / УКРАЇНИ / 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2006 (National Bank of Ukraine, 10 hryvnias, 2006); there is the indication of metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 31.1g; on the German silver coin – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК / УКРАЇНИ / 5 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2006 (National Bank of Ukraine, 5 hryvnias, 2006). On the left and on the right of both coins there are conventionalized frozen twigs with snowflakes and the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins there is a multifigured composition of a prayer service over a cross-shaped ice-hole with holographic depicting of water; the bow-shaped inscription on the left says: ВОДОХРЕЩЕ (Water baptism).

name: The Water Baptism
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to one of the important Orthodox holy days related to the Baptism of the Lord feast (observed together with the Epiphany or the Theophany) and celebrated on January 19.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins there is a composition of Ukrainian female adornments, held by doves, and a church chalice; there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine above; the inscriptions below say: on the silver coin – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК / УКРАЇНИ / 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2006 (National Bank of Ukraine, 10 hryvnias, 2006); there is the indication of metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 31.1g; on the German silver coin – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК / УКРАЇНИ / 5 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2006 (National Bank of Ukraine, 5 hryvnias, 2006). On the left and on the right of both coins there are conventionalized frozen twigs with snowflakes and the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins there is a multifigured composition of a prayer service over a cross-shaped ice-hole with holographic depicting of water; the bow-shaped inscription on the left says: ВОДОХРЕЩЕ (Water baptism).

name: Saint Cyril Church
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to the famous architectural and historical monument of XII century – St. Cyril Church in Kyiv, wherein the Grand Duke Sviatoslav, a hero of the Ancient Rus poem “The Lay of Igor’s Campaign” was buried in 1194.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the both coins there is a composition of M. Vrubel “Angels with Labara” from paintings of St. Cyril Church, above there is the semicircular inscription -- НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (The National Bank of Ukraine), below it - the year of coinage -- 2006, the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, underneath – the denomination: on the silver coin -- 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias), the kind of metal and its fineness -- Ag 925, its weight in fineness -- 31.1; on the coin of German silver -- 5 / ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias). The both coins have the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the both coins the St. Cyril Church is depicted with the inscriptions: above the semicircular one - КИРИЛІВСЬКА ЦЕРКВА ХІІ СТ. (St. Cyril Church of the ХІІ century), below - КИЇВ (Kyiv).

name: Kharkiv National Economic University
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Kharkiv National Economic University, founded in 1930.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, below the year of coinage: 2006. There are two semicircular inscriptions: above - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below - ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnia) ) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the university building, above which its logotype is placed (to the right) and the inscriptions: to the left - ХАРКІВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ ЕКОНОМІЧНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ (the Kharkiv National Economic University, below - РІК ЗАСНУВАННЯ/ 1930 (the year of the foundation/1930).

name: Saint Cyril Church
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to the famous architectural and historical monument of XII century – St. Cyril Church in Kyiv, wherein the Grand Duke Sviatoslav, a hero of the Ancient Rus poem “The Lay of Igor’s Campaign” was buried in 1194.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the both coins there is a composition of M. Vrubel “Angels with Labara” from paintings of St. Cyril Church, above there is the semicircular inscription -- НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (The National Bank of Ukraine), below it - the year of coinage -- 2006, the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, underneath – the denomination: on the silver coin -- 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnias), the kind of metal and its fineness -- Ag 925, its weight in fineness -- 31.1; on the coin of German silver -- 5 / ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias). The both coins have the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the both coins the St. Cyril Church is depicted with the inscriptions: above the semicircular one - КИРИЛІВСЬКА ЦЕРКВА ХІІ СТ. (St. Cyril Church of the ХІІ century), below - КИЇВ (Kyiv).

name: Serhii Ostapenko
generalDescription: The Commemorative coin is dedicated to the 125th anniversary of birth of Serhii St. Ostapenko (1881 - 1937), a Ukrainian statesman, economist, professor. Serhii Ostapenko was the consultant on economic issues of the Ukrainian People` Republic delegation in Brest-Lytovsk during the negotiations with Germany, Austria and Hungary, Bulgaria and Turkey. He was the minister of trade and industry (26.12.1918 - 11.02.1919), the Chairman of the Council of People`s Ministers of the UPR (13.02. - 09.04.1919).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is depicted the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, thereunder -: the year of coinage: 2006; around the coin circumference there are the inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnias) (below) and the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Serhii Ostapenko is potrayed against the background of conventionalized ornament there are the inscriptions to the left: СЕРГІЙ ОСТАПЕНКО (Serhii Ostapenko), below within the semicircke: ЛЮТИЙ - КВІТЕНЬ1919 (February - April 1919) and ГОЛОВА РАДИ НАРОДНИХ МІНІСТРІВ УНР (Chairman of the Council of People`s Ministers of the UPR).

name: Mykhailo Lysenko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Mykhailo Lysenko (1906 – 1972), a Ukrainian sculptor, People s artist of the USSR and an academician, whose works are adornment of many Ukrainian cities.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, beneath - there is the inscription: Національний Ьанк України (National Bank of Ukraine) and there are depicted tooling of a sculptor, artist and graphic artist against the background of a conventionalized palette. Below there are inscriptions: 2 гривні / 2006 (2 Hryvnia/2006) and the Mint logotype of the National Emblem of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a portrait of Mykhailo Lysenko, against whose background there are his years of life: 1906 – 1972; above there is a semicircular inscription: Михайло Лисенко (Mykhailo Lysenko).

name: Mykhailo Hrushevskyi
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the 140th birth anniversary of birth of Mykhailo Hrushevskyi (1866 – 1934), a leading personality in the national culture and statehood renaissance of Ukraine, literary critic, writer, sociologist, publicist, the author of a comprehensive study of the Ukrainian history.
averseDescription: On obverse of both coins there are above - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, under which there is the inscription - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), elements of the conventionalized ornament are depicted diagonally, to the left - the coin face value: on the coin of German silver - 2 ГРИВНІ/ 2006 (2 Hryvnia/2006). On the coin there is also the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint .
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Mykhailo Hrushevsky, to the left there is the vertical inscription: МИХАЙЛО/ ГРУШЕВСЬКИЙ (Mykhailo Hrushevskyi), beneath there are the years of life: 1866/ 1934.

name: Mykhailo Hrushevskyi
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the 140th birth anniversary of birth of Mykhailo Hrushevskyi (1866 – 1934), a leading personality in the national culture and statehood renaissance of Ukraine, literary critic, writer, sociologist, publicist, the author of a comprehensive study of the Ukrainian history.
averseDescription: On obverse of both coins there are above - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, under which there is the inscription - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), elements of the conventionalized ornament are depicted diagonally, to the left - the coin face value: on the silver coin - 5 ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2006 (5 Hryvnia/2006), designation of the metal Ag 925 and its weight in fineness; On the coin there is also the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint .
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Mykhailo Hrushevsky, to the left there is the vertical inscription: МИХАЙЛО/ ГРУШЕВСЬКИЙ (Mykhailo Hrushevskyi), beneath there are the years of life: 1866/ 1934.

name: 10th anniversary of the Clearing House of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 10th anniversary of the Clearing House
averseDescription: On the coin obverse framed by a conventionalized floral ornament there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, year of issue 2006, coin denomination – 10/ ГРИВЕНЬ (10/ HRYVNIAS) below, indication of the metal and its fineness Ag 925, weight in fineness 31.1 g, above there is the semicircular legend НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (NATIONAL BANK OF UKRAINE).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the building of the Clearing House of Ukraine, below there is the legend 10 /РОКІВ (10 YEARS) against the background of the Ancient Rus hryvnia, the semicircular inscription РАХУНКОВА ПАЛАТА (CLEARING HOUSE) above and a conventionalized floral ornament beneath.

name: Dmytro Lutsenko
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the 85th birth anniversary of Dmytro Lutsenko (1921 - 1989), who was born in the village of Beresova Rudka of Poltava region. Dmytro Lutsenko is the song writer of many famous songs: `My Kyiv`, Great age, Front-line soldiers, Mother`s cherry- tree, Autumn gold, etc.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a chestnut inflorescence against the background of the Kyiv panorama (on the right). Above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under which there is the inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), on the left against the smooth background: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК (National Bank), the coin issue year - 2006; on the German silver coin: ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnias). On the coin there is also the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a portrait of Dmytro Lutsenko, on the right from which there are two chestnut inflorescences and conventionalized inscriptions: Березова/ Рудка 1921/ Київ 1989 (Beresova/ Rudka/ 1921/ Kyiv/ 1989); around the coin circumference it is inscribed: ЯК ТЕБЕ НЕ ЛЮБИТИ, КИЄВЕ МІЙ! (One can not but love you, my Kyiv !) (above), ДМИТРО ЛУЦЕНКО (Dmytro Lutsenko) (below)

name: Dmytro Lutsenko
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the 85th anniversary of birth of Dmytro Lutsenko (1921 - 1989), who was born in the village of Berezova Rudka of Poltava region. Dmytro Lutsenko was the author of texts of many famous songs: `My Kyiv`, `Grey Hairs`, `Front-Line Soldiers`, `Mother`s Cherry Tree`, `Autumn Gold`, etc.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins the chestnut tree blossom cluster is depicted against the background of Kyiv panorama (to the right); above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, thereunder - the inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), to the left the semicircular inscription against the mirror-like background: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК (National Bank) and the year of coinage - 2006; denomination on the silver coin - П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (5 Hryvnias), the name of the metal and its fineness - Ag 925, its weight in fineness - 15.55, on the German silver coin: ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnias). On both coins there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of both coins there is a portrait of Dmytro Lutsenko, to the right whereof two chestnut blossom clusters and conventionalized inscriptions: Березова/ Рудка 1921/ Київ 1989 (Berezova/ Rudka/ 1921/ Kyiv/ 1989);and two semicircular inscriptions: above - ЯК ТЕБЕ НЕ ЛЮБИТИ, КИЄВЕ МІЙ! (How cannot anybody love you, my Kyiv, below - ДМИТРО ЛУЦЕНКО (Dmytro Lutsenko).

name: The 10th anniversary of the Recovery of Ukrainian Currency Unit - Hryvnia
generalDescription: These commemorative coins are dedicated to the 10th anniversary of currency reform in Ukraine which resulted in putting into circulation the national currency unit - hryvnia and its hundredth fraction - kopiyka.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, below - the image of the reverse side of the coin in circulation `Volodymyr the Great`; to the left whereof there is logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint, to the right - the coin issue year - 2006. Around the coin circumference there are the following inscriptions: on the German silver coin: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) -above and П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (Five Hryvnia) below.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins in the center against the background of Ukrainian banknotes there is the image of Kyiv type silver hryvnia of the 11th-13th centuries, to the right whereof there is a shortened text of the Order of the National Bank of Ukraine # 71 of August 26, 1996 `On Measures to Execute the Decree of the President of Ukraine of August 25, 1996 `On the Currency Reform in Ukraine`. Below there is an image of subsidiary coins of Ukraine, above - the semicircular inscription: 10 РОКІВ ВІДРОДЖЕННЯ ГРОШОВОЇ ОДИНИЦІ УКРАЇНИ (10 Years of the recovery of the currency unit of Ukraine

name: The 10th anniversary of the Recovery of Ukrainian Currency Unit - Hryvnia
generalDescription: These commemorative coins are dedicated to the 10th anniversary of currency reform in Ukraine which resulted in putting into circulation the national currency unit - hryvnia and its hundredth fraction - kopiyka.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, below - the image of the reverse side of the coin in circulation `Volodymyr the Great`; to the left whereof there is logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint, to the right - the coin issue year - 2006. Around the coin circumference there are the following inscriptions: on the silver coin - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, СТО ГРИВЕНЬ (One hundred Hryvnia) - below; there is Ag 999, indication of metal and its fineness and 1000,0 g, the coin weight in fineness;
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins in the center against the background of Ukrainian banknotes there is the image of Kyiv type silver hryvnia of the 11th-13th centuries, to the right whereof there is a shortened text of the Order of the National Bank of Ukraine # 71 of August 26, 1996 `On Measures to Execute the Decree of the President of Ukraine of August 25, 1996 `On the Currency Reform in Ukraine`. Below there is an image of subsidiary coins of Ukraine, above - the semicircular inscription: 10 РОКІВ ВІДРОДЖЕННЯ ГРОШОВОЇ ОДИНИЦІ УКРАЇНИ (10 Years of the recovery of the currency unit of Ukraine

name: Ivan Franko
generalDescription: These jubilee coins are dedicated to the 150th anniversary of birth of Ivan Yakovych Franko (1856-1916) – a prominent Ukrainian writer, publicist, public and political figure, D. Sc. in Philosophy. His talent was not limited to the national framework, he wrote in the Ukrainian, Polish and German languages. Poetry, prose, drama, scientific works, journalism - Ivan Franko rose to the highest pitch of greatness in everything. His contribution to the development of the Ukrainian journalism, literature and theater studies, folkloristics and ethnography is invaluable.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine placed on the left above, in the center – a “kameniar” (stone-breaker) shattering a rock, thereunder – the year of the coin issue – 2006. The semicircular inscriptions say: on the silver coin – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and П’ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (five hryvnias) below, the indication of metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 15.55 g; on the German silver coin – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias) below. The logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint is placed on both coins.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins there is a portrait of Ivan Franko, to the left and to the right of the portrait there are lumps of the shattered rock and inscriptions: ІВАН ФРАНКО (Ivan Franko) on the left and years of his life – 1856 / 1916 (on the right).

name: Ivan Franko
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the 150th birth anniversary of Ivan Franko, an outstanding Ukrainian writer, publicist, public and state figure, doctor of philosophy. His talent as a creator went far beyond the scope of the national interest: he wrote his works in Ukrainian, Polish, and German. Poetry prose, dramatic composition, scientific works, journalism - in all these fields Ivan Franko achieved perfection. His contribution to the development of the Ukrainian publicism, study of literature and theatre science is invaluable.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above (on the left) there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, in the centre there is depicted a mason splitting a rock, below there is the coin issue year - 2006, around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: on the silver coin: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (5 Hryvnias) (below), as well the indication of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. On the coin there is also the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a portrait of Ivan Franko, on either sides of which there are fragments of the stone rock and inscriptions: ІВАН ФРАНКО (Ivan Franko) (on the left) and his years of life - 1856/ 1916 (on the right).

name: The 15th anniversary of the Independence of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to the 15th anniversary of adoption of the Act of Independence of Ukraine by the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine on August 24, 1991.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins there is a composition within the necklace circlet, which embodies the idea of Ukraine`s integrity: the Small National Emblem of Ukraine is enframed in a vegetative ornament and held up by a lion and a Cossack with a musket; there is a circumscription: on the German silver coin - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2006 (The National Bank of Ukraine /5 Hrivnias /2006).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins in the nacklace circlet against the background of the map of Ukraine there is the building of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and the circumferential legend: УКРАЇНА/ 15 РОКІВ НЕЗАЛЕЖНОСТІ (Ukraine / 15 Years of independence).

name: The 15th anniversary of the Independence of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to the 15th anniversary of adoption of the Act of Independence of Ukraine by the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine on August 24, 1991.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins there is a composition within the necklace circlet, which embodies the idea of Ukraine`s integrity: the Small National Emblem of Ukraine is enframed in a vegetative ornament and held up by a lion and a Cossack with a musket; there is a circumscription: on the silver coin - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 20/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2006 (The National Bank of Ukraine /20 Hrivnias /2006), indication of the metal - Ag 925, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness - 62.2 g; On both coins there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins in the nacklace circlet against the background of the map of Ukraine there is the building of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and the circumferential legend: УКРАЇНА/ 15 РОКІВ НЕЗАЛЕЖНОСТІ (Ukraine / 15 Years of independence).

name: 10 th anniversary of the Constitution of Ukraine
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to the 10th anniversary of the Constitution of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 10 hryvnias coin above there is engraved the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, below - the inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 2006/ 10/ ГРИВЕНЬ (National Bank /of Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/ 2006); the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and the coin face value are enframed in conventionalized flowers; there is the indication of metal and its fineness - Ag 925, weight in fineness - 15.55 g. The logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint is placed on both coins.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins there is a column base, as a symbol of law, enframed in conventionalized ornament pattern, there are engraved the following inscriptions: КОНСТИТУЦІЯ/ УКРАЇНИ (Constitution of Ukraine) above the column and 28/ ЧЕРВНЯ/ 1996 (28/June/ 1996 ) on the ribbon crossing the column.

name: Volodymyr Chekhivskyi
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 130th anniversary of birth of Volodymyr M. Chekhivskyi (1876/ 1937), a Ukrainian statesman and political figure. Volodymyr Chekhivskyi was an active participant of the public life of the Odesa City; in 1917 he became a member of the Ukrainian Central Rada. Since 26.12.1918 till 11.02.1919 he headed the Council of Ministers and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the UPR (Ukrainian People`s Republic). On his initiative on 01.01.1919 the Government of the UPR proclaimed the autocephaly of the Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church. In 1929 a criminal case was framed up against Chekhivskyi as a result whereof he was arrested and executed by shooting on the isle of Solovki.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, thereunder - the year of coinage - 2006, there are also the semicircular inscriptions: above - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) below - ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnias) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Volodymyr Chekhivskyi is potrayed against the background resembling very conventionalized cross, to the left there is the inscription: ВОЛОДИ-/ МИР/ ЧЕХІВ-/ СЬКИЙ (Volody/myr /Chekhiv/skyi), to the right - his years of life - 1876/ 1937.

name: Mykola Vasylenko
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 140th anniversary of birth of Mykola P.Vasylenko (1866 – 1935), a jurist, historian, statesman and public figure. Mykola Vasylenko was the founder of the Ukrainian legal history, he had done a lot for revival and development of the national education, science and culture, he advocated actively Independence of Ukraine, he was an academician (1920) and one of the founders of the Ukrainian Academy of Sciences.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, thereunder the year of coinage: 2006, there are also two semi-circular inscriptions: above - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below - ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnias) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Mykola Vasylenko is portrayed against the background of a conventionalized ornamental pattern of the 1920-s, to the left there are his years of life: 1866 - 1935, there is also a semicircular inscription: МИКОЛА ВАСИЛЕНКО (Mykola Vasylenko).

name: 10 Years of the Constitution of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 10th anniversary of the adoption of the Constitution of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and beneath there is a legend: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ/ БАНК/ УКРАЇНИ/ 2006/ 10/ ГРИВЕНЬ (National Bank /of Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/ 2006), as well as the designation of the metal - Ag 925, its fineness and its weight in fineness- 31,1. On the coin there is also depicted the logotype of the NBU Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a column foot as a symbol of law surrounded by a conventionalized ornament. There are engraved the following inscriptions: КОНСТИТУЦІЯ/ УКРАЇНИ (Constitution of Ukraine) - above the column and 28/ ЧЕРВНЯ/ 1996 (28/June/ 1996 ) - on the ribbon intersecting the column.

name: Ukrainian Bush Cricket (Poecilimon Ukrainicus
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to Grasshopper Ukrainian (POECILIMON UKRAINICUS), the rare species of grasshoppers which inhabits only the area of Ukraine and who is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins, set in a wreath of images of certain flora and fauna species, there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: on the silver coin – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ / 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2006 (National Bank of Ukraine, 10 hryvnias, 2006); there is the indication of metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 31.1g; on the German silver coin – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ / 2 / ГРИВНІ / 2006 (National Bank of Ukraine, 2 hryvnias, 2006). The logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint is placed on both coins.
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse of both coins there is a cricket on a grass stem and the semicircular inscriptions say: ПИЛКОХВІСТ УКРАЇНСЬКИЙ (Ukrainian bush cricket) above and POECILIMON UKRAINICUS below.

name: Ukrainian Bush Cricket (Poecilimon Ukrainicus
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to Grasshopper Ukrainian (POECILIMON UKRAINICUS), the rare species of grasshoppers which inhabits only the area of Ukraine and who is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins, set in a wreath of images of certain flora and fauna species, there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: on the silver coin – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ / 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2006 (National Bank of Ukraine, 10 hryvnias, 2006); there is the indication of metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 31.1g; on the German silver coin – НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ / БАНК / УКРАЇНИ / 2 / ГРИВНІ / 2006 (National Bank of Ukraine, 2 hryvnias, 2006). The logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint is placed on both coins.
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse of both coins there is a cricket on a grass stem and the semicircular inscriptions say: ПИЛКОХВІСТ УКРАЇНСЬКИЙ (Ukrainian bush cricket) above and POECILIMON UKRAINICUS below.

name: Gemini
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to one of the twelve Zodiac constellations - Gemini.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 2 hryvnia coin there is a circle diagonally divided into four sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a styled image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2006 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; the circumscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the 2 hryvnia coin a styled image of Gemini with stars around them is depicted, above there is their Sign of Zodiac.

name: Gemini
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to one of the twelve Zodiac constellations - Gemini
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 5 hryvnia coin in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the coin issue year: 2006 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Ag 925, and weight of the precious metal in fineness 15.55 are indicated; the circumscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) below, and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the 5 hryvnia coin a styled image of Gemini with stars around them is depicted, to the left whereof is their Sign of Zodiac, to the right – the inscription: БЛИЗНЮКИ (Gemini)

name: Chyhyryn
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the town of Chyhyryn, which is in Cherkasy region. During the first National Liberation War of the Ukrainian people under the leadership of Bohdan Khmelnytskyi the Ukrainian Cossack`s state - Hetmanschyna was established. Chyhyryn became its military, administrative and political centre. The first capital of the Hetmanschyna was residence of the Hetmans Bohdan Khmelnytskyi , Ivan Vyhovskyi, Yuri Khmelnytskyi, Pavlo Teteria and Petro Doroshenko
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a Cossack holding a bunchuk (a pole with a golden sphere and horsetail - a symbol of Hetman`s power) against the background of Cossack standards, cannons, kettle-drums; above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, the year of coin issue - 2006 and the crescent-shaped inscription above: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and the legend 10/ ГРИВЕНЬ (10/Hryvnia) - below.There is the indication of metal and its fineness - Ag 925, its weight in fineness - 31,1g and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are depicted five portraits in medallions, with the bow-shaped inscriptions under them: БОГДАН ХМЕЛЬНИЦЬКИЙ, ЮРІЙ ХМЕЛЬНИЦЬКИЙ, ІВАН ВИГОВСЬКИЙ, ПАВЛО ТЕТЕРЯ, ПЕТРО ДОРОШЕНКО (Bohdan Khmelnytskyi, Yuri Khmelnytskyi, Pavlo Teteria and Petro Doroshenko); above the portraits there is the town`s coat of arms and the inscriptions: ГЕТЬМАНСЬКА СТОЛИЦЯ/ ЧИГИРИН (Hetman`s capital/ Chyhyryn); beneath - Chyhyryn townscape (a fragment of an illustration from Samiylo Velychko` chronicle).

name: Mykola Strazhesko
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 130th anniversary of birth of Mykola Strazhesko (1876 – 1952), a scientist in the field of medicine, who was the founder of the national cardiology. Mykola Strazhesko was one of the initiators of the contemporary IInstitute for Cardiology of the Ukrainian Academy of Medical Sciences, which is mostly engaged in clinical and experimental researches. His atlas and study guide for haematology have been invaluable contributions of the scientist and the co-workers to the development of treatment for the deseases of hematopoietic organs.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse a semiabstract heart with vessels is depicted against the background of a circle with the circumscription - ІНСТИТУТ КАРДІОЛОГІЇ ІМЕНІ М.Д.СТРАЖЕСКА (M.D.Strazhesko Institute for Cardiology), above there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right there is the semicircular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine; beneath - 2 ГРИВНІ 2006 (2 hryvnias 2006), as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint; to the left there is a vertically oriented composition of drops and names of the medical science sections.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse M.D.Strazhesko is potrayed, to the left there are the vertical three line inscriptions: 1876 – 1952/ АКАДЕМІК/ М.Д.СТРАЖЕСКО. (1876 – 1952/ Academician/ M.D.Strazhesko).

name: 750th Anniversary of the City of Lviv
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to one of the leading economic, scientific and cultural centres of the state – the city of Lviv. The first written reference to the city was made as far back as 1256. The city had been founded by the King Danylo of Halych and named after his son Lev. Since 1272 Lviv had been the capital of the principality of Halych and Volhynia.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of an ornamentation element of the chapel of Boim family - a lion`s head, to the left whereof there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right: 2006, the coin mintage year, there are also conventionalized inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above in a semicircle), 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 Hryvnias) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a panoramic view of the city of Lviv in the early 17th century as depicted on an A.Passarotti`s picture (1613), above which there is a fragment of an official Council seal of the city of Lviv and beneath there is the inscription: ЛЬВІВ/ 750 (Lviv / 750).

name: Taurus
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to one of the twelve zodiac constellations
averseDescription: On the coin obverse made of silver, in the middle of the circle there is a conventionalized depiction of the sun, left and right, from it, as well as above and beneath it, there are four sunny spheres symbolizing four seasons. Left from the circle there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine, right - 2006, the coin mintage year, Ag 925, the metal designation and 15,55g, its weight; around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 Hryvnias) (beneath), as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the 5 hryvnia coin a styled image of Taurus with stars around it is depicted, and its Sign of Zodiac above it.

name: Taurus
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to one of the twelve zodiac constellations
averseDescription: On the obverse of the 2 hryvnia coin there is a circle diagonally divided into four sectors symbolizing four elements: earth, air, water, fire; in the center of the circle there is a styled image of the Sun. To the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, to the right – the year of issue: 2006 as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness – Au 999.9, weight of the precious metal in fineness – 1.24; there are the circumferential inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above, 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias) below and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the 2 hryvnia coin a styled image of Taurus with stars around it is depicted, and its Sign of Zodiac above it.

name: Hedgehog
generalDescription: The coin of the international ecological series is dedicated to the hedgehog whose picture is thereon
averseDescription: On the obverse the Small National Emblem of Ukraine is located in the necklace circle, above it – the year of coinage -- 2006; between the necklace circle and the coin edging there are inscriptions: above - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (The National Bank of Ukraine), below - 2 ГРИВНІ (two hryvnias), to the left - kind of the metal and its fineness: Au 999.9, its weight in fineness -- 1.24; to the right - the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse the hedgehog is depicted and there are the inscriptions: above - ЇЖАК (hedgehog) and below - ERINACEUS

name: Viacheslav Prokopovych
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to 125th anniversary of birth of Viacheslav Prokopovych (1881-1942), a Ukrainian public figure, politician and statesman, pedagogue, historian, publicist. Viacheslav Prokopovych was one of the founders of the Ukrainian Central Rada. In January - April 1918 he was a minister of national education of the Ukrainian Peoples Republic (UPR), in 1920 he was appointed as the Chairman of the UPR Council of Ministers. As emigrant abroad, Prokopovych (one of the Symon Petliura`s comrades-in-arms) held positions of great trust in the UPR Government in exile.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, underneath the year of coinage - 2006. There are the following circumscriptions: above - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below - ДВІ ГРИВНІ (two Hrivnias) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Prokopovych is portrayed, to the left of the portrait there is a vertical inscription: В’ЯЧЕСЛАВ / ПРОКОПОВИЧ (Viacheslav / Prokopovych), to the right -1881/ 1942, his years of life

name: 100 Years of the Kyiv National Economic University
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to Vadym Hetman National Economic University. The university was established on the basis of the first in Ukraine Higher Commercial Courses,opened in Kyiv in 1906. Great experience and creative potential of the university has enabled it to become one of the leaders in reforming higher education and university science in the conditions of coming-to-be of independent Ukraine and formation of market relations in the Ukrainian economy.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins there is a composition made of lines which symbolically reflect the dynamics of contemporary global economic processes. The composition also contains international mathematical signs and the Hryvnia signl. Against the background of this composition there is the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below the inscription - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine (above), 2006, the coin issue year (to the right) and the inscriptions: on the coin of German silver - 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias). On both coins there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins the university building is depicted, above there is the year of its foundation - 1906, there are also the two-lined inscription: 100 РОКІВ (100 Years) and the circumscription: КИЇВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ ЕКОНОМІЧНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМЕНІ ВАДИМА ГЕТЬМАНА (Vadym Hetman National Economic University).

name: 100 Years of the Kyiv National Economic University
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to Vadym Hetman National Economic University. The university was established on the basis of the first in Ukraine Higher Commercial Courses,opened in Kyiv in 1906. Great experience and creative potential of the university has enabled it to become one of the leaders in reforming higher education and university science in the conditions of coming-to-be of independent Ukraine and formation of market relations in the Ukrainian economy.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins there is a composition made of lines which symbolically reflect the dynamics of contemporary global economic processes. The composition also contains international mathematical signs and the Hryvnia signl. Against the background of this composition there is the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below the inscription - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine (above), 2006, the coin issue year (to the right) and the inscriptions: on the silver coin - 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias), Ag 925, designation of metal and 15,55, the coin weight fineness. On both coins there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.On the obverse of both coins there is a composition made of lines which symbolically reflect the dynamics of contemporary global economic processes. The composition also contains international mathematical signs and the Hryvnia signl. Against the background of this composition there is the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine), below the inscription - the Small National Emblem of Ukraine (above), 2006, the coin issue year (to the right) and the inscriptions: on the silver coin - 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias), Ag 925, designation of metal and 15,55, the coin weight fineness. On both coins there is the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins the university building is depicted, above there is the year of its foundation - 1906, there are also the two-lined inscription: 100 РОКІВ (100 Years) and the circumscription: КИЇВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ ЕКОНОМІЧНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМЕНІ ВАДИМА ГЕТЬМАНА (Vadym Hetman National Economic University).

name: Aries
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to one of the Zodiac constellations - Aries, located in the Northern Hemisphere
averseDescription: On the coin obverse made of silver, in the middle of the circle there is a conventionalized depiction of the sun, left and right, from it, as well as above and beneath it, there are four sunny spheres symbolizing four seasons. Left from the circle there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine, right - 2006, the coin mintage year, Ag 925, the metal designation and 15,55g, its weight; around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 Hryvnias) (beneath), as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins a styled image of Aries with stars around it is depicted, on the left whereof is its Sign of Zodiac; on the right there is the inscription: ОВЕН (Aries).

name: Aries
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to one of the Zodiac constellations - Aries, located in the Northern Hemisphere.
averseDescription: On the obverse of both coins in the center of the circle there is a conventionalized image of the Sun, on the left, on the right, above and underneath whereof – four lighted by it spheres symbolizing the seasons. On the left of the circle there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine, on the right – the coin issue year: 2006, as well as the indication of the metal, its fineness, and the coin weight in fineness (on the silver coin – Ag 925, 15.55; on the gold coin – Au 999.9, 1.24). There are circular legends: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) above and 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnias) on the silver coin ((2 ГРИВНІ) (2 hryvnias) on the gold one)) below, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins a styled image of Aries with stars around it is depicted, on the left whereof is its Sign of Zodiac; on the right there is the inscription: ОВЕН (Aries).

name: Heorhyi Narbut
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 120th anniversary of Heorhii Narbut`s birth (1886-1920), who was a prominent painter, coryphaeus of the Ukrainian graphic arts. He became one of the founders of the Ukrainian Academy of Arts and later on its president. Narbut made sketches of the Ukrainian banknotes in the time of the Ukrainian People`s Republic (UPR) and developed a set of the national symbols.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse a fragment of 1918 design banknote is depicted - a peasant woman and a workman against the background of a garland of flowers and fruits, above which there are the year of issue - 2006, the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and semicirclar inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine); beneath: 2/ ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnia) and the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is Heorhii Narbut`s portrait in silhouette, to the right - the coat of arms of the family of Narbuts, thereunder - the years of life: 1886/1920 and the inscription: ГЕОРГІЙ НАРБУТ (Heorhii Narbut) located as a semicircle.

name: Winter Olympic Games of 2006
generalDescription: The coin continues the `Sport` Series and is dedicated to the XXth Winter Olympic Games, which took place in Turin (Italy)
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the Olympic torch against the background of a conventionalized glass toboggan road; to the right from the torch there are inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ 10 ГРИВЕНЬ 2006 (National Bank of Ukraine) to the left there is the National Emblem of Ukraine; beneath: the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine; marking of the metal and its fineness Ag 925, and its weight in fineness.31,1 g.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a female tobogganer on the road is depicted, to the left there is the emblem of the National Olympic Committee of Ukraine against the background of a glass surface; to the right there are inscriptions: ЗИМОВІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ / WINTER OLYMPIC GAMES/ 2006.

name: Oleh Antonov
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the centenary of birth of Oleh K. Antonov (1906 - 1984), an aircraft designer, under whose guidance various transport, training, sporting airplanes and gliders were built. Oleh Antonov always wished his airplanes, including such giants as `Antei` and `Ruslan`, to be versatile and good-looking, able to convey many cargos and passengers over a long distance. At present the specialist of the Aviation Scientific and Technical Complex named after O.K.Antonov continue the work of the talented aircraft designer.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are airplanes (AN-2 and AN-124 `Ruslan`) depicted in the centre of the composition, under which the denomination of the coin 2 ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnias) is placed; above there is a semicircular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) with the small State Emblem of Ukraine and the year of issue -2006, as well as the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint thereunder
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a conventionalized engineering drawing there is a portrait of Antonov, to the right of the portrait - the logotype `АN`(AN); there are also semi-circular inscriptions: ОЛЕГ АНТОНОВ (Oleh Antonov) - to the right and 1906 - 1984, the years of his birth and death - left below.

name: 10 Years of the Antarctic Station Academician Vernadskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the `Academician Vernadsky` Ukrainian antarctic scientific centre (its former name was `Faradey`), which is located in the Galindes island of Argentine Archipelago. This station was handed over to Ukraine in accordance with the Memorandum of Understanding between the British Antarctic Service and the Ukrainian Antarctic Centre. There are conducted investigations on the station in many research lines to observe concern of Ukraine in this region and to ensure the integration of Ukraine into the world science, etc.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the Ukrainian flag flying on a vertical stock; beneath there is the Academician Vernadsky antarctic station and the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК (National Bank) (right and in semicircle); below there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine under which there are the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА/ 5/ГРИВЕНЬ; 2006 (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia/ 2006), the coin issue y10 The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Ukrainian Antarctic Research Station `Academician Vernadskyi` (previous name `Faraday`), located on Galindez Island in the Argentine Islands. The station was transferred to Ukraine under the Memorandum of Understanding between the British Antarctic Survey and Ukrainian Antarctic Center. The Station performs research activities in many scientific areas and these activities are aimed at securing geopolitical interest of Ukraine in the whole region and its integration into global scienceear (on the left), as well as the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse: the contours of Antarctica and inscription 10 РОКІВ (10 YEARS). In the center of the zero cipher there is an asterisk showing geographical location of the Station. There are also the semi-circular inscriptions: АНТАРКТИЧНА СТАНЦІЯ (ANTARCTIC STATION) to the right above, and АКАДЕМІК ВЕРНАДСЬКИЙ (ACADEMICIAN VERNADSKYI) to the left below.

name: Year of the Dog
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the Year of the Dog, one of the animal-symbols of the Chinese calendar based on the twelve-year cycle of the Jupiter, the largest planet of the Solar system.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the coin, bordered by a primitivism style vegetative ornament, there are the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА / 5 / ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine, 5 hryvnias); above – the Small National Emblem of Ukraine with the inscription over it: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК (National Bank), below – the year of the coin issue – 2006, the indication of metal and its fineness – Ag 925, weight in fineness – 15.55g and the logo of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of the coin there is a lubok-print-like depiction of a dog surrounded by conventionalized vegetative ornaments. Above and below this composition there are small silhouettes of all 12 animal symbols of the Chinese calendar; the inscriptions below say: РІК / СОБАКИ (Year of the Dog).

name: Illia Mechnikov
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 160th anniversary of Illia Mechnikov (1845 – 1916), an outstanding, world-famous scientist and the Nobel Prize winner (1908). Mechnikov is one of the founders of evolution embryology, immunology and microbiology, who had discovered the phagocytosis phenomenon, had developed the phagocytic theory of immunity (1883). And even now ideas of the scientist have contributed to development of various fields of biology and medicine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse on the right there is depicted a cell under a microscope - a conventionalized phagocytosis process; on the left there is 2005, the coin issue year and the small National Emblem of Ukraine. Around the coin circumference there are the inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (on the left), the NBU Mint logotype and ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2/ hryvnia) (beneath).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Illia Mechnikov (displaced to the right) and 1845/1916, his years of life; left there is a semicircular inscription: ІЛЛЯ МЕЧНИКОВ (Illia Mechnikov)

name: Oleksii Alchevskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 170th birth anniversary of Oleksii Alchevskyi (1835 - 1901), a Ukrainian industrialist and a banker, founder of a number of banks and industrial enterprises, in particular, `Kharkiv trade bank`, the first in the city of Kharkiv and the second in Russia commercial credit bank, the first in Russia Land bank.
