He was also one of the founders of Agricultural Association. Two largest metallurgical works (now they are Public Corporation Alchevsk metallurgical complex and PC Mariupil metallurgical complex named after Illich) have been built on his initiative.
averseDescription: O On the coin obverse a steam locomotive is depicted (as a symbol of the progress of the end of 19th c.) against the background of conventionalized waste banks` contours, blast-furnace and open-hearth shop; there are also depicted: the small National Emblem of Ukraine (left), the circular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), 2005, the coin issue year (beneath), 2 ГРИВНІ (2/ hryvnia) and the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a portrait of Oleksii Alchevskyi is depicted, under it there are the semicircular inscriptions:1835 - ОЛЕКСІЙ АЛЧЕВСЬКИЙ (Oleksii Alchevskyi) - 1901.

name: 500 Years to Cossack settlements. Kalmiuska palanqua
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 500 Years to Ukrainian Cossack settlements on the territory of the present Donetsk and Luhansk regions, which established later Kalmiuska palanqua (administrative district) of Zaporizhia Army situated down stream.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a conventionalized coat of arms of Zaporizhia Army, left from which there is the small National emblem of Ukraine; 2005, the coin issue year (beneath) and the circular inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ hryvnia) (beneath), as well as the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a Cossack community headed by a foreman; left there is a stone idol of Polovtsi tribe; under the composition there is a coat of arms of Kalmiuska palanqua. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: 500 РОКІВ КОЗАЦЬКИМ ПОСЕЛЕННЯМ. КАЛЬМІУСЬКА ПАЛАНКА (500 Years to Cossack settlements, Kalmiuska palanqua).

name: Vsevolod Holubovych
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 120th anniversary of Vsevolod Holubovych, a Ukrainian political figure and statesman who made a significant contribution to the process of Ukrainian state-and lawmaking. Since January 18, 1918 he had been the first chairman of the Council of people`s ministers and the minister of foreign affairs of the UPR (Ukrainian People`s Republic). In December 1917 - January 1918 he headed the UPR delegation at the peaceful summit talks with Germany, Austrian and Hungarian Republic, Bulgaria and Turkey.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under it there is 2005, the coin issue year, around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2/ hryvnia) (beneath) and the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a portrait of Vsevolod Holubovych (Vsevolod Holubovych) is depicted, around the coin circumference there is an inscription: ВСЕВОЛОД ГОЛУБОВИЧ (above) and 1885 – 1939, his years of life (beneath).

name: Sviatohirsk Assumption Lavra Monastery
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Sviatohirsk Assumption Monastery, a famous architectural and historical monument (17th - 19th cc), which was given the Lavra status in 2004. The monastery, founded at the bottom of the hill on the right bank of the Siversky Donets river, was first mentioned for the year 1624. The principle role in its architectural composition is played by St.Nicolas church (17th c.), the most ancient temple of the monastery, the main part of which is located inside a rock
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the Miracle-working icon of Sviatohirsk Mother of God, on both sides of which there are two angels holding gifts: coins, crosses, pendants, etc.; above there is a semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), on the right: the small National Emblem of Ukraine, on the left: 2005, the coin issue year; beneath in semicircle: П`ЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnia) and the Mint logo of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the ancient Sviatohirsk Assumption Monastery on the river bank, which is located at the bottom of cretaceous hills covered with thick forest and above there is the semicircular inscription: СВЯТО-УСПЕНСЬКА СВЯТОГІРСЬКА ЛАВРА (Sviatohirsk Assumption Lavra Monastery)

name: Volodymyr Vynnychenko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 125th anniversary of Volodymyr Vynnychenko, a public and political figure and writer. Volodymyr Vynnychenko is one of the key figures of the Ukrainian history and culture of the first decades of twenties century. Being in the centre of political life he became the Vice Chairman of the Central Rada (Ukrainian Parliment), he headed the first Ukrainian Government and at the end of 1918 became the first Directoire Chairman of the Ukrainian People` Republic.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, beneath - 2005, the coin issue year; around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) -above; ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2/ hryvnia) -beneath, as well as the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a portrait of Vynnychenko, on both sides of which there are inscriptions: ВОЛОДИМИР/ ВИННИЧЕНКО (Volodymyr Vynnychenko) - on the left and his years of life: 1880/1951 - on the right.

name: The Family of Symyrenko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the family of Symyrenko, a famous Ukrainian family, which gave Ukraine talented engineers, sugar producers, outstanding fruit-growing scientists and generous Maecenas. The successors of the Cossack family, including also serfs (in particular, Fedir Symyrenko), became equal to persons possessing titles of nobility and belonging to the richest entrepreneurs of Europe. And Lev Platonovych Symyrenko, an outstanding scientist - pomologist and a gardener had developed the most famous in Europe collection of fruits and berries, grew a variety of apple-trees, broadly known as `Reanette of Symyrenko`
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the semicircular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК (National Bank), under which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine against the background of the conventionalized apple blossom which symbolizes a family tree; below: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) inscription; Ag 925, designation of metal; 31,1, its weight in fineness (on the left); the NBU Mint logotype; 2005, the coin mintage year (on the right); beneath there is the semicircular inscription: ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (10/ hryvnia
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a conventionalized family tree, amidst the leaves and twigs of which there are names and years of life of members of the Symyrenko family: ФЕДІР (Fedir) (1790 - 1867), ПЛАТОН (Platon) (1820 - 1863), ВАСИЛЬ (Vasyl) (1835 - 1915), ЛЕВКО (Levko) (1855 - 1920), ВОЛОДИМИР(Volodymyr) (1891 - 1938) and beneath there is the semicircular inscription: РОДИНА СИМИРЕНКІВ (the family of Symyrenko).

name: Baturyn
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Baturyn, the capital city of such Ukrainian Hetmans of the Left Bank Ukraine, as: D.Mnohohrishny, I.Samoilovych, I.Mazepa and K.Rozumovsky. Starting since 1669 governmental institutions had been functioning in the city and representatives of the Cossack managerial staff lived there. Destroyed in 1708 on the order of Russian Czar Peter the First, Baturyn was restored to life again and for the second but the last time became the capital city of the Cossack state under ruling of Hetman Kyrylo Rozumovsky remaining forever the symbol of the national statehood.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine against the background of rays, symbolizing the dream on independent Ukraine; below there is a semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА, on both sides of the coin there are depicted Zaporizhia Cossacks from the icon of the Protection of the Sich; beneath there is the inscription: 10/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2005, (10/ hryvnia)/ 2005), as well as Ag 925, the designation of the metal, 31,1 g, its weight in fineness and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of three portraits in lockets, under which there is the inscription on a ribbon: ДЕМ`ЯН МНОГОГРІШНИЙ/ ІВАН САМОЙЛОВИЧ/ ІВАН МАЗЕПА/ КИРИЛО РОЗУМОВСЬКИЙ ( Demian Mnohohrishny/ Ivan Samoilovych/ Ivan Mazepa and Kyryo Rozumovsky) ; above the portraits there is a coat of arm of the city, beneath the ribbon - a view of Baturyn taken from cheap popular prints of the middle of 19th century; at the top of the coin there is the two-lined inscription: ГЕТЬМАНСЬКА СТОЛИЦЯ/ БАТУРИН (Hetman capital city/ Baturyn)

name: Sviatohirsk Assumption Lavra Monastery
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Sviatohirsk Assumption Monastery, a famous architectural and historical monument (17th - 19th cc), which was given the Lavra status in 2004. The monastery, founded at the bottom of the hill on the right bank of the Siversky Donets river, was first mentioned for the year 1624. The principle role in its architectural composition is played by St.Nicolas church (17th c.), the most ancient temple of the monastery, the main part of which is located inside a rock.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the Miracle-working icon of Sviatohirsk Mother of God, on both sides of which there are two angels holding gifts: coins, crosses, pendants, etc.; above there is a semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), on the right: the small National Emblem of Ukraine, on the left: 2005, the coin issue year; beneath in semicircle : ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (10/ hryvnia), as well as Ag 925, designation of metal, 31,1, its weight in fineness and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the ancient Sviatohirsk Assumption Monastery on the river bank, which is located at the bottom of cretaceous hills covered with thick forest and above there is the semicircular inscription: СВЯТО-УСПЕНСЬКА СВЯТОГІРСЬКА ЛАВРА (Sviatohirsk Assumption Lavra Monastery)

name: 100 Years to the Olha Kobylianska Music and Drama Theatre in Chernivtsi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Olha Kobylianska Music and Drama Theatre in Chernivtsi, an architectural masterpiece of the beginning of 20th century and an adornment of the city, which was built in 1904 – 1905 according to the design project of the Austrian architects Ferdinand Felner and Hermann Helmer
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a sculptural composition with Melpomene (scenic art symbol) which decorates the theatre portal; on the right from it there are the small National Emblem of Ukraine and semicircular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) - above, ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (10/ hryvnia) - beneath); under the sculptural composition there are: Ag 925, designation of metal, 31,1g, its weight in fineness, the NBU Mint logotype and 2005, the coin issue year
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of the theatre building and the monument to Olha Kobylianska, which is located in front of the theatre; beneath it there is an inscription: 100 РОКІВ (100 years) around the coin circumference there is inscribed: ЧЕРНІВЕЦЬКИЙ МУЗИЧНО-ДРАМАТИЧНИЙ ТЕАТР ім. О.КОБИЛЯНСЬКОЇ (the Olha Kobylianska Music and Drama Theatre in Chernivtsi)

name: The Protection of the Virgin
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to one of the important Orthodox holydays related to the Virgin Mary, the true patroness of all believers. The sense of this holiday is in the idea of protection
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the composition made of a guelder-rose, plants and a towel. Upon the background of it there is an inscription: 2005, the coin issue year; in the centre of the composition there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under it there are Hetman`s symbols of power and a Cossacks sabre. On its left and right there are conventionalized flowers and birds amidst of which there is the inscription: УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 5 / hryvnia). On the coin there is also a depiction of the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a multi-figured composition depicting a reception of a newly-married couple by their parents. They are holding an icon and weddings round loaf in their hands; above there is the Protection of the Virgin. To the right there is a semicircular inscription: ПОКРОВА (Protection of the Virgin).

name: The Protection of the Virgin
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to one of the important Orthodox holydays related to the Virgin Mary, the true patroness of all believers. The sense of this holiday is in the idea of protection
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the composition made of a guelder-rose, plants and a towel. Upon the background of it there is an inscription: 2005, the coin issue year; in the centre of the composition there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under it there are Hetman`s symbols of power and a Cossacks sabre. On its left and right there are conventionalized flowers and birds amidst of which there are inscriptions: on the silver coin: УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, (Ukraine /10/ hryvnia), as well as Ag 925, designation of metal and its weight in fineness. On the coin there is also a depiction of the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a multi-figured composition depicting a reception of a newly-married couple by their parents. They are holding an icon and weddings round loaf in their hands; above there is the Protection of the Virgin. To the right there is a semicircular inscription: ПОКРОВА (Protection of the Virgin).

name: Dmytro Yavornytsky
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 150th anniversary of Dmytro Yavornytsky (1855 - 1940), a historian, archaeologist, ethnographer, specialist in folklore and writer. Being a person of versatile interests, Dmytro Yavornytsky devoted almost all his life to study the history of Zaporizhia Cossacks, which was crowned with `The History of Zaporizhia Cossacks` in three books
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, above which there is 2005, the coin issue year, under it - 2 ГРИВНІ, (2/ hryvnia), there are also the inscriptions around the coin circumference: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above), НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (beneath) and the Mint logo of the National Bank of Ukraine (right
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a portrait of Dmytro Yavornytsky, to the right: 1855/1940, his years of life is inscribed and on both sides there is a semicircular inscription: ДМИТРО ЯВОРНИЦЬКИЙ (Dmytro Yavornytsky)

name: 300 Years to David Guramishvili
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 300 Years of David Guramishvili (1705 - 1792), an outstanding Georgian poet, whose life and creative work were closely bound up with Ukraine: in 1760 the poet settled down in Myrhorod, where he lived till the end of his life. Guramishvili`s literary work started in Georgia, but his poetic talent become fully apparent exactly in Ukraine. His autobiographical collected poems `Davitiani` (1787), the poet`s most distinguished work, were created in Ukraine. His other poem `Joyous Spring` was full of sympathy towards peasants and had vivid Ukrainian colouring
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of two national ornamentations - Georgian and Ukrainian, connected together, which symbolizes ties and friendship between two peoples; above there is a semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА, under which there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine and the coin mintage year: 20-05; beneath - 2/ГРИВНІ and the Mint logo of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a half face portrait of David Guramishvili upon the background of a conventionalized hilly Georgian landscape, on peak of one of its mountains a temple is located; to the left and right there is a semicircular inscription in Ukrainian and Georgian languages: ДАВИД ГУРАМІШВІЛІ, beneath: 1705/1792, his years of life.

name: The Vasyl Tairov institute for wine growing and wine making
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the centenary since foundation of the National scientific centre `The Vasyl Tairov institute for wine growing and wine making `. For the period of the institute existing great achievements were made in development of new technologies for wine growing and wine treatment.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under it there is 2005, the coin issue year, around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) -above, ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2/ hryvnia) (beneath) and the NBU Mint logotype
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a structure of the institute is depicted, on the background of which there is a portrait of V.E.Tairov; over the portrait, between the years: 1905 2005 there is the institute logo, beneath - a conventionalized vine and a circular inscription: ІНСТИТУТ ВИНОГРАДАРСТВА І ВИНОРОБСТВА ІМЕНІ В.Є.ТАЇРОВА (The Vasyl Tairov institute for wine growing and wine making)

name: 350 Years to the city of Sumy
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the city of Sumy, located at the picturesque right bank of the river Psel, which was founded at the beginning of fifties of 17th century by Ukrainian Cossacks-migrants from the Right Bank Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under it - 2005, the coin issue year and circular inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and ПЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ hryvnia) (beneath), as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the main street of the city with the Saviour and Transfiguration cathedral, against the street background there is the coat of arm of city of Sumy and the semicircular inscriptions: СУМИ (Sumy) (above), 350 РОКІВ (350 Years) - beneath

name: National Anthem of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the National symbol and is issued to mark 140th anniversary of the first public performance of the National Anthem of Ukraine made to music of M.Verbytsky (1815 – 1870) and to poetry of P.Chubynsky (1839 – 1884).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of the conventionalized National Flag of Ukraine there is a depiction of the first lines of the National Anthem of Ukraine: ` Still has not died the glory and liberty of Ukraine`, above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, as well as the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above and in semicircle), 10 ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2005 (10/ hryvnia/ 2005) (beneath), as well as Ag 925, the designation of metal and 31,1, its weight in fineness). On the coin there is also a depiction of the Mint logoTYPE of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the spiral inscription: СТО СОРОКОВА РІЧНИЦЯ З ЧАСУ ПЕРШОГО ПУБЛІЧНОГО ВИКОНАННЯ НАЦІОНАЛЬНОГО ГІМНУ УКРАЇНИ АВТОР МЕЛОДІЇ - МИХАЙЛО ВЕРБИЦЬКИЙ (1815 - 1870) АВТОР СЛІВ - ПАВЛО ЧУБИНСЬКИЙ (1839 - 1884) (140th anniversary of the first public performance of the National Anthem of Ukraine/ to music of M.Verbytsky (1815 - 1870/ to poetry of P.Chubynsky (1839 - 1884). In the middle of this inscription (in the centre of the coin) there is the holographic depiction of a conventionalized flower

name: 1300 Years to the town of Korosten
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the town of Korosten (annalistic Iskorosten), one of the ancient towns in the territory of Ukraine (Zhytomir region), which was first mentioned in the chronik writer Nestor`s `Tale of bygone years` for the year of 945.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted in the centre the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under it - 2005, the coin issue year and the circular inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ ( National Bank of Ukraine) and ПЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ hryvnia) (beneath), as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of the town panorama, on the foreground there is a silver earring (dated before 946), which was found during an archeological dig on the territory of the town, at the top right corner there is the coat of arm of the town of Korosten, as well as inscriptions: 1300/ РОКІВ, above to the left and КОРОСТЕНЬ Korosten, beneath and in semicircle.

name: Sorochynsky Fair
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Sorochynsky Fair, a genuine merchant festival which was poetized by Mykola Hohol in one of his tales of the `Nights in the Khutor near Dykan`ka` series.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre and against the background of the Ukrainian landscape there is a depiction of Mykola V.Hohol and Rudy Panko, his literary character, above there is the semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), beneath - the small National Emblem of Ukraine, 20-05, the coin mintage year and the inscriptions: 20/ ГРИВЕНЬ (20/ hryvnia), Ag 925, designation of the metal and 62,2 g, its weight in fineness, as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint is depicted.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a multi -figured composition, typical for a country fair of 19th-20th centuries; above there is a semicircular inscription: СОРОЧИНСЬКИЙ ЯРМАРОК (Sorochynsky Fair)

name: Sorochynsky Fair
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Sorochynsky Fair, a genuine merchant festival which was poetized by Mykola Hohol in one of his tales of the `Nights in the Khutor near Dykan`ka` series.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre and against the background of the Ukrainian landscape there is a depiction of Mykola V.Hohol and Rudy Panko, his literary character, above there is the semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), beneath - the small National Emblem of Ukraine, 20-05, the coin mintage year and the inscriptions: 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ hryvnia), as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint is depicted
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a multi -figured composition, typical for a country fair of 19th-20th centuries; above there is a semicircular inscription: СОРОЧИНСЬКИЙ ЯРМАРОК (Sorochynsky Fair)

name: SPALAX ARENARIUS RESHETNIK
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to SPALAX ARENARIUS RESHETNIK, a rare species living only in the territory of Ukraine, which is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine, the International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources and Europe
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a legend:
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse з there is a depiction of the rodent on the background of plants (left) and inscriptions: СЛІПАК ПІЩАНИЙ (above) and SPALAX ARENARIUS RESHETNIK (beneath).

name: SPALAX ARENARIUS RESHETNIK
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to SPALAX ARENARIUS RESHETNIK, a rare species living only in the territory of Ukraine, which is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine, the International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources and Europe
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a legend:
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse з there is a depiction of the rodent on the background of plants (left) and inscriptions: СЛІПАК ПІЩАНИЙ (above) and SPALAX ARENARIUS RESHETNIK (beneath).

name: Ruslan AN-124 Aircraft
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to `Ruslan` AN-124 aircraft, the world biggest as to its size and carrying capacity, which is now in serial production and is unique as to its transport efficiency
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the circle made of a string of beads there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine within an allegoric composition of the sun, a conventionalized wing, birds and stars that symbolize the dream of mankind to reach outer space. There are the following inscriptions: on the silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 2005, 20, ГРИВЕНЬ, (Ukraine/ 20/ hryvnia/ 2005), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine. On the coin there is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted `Ruslan` AN-124 aircraft and between the coin outer rim and the bead circle there are circular inscriptions: ЛІТАКИ УКРАЇНИ (aircrafts of Ukraine) - above; АН-124 `РУСЛАН`( Ruslan) - beneath. Between these two inscriptions there is `AН` (AN) logotype which is holographic on the silver coin.

name: Ruslan` AN-124 aircraft
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to `Ruslan` AN-124 aircraft, the world biggest as to its size and carrying capacity, which is now in serial production and is unique as to its transport efficiency
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the circle made of a string of beads there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine within an allegoric composition of the sun, a conventionalized wing, birds and stars that symbolize the dream of mankind to reach outer space. There are the following inscriptions: on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 2005, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia/ 2005). On the coin there is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted `Ruslan` AN-124 aircraft and between the coin outer rim and the bead circle there are circular inscriptions: ЛІТАКИ УКРАЇНИ (aircrafts of Ukraine) - above; АН-124 `РУСЛАН`( Ruslan) - beneath. Between these two inscriptions there is `AН` (AN) logotype which is holographic on the silver coin.

name: Olexander Korniychuk
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the birth centenary of Olexander Korniychuk, a Ukrainian playwright, a script writer, a public figure and a member of the World Peace Council, who was born in Kyiv region. The plays of Korniychuk made an impact on the development of dramatic art.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse on the left and against the background of conventionalized sheets of paper there is depicted theatre masks - symbols of dramatic art, under them - a conventionalized pen and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine, above and on the right there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, below which there is the inscription: УКРАЇНА/ 2/ГРИВНІ/2005 (Ukraine/ 2 / hryvnia /2005).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse upon a background of conventionalized sheets of paper there is a portrait of Korniychuk (left), right from it there is a two lined inscription: 1905 - 1972, his years of life and a semicircular inscription: ОЛЕКСАНДР КОРНІЙЧУК (Olexander Korniychuk)

name: 75 Years to the National Zhukovsky Aerospace University in Kharkiv
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 75th anniversary of Kharkiv National Zhukovsky Aerospace University, which history is directly connected with the development of the aircraft industry and science. This is the only institution of higher learning, where on the basis of its own design and construction office aircrafts were designed under supervision of professor Neumann; aircrafts were manufactured commercially at aircraft works and were operated with airlines.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of an open book there is a depiction of the university building, above which there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, as well as the semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) beneath: 2005, the coin mintage year (on the left), in the middle and in two lines: 2 ГРИВНІ (2/ hryvnia) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a composition containing a depiction of a monitor with a keyboard, an aircraft and book, above which there is the inscription: 75 years and НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ АЕРОКОСМІЧНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМ. М.Є. ЖУКОВСЬКОГО `ХАІ`( National Zhukovsky Aerospace University) around the coin circumference.

name: 60 Years of Ukraine Membership in UN
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 60th anniversary of Ukraine membership in the United Nations Organization - international organization of independent states, which was founded for preserving peace and international cooperation. Ukraine was among UN founding members
averseDescription: On the coin obverse on the right and against the relief background there is depicted an olive twig, which decorates the UN emblem (symbol of peace); against the glass background there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, on left there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА/ 10/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2005 (Ukraine/ 10 / hryvnia/ 2005), Аg 925, designation of metal and 31,1, the coin`s weight in fineness, as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a conventionalized depiction of a fragment of the terrestrial globe above there is depicted the emblem of the United Nations Organization, on the left there is the inscription: 60 РОКІВ ЧЛЕНСТВА УКРАЇНИ В ООН (60 Years of Ukraine membership in the United Nations Organization)

name: 50 Years to the Kyivmiskbud
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 50th anniversary of the Kyivmiskbud (Design & Construction Company), which works for preserving and adorning of the architectural face of the city of Kyiv
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in its centre there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, beneath - 2005, the coin issue year; around the coin circumference there are the inscriptions: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) (above), ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2/ hryvnia) (beneath) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are structures, built by the Kyivmiskbud company, among which in the foreground there is a building of the Southern railway station

name: 60th anniversary of the Victory in the Second World War
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 60th anniversary of the Victory in the Second World War in 1941 - 1945
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a crane wedge disappearing in clouds, the inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above) and the small National Emblem of Ukraine (on the right). Under the wedge - 2005, the coin issue year, below - Ag 925, the designation of metal and 62,2 g, its weight in fineness, as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine; beneath - 20/ ГРИВЕНЬ (20 / hryvnia), the coin face value.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are depicted soldiers returning from the battle-front in that part of the segment which is marked by three searchlight beams. On the left there is the inscription: 60/ РОКІВ/ ПЕРЕМОГИ/ У ВЕЛИКІЙ/ ВІТЧИЗНЯНІЙ/ ВІЙНІ/ 1941 - 1945 (60 Years of the Victory in the Second World War in 1941 - 1945). Below the inscription there is a holographic depiction of the Order of the Great Patriotic War.

name: Serhii Vsekhsviatskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the birth centenary of Serhii Vsekhsviatskyi (1905 - 1984), an outstanding Ukrainian astronomical scientist. As the founder of the department for astronomy in the Kyiv national university (1939), Vsekhsviatskyi played a significant role in development and popularizing of the astronomy not only in Ukraine but in the whole world during 1939 - 1984. In 1960 Serhii Vsekhsviatskyi made a presumption on the presence of a cup around the Jupiter, which was really discovered in 1979; He proved the presence of the `solar wind`, which used to cause magnetic storms and had developed a dynamic theory of the`Solar corona`.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a conventionalized depiction of the `solar wind` and a semi-circular inscription Україна (Ukraine) (left). Underneath there is depicted 2005, the coin issue year and the small National emblem of Ukraine; below - 2/ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnia) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine (on the right).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a half face portrait of Vsekhsviatsky on the background of a starry sky and a transiting comet (left); to the right there are semi-circular inscriptions СЕРГІЙ ВСЕХСВЯТСЬКИЙ (Serhii Vsekhsviatskyi) 1905-1984.

name: Scythian Gold
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Scythian period (7th - 3d centuries B.C.), an extremely important stage in the development of the jeweller`s art in the territory of Ukraine. This distinctive jeweller`s art was embodied in figures of animals which decorated military munitions, household goods, clothing; etc.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the bead circle there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, above which there is 2005, the coin issue year; between the bead circle and the coin rim there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) -above, 2 ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnia)-beneath, as well as Au 999,9, the designation of metal (on the left), 1,24 g, its weight in fineness and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine (on the right).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a golden plaque depicting a relief sideview figure of a Scythian horseman, which was found in 1830 during archeological excavations of Kul-Oba burial mound near the city of Kerch.

name: Pavlo Virsky
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the birth centenary of Pavlo Virsky, a Ukrainian choreographer, people` artist of the USSR, who had made great contribution to the dancing development enriching it with masterly choreographic elements. Working as a choreographer of Odesa, Dnipropetrovsk, Kharkiv and Kyiv opera and ballet theatres and as an art director (1955 - 1975) of Ensemble of Dancing (since 1977 called after him), Virsky maintained in his creative work principles of folk dance adaptation for the stage which was a very organic combination with a classic dance.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are semicircular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above), 2 ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnia), and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine (beneath); within the frame of a bead circle there is a composition symbolizing the Ukrainian dance - flowers with ribbons, in the middle of which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, above which there is the coin issue year - 2005
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a half face portrait of Virsky, left from which and in two lines there are his years of life: 1905 – 1975, beneath in a semicircle there is an inscription: ПАВЛО ВІРСЬКИЙ (Pavlo Virsky)

name: Maksym Rylsky
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the birth centenary of Maksym Rylsky, a classic of the Ukrainian literature of the 20th century, a talented translator, scholar and public figure. Rich heritage of the outstanding poet (`Roses and Grapes`, `Distant Horizon`, `Autumn in Golosiiv`, etc.) has raised the modern Ukrainian poetry to the summits of the world literature.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a conventionalized composition illustrating poetry, where roses and grapes are interlaced; left from the composition there is a two-lined inscription: УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, (Ukraine/ 2 / hryvnia), above it there is the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine; under inscription there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and 2005, the coin issue year.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a portrait of Rylsky is depicted, left from which there is a vertical two-lined inscription: МАКСИМ РИЛЬСЬКИЙ (Maksym Rylsky), under the inscription - 1895-1964, his years of life.

name: Ulas Samchuk
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 100th anniversary of Ulas Samchuk, a Ukrainian writer who was born in Derman village of Rivne region but created his works in foreign country. The personality of Ulas Samchuk is one of the most distinctive among Ukrainian prose writers of 20th century. He is the author of memoirs, trilogy novel `Volyn`, `Maria`story, `Listen, listen, Moscow speaking` plays, `One can hear the noise of the Millstones`, etc
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a composition, conventionalized like covers of the writer`s first editions - books with horsemen on their both sides. Above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under it there is УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) inscription, beneath - 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia) 2005 and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a portrait of Ulas Samchuk is depicted conventionalized like an engraving, right and left from which there are conventionalized flowers, beneath there are inscriptions: 1905-1987 УЛАС САМЧУК (Ulas Samchuk)

name: Volodymyr Filatov
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 130th anniversary of Volodymyr Filatov, an outstanding ophthalmologist and surgeon, whose greatest discovery was a tissue therapy - a principally new medical treatment method. Volodymyr Filatov is a brilliant representative of a Pleiad of scientists who have enriched world medical science with distinguished achievements. He was the founder of the national scientific school of ophthalmologists, a foundation initiator and director of Odesa scientific and research institute for eye-diseases and tissue therapy
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a conventionalized diagram of the human optical system and the inscription 2 ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnia), the coin face value; above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine under which there is the semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), beneath - 2005 (the coin issue year) as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Volodymyr Filatov, displaced to the right from the centre; on the left there is the inscription: ВОЛОДИМИР ФІЛАТОВ (Volodymyr Filatov) 1875/1956, made as a chart for eyesight checking.

name: Boris Liatoshynsky
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 110th anniversary of Boris Liatoshynsky, a Ukrainian composer and a conductor; who was also a very talented pedagogue and founded his own conductor school. Among his pupils were such composers as L.Hrabovsky, I.Karabyts, V. Silvestrov, Y. Stankovych, I.Shamo and I.Belza, a musicologist. He had composed two operas, five symphonies, chamber music, romances, piano miniatures, etc.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the semicircular inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), under it - the small National Emblem of Ukraine. Against the background of music lines there is a depiction of a treble clef within an ornamental pattern made on motives of folk wall-paintings, above the music lines there is the inscription: 2 ГРИВНІ (2 / hryvnia), the coin face value, beneath - the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine and 2005, the coin issue year
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a portrait of Liatoshynsky and semicircular inscriptions: БОРИС ЛЯТОШИНСЬКИЙ (Boris Liatoshynsky) 1895 – 1968.

name: Lyre
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an ancient musical instrument which has been popular in Ukraine since 15th-16th centuries. Lyre is a string-keyboard and bow folk musical instrument.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse its horizontal surface symbolically represents lyre strings tuning a melody like a conventionalized baroque ornamental pattern. Above there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and `Ukraine` inscription made to look like the Cossack script; beneath - 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5/ hryvnia), 2004 (right) and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a lyre is depicted, around its circumference there is a baroque ornament and ЛІРА (Lyre) inscription made to look like the Cossack script.

name: The Ostrozkyi Family
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Ostrozkyi family, a mighty princely family, which originates from the Volyn offshoot of Monomakhs and Ruericks. For centuries this family has been a symbol of patriotism and devotion to Ukraine. Representatives of this family were great admirers and patrons of education, science and art in Ukraine, founders of the Ostroh (1578) academy, the first institution of higher learning in the Eastern Europe by which a printing house was built
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the frame of a conventionalized ornament, there is depicted the Holy Mother icon from the St. Elias church in the town of Dubno gifted by the prince Vasyl Konstiantyn, above which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and semicircular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above), ДЕСЯТЬ ГРИВЕНЬ (10 Hryvnias) (beneath). On the icon both sides there are: the coin mintage year - 2004 (left), the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine, Ag 925, designation of metal and 31,1, its weight in fineness (right).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are portraits of some bright members of the Ostrozkyi family: prince Konstiantyn (1460 - 1530), prince Vasyl Konstiantyn (1526 - 1608) and princess Elisabeth (Halshka) (1575 - 1642); above there is the semicircular inscription: РОДИНА ОСТРОЗЬКИХ (The Ostrozkyi Family), beneath - the Ostrozkyi family emblem, on either side of which there are the dates: XIV ст. XVII ст.(14th century 17th century).

name: Icebreaker `Captain Belousov`
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the icebreaker which was put into operation 50 years ago and which is named after Mykhailo P. Belousov (1904 - 1946), an experienced polar captain and a Hero of the Soviet Union.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse on the left there is a depiction of an anchor and a steering-wheel, against whose background there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine is depicted; in the middle there are engraved horizontal symbolic waves above which there are inscriptions: on the German silver coin: УКРАЇНА/2004 (above), 5/ГРИВЕНЬ (beneath). There is also the Mint logotype of the Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of an ice-breaker amidst blocks of ice - in the foreground, and a boat in pure water - in the background; there are the inscriptions: `КАПІТАН БЄЛОУСОВ` (`Captain Belousov`), above in semicircle, and beneath - КРИГОЛАМ (Icebreaker) horizontal depiction against the mirror background

name: Icebreaker `Captain Belousov`
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the icebreaker which was put into operation 50 years ago and which is named after Mykhailo P. Belousov (1904 - 1946), an experienced polar captain and a Hero of the Soviet Union.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse on the left there is a depiction of an anchor and a steering-wheel, against whose background there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine is depicted; in the middle there are engraved horizontal symbolic waves above which there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА/2004 (Ukraine/2004) (above), 10/ГРИВЕНЬ (10/Hryvnia), as well as - designation of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of an ice-breaker amidst blocks of ice - in the foreground, and a boat in pure water - in the background; there are the inscriptions: `КАПІТАН БЄЛОУСОВ` (`Captain Belousov`), above in semicircle, and beneath - КРИГОЛАМ (Icebreaker) horizontal depiction against the mirror background

name: Nuclear Power of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the nuclear power, which is the leader in the power industry of Ukraine and is of strategic importance for its economy satisfying for 50% of the state`s needs in electric power. These indicators will further increase due to setting in operation of two new nuclear power units - the second unit of Khmelnytsk- and the forth unit of Rivne nuclear power plants, which are being put into operation under compliance of current requirements and safety regulations. The completion of these units have been accomplished without drawing foreign credits but with support of international institutions which do care about their future safety
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a conventionalized fire wheel symbolizing motion and technological progress. Atomic energy serves as an engine placed in the centre of the wheel. Against the wheel background around its circumference there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine (above) and the inscriptions: 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia) (beneath), УКРАЇНА, 2004 (2004 (Ukraine/ 2004), the coin mintage year and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse upon the background of a nuclear reactor`s encapsulation there is a symbolic depiction of 15 nuclear reactors in the form of fuel channels (according to their number in Ukraine), two of which are designated with sprouts symbolizing new nuclear power units.

name: Mykhailo Deregus
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 100th anniversary of Mykhailo Deregus (1904 - 1997), one of the brightest artists of the 20th century. Being a painter and graphic artist, pedagogue and cultural worker, Mykhailo Deregus managed to combine skillfully the generalized national tradition with achievements of the world culture. Well-known are his paintings of the Cossacks themes, and namely: `Khmelnytsk land`, `Pereyaslav Rada`, ` Thought on the Cossack Holota ` triptych, etc. His illustrations for works of Ivan Kotliarevskyi, Taras Shevchenko, Lesia Ukrainka, M.Gogol and M.Nekrasov have become significant attainment of the graphic art.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under it there is the three-lined inscription - УКРАЇНА 2 ГРИВНІ (Ukraine /2 hryvnia) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine. There inscriptions are depicted against the background of a palette with two brushes (right), beneath - 2004, the coin issue year.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a profile portrait of Mykhailo Deregus and semicircular inscriptions: 1904 – 1997 МИХАЙЛО ДЕРЕГУС (Mykhailo Deregus)

name: 200 Years to Kharkiv National University named after V.N.Karazin
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Kharkiv National University, one of the leading centres of education and science. The university was founded in 1804 on the initiative of an outstanding enlightener V.N.Karazin and for about 200 years it has embodied man`s striving for knowledge and winning of scientific summits.
averseDescription: On the coins obverse there is the symbolic depiction of the Solar system as a part of the Universe, which contains `the planet of knowledge`, above it and to the right, there is a semicircular inscription: РОЗУМ o ЗНАННЯ o МАЙБУТНЄ (intellect o knowledge o futurity); above and to the left - the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse on the upper part of the coin field, there is depicted the present-day University building, at the coin lower part as in a mirror reflection - the original building of the university and the circular inscription : ХАРКІВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМ. В.Н.КАРАЗІНА o 200 РОКІВ (V.N.Karazin Kharkiv National University/200 Years)

name: 200 Years to Kharkiv National University named after V.N.Karazin
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Kharkiv National University, one of the leading centres of education and science. The university was founded in 1804 on the initiative of an outstanding enlightener V.N.Karazin and for about 200 years it has embodied man`s striving for knowledge and winning of scientific summits.
averseDescription: On the coins obverse there is the symbolic depiction of the Solar system as a part of the Universe, which contains `the planet of knowledge`, above it and to the right, there is a semicircular inscription: РОЗУМ o ЗНАННЯ o МАЙБУТНЄ (intellect o knowledge o futurity); above and to the left - the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: on the German silver coin - 2 ГРИВНІ/ УКРАЇНА 2004. (2 Hryvnia/ Ukraine /2004). There is also the Mint logotype of the Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse on the upper part of the coin field, there is depicted the present-day University building, at the coin lower part as in a mirror reflection - the original building of the university and the circular inscription: ХАРКІВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМ. В.Н.КАРАЗІНА o 200 РОКІВ (V.N.Karazin Kharkiv National University/200 Years)

name: The Yaroslav the Wise National Law Academy of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 200th anniversary of the Yaroslav the Wise National Law Academy of Ukraine in the city of Kharkiv. The academy trains highly skilled specialists for governmental bodies, institutions of local governing, law machinery and various fields of legal practice. Such well-known men of law as M.Bazhanov, M.Baru, M.Bokarius, S.Vilnjansky, V.Horshenjov, M.Hrodzynsky, V.Kolmanov, S.Fuks, V.Shelestov, V.Yanovsky and many others worked at the academy. The authoritative schools in the field of jurisprudence are founded and function at the academy.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine (above, on the right), in the centre there are the Academy emblem and semicircular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА 2004 (Ukraine/ 2004) (left), 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia) (beneath, on the right) and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the academy`s building and the inscriptions around the coin circumference - НАЦІОНАЛЬНА ЮРИДИЧНА АКАДЕМІЯ УКРАЇНИ ІМ. ЯРОСЛАВА МУДРОГО; (the Yaroslav the Wise National Law Academy of Ukraine) underneath the building depiction there is the two-lined inscription - 200 РОКІВ (200 Years)

name: St.Yur Cathedral
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to one of the outstanding monuments of Ukrainian architecture of the 18th century whereinto the Western European Baroque canons were brilliantly embodied. The Lviv cathedral was founded by a metropolitan Atanasiy Sheptytskiy. It was constructed in the years 1744 - 1761 according to the design project of Bernard Meretyn, the most distinguished architect of the Dniper Right Bank-Side Ukraine in the epoch.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the statue of St.Yur (St.George) chiseled by Johan Pinsel (1759 - 1761) on the cathedral fa?ade; on the left from the statue there is the coin issue year - 2004 with the small National Emblem of Ukraine placed beneath; above the statue there is a semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) - 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (hryvnia) -beneath, as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the cathedral, as well as the inscriptions: СОБОР СВЯТОГО ЮРА (St.Yur cathedral) (semicircular, above) and ЛЬВІВ (Lviv) -beneath.

name: 170 Years of the Kyiv National University
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Kyiv National University named after Taras Shevchenko - one of the leading centres of education and science in Ukraine. Founded in 1834 this institution has made very significant contribution to the development of the Higher School, science and culture and to promotion of the Ukrainian people spirituality. The University is associated with scientific activities of many well-known scientists, as well as with formation and development of distinguished scientific ideas and schools
averseDescription: On the coins obverse there is depicted a composition in the form of a laser-read disk, in the centre of which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine; on the both sides of which there are objects and formulae symbolizing various sciences, as well as inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse there is the University`s building (1837-1843), architect Benjamin Beretti and the following inscriptions: КИЇВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ (Kyiv National) (above in semicircle), under it - 1834 and УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМЕНІ ТАРАСА ШЕВЧЕНКА (University-named after/ Shevchenko (below)

name: 170 Years of the Kyiv National University
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Kyiv National University named after Taras Shevchenko - one of the leading centres of education and science in Ukraine. Founded in 1834 this institution has made very significant contribution to the development of the Higher School, science and culture and to promotion of the Ukrainian people spirituality. The University is associated with scientific activities of many well-known scientists, as well as with formation and development of distinguished scientific ideas and schools.
averseDescription: On the coins obverse there is depicted a composition in the form of a laser-read disk, in the centre of which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine; on the both sides of which there are objects and formulae symbolizing various sciences, as well as inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse there is the University`s building (1837-1843), architect Benjamin Beretti and the following inscriptions: КИЇВСЬКИЙ НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ (Kyiv National) (above in semicircle), under it - 1834 and УНІВЕРСИТЕТ ІМЕНІ ТАРАСА ШЕВЧЕНКА (University-named after/ Shevchenko (below)

name: Mykhailo Kotsiubynskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 140th birth anniversary of Mykhailo Kotsiubynskyi (1864 - 1913), a talented Ukrainian writer and a public figure born in the city of Vinnytsia. Mykhailo M. Kotsiubynskyi is the author of such famous works as `Fata Morgana`, `Intermezzo`, `Laughter`, `Apple Blossom` and `Shadows of the Forgotten Ancestors`, which are bright examples of the Ukrainian prose of the end of the 19th - beginning of the 20th centuries
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of a conventionalized composition made of Heorhii Yakutovych`s engraving to `Shadows of the Forgotten Ancestors`. Above there are: a semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), the coin issue year - 2004 (left), the small National Emblem of Ukraine (right) and the coin face value - 2/ ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia), left from the composition, as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a portrait of Mykhailo Kotsubynsky is depicted and circular inscriptions: 1864 • МИХАЙЛО КОЦЮБИНСЬКИЙ (Mykhailo Kotsiubynskyi) 1913

name: 250 Years to Kirovohrad
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the regional centre - the city of Kirovohrad (named as Elisavethrad before 1934). The origin of the city is associated with a foundation of St.Elisabeth fortress built upon the former lands of Zaporizhia Sich to defend southern borders of Ukraine against predatory attacks of Turks and Crimean Tatars
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are depicted two crossed cannons, above which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the coin issue year: 2004, semicircular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above) , 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnia) (beneath), as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a panoramic view of the city, upon the background of which two dates– 1754 - 2004 are depicted, the coat of arm of the city, as well as a semicircular inscription КІРОВОГРАД (Kirovohrad)

name: Mykhailo Maksymovych
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the second birth centenary of Mykhailo Maksymovych, a naturalist scientist, historian, archeologist, linguist, pedagogue and writer
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a structure of the university (from the side of the Botanical garden) as well as the inscriptions: above there is a semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), under which - the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the coin issue year: 2004. Below there is the coin denomination: 2/ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a profile portrait of Maksymovych and the following inscriptions: МИХАЙЛО (Mykhailo) (on the left) -on both sides and in a half circle; МАКСИМОВИЧ (Maksymovych) (on the right) and beneath - 1804 - 1873, his years of life.

name: Yurii Fedkovych
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 170th anniversary of Yurii Fedkovych (1834-1888), an innovative writer, poet, ethnographer, specialist in folklore, playwright and public figure. Being a son of the Ukrainian Carpathian region, Yurii (Osyp) A.Fedkovych is a folk author, one of the pioneers of the national Renaissance in Bykovyna region.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse a composition is depicted which personifies a patriotic, heroic and romantic trend in the creative work of Fedkovych: a horseman holding a hatchet in his hand defending swallows from a bird of prey. To the left from the composition there is the coin mintage year: 2004, under which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the Mint logo of the National Bank of Ukraine; to the right there is a three-lined conventionalized inscription : УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and the coin face value: 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Yuri Fedkovych, to the right from which an inscription ЮРІЙ ФЕДЬКОВИЧ(Yurii Fedkovych) and his years of life: 1834 - 1888 are depicted.

name: Mykola Bazhan
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the birth centenary of Mykola P.Bazhan (1904 - 1983), a poet, editor, specialist in drama study, film critic, script writer, translator, state and public figure. He was born in the town of Kamianets-Podilskyi (now Khmelnytsk region). Mykola P.Bazhan was a man of great learning, a person of encyclopaedic knowledge, an academician of the Academy of Sciences of the UkrSSR (1951), an honoured worker of science of the UkrSSR (1966), whose sphere of interest covered almost all fields of cultural life of Ukraine. He was an initiator and scientific supervisor of the `Ukrainian Soviet Encyclopedia` publication. Though above all, Bazhan went down in the history of Ukraine as a poet. His poetry is characterized by sublimity of inflexions, epic sounding, predominance of poetic and civic motives
averseDescription: On the coin obverse above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine is depicted, under it there is УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) inscription; in the centre of the coin a composition made of a pencil, a pen with Pegasus` wing and a brush is depicted; to the right there are inscriptions: 2/ГРИВНІ, (2 hryvnia); beneath: 2004, the coin mintage year and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a portrait of Mykola Bazhan is depicted, on its both sides there are semicircular inscriptions: left – МИКОЛА БАЖАН (Mykola Bazhan), right – 1904 – 1983, his years of life.

name: 28th Olympic Games
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 28th Olympic Games held in Athens (Greece) in July 2004. Ancient Greek Olympic Games in honour of Zeus took place every four years since 776 B.C. till 394 A.D. For the period of Olympic Games all wars were terminated and peace was made. The present Olympic Games are held since 1896 and the first one took place in Athens.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the square there is depicted a Greek girl dressed in a tunic who is holding a cup with the holographic flame in her right hand and an Olive branch, an ancient symbol of peace in her left hand. Above the square there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) inscription, under the square - 20 ГРИВЕНЬ (20 Hryvnia); on both sides of the square against the background of the antique meander-line ornament there are the indications of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness and the logotype of Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine. On the right - 2004, the coin issue year
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a square there depicted representatives of various f sports, in the middle - a cup with the Olympic flame. Around the square there are the following inscriptions: ІГРИ/ XXVIII ОЛІМПІАДИ (above), OLYMPIC GAMES/ XXVIII (beneath), АФІНИ 2004 (left), ATHENS 2004 (right

name: Olexander Dovzhenko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 110th birth anniversary of Olexander Dovzhenko (1894 - 1956), the founder of the Ukrainian national school of cinematography, a writer and artist who was born in a town of Sosnytsia of Chernihiv region. Dovzhenko was a screen poet and philosopher, a brilliant film-director, whose feature film `Earth` is included to the 12 world best feature films. He was a distinctive romanticist writer, who was called the Homer of the XXth century
averseDescription: On the coin obverse a boy is depicted standing in a boat with a candle in his hand and floating along the river of time to meet his destiny; on the left of the composition there is 2004, the coin issue year, under which there is small National Emblem of Ukraine and the coin face value- 2 ГРИВНІ, (2 hryvnia), on the right there is a semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Olexander Dovzhenko , as well as the inscriptions: on the right: 1894-1956, his years of life; to the left in a semi-circle: ОЛЕКСАНДР ДОВЖЕНКО (Olexander Dovzhenko)

name: 350 Years to the citu of Kharkiv
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the city of Kharkiv, one of the largest industrial, scientific and cultural centres of Ukraine. The city was founded about 1655 by Ukrainian Cossacks - migrators from the Right Bank Ukraine as a fortress for defense of the Ukrainian territories from aggressive attacks of conquerors.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the Bell tower of the Assumption Cathedral (1821 - 1848); above - the small National Emblem of Ukraine; on the left - designation of metal - 5, on the right there is a semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine); beneath - the ГРИВЕНЬ (hryvnia), inscription and the coin issue year: 2004. Furthermore, there is the Mint logotype of the National bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the State Industry building (Derzhprom), which was built in the constructivism style (1928), above and on the left there is the city coat of arms, below there is the semicircular inscription ХАРКІВ o 350 РОКІВ (Kharkiv/ 350 Years)

name: Golden Gates
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Golden Gates of Kyiv, the principal ceremonial entrance to the city, a unique fortification structure built during ruling period of the Prince Yaroslav the Wise. The structure was crowned with the Church of Annunciation. Golden Gates... Attracts attention the very name of the gate which originates still from ancient times. In bygone period it laid emphasis on its specific importance among others defensive structures of the city. The chronicler Nestor in entries for the year 1037 noted: `And laid Yaroslav a great city with the Golden Gates, and also founded a Church devoted to St.Sophia, the centre of the empire, as well as the Church of Annunciation on the top of the Golden Gates...`
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of an old-Rus symbol of the sun there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine; above there is the semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine). Underneath the Emblem there is the coin face value - 100 ГРИВЕНЬ (100 Hryvnia). On each side of the obverse there are stylized cranes (from the motifs of old Kyiv bracelets) with the indications of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness (on the right) and the logotype of Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine. Underneath there is a stylized ornamental stripe, under which there is engraved 2004.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a stylized miniature-like annalistic scene - riders approaching the gates. Overhead to the right there is a semicircular stylized inscription: ЗОЛОТІ ВОРОТА (Golden Gates, underneath the stylized ornamental stripe - 1037, the year of the gates construction.

name: Maria Zankovetska
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 150th birth anniversary of Maria Zankovetska, an outstanding actress, public figure, one of the founders of the Ukrainian National theatre and the first People` artist of Ukraine (1923)
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the smooth background there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above) and 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia) / 2004 (beneath); in the centre there is a depiction of a stylized flower; on the right this composition is framed with a stage curtain. On the coin obverse there is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the foreground there is a portrait of Maria Zankovetska; in the background there is a stylized floral ornamental pattern; on the left around the circumference there is an inscription: МАРІЯ ЗАНЬКОВЕЦЬКА (Maria Zankovetska) and beneath - 1854-1934, her years of life.

name: Whitsunday
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Whitsunday, one of the grandest Christian holidays celebrated on the 50th day after Easter
averseDescription: On the coin obverse, there is a depicted a charm garland made of flowers, in the middle of which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and above it - 2004, the coin issue year. To the left and to the right there are conventionalized rye spikelets, poppy-heads and cornflowers. Beneath the garland there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a group of girls is depicted adorned with flowers, ribbons and garlands, among whom a girl, embellished as a `poplar-tree` is a central figure. At the top and above the group there is a symbolic depiction of the Holy Trinity, on both sides of which there is an inscription: СВЯТО ТРІЙЦІ (Whitsunday Celebration)

name: Whitsunday
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the Whitsunday, one of the grandest Christian holidays celebrated on the 50th day after Easter
averseDescription: On the coin obverse, there is a depicted a charm garland made of flowers, in the middle of which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and above it - 2004, the coin issue year. To the left and to the right there are conventionalized rye spikelets, poppy-heads and cornflowers. Beneath the garland there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ, (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a group of girls is depicted adorned with flowers, ribbons and garlands, among whom a girl, embellished as a `poplar-tree` is a central figure. At the top and above the group there is a symbolic depiction of the Holy Trinity, on both sides of which there is an inscription: СВЯТО ТРІЙЦІ (Whitsunday Celebration)

name: 50 Years of Ukraine Membership in UNESCO
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 50th anniversary of Ukraine`s full membership in UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization). Since May 12, 1954 is Ukraine a member of UNESCO and since 1962 the Permanent mission of Ukraine at the UNESCO functions in Paris. The main task of UNESCO lies in strengthening peace and security through broadening of people`s cooperation in education, science and culture. As a member of UNESCO, Ukraine has initiated many international programs and projects
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the insert ring, against the background of a conventionalized ornament there is depicted the small National emblem of Ukraine, above there is the coin issue year - 2004, year; within the outer circle there are the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia) and the logotype of the NBU Mint
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the insert ring, against the background of a conventionalized ornament there is the UNESCO logotype; within the outer ring there are the inscriptions: 50 РОКІВ УКРАЇНИ В ЮНЕСКО, 50 YEARS OF UKRAINE IN UNESCO.

name: Heroic Defence of the city of Sevastopol in 1854-1856
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 150th anniversary of the heroic defence of Sevastopol, which lasted for 349 during the Crimean war, the greatest war taking place on the Ukrainian lands in 19th century. Some regiments raised in Ukraine participated in the war, such as Chernihiv, Poltava, Zhytomir, Podil, Odesa, Volyn and Kremenchuh regiments, as well as detachments of the Black Sea Cossack`s forces. Along with V.Kornilov, P.Nakhimov, V.Istomin and others well-known Admirals of the Black Sea Sailing Fleet (which was sank to prevent access to Sevastopol harbor for enemy steam ships,
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of a fortification scheme of Sevastopol bastions and batteries there is a depiction of a monument to sunk ships (on the right); above it there is an inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine); to monument`s left there are placed: at the top - the small National Emblem of Ukraine above, the inscription - 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10 Hryvnia) - in the middle, and the coin issue year beneath: 2004 - below. On the left in two lines there is the designation of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse on the foreground there is a depiction of the basic technical defence elements: 36-pound ship cannon and ammunition (case-shot, cannon-balls, bombs, ramrods), on the background there are sailing and steam ships and a fort protecting entrance to the ship bay; there are the following inscriptions: СЕВАСТОПОЛЬ (Sevastopol) at the top on the conventionalized naval ribbon and ГЕРОЇЧНА ОБОРОНА 1854-1856 (Heroic Defence/ 1854-1856), beneath in semicircle.

name: 50 Years of Annexation of the Crimea to Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 50th anniversary of Annexation of the Crimea to Ukraine. In February 1954 the Crimean region was annexed to the UkSSR. On February 12, 1991 the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted the Law of Ukraine `On the renewal of the Crimean Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic`. On April 24, 1992 it was renamed for the Autonomous Republic of the Crimea which is an autonomous administrative and territorial unit of Ukraine and its inseparable constituent part. It is situated in the south of the state in the Crimean peninsula. The area makes up 27 thousand km2, its population is 2,221 million people
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of the map of Ukraine there is depicted a sheaf consisted of 25 wheatears tied up with a jute, which symbolizes Ukraine. In the centre there is represented the small National Emblem of Ukraine. Underneath the map there are engraved the coin issue year - 2004he left) and the inscription: КРИМ (Crimea) on the right and the logotype of the NBU Mint. Within the outer ring there are semicircular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) -above, and 5 ГРИВЕНЬ ( 5/ hryvnia) -beneath.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the centre there is depicted the Coat of arms of the Autonomous Republic of the Crimea, beneath - a bunch of grapes; the outer and insert rings are linked by a jute, along the outer ring there is the circular inscription: ВХОДЖЕННЯ КРИМУ ДО СКЛАДУ УКРАЇНИ (Annexation of the Crimea to Ukraine), above there is the inscription - 50 РОКІВ (50 Years)

name: AN-140 aircraft
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a new generation aircraft `AN`-140 for passenger and cargo carriage (up to 6 tons). AN-140 aircraft performed its first flight in 2002. It has high performance capability and is in serial production at Kharkiv Aviation Plant.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the circle made of a string of beads there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine within an allegoric composition of the sun, a conventionalized wing, birds and stars that symbolize the dream of mankind to reach outer space. There are the following inscriptions: on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 2004, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia/ 2004). On the coin there is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of AN-140 aircraft and there are circular inscriptions between the coin external rim and the beads circle: ЛІТАКИ УКРАЇНИ (aircrafts of Ukraine)- above, АН-140 and AN-140 -beneath; , between which there is AN logotype is depicted.

name: AN-140 Aircraft
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a new generation aircraft `AN`-140 for passenger and cargo carriage (up to 6 tons). AN-140 aircraft performed its first flight in 2002. It has high performance capability and is in serial production at Kharkiv Aviation Plant
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the circle made of a string of beads there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine within an allegoric composition of the sun, a conventionalized wing, birds and stars that symbolize the dream of mankind to reach outer space. There are the following inscriptions: on the silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 2004, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/ 2004), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine. On the coin there is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of AN-140 aircraft and there are circular inscriptions between the coin external rim and the beads circle: ЛІТАКИ УКРАЇНИ (aircrafts of Ukraine)- above, АН-140 and AN-140 -beneath; , between which there is AN logotype is depicted.

name: Stork
generalDescription: Dedicated to a white stork, one of two species of the stork family in the fauna of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the circle made of a string of beads there is the small National emblem of Ukraine is depicted, with the year of coin issue above it - 2004, the coin mintage year. Between the beads circle and the coin rim there are circular inscriptions УКРАЇНА ((Ukraine) -above, 2 Г РИВНІ (2/ hryvnia) - beneath), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logo of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the circle made of a string of beads there is a depiction of a stork taking wing; between the coin external rim and the beads circle there are circular inscriptions: ЛЕЛЕКА (Stork) - above CICONIA CICONIA -beneath

name: 50 Years of the State Design Office `Pivdenne`
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the State design office `Pivdenne`, which was founded on 10 April, 1954 in the city of Dnipropetrovsk. About 70 types of space vehicles developed at the design office `Pivdenne` enabled to conduct space researches within the frame of both national and international projects, contributing to the development of science and the national economy. As of today, one of the priority tasks of this design office is the implementation of the National Space Program of Ukraine according to which the launch of `Sich-1M` multifunctional space vehicle is planned for 2004.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a space satellite orbit above one part of a terrestrial globe, against whose background there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions: 2004, УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (2004/ Ukraine/ 5 hryvnia), as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are depicted a crescent (on the left) and a space vehicle, above there is the semicircular inscription: `КБ`ПІВДЕННЕ` (Design office `Pivdenne`) and 50 РОКІВ (50 Years) - below

name: 2006 Football World Cup
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 2006 FIFA Football World Cup which is to take place in Germany
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is engraved a ball in the goal; above there are the small State National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine); on the right of the goal there are the inscriptions: on the silver coin: 10/ ГРИВЕНЬ/ 2004,(10 /Hryvnia / 2004), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. Besides, there is the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of the goal, there are depicted a football player and a goal-keeper with a ball playing the game; beneath there are inscriptions: ЧЕМПІОНАТ СВІТУ З ФУТБОЛУ, НІМЕЧЧИНА, 2006. (2006 Football World Cup/ Germany)

name: 2500 Years to Balaklava
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a former ancient town and one of today`s districts of the city of Sevastopol. According to Strabo, Pliny the Elder and other ancient authors there was located on the territory of the present Balaklava an ancient Tauridian settlement of Palakion (the 7-6th century B.C.), in 4th century B.C. it was captured by the Greeks, in 5-th - by the Byzantines. The bay, well sheltered from the sea by high rocks, constantly attracted attention: in 1357 the town was captured by the Genoeses who built here Chymbalo fortress; in 1457 it was captured by the Turks and since that it is called Balaklava (fish town).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are depicted ancient Greek merchant ships, between them in the centre there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, under which there is a two-line inscription: 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnia), within the frame of an ornamental composition made of acanthus leaves and vines; besides there is the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine. Above there is УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) inscription, under which - 2004, the coin issue year .
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the upper part of the coin field the Balaklava bay is depicted; to the right - sailing ships, to the left - the coat of arms of the town of Balaklava; in the lower part of the coin field there is a column and two anchors, found during archeological excavations; above there is a semicircular inscription: 2500 РОКІВ БАЛАКЛАВІ (2500 Years to Balaklava)

name: Azov Dolphin
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a mammalian of cetacean species, a representative of the dolphin family in the fauna of Ukraine, a narrow-areal relic subspecies, the habitat of which is the Black Sea and the Sea of Azov. Azov Dolphin is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine and into the European Red-List.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a legend: on the coin made of German silver there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ, 2004 (Ukraine/ 2/ hryvnia/ 2004), as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint is depicted
