reverseDescription: On the coins reverse there are two Azov Dolphins are depicted with air bubbles in the water, beneath - there is a seaweeds and circular inscriptions: АЗОВКА (Azov Dolphin) (right) and PHOECENA PHOECENA RELICTA ABEL (left).

name: Azov Dolphin
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a mammalian of cetacean species, a representative of the dolphin family in the fauna of Ukraine, a narrow-areal relic subspecies, the habitat of which is the Black Sea and the Sea of Azov. Azov Dolphin is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine and into the European Red-List.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a legend: on the silver coin: УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, 2004, (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/ 2004), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logo of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coins reverse there are two Azov Dolphins are depicted with air bubbles in the water, beneath - there is a seaweeds and circular inscriptions: АЗОВКА (Azov Dolphin) (right) and PHOECENA PHOECENA RELICTA ABEL (left).

name: 2006 Football World Cup
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 2006 FIFA Football World Cup which is to take place in Germany
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is engraved a ball in the goal; above there are the small State National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine); on the right of the goal there are the inscriptions: on the German silver coin: УКРАЇНА / 2 / ГРИВНІ / 2004 (Ukraine/ 2 Hryvnia/2004). Besides, there is the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of the goal, there are depicted a football player and a goal-keeper with a ball playing the game; beneath there are inscriptions: ЧЕМПІОНАТ СВІТУ З ФУТБОЛУ, НІМЕЧЧИНА, 2006. (FIFA World Cup/ Germany/ 2006)

name: Serzh Lyfar
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the birth centenary of Serhii Mykhailovych Lyfar, an outstanding ballet dancer, choreographer, pedagogue and ballet theorist.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of a relief square there is depicted a dancer`s figure as Ikar`s character (one of the most famous parts of Lyfar); to the right against the coin smooth background there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and semicircular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, (Ukraine) 2004, 2, ГРИВНІ (2004 / Ukraine/ 2 /hryvnia) and the Mint logotype the National bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is Serzh Lyfar`s profile portrait and inscriptions: СЕРЖ ЛИФАР (Serzh Lyfar) (beneath) in two lines and 1904-1986, his years of life - to the right.

name: `Our Spirit Never Can be Downed, Our Striving To Be Free`
generalDescription: The coin is issued on the occasion of 190th anniversary of Taras Shevchenko, an outstanding Ukrainian poet (1814-1861) and is made on motives of his poems
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine is depicted against the background of a rushnyk (towel) with an ornamentation holographic depiction (on the left); to the right from the Emblem there are mallow flowers. Above there is the semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine); beneath in three lines - 20 ГРИВЕНЬ 2004 (20 Hryvnia/2004), as well as - designation of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the portrait of Taras Shevchenko with facsimile, on the both sides of the portrait there is a composition consisting of characters of his poems; there are the semicircular inscriptions: above - НЕ ВМИРАЄ ДУША НАША (`Our Spirit Never Can be Downed`) beneath - НЕ ВМИРАЄ ВОЛЯ (`Our Striving To Be Free`).

name: 350 Years of the Pereiaslav Cossack Rada of 1654
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Pereiaslav Rada of January 8 (18), 1654, an important event in the period of the national and liberation war of the Ukrainian people, when the Assembly of foremen, Cossacks, petty bourgeoisie and peasants voted for Ukraine joining the Russia as political self-government.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of a threefold arch of an Orthodox temple there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine with the coin denomination: 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10 Hryvnia) under it; on the right in three lines - designation of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine and a the semicircular inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine); beneath - the coin mintage year: 2004
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the smooth background of a threefold arch of an Orthodox temple there is a multifigured composition headed by Bohdan Khmelnytskyi, under which there is the date 1654, to the right there is a semicircular inscription: ПЕРЕЯСЛАВСЬКА КОЗАЦЬКА РАДА. (Pereiaslav Cossack Rada

name: Bandura
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the bandura, a stringed plucking-played musical instrument.
averseDescription: The raised obverse symbolizes bandura strings. Here a Ukrainian song is reproduced as a conventionalized Baroque ornamentation. Above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, conventionalized inscriptions in the Cossack script - УКРАЇНА (Ukraine). Beneath there are inscriptions: 2003, the coin issue year, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnia) and the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse a bandura is depicted encircled with a Baroque ornament and the conventionalized inscription БАНДУРА (bandura) made to look like the Cossack script.

name: Salamander
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the speckled salamander, a representative of Caudate amphibious species, the only type of salamander species in the fauna of Ukraine, that habits the mountain and submountain regions of the Carpathian mountains
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the circle made of a string of beads there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine with the year of coin issue above it - 2003. There are the circular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) 2003 (above), 2 ГРИВНІ (2/ Hryvnia/ (beneath), as well as Ag 925, the designation of the metal, its fineness and 31.1, the coin weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the salamander depiction, around which there are circular inscriptions: САЛАМАНДРА (salamander) та SALAMANDRA

name: Kyrylo Rozumovskyi
generalDescription: The commemorative coin of 10 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the count Kyrylo Rozumovskyi, the last Hetman of the Left Bank Ukraine (1728 - 1803), a well educated person, the president of the St.Petersburg Academy of Sciences, field marshal, chamberlain and senator. During his hetmanship many important reforms were implemented: judicial and military reform, national census, as well as longstanding Ukrainian rights and privileges were asserted.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the composition similar to the whole Series of coins which embodies the National idea of the Unified Ukraine: next to the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the emblematic figures of Michael the Archistrategos and crowned lion are located, which are symbols of Kyiv and Lviv Cities. Circular inscriptions are split by baroque ornamentation: УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 2003, (Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnia/ 2003), the designation of precious metal - Ag 925 and its weight in fineness - 31,1). There is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the circle made of a string of beads there is engraved a half-length portrait of Kylylo Rozumovskyi, to the left there is his coat of arm and the Cathedral of Virgin `s Nativity in the Town of Kozelets (on the right). Between the coin outer rim and the beads circle there is the conventionalized inscription: КИРИЛО РОЗУМОВСЬКИЙ (Kyrylo Rozumovskyi) - above and 1728 - 1803, his years of life - below.

name: Pochaiv Laura
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a Ukrainian Orthodox monastery, the Pochaiv Assumption Lavra, the famous architectural and historical monument first mentioned in the 16th century. Now its architectural complex contains 16 churches. Pochaiv Laura plays a significant role in the Orthodox spiritual tradition.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Star of Bethlehem, under which there is the inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions: 2003, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (2003/ 10/hryvnia). Below there is a footprint of the Blessed Virgin against the conventionalized peak of the Pochaiv hill. There are seraphim on each side of the obverse and below there is the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also placed the logotype of the NBU Mint.
reverseDescription: an image of the Blessed Virgin and the circular inscription: СВЯТО-УСПЕНСЬКА ПОЧАЇВСЬКА ЛАВРА (Pochaiv Saint Assumption Laura)

name: Andrii Malyshko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Ukrainian poet and songwriter Andrii Malyshko (02.11.1912 - 17.02.1970). Malyshko`s lyrics set to music by the Ukrainian composer P.Maiboroda (`The Kyivan waltz`, `Song about rushnyk`, `Small path`, etc.) became folk songs.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is represented a towel whereon there are conventionalized images of a bird (on the left) and flowers (on the right). Above and below the towel there is the semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) as well as the small National Emblem of Ukraine. At the bottom of the coin there is the inscription: 2 ГРИВНІ 2003 (2 hryvnia /2003) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Andrii Malyshko; against the background of a rural scene consisting of the sun and trees (on the left) and a peasant`s hut and mallow flowers (on the right). Beneath there is the semicircular inscription: 1912-1970, АНДРІЙ МАЛИШКО (Andrii Malyshko)

name: 60 Years of Liberation of Kyiv from Fascist Invaders
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Kyiv from fascist invaders in November 1943 in the course of the battle for Dnipro, an important offensive operation of the second phase of the Great Patriotic war, in the result of which the `Eastern Barrage Fire` was destructed and the radical turn in the course of the war was completed
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted: above - the coins issue year, under which - the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a three-lined inscription: on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia); on the right side of the coin there is depicted a memorial plaque and eternal flame. On the coin there is also as the logotype of the NBU Mint is depicted.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted at the top a map of the Soviet troops advance, below which there is a conventionalized scene of the Dnipro river forced crossing; in the background there is depicted a panorama of the City of Kyiv; as well as the following inscriptions: above - a three-lined inscription: 60 РОКІВ ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ КИЄВА (60 Years of the liberation of Kyiv), beneath to the left -there is a semicircular inscription - ВЕЛИКА ВІТЧИЗНЯНА ВІЙНА (Second World War)

name: 60 Years of Liberation of Kyiv from Fascist Invaders
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 60th anniversary of the liberation of Kyiv from fascist invaders in November 1943 in the course of the battle for Dnipro, an important offensive operation of the second phase of the Great Patriotic war, in the result of which the `Eastern Barrage Fire` was destructed and the radical turn in the course of the war was completed
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted: above - the coins issue year, under which - the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a three-lined inscription: on the silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 20 ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 20/ hryvnia), on the right side of the coin there is depicted a memorial plaque and eternal flame; on the silver coin the right part of the flame is holographic. On the coin there is also as the logotype of the NBU Mint is depicted
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted at the top a map of the Soviet troops advance, below which there is a conventionalized scene of the Dnipro river forced crossing; in the background there is depicted a panorama of the City of Kyiv; as well as the following inscriptions: above - a three-lined inscription: 60 РОКІВ ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ КИЄВА (60 Years of the liberation of Kyiv), beneath to the left -there is a semicircular inscription - ВЕЛИКА ВІТЧИЗНЯНА ВІЙНА (Second World War)

name: Vasyl Sukhomlynskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 85th anniversary of Vasyl Sukhomlynskyi (28.09.1918 - 02.09.1970), a Ukrainian pedagogue, Honoured teacher of the Ukraine SSR and the State Prize Winner of the USSR. Being the author of numerous scientific works (including `My heart is given to children`) and many fiction books for children, he devoted all his life to children. 33 years he worked as a director of Pavliv secondary school in Kirovohrad region, cultivating civil dignity and faith in a human being and bringing up children to love their native land.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse a horizontal composition is depicted based on Sukhomlynskyi`s books. The composition contains primarily depiction of children having and books. Above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine (left), inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine; at the lower part of the coin field there is the coin issue year (2003) and its face value - 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Vasyl Sukhomlynskyi, on the left there is a vertical image of a pen and his years of life: 1918-1970; on the right there is a semi-circular inscription: В.О.СУХОМЛИНСЬКИЙ (Vasyl Sukhomlynskyi).

name: Ostap Veresai
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the second birth centenary of Ukrainian kobza-player Ostap M.Veresai (Ostap Sokyrynskyi, Labsa, Radchyshin (1803 - 1890). Possessing some powerful influence on the audience as a artist, the kobza-player tried to bring to his people only lofty ethic norms, to favour them with positive emotions and to find those words which were awaited from him. In 1860 Taras Shevchenko presented his `Kobsar` (a book of his poems) to him. Veresai`s creative work attracted attention of Mykola Lysenko, Ivan Franko, F.Kolessy, M.Hrynchenko and others, his concerts were held in Kyiv and St.Petersburg
averseDescription: On the coin obverse to the right there is a depiction of a bandura against the background of a horizontal ornamental band, above which there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine; beyond the band there is a three-line inscription: 2 ГРИВНІ, (2 hryvnia) 2003
reverseDescription: The coin is dedicated to the second birth centenary of Ukrainian kobza-player Ostap M.Veresai (Ostap Sokyrynskyi, Labsa, Radchyshin (1803 - 1890). Exerting his powerful influence on the audience as a artist, the kobza-player poetized the high ideals of folk ethics and morals and tried to find those words which were awaited from him. In 1860 Taras Shevchenko presented his `Kobsar` (a book of his poems) to him. Veresai`s creative work attracted attention of Mykola Lysenko, Ivan Franko, F.Kolessy, M.Hrynchenko and others, his concerts were held in Kyiv and St.Petersburg

name: 150 Years of the Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine, one of the oldest archive depository of the state, which was founded in 1852 on an initiative of the Provisional Commission on investigation of ancient statements by Kyiv, Podil and Volyn general-governor and which started to operate in 1853. Today the Archives collection contains about 1,5 million copies of unique documents of the history of Ukraine since 13th till 20th centuries. Among them there are parchment credentials of 13th-15th centuries, universals of Ukrainian hetmans, Collection of incunabulums and ancient prints, Kosh Archives of the New Zaporizhia Sich, General Description of the Left-Bank Ukraine, documents of the Hetmanhood institutions, of monastery and church funds and of private funds.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the inset ring there is etched the italicized inscription: 5 ГРИВЕНЬ ( 5/ hryvnia). Below and on the right there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine against the background of a sealing wax imprint and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine. The outer ring contains the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine.) - above and 2003 - below.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a sand-glass as a symbol of time on which background there are the following dates:1852 (above) and 2002 (beneath); to the left and to the right from the sand-glass there are books, maps and pictures are depicted. Along the circumference there is an inscription: ЦЕНТРАЛЬНИЙ ДЕРЖАВНИЙ ІСТОРИЧНИЙ АРХІВ УКРАЇНИ (Central State Historical Archives of Ukraine)

name: Livadia Palace
generalDescription: Dedicated to the Great Livadia Palace, an exquisite architectural monument of the new Renaissance and the former tsar`s summer residence. It was founded at the beginning of 20th century according to the design project of the architect M.Krasnov. In Livadia in February 1945 there was held the Yalta conference of the heads of states-allies in anti-Hitler coalition.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a fragment of the gate in the Italian courtyard and a lion statue. Above there is the inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. Below there are inscriptions: 10 (to the left) and ГРИВЕНЬ o 2003 (hryvnia/ 2003). There is also placed the logotype of the NBU Mint
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of mountains silhouette there is engraved the palace and the semicircular inscription ЛІВАДІЙСЬКИЙ ПАЛАЦ (Livadia palace)

name: 100 Years of the World Aviation and 70 Years of the National Aviation University
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 100th anniversary of the World Aviation. A human being used to dream on flying since many centuries, but practically, aviation (from the Latin: avis - bird) has started its development only in 20th century. The American mechanics, brothers Write were the first to put an internal-combustion engine inside an airplane. The first successful flight of their airplane took place on December 17, 1903. At the end of 30-s a jet-engine was invented. And since that time the aviation has been developing very rapidly.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of the a terrestrial globe there is pictured a composition, symbolizing dynamics of air communication, the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions: 2 ГРИВНІ, 2003 (2 hryvnia/ 2003). Above and on the right there is a semicircular inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine).Beneath there is the NBU Mint logotype.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a composition inside of which there is a biplan of the Wright brothers is depicted against the background of the conventional plane skin which is decorated with a schematic sketch of Leonardo da Vinci. Above to the left there is a semicircular inscription: СВІТОВІЙ АВІАЦІЇ (of World Aviation) and to the right there is a two-lined inscription: 100 РОКІВ (100 Years). Beneath to the right there is a building is depicted, under which there is a semicircular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ АВІАЦІЙНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ (National Aviation University).

name: Pectoral
generalDescription: Commemorative coin of 100 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the golden Pectoral (4-th century B.C.), the unsurpassed masterpiece of Hellenic and Scythian art found in the Tovsta Mohyla burial mound in Dnipropetrovsk region (1971). The archaeologist Boris M. Mozolevskyi who found this moonlike three-tier decoration of a Scythian tsar said, ` Like a drop of dew it reflects not only the shine of Scythian gold but also the great heart of the whole nation`
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depicted a stranded twine with a floral ornament, separating the pectoral tiers. Inside it there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the year of coin issue (2003), as well as inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 100 ГРИВЕНЬ,(Ukraine/ 100/ hryvnia ), the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness .On the coin obverse there is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a Scythian kurgan there is the pectoral depiction with magnified fragments of the top tier. Above the pectoral there is a mare with a foal, beneath - two men stretching an animal skin

name: Seahorse (Hippocampus)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a representative of the Spicular family (pipefishes and seahorses), the only endemic subspecies of the Black Sea Hippocampus in the fauna of Ukraine that inhabits the Sea of Azov and the Black Sea.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a legend: on the silver coin: УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, 2003, (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/ 2003), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logo of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the Hippocampus is presented a picture of a seahorse surrounded by the inscriptions: МОРСЬКИЙ КОНИК ЧОРНОМОРСЬКИЙ (Black Sea seahorse) and HIPPOCAMPUS GUTTULATUS MICROSTEPHANUS

name: Seahorse (Hippocampus)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to a representative of the Spicular family (pipefishes and seahorses), the only endemic subspecies of the Black Sea Hippocampus in the fauna of Ukraine that inhabits the Sea of Azov and the Black Sea
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a legend: on the coin made of German silver there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ, 2003 (Ukraine/ 2/ hryvnia/ 2003), as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint is depicted.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the Hippocampus is presented a picture of a seahorse surrounded by the inscriptions: МОРСЬКИЙ КОНИК ЧОРНОМОРСЬКИЙ (Black Sea seahorse) and HIPPOCAMPUS GUTTULATUS MICROSTEPHANUS

name: 2500 Years of the town of Yevpatoria
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 2500 Years of the ancient town of Yevpatoria. At the turn of 6-th and 5-th centuries B.C. in the period of Greek colonization, an ancient town of Cerkinitidus appeared there. It was first mentioned in written sources by Hecateus of Miletus, later - by Herodotus, Ptolemy and Arrian. Today Yevpatoria is an All-Ukrainian child health centre, climatic, balneal and mud health resort
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a conventionalized image of the sun and sea, above - there is the coin issue year: 2003, below there are engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia), as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse at the top against the background of sea there is a collage made of depictions of architectural monuments and modern buildings; in the centre there is a two-lined inscription: ЄВПАТОРІЯ, 2500 років (Yevpatoria / 2500 Years). In the foreground there is depicted an amphora with a sea gull sitting on it.

name: Borys Hmyria
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the birth centenary of Borys Romanovych Hmyria, bass singer, who rose to eminence in his performance. Working as a soloist in Kharkiv (1936) and Kyiv (1939-1957) opera and ballet theatres he contributed to the world treasury of masterly performance over 600 romances, 39 opera parts, 85 fragments from vocal -stage and symphonic compositions. Borys Hmyria was given the rank of the People`s artist of the USSR (1951) and became a winner of the USSR State prize.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a treble set within the frame of wildflowers, above which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, beneath there are depicted 2003, the mintage year and circular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (left), 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia) (right), as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Borys Hmyria `s portrait is depicted, on its right there is a two-lined depiction of the years of his life:1903 - 1969, beneath there is a facsimile of the outstanding singer

name: Volodymyr Korolenko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Volodymyr Korolenko (27.07.1853 - 25.12.1921), a writer, publicist, public figure and humanist, who was born in the town of Zhytomyr. The writer`s life and creative work is closely associated with the Ukrainian people and its culture. In his stories and tales `The noise of the forest`, `The Judgement Day`, `In a bad company`, `The blind musician`, `Paradox`, `Makar`s dream` he depicts the spiritual beauty of the Ukrainian people, the beauty of the Ukrainian nature and the way of life of the Ukrainian people.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse an open book is depicted, above which there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (above in semicircle), 2003, (Ukraine /2003) 2 ГРИВНІ (2 /hryvnia) (beneath), as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of V.Korolenko and on both sides - the four-line inscription: ВОЛОДИМИР (Volodymyr) (on the left), КОРОЛЕНКО (Korolenko) (on the right) and 1853-1921 - his years of life (beneath in two lines).

name: Genoese Fortress in the town of Sudak
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Genoese Fortress, a distinguished medieval fortification work of 14th-15th centuries located in Sudak, the former capital of Soldaia Consulate of the Genoese Republic in the Crimea. The fortress majestic ramparts and towers had been under construction for about 100 years and now belong to the most interesting monuments of the world architecture
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the fortress lay-out in whose centre against the background of a conventionalized ornament there is an inscription: 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10 hryvnia. On both sides there are figures of a warrior with an arbalest (on the right) and a wine-grower (on the left); On the right there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) -above, 2003 (left); beneath there is the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness, as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint is depicted
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the fortress against whose background (beneath) there is an inscription: 14th-15th centuries, separated by between a heraldic plate the coat of arms of Genoase doge, the Genoese Republic and the Consulate) which decorate one of the fortress towers. On the left of the fortress there is depicted a merchant ship and circular inscriptions: СУДАК (Sudak) -above, left) and ГЕНУЕЗЬКА ФОРТЕЦЯ (Genoese Fortress) - below

name: AN-2 Aircraft
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the forerunner of all `AN` aircrafts, one of the heaviest and most long-lived multi-purpose aircrafts for passenger and cargo carriage. The plane made its first flight on August 31, 1947 and its serial production began at the Kyiv Aviation Plant in 1949 (now - `Aviant`).There are developed 18 modifications of the aircraft which were exported to 23 countries of the world.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the circle made of a string of beads there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine within an allegoric composition of the sun, a conventionalized wing, birds and stars that symbolize the dream of mankind to reach outer space. There are the following inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of AN-2 aircraft and circular inscriptions: above - ЛІТАКИ УКРАЇНИ (aircrafts of Ukraine); beneath - AN-2 and AN-2, between which there is AN logotype is depicted.

reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of AN-2 aircraft and circular inscriptions: above - ЛІТАКИ УКРАЇНИ (aircrafts of Ukraine); beneath - AN-2 and AN-2, between which there is AN logotype is depicted.

name: Easter Holiday
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Easter, the greatest Christian holiday. The holiday is associated with the all-night service, solemn religious processions, ringing of church bells and singing songs, glorifying Jesus Christ, whose resurrection has become a triumph of eternal life over death.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a composition made of seven Easter eggs decorated with ornaments peculiar to various regions of Ukraine. In the middle of the composition there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, above there is the coin issue year - 2003. Set in the conventionalized image of willow twigs there are the following inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is pictured a ceremonial procession of believers headed by a priest carrying the shroud of Christ, crosses, gonfalons and candles, as well as the ritual of consecration, above which there is the inscription: ВЕЛИКДЕНЬ (Easter).

name: BISON BONASUS
generalDescription: The coin of is dedicated to BISON BONASUS, an almost completely annihilated representative of the artiodactila species in the fauna of Ukraine who has been successfully bred and settled in Ukraine since 1965. The bison is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine, the International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources and Europe.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a legend:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a bison depiction circumscribed by: ЗУБР(bison) -above and BISON BONASUS -beneath

name: BISON BONASUS

averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a legend: on the coin made of German silver there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ, 2003 (Ukraine/ 2/ hryvnia/ 2003). On the coins of both types the logotype of the NBU Mint is placed
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a bison depiction circumscribed by: ЗУБР(bison) -above and BISON BONASUS -beneath

name: Volodymyr Vernadskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Volodymyr Vernadskyi (12.03.1863–06.01.1945), an outstanding natural scientist and thinker; the founder of such modern sciences about the Earth, as geochemistry and biochemistry, an academician and the first president of the All-Ukrainian Academy of Sciences (1919). His ideas played an important role in formation of the present-day scientific picture of the world and his doctrine on interrelation of the nature and the society influenced the formation of contemporary ecological perception.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the Earth, the cradle of mankind, above it there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2003 (Ukraine /2003) (above, in semicircle) 2 ГРИВНІ (2 /hryvnia) (beneath), and the Mint logotype of the National bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Volodymyr I.Vernadskyi (on the right); around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: В.І. ВЕРНАДСЬКИЙ (Volodymyr I.Vernadskyi -on the left and 1863-1945, his years of life made in two lines.

name: Boxing
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 28th Summer Olympic Games held in Athens (Greece) in 2004
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the square there is depicted an allegoric scene of the opening of the Olympic Games: two female figures dressed in tunics are holding a cup with flame and laurel branches, the symbol of peace. Above the square there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: on the silver coin: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above), 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10/ Hryvnia) (beneath), 2003 (on the left), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the square there is represented a helmet boxer. Around the square there are the following inscriptions: ІГРИ/ XXVIII ОЛІМПІАДИ (Olympic Games) (above), OLYMPIC GAMES/ XXVIII (beneath), АФІНИ 2004 (to the left), ATHENS 2004 (on the right).

name: Viacheslav Chornovil
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Viacheslav M.Chornovil, an outstanding state and public figure, famous journalist, deputy of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine of the first and third convocation and the Hero of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the bead circle there is depicted the composition symbolizing the national idea of Unification of Ukraine: the small National Emblem of Ukraine in circumference of floral ornamentation which is supported by a lion and a Cossack holding a musket. There are also conventionalized inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, 2003 (Ukraine/ 2003 /2 hryvnia) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Viacheslav V.M.Chornovil and around the coin circumference there are circular inscriptions: В`ЯЧЕСЛАВ ЧОРНОВІЛ (Viacheslav Chornovil) and his years of life: 1937-1999.

name: Boxing
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 28th Summer Olympic Games held in Athens (Greece) in 2004
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the square there is depicted an allegoric scene of the opening of the Olympic Games: two female figures dressed in tunics are holding a cup with flame and laurel branches, the symbol of peace. Above the square there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: on the silver coin: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above), 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10/ Hryvnia) (beneath), 2003 (on the left), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the square there is represented a helmet boxer. Around the square there are the following inscriptions: ІГРИ/ XXVIII ОЛІМПІАДИ (Olympic Games) (above), OLYMPIC GAMES/ XXVIII (beneath), АФІНИ 2004 (to the left), ATHENS 2004 (on the right).

name: Pavlo Polubotok
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Pavlo Polubotok (app 1660 - 1724), Hetman of the Left-bank Ukraine who headed high-rank Cossacks, opposed the restrictions of rights of the autonomous Ukraine. He advocated the revival of hetmanship and dissolution of the Little Russia Collegium. For his opposition he was imprisoned organization in Peter and Paul fortress in St.Petersburg , where he died thereafter. Polubotok is buried in St.Petersburg.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the composition similar to the whole Series of coins which embodies the National idea of the Unified Ukraine: next to the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the emblematic figures of Michael the Archistrategos and crowned lion are located, which are symbols of Kyiv and Lviv Cities. Circular inscriptions are split by baroque ornamentation: УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 2003, (Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnia/ 2003), the designation of precious metal - Ag 925 and its weight in fineness - 31,1.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the circle made of a string of beads there is engraved a half-length portrait of Pavlo Polubotok and to the right there is his coat of arms. Above, between the external rim of the coin and the bead circle there is a conventionalized inscription: ПАВЛО ПОЛУБОТОК (Pavlo Polubotok) and beneath -1660 - 1724, his years of life.

name: Celebration of Christmas in Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Christmas, one of the significant events in the history of Christianity in whose celebration many folk customs and rituals are preserved
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the Christmas star, a traditional attribute associated with the evangelic legend about Jesus Christ. In the middle of the star there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine with the issue year (2002) above it. At the both sides of the obverse there is engraved a baroque ornament between which at the bottom of the coin there are inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a traditional festive scene: a group of people singing Christmas carol with the Christmas star circumscribed by СВЯТО РІЗДВА ХРИСТОВОГО (Celebration of Christmas).

name: Celebration of Christmas in Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Christmas, one of the significant events in the history of Christianity, in whose celebration many folk customs and rituals are preserved
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the Christmas star, a traditional attribute associated with the evangelic legend about Jesus Christ. In the middle of the star there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine with the issue year (2002) above it. At the both sides of the obverse there is engraved a baroque ornament between which at the bottom of the coin there are inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a traditional festive scene: a group of people singing Christmas carol with the Christmas star circumscribed by СВЯТО РІЗДВА ХРИСТОВОГО (Celebration of Christmas).

name: Cathedral of Virgin`s Nativity in the town of Kozelets
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Cathedral of Virgin`s Nativity in the town of Kozelets (Chernigiv region), an exquisite five-domed temple which was built in 1752 - 1763 according to a design project of architects B.Rastrelli, A.Kvasov and I.Hryhorovich-Barskyi. The temple is considered to be one of the best architectural works of Ukrainian baroque of the middle of 18th century.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine surrounded by figures of four archangels from the cathedral murals and a four-line inscription: 2002, УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/ 2002), аs well as designation of metal, its fineness, and the coin weight in fineness. There is also the logotype of the NBU Mint
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are depicted the temple and the bell-tower against the background of a symbolic triangle with the Star of Bethlehem in the upper corner. Under the triangle there is a lily flower - a symbol of purity; around the triangle there are circular inscriptions: СОБОР РІЗДВА (Cathedral of Nativity) -left, БОГОРОДИЦІ (of Virgin) -right, КОЗЕЛЕЦЬ (Kozelets ) -below.

name: Volodymyr Monomakh
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Volodymyr Monomakh (1113-1125), the Grand Kiev Prince, an outstanding Old-Rus statesman and politician, the author of a number of laws and the well-known `Admonition` addressed to children. During the reign of Volodymyr Monomakh there were stopped intestine wars between princes and a new stage in development of culture and art was launched.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the old-Rus ornament recreated from the images of the casing of a manuscript book of the epoch there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of buildings of an Old-Rus town, there is pictured a half-length portrait of the Prince holding a folio in his hands. On his right there is a depiction of the Saint George -the Fighter against Dragon, as well as conventionalized inscriptions: ВОЛОДИМИР 1113 МОНОМАХ 1125 (Volodymyr/ 1113/ Monomakh /1125 -above and КНЯЖА / УКРАЇНА (Princes of Ukraine) -below.

name: Sviatoslav
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Kievan Duke Sviatoslav (964-972), whose rule over the Kyiv an Rus inaugurated a new era in the history of the ancient state. As a result of his continuous fight against Khasares, Volga Bulgars, Byzantium and the mighty Bulgarian Kingdom, he significantly expanded and strengthened the territory of the Kyivan Rus.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the old-Rus ornament recreated from the images on the brim of a ritual cup made from an aurochs horn discovered in the Chorna Mohyla (Black Tomb) burial mound (Chernihiv region, the 10th century) there are engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and conventionalized inscriptions: 2002 / УКРАЇНА / 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ / (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/2002), аs well as designation of metal, its fineness, and the coin weight in fineness. There is also the logotype of the NBU Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of pagan idols and a battle scene there are depicted a half-length figure of the warrior Duke holding a sword above his head in his right hand and a shield with the picture of the sun in his left hand, as well as conventionalized inscriptions: 964 СВЯТОСЛАВ 972 (964/ Sviatoslav /972) -above and КНЯЖА / УКРАЇНА (Princes of Ukraine) - below.

name: 70 Years of the Dnipro Hydroelectric Power Station
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 70th anniversary of putting into operation the first and the largest hydroelectric power station of Dnipro cascade (Zaporizhia), built in 1927-1932. The construction of the first Ukrainian power station was of great importance for development of metalurgical industry, mechanical engineering and agriculture of the Eastern and South Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the inset ring there are depicted: a turbine with the engine room arch of the power station, the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the coin issue year - 2002, and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine. Within the outer ring there are circular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the internal ring there is a depiction of the dam and the building-1 of the power station; in external ring there are circular inscriptions: ДНІПРОГЕС, 70 РОКІВ (70 Years /Dnipro Hydroelectric Power Station

name: Leonid Hlibov
generalDescription: On the coin obverse there are depicted a roll with the small National Emblem of Ukraine, inscriptions: 2002, УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ (Ukraine/ 2002 /2 hryvnia) and characters of `Musicians` fable, as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are depicted a roll with the small National Emblem of Ukraine, inscriptions: 2002, УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ (Ukraine/ 2002 /2 hryvnia) and characters of `Musicians` fable, as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a half-length portrait of Hlibov sitting at the table with a quill at his hand. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: ЛЕОНІД ГЛІБОВ (Leonid Hlibov) (to the right) and his years of life 1827-1893 (to the left

name: 350 Years of the Battle of Batih
generalDescription: Jubilee coin is dedicated to the historic victory of the Ukrainian army in the battle of Batih in the course of the Liberation war against the Ukrainian-Tartar army headed by Bohdan Khmelnitskiy and the Polish army headed by M.Kalinovskyi. The battle took place on 1-2 June, 1652 on the left bank of the Southern Bug river close to Batih mountain (near the village of Chetvertynivka of Trostianets distrikt in Vinnitsa region)
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the composition similar to the whole Series of coins which embodies the National idea of the Unified Ukraine: next to the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the emblematic figures of Michael the Archistrategos and crowned lion are located, which are symbols of Kyiv and Lviv Cities. Circular inscriptions are split by baroque ornamentation: УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ, 2002, (Ukraine/ 5 Hryvnia/ 2002). There is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the middle of the beads circle, there is a depiction of the battle scene, around which there is a conventionalised inscription: 350-РІЧЧЯ БИТВИ ПІД БАТОГОМ (350 Years of the battle of Batih).

name: Eagle Owl (Bubo Bubo)
generalDescription: The coin of is dedicated to Bubo Bubo, a sedentary and migratory bird - the only representative of this species in the fauna of Ukraine. Its prevailing population is concentrated mostly at the western parts of the country. This species is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the window frame, formed by depictions of various species of flora and fauna there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine is depicted and the four-line inscriptions: on the silver coin: УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, 2002, (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/ 2002), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also the Mint logo of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of Bubo bubo, sitting on a oak twig and circular inscriptions: ПУГАЧ and BUBO BUBO

name: Swimmimg
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 28th Summer Olympic Games held in Athens (Greece) in 2004
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the square there is depicted an allegoric scene of the opening of the Olympic Games: two female figures dressed in tunics are holding a cup with flame and laurel branches, the symbol of peace. Above the square there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above), 2 ГРИВНІ (2/ Hryvnia/ 2002) (beneath). There is also the logotype of Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the square there is represented a full-face swimmer. Around the square there are the following inscriptions: ІГРИ/ XXVIII ОЛІМПІАДИ (Olympic Games) (above), OLYMPIC GAMES/ XXVIII (beneath), АФІНИ 2004 (to the left), ATHENS 2004 (on the right).

name: Swimming
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 28th Summer Olympic Games held in Athens (Greece) in 2004
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the square there is depicted an allegoric scene of the opening of the Olympic Games: two female figures dressed in tunics are holding a cup with flame and laurel branches, the symbol of peace. Above the square there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: on the silver coin: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above), 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10/ Hryvnia) (beneath), 2002 (on the left), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the square there is represented a full-face swimmer. Around the square there are the following inscriptions: ІГРИ/ XXVIII ОЛІМПІАДИ (Olympic Games) (above), OLYMPIC GAMES/ XXVIII (beneath), АФІНИ 2004 (to the left), ATHENS 2004 (on the right).

name: 1100 Years of the Town of Romny (Romen)
generalDescription: The coin of 5 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the 1100th anniversary of the ancient town of Romny (Romen) - the eastern outpost of the Kyivan Rus, situates on the right bank of Sula river.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the conventionalized inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2002 (Ukraine/ 2002) (above) and 5, ГРИВЕНЬ (5 / hryvnia) (beneath). There are also depicted some conventionalized flowers and cocks which are embroidery elements of Sumy region, as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse at the upper part of the coin field and between the circular inscriptions: РОМЕН - РОМНИ (Romny (Romen) there depicted an ancient and a modern town coat of arms against the background of a baroque frame with the inscription: 1100 / РОКІВ (1100 Years); at the lower part of the coin field there is a coalesced depiction of architectural monuments and modern structures of the town

name: Pylyp Orlyk
generalDescription: Commemorative coins of 10 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to Pylyp Orlyk (1672 - 1742), a representative of Ukrainian noble family and Ivan Mazepa`s companion-in-arms, who became a Hetman in exile. He was the author of the first Ukrainian constitution Pacts and Fundamentsl Laws Regulating the Rules and Freedoms of the Zaporizhian Army (1710), which was a historical document of domestic political and legal mind of the beginning of 18 th century, regulating principal issues of the national state building in Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the composition similar to the whole Series of coins which embodies the National idea of the Unified Ukraine: next to the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the emblematic figures of Michael the Archistrategos and crowned lion are located, which are symbols of Kyiv and Lviv Cities. Circular inscriptions are split by baroque ornamentation: УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 2002, (Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnia/ 2002), the designation of precious metal - Ag 925 and its weight in fineness - 31,1.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the circle made of a string of beads there is depicted Pylyp Orlyk surrounded by his Cossack companion-in-arms with his right arm raised and holding the unfolded roll of the constitution in his left hand. Between the coin external edge and the semicircle of beads there is an conventional inscription: ПИЛИП ОРЛИК (Pylyp Orlyk) and his years of life: 1672 - 1742 - below on the left.

name: 1000 Years of the town of Khotyn
generalDescription: Jubilee coin of 5 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to a town in Bukovyna situated on a high Dnister bank, which in 10-11th centuries belonged to Kyiv Rus and since the second half of 12th century formed a part of Halych and Volyn principality. Its first fortifications and a stone church were constructed yet in 1250 – 1264, in the period of Danyla of Halych. The fortress walls witnessed many important events. But in particular, Khotyn is famous through the victorious military campaign of 1621 when the Cossack army headed by Petro Sahaidachny and Polish army met here for a battle against Turkish and Tartar forces.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within an arch opening of the brick fortress wall decorated with geometric ornament there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine, some attributes of the Cossack army (flags, trumpets, drums, spikes, muskets, cannons and balls), the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА/ 2002/ 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 2002 / 5/ hryvnia), as well as the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a mighty structure of the Khotyn fortress (13th-18th centuries), an unsurpassed monument of fortification art, above which there is the town coat of arms is depicted and circular inscriptions: ХОТИН 1000 РОКІВ (1000 Years of Khotyn)

name: AN-225 `Mria`aircraft
generalDescription: The coins launch a new series `Aircrafts of Ukraine` which is to reflect half a century activities of the Antonov Aviation Research and Engineering Complex, as well as achievements of modern Ukrainian aircraft construction. The coins are dedicated to the unique wide-body super heavy aircraft for transportation of cargo of overall dimensions weighting up to 250 tons that made its first flight in 1988. The aircraft has to its credit over 200 domestic and about 150 international aircraft records.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the circle made of a string of beads there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine within an allegoric composition of the sun, a conventionalized wing, birds and stars that symbolize the dream of mankind to reach outer space. There are the following inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is represented a super heavy aircraft over a runway encircled with the inscriptions: ЛІТАКИ УКРАЇНИ (aircrafts of Ukraine) (above) and АН-225 `МРІЯ (AN-225 `Mria`) (beneath); the АН (AN) logotype being between the latter inscription.

name: AN-225 `Mria`aircraft

reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is represented a super heavy aircraft over a runway encircled with the inscriptions: ЛІТАКИ УКРАЇНИ (aircrafts of Ukraine) (above) and АН-225 `МРІЯ (AN-225 `Mria`) (beneath); the АН (AN) logotype being between the latter inscription.

name: Mykola Lysenko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 160th anniversary of Mykola Lysenko, an outstanding Ukrainian composer, founder of the Ukrainian classic music, pianist, pedagogue, chorus conductor, public figure and ethnographer who was born in Hrynki village of Poltava region. The composer`s creative work is of great importance for the Ukrainian music. He is the author of 9 operas (Natalka Poltavka, Taras Bulba, Oneida, Christmas night, Drowned woman, Naughty nanny-goat etc.) and of numerous works. The pleiad of such Ukrainian composers as Stetsenko, Stepovyi, Leontovich, Ludkevich and Revutskyi was formed due to his direct influence
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there depicted a music fragment of the `Prayer for Ukraine` composition (1885), above which there is small National Emblem of Ukraine. At the top there is circular inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), beneath there are conventionalized flowers and inscriptions: 2, ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia), 2002 and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of Mykola Lysenko`s portrait; around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: МИКОЛА ЛИСЕНКО (Mykola Lysenko) (on the right) and 1842 - 1912, his years of life (on the left).

name: Ivan Sirko
generalDescription: Commemorative coins of 10 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to Ivan Sirko, (year of birth is unknown - 1680), an outstanding Cossack military leader and active participant of liberation war of 1648 - 1654, the glorious koshovyi ataman (commandant of the headquarters of the Cossacks) of the Zaporizhian Sich, who used to organize successful campaigns against Crimean Khanate and Black Sea Turkish fortresses. Due to his inherent cleverness and great talent, became one of the most outstanding statesmen and diplomats of his time
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the composition similar to the whole Series of coins which embodies the National idea of the Unified Ukraine: next to the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the emblematic figures of Michael the Archistrategos and crowned lion are located, which are symbols of Kyiv and Lviv Cities. Circular inscriptions are split by baroque ornamentation: УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 2002, (Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnia/ 2002), the designation of precious metal - Ag 925 and its weight in fineness - 31,1.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse set in the string of beads there is depicted the battle scene of Cossack horsemen under the command of Ivan Sirko (on the right) pursuing their enemies depicted against the background of the moon. Between the coin edge and the semicircle of beads there is a conventionalized inscription: ІВАН СІРКО (Ivan Sirko), the year of death being at the bottom of the coin (1680)

name: Skating
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 19th Winter Olympic Games, which are to take place in Salt-Lake-City (USA) in 2002.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a semicircular conventionalized depiction of a snowflake fragment, upon which there are the inscriptions УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and the small National Emblem of Ukraine; below and on the right, against the mirror background there are inscriptions: on the silver coin -10 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2002 (10/ Hryvnia/ 2002), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse above and on the left, against the mirror background there is the conventionalized depiction of a skater; below and on the right, there is engraved a snowflake against whose background there are three-lined inscriptions: ХІХ ЗИМОВІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ / СОЛТ-ЛЕЙК-СІТІ / 2002 (19 th Winter Olympic Games/ Salt-Lake-City / 2002)

name: Skating Sport
generalDescription: The coin of 2 Hryvnia denomination is dedicated to the 19th Winter Olympic Games, which were held in Salt-Lake-City (USA) in 2002.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse on the he left there is a semicircular depiction of a conventionalized snowflake fragment with an inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) against its relief background and the small National Emblem of Ukraine; on the right, beneath against the smooth background there are inscriptions: 2 / ГРИВНІ / 2002 (2 hryvnia/ 2002) and there is the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse to the left on the background of a glass there is a silhouette depiction of a skater; to the right on the snowflake relief background there are three-lined inscriptions: ХІХ ЗИМОВІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ / СОЛТ-ЛЕЙК-СІТІ / 2002.

name: Kyivan Rus
category: Monuments of ancient cultures of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to one of the greatest early medieval states in Europe (9th - middle of 12th centuries), which appeared through unification of Eastern-Slavic tribes around Kyiv and Middle Dnipro basin
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the insert ring and against the background of rye ears there is depicted of a symbolic wheel of history with a falcon sitting on it, underneath it there is depicted a snake; above and to the left there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine; within the outer ring, there are depicted a Duke holding a model of a cathedral in his hands. At Duke`s feet there is a lying cheetah; on the right there are depicted a Duchess with sewing, as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint and the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА / 2000 / 20 / ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 20/ hryvnia/ 2000)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the insert ring there is depicted an old-Rus feminine adornment; within the outer ring there are depicted fragments of Kyivan ritual bracelet (12th c.- 13th c.) and the conventionalized inscription: КИЇВСЬКА РУСЬ (Kyivan Rus)

name: 10 Years of the Armed Forces of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 10th anniversary of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the internal ring set in the oak wreath and upon the glass background there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the crossed verges (symbols of hetman`s power in Cossak army) under it, 2001, the coin issue year and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine. Within the external ring there are circular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the internal ring there is a depiction of an equal-armed cross with broadened ends framed with the laurel wreath; in the centre of the cross there is a medallion with the picture of small National Emblem of Ukraine; in external ring there are circular inscriptions: ЗБРОЙНІ СИЛИ УКРАЇНИ, 10 РОКІВ (Armed Forces of Ukraine/ 10 Years)

name: Polish Larch (LARIX POLONICA RACIB)
generalDescription: Commemorative coin is dedicated to Larix Polonica Racib (Pinaceae family), a disappearing species of valuable conifer wood which is widespread in Ukrainian Carpathians and on the endangered-species list of Ukraine. Larix Polonica Racib is cultivated in forests, parks and botanical gardens, in particular, in Kedrynskyi and Skyt Maniavskyi forest reserves
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend: УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ, 2001 (Ukraine/ 2/ hryvnia/ 2001). On the coin there is also placed the logotype of the NBU Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a pine branch with a cone and the circular inscriptions: МОДРИНА ПОЛЬСЬКА (Polish Larch) - above and LARIX POLONICA RACIB - below.

name: Polish Larch (Larix Polonica Racib)
generalDescription: Commemorative coin is dedicated to Larix Polonica Racib ( Pinaceae family), a disappearing species of valuable conifer wood which is widespread in Ukrainian Carpathians and on the endangered-species list of Ukraine. Larix Polonica Racib is cultivated in forests, parks and botanical gardens, in particular, in Kedrynskyi and Skyt Maniavskyi forest reserves
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend: on the silver coin УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, 2001- (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/ 2001), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. On the coin there is also placed the logotype of the NBU Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a pine branch with a cone and the circular inscriptions: МОДРИНА ПОЛЬСЬКА (Polish Larch) - above and LARIX POLONICA RACIB - below

name: 200 Years of Volodymyr Dal
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 200th birth anniversary of Volodymyr Dal (1801-1872), a writer, ethnographer and the author of the well-known Russian language vocabulary. Dal came from Luhansk region, which was represented in his pseudonym: Cossak of Luhansk.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in its centre there is a composition made of books, roll, sheets of paper and inkstand with a pen; above there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine, around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ, 2001 (Ukraine/ 2001 /2 hryvnia) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted Volodymyr Dal`s portrait, beneath depicted is a pen under which there is the conventionalized inscription: КОЗАК ЛУГАНСЬКИЙ (Cossack of Luhansk). Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: ВОЛОДИМИР ДАЛЬ (Volodymyr Dal) and 1801-1872

name: Khan Palace in Bakhchyserai
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to an architectural monument of 16th-18th centuries - the palace ensemble with light galleries, marble fountains and splendid rooms which was the seat of Crimean and Tartar Khans (now it is the historical and architectural museum in the town of Bakhchyserai)
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the frame of an oriental ornament decorating the Golden Fountain (1733) there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a fragment of a marble fountain plate, and the four-line inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, 2001 (Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnia/ 2001), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. On the coin there is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted an inner court of the palace ensemble above which there is the date 16 - 18 centuries is depicted, as well as the inscriptions: ХАНСЬКИЙ ПАЛАЦ (Khan palace) above in circumference and БАХЧИСАРАЙ ( Bakhchyserai) - below.

name: Mykhailo Drahomanov
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 160th anniversary since the birth of Mykhailo Drahomanov (18.09.1841 - 20.06.1895), an outstanding Ukrainian politician, historian scientist, literary critic and ethnographer, who was born in Hadyach, Poltava region.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse at its centre within the frame of a conventionalized vegetable ornamental pattern there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four-line inscription: УКРАЇНА, 2001, 2, ГРИВНІ (Ukraine/ 2001 /2 hryvnia) and the Mint logo of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the circle there is a depiction of Mykhailo Drahomanov who sits leaning on a table with a book in his hand. Around the coin circumference there is an inscription: МИХАЙЛО ДРАГОМАНОВ 1841 - 1895 (Mykhailo Drahomanov)

name: 400 Years of the town of Krolevets
generalDescription: Jubilee coin of 5 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the town of Krolevets, the district centre of Sumy region, which was founded in 160. In 1644 the town obtained the Magdeburg Right. It is one of the trade centres broadly known through its decorative textiles and embroidered towels.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of a colonnade arch (the central entrance to the city recreation park), under it - a fragment of an ornamental pattern, which is used in Krolevetz embroidered towels; above there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine and the four line inscription: УКРАЇНА/ 2001/ 5/ ГРИВЕНЬ and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the town coat of arms within a frame of geometrical and vegetable ornament characteristic for Krolevets , as well as the inscriptions: above - 400 РОКІВ (400 Years) and beneath the conventionalized inscription of КРОЛЕВЕЦЬ (Krolevets)

name: 100 Years of Mykolayiv Zoo
generalDescription: Jubilee coin of 2 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to one of the oldest zoological gardens of Ukraine. Mykolayiv Zoo is a member of European Association of zoological gardens and aquariums and is one of the leading centres of preservation and breeding of animals in captivity. In this zoo there are over 360 species available.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of Mawglie with a panther (the Zoo logotype); on the right there is placed the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2001, 2, ГРИВНІ (Ukraine/ 2001/ 2 /hryvnia/) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are depicted representatives of fauna of all continents which live in the zoo and circular inscriptions: МИКОЛАЇВСЬКИЙ ЗООПАРК (Mykolaiv Zoo) (above), 100 РОКІВ (100 Years) (beneath).

name: 10 Years of the Declaration of Independence of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 10th Anniversary of the Independence Act adoption by the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine on August 24, 1991.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within in circle made of a string of beads there is depicted a composition which embodies the integrity of Ukraine - the small National Emblem of Ukraine framed with a vegetable ornament is supported by a lion and a Cossack holding a musket. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in circle made of a string of beads within against the background of the map of Ukraine there is depicted the structure of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and circular inscriptions: 10 РОКІВ НЕЗАЛЕЖНОСТІ УКРАЇНИ, 1991- 2001 (10 Years of Declaration of Independence of Ukraine/ 1991- 2001

name: Mykhailo Ostrohradskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 200 Years since the birth of Mykhailo Ostrohradskiy (24.09.1801-01.01.1862), an outstanding Ukrainian scientist-mathematician, a member of five Academies (Paris, St-Petersburg, Rome, Turin and USA) who was born in Pashenivka villiage of Poltava region. His main works are dedicated to mathematical analysis, theoretical mechanics and mathematical physics.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse at the centre there is depicted a set of integral curves in the frame of reference, as well as the small National Emblem of Ukraine, a four- line inscription: УКРАЇНА, (Ukraine) 2001, 2, ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia), and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Myhkailo Ostrohradskiy; to the left there is the fractional and rational function integral (the integration method of such functions is named after him), to the right there is a half-circular two-line inscription:1801-1862, МИХАЙЛО ОСТРОГРАДСЬКИЙ.

name: 10 Years of the Declaration of Independence of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 10th Anniversary of the Independence Act adoption by the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine on August 24, 1991.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within in circle made of a string of beads there is depicted a composition which embodies the integrity of Ukraine - the small National Emblem of Ukraine framed with a vegetable ornament is supported by a lion and a Cossack holding a musket. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: on the silver coin: УКРАЇНА, 20 ГРИВЕНЬ, 2001 (Ukraine/ 20 Hryvnia/ 2001), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. On the coin there is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in circle made of a string of beads within against the background of the map of Ukraine there is depicted the structure of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and circular inscriptions: 10 РОКІВ НЕЗАЛЕЖНОСТІ УКРАЇНИ, 1991- 2001 (10 Years of Declaration of Independence of Ukraine/ 1991- 2001)

name: 1100 Years of the city of Poltava
generalDescription: The coin of 5 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the ancient city first mentioned in Ipatiiv chronicle under the name of Ltava. The latest archeological findings testify that the city was founded in the 9th century. Under the present name the city was first mentioned in 1430. In the 17th century it was granted the Magdeburg Right
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the frame of vegetable ornamentation and outline of a heraldic shield there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the inscriptions: 2001, УКРАЇНА, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ(2001/ Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the coin upper part there is a panoramic picture of famous historic and architectural monuments of the city; in its lower - the city coat of arms within the frame of vegetable ornamentation, as well as inscriptions: ПОЛТАВА (Poltava) (above) and 1100 РОКІВ (1100 Years) (beneath).

name: 10 Years of the Declaration of Independence of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 10th Anniversary of the Independence Act adoption by the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine on August 24, 1991.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within in circle made of a string of beads there is depicted a composition which embodies the integrity of Ukraine - the small National Emblem of Ukraine framed with a vegetable ornament is supported by a lion and a Cossack holding a musket. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ, 2001 (Ukraine/ 5 Hryvnia/ 2001). On the coin there is also the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in circle made of a string of beads within against the background of the map of Ukraine there is depicted the structure of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and circular inscriptions: 10 РОКІВ НЕЗАЛЕЖНОСТІ УКРАЇНИ, 1991- 2001 (10 Years of the Declaration of Independence of Ukraine/ 1991- 2001)

name: Hockey
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 19 th Winter Olympic Games held in Salt-Lake-City (USA) in 2002.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a semicircular conventionalized depiction of a snowflake fragment, upon which there are the inscriptions УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and the small National Emblem of Ukraine; below and on the right, against the mirror background there are inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse, above and on the left, against the mirror background there is a conventionalized depiction of a hockey player; below and on the right there is engraved a snowflake against whose background there are inscriptions: ХІХ ЗИМОВІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ / СОЛТ-ЛЕЙК-СІТІ / 2002 (19th Winter Olympic Games/ Salt Lake City/ 2002

name: Hockey
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 19th Winter Olympic Games held in Salt Lake City (USA) in 2002
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a semicircular conventionalized depiction of a snowflake fragment, upon which there are the inscriptions УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and the small National Emblem of Ukraine; below and on the right, against the mirror background there are inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse to the left, on the background of a glass and a snowflake there is a

name: 5 Years of the Constitution of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the fundamental Law of Ukraine, adopted by the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine on 28 June, 1996
averseDescription: On the coin obverse, in its upper part there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine under which there is an inscription УКРАЇНА (Ukraine); between two fragments of a conventionalized vegetable- and flower-ornament there are the three line inscription: 2, ГРИВНІ, 2001 (2 /hryvnia/2001), and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the centre there is depicted an open book with the three line inscription: 5 РОКІВ КОНСТИТУЦІЇ (5 Years of the Constitution) within the frame of a vegetable composition of wheatears and cranberry sprays; above it there is the building of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine; beneath - 28 / ЧЕРВНЯ / 1996 (28/June/ 1996), the date of adoption of the Constitution

name: Kindness to Children
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Day of Children Protection
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the frame of an ornament made of vegetables and birds there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, above which there is the inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine). Underneath the Emblem there is the inscription: 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia). Below there is depicted a nest with three nestlings, underneath there is the coin issue year - 2001.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the composition centre there is a depiction of a stream uniting water, nature and the sun; on its both sides there are figures of a boy and a girl who are rejoicing over this life-giving stream; beneath there is an open book and a ribbon with the inscription ДОБРО - ДІТЯМ (Kindness to Children).

name: The Ostroh Academy
generalDescription: The сoin is dedicated to the Ostroh academy, the first Ukrainian high level school founded by Vasyl Konstiantyn Ostrozkyi in 1576. The Slavic, Greek and Latin languages were taught in the high school, as well as the so-called free sciences (Grammar, Arithmetic, Rhetoric, Logics, etc. The writer and scientist Meletii Smotrytskiy, hetman Petro Sahaidachnyi and other famous people were among the high school graduates. Ostroh academy was closely linked to the printing-house, where works of the school tutors were printed and in 1581 Ivan Fedorov printed here the Bible a.k.a. the Ostroh Bible
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in its upper part there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine and beneath there are depicted: printing attributes: a galley, printing-press and a cutting tool - to the right and a roll with a seal and an inkstand - to the left and the four line inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ, 2001 (Ukraine/ 2001/ 5 / hryvnia) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the centre of the composition there is a depiction of a teacher and students; against the background there are the Round tower and church outlines. The general background combining this picture is the first page of the Ostroh ABC book printed at Ivan Fedorov`s printing house; to the left there is the family emblem of the prince Vasyl K.Ostrozhskiy and a semicircular inscription: ОСТРОЗЬКА АКАДЕМІЯ (Ostroh academy), and beneath, there is the Academy foundation date - 1576

name: LYNX LYNX
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Lynx lynx, which belongs to Carnivore species. This precious furry animal inhabits mostly the Ukrainian Carpathians. Its small population is preserved in the woods which are difficult of access in Manevytskyi district of Volyn region. Lynx is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a lynx depiction with a lynx-cub sitting on a twig and circular inscriptions: above - РИСЬ ЗВИЧАЙНА, beneath - LYNX LYNX.

name: Lynx lynx
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Lynx lynx, which belongs to Carnivore species. This precious furry animal inhabits mostly the Ukrainian Carpathians. Its small population is preserved in the woods which are difficult of access in Manevytskyi district of Volyn region. Lynx is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a lynx depiction with a lynx-cub sitting on a twig and circular inscriptions: above - РИСЬ ЗВИЧАЙНА, beneath - LYNX LYNX.

name: 10 Years of the National Bank of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the central bank of Ukraine, the only issuing centre of the state, which carries out consistent monetary policy and secures the efficient operation of the banking system of Ukraine and stability of the national monetary unit -Hryvnia
averseDescription: On the coin obverse between two ornamental slits there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions: on the silver coin: УКРАЇНА, 2001, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnia 2001), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness. There is also the depiction of the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the facade of the bank`s capital building (architects: O.Kobeliev and O.Verbytskyi) above the building there is depicted the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine and the circular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and below: 10 РОКІВ (10 years).

name: 10 Years of the National Bank of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the central bank of Ukraine, the only issuing centre of the state, which carries out consistent monetary policy and secures the efficient operation of the banking system of Ukraine and stability of the national monetary unit -Hryvnia
averseDescription: On the coin obverse between two ornamental slits there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions: on the German silver coin: УКРАЇНА, 2001, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 5 Hryvnia/ 2001). There is also the depiction of the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the facade of the bank`s capital building (architects: O.Kobeliev and O.Verbytskyi) above the building there is depicted the logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine and the circular inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine) and below: 10 РОКІВ (10 years)

name: On the Verge of Millenniums
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to transition of mankind to the third millennium, which is associated with people`s expectations of peace, mutual understanding and prosperity
