averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the inset ring and against the mirror background there are depicted the spirals in the form of an egg which symbolizes the powerful life-giving breath. Within the outer ring there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the circular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ, 2001 (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia/ 2001) and the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the insert ring there is a depiction of a Mother-woman with a baby. The composition symbolizes continuity and perpetuity of life. Within the outer ring there are depicted a symbolic star (above) and the circular inscriptions: НА МЕЖI ТИСЯЧОЛIТЬ (On the Verge of Millenniums)

name: Yaroslav the Wise
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Yaroslav the Wise (1015-1054), the Great Kyivan Prince and statesman, during whose reign the Kyivan Rus had strengthened and expanded its borders; the international position of the state was reinforced; the Kyiv archdiocese was founded; the legal code of the Old Rus state was developed; the old-Rus culture had reached the peak of its development
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the frame of old-Rus ornament recreated from the pattern on the Yaroslav the Wise`s sarcophagus, there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the conventionalized inscriptions: 2001 / УКРАЇНА / 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia), the indication of the metal, its fineness, as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the Yaroslav the Wise, holding the Kyiv Rus Code of Laws in his hand with the inscriptions: `ПРАВДА РУСЬСКАЯ` (Pravda/ Russkaia). On the left there is the mosaic depiction of Orante face and on the right there is depicted a cathedral. There are the conventionalized inscriptions: ЯРОСЛАВ / 1015 / МУДРИЙ / 1054 / (Yaroslav/ 1015/ the Wise/ 1054) - above, and КНЯЖА УКРАЇНА (Princes of Ukraine) - below.

name: Ivan Mazepa
generalDescription: Commemorative coin is dedicated to Ivan Mazepa (1687-1709), the Hetman of the Left-Bank Ukraine, a well-known public and political figure, patron of education and art, the person of hard and dramatic fate, who tried to conduct prudent but consistent policy, geared to winning of independence of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the composition similar to the whole Series of coins which embodies the National idea of the Unified Ukraine: next to the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the emblematic figures of Michael the Archistrategos and crowned lion are located, which are symbols of Kyiv and L`viv Cities. Circular inscriptions are split by baroque ornamentation: УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 2001, (Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnia/ 2001), the designation of precious metal - Ag 925 and its weight in fineness - 31,
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the circle made of a string of beads there are depicted a portrait of the Hetman with a bulava (Hetman`s baton); his family Coat of arms on the right and a cathedral on the left. There are circular conventionalized inscriptions: ІВАН МАЗЕПА (Ivan Mazepa) (and 1644-1709

name: Scythia
category: Monuments of ancient cultures of Ukraine
generalDescription: Commemorative coin of 20 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to a great union of Scythian cattle-breeding and settled tribes (7th century B.C. - 3d century A.D.) which inhabited the steppe and forest-step regions of today` Ukraine. The political union of Scythian tribes played important role in the life of the south-western Europe and the northern Black Sea regions
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the insert ring and against the background of rye ears there is depicted of a symbolic wheel of history with a falcon sitting on it, underneath it there is depicted a snake; above and to the left there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine; within the outer ring, there are depicted a Scythian warrior with a bowl in his hand (on the left) and a Scythian queen holding a mirror (on the right), as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint and the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА / 2000 / 20 / ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 20/ hryvnia/ 2000)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the insert ring there is a depiction of a archeological find (7th beginning of 6th centuries B.C.) a Scythian plate which decorated a female headdress; within the outer ring there are conventionalized depictions made in so-called Scythian animal style and the inscription: СКІФІЯ (Scythia)

name: Ice Dancing
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 19th Winter Olympic Games held in Salt Lake City (USA) in 2002
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a semicircular conventionalized depiction of a snowflake fragment, upon which there are the inscriptions УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and the small National Emblem of Ukraine; below and on the right, against the mirror background there are inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse, above and on the left, against the mirror background there is a conventionalized depiction of a couple of dancing figure skaters; below and on the right there is engraved a snowflake against whose background there are inscriptions: ХІХ ЗИМОВІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ / СОЛТ-ЛЕЙК-СІТІ / 2002 (19th Winter Olympic Games/ Salt Lake City/ 2002)

name: Ice Dancing
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 19th Winter Olympic Games held in Salt Lake City (USA) in 2002
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a semicircular conventionalized depiction of a snowflake fragment, upon which there are the inscriptions УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and the small National Emblem of Ukraine; below and on the right, against the mirror background there are inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse, above and on the left, against the mirror background there is a conventionalized depiction of a couple of dancing figure skaters; below and on the right there is engraved a snowflake against whose background there are inscriptions: ХІХ ЗИМОВІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ / СОЛТ-ЛЕЙК-СІТІ / 2002 (19th Winter Olympic Games/ Salt Lake City/ 2002)

name: ТИСЯЧОЛІТЬ (On the Verge of Millenniums) (2000)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to transition of mankind to the third millennium, which is associated with people`s expectations of peace, mutual understanding and prosperity
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of a mirror there is depicted the vivid three-petal ornament formed by three semicircles, symbolizing the triunity of the past, the present and the future. In the middle of this ornament there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine. Among the petals there are circular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ, 2000 (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia/ 2000) and the logotype of the Mint of the National bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a conventionalized figure of a sower, who is walking along a tillage and sowing the seeds of the `rational, good and eternal` for those people who will live in the next millennium. Around the circle there is an inscription: НА МЕЖІ ТИСЯЧОЛІТЬ (On the Verge of Millenniums)

name: Olbia
category: Monuments of ancient cultures of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the city-state Olbia, one of the most important centres of ancient material and spiritual culture of Northern and North-Western Region of the Black Sea coast, which was founded at the beginning of 6th century B.C. in the Lower Bug basin region and existed for about 1000 years. There was in the city quite original coin production, manufacturing cast copper dolphin-figures and arrows, which served as legal tender
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the insert ring and against the background of rye ears there is depicted of a symbolic wheel of history with a falcon sitting on it, underneath it there is depicted a snake; above and to the left there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine; within the outer ring, there are depicted a potter (on the left) right, a woman with children against the background of a Greek column (on the right), as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint and the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА / 2000 / 20 / ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 20/ hryvnia/ 2000).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the insert ring there is a depiction of an Olbian gold coin; within the outer ring there are depicted the ornament and patterns of vase painting, which were characteristic for that period, as well as the inscription: ОЛЬВІЯ (Olbia)

name: 2600 Years of the town of Kerch
generalDescription: Jubilee coin of 5 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to 2600th anniversary of the town of Kerch, which was founded in the 6th century B.C. by ancient Greeks and was called Pantikapaeum (the capital of the Bosporus Kingdom in the 5-6th centuries B.C.). Due to its favorable geo-political location the town was trade, cultural and crafts center, it also minted its own coins
averseDescription: On the coin obverse at its upper part there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine; on the background of the Mitrydat hill there is a bracelet made of archeological finds of Kul-Oba kurgan; on the hill both sides there are conventionalized depictions of Black and Azov Seas, as well as inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) 2000, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ (5/Hryvnias) and the Mint logotype of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse at the center there is a depiction of the ionic order column, a monument in the town of Kerch; above the column there are coins of Pantikapaeum, on the column left side against the background of a town landscape there is the church of John the Baptist, the monument of 10th-14th century; on the column right side there are stairs leading to the Mitrydat hill and semicircular inscriptions: КЕРЧ 2600 (Kerch/ 2600

name: Paleolith
category: Monuments of ancient cultures of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Paleolith, the eldest epoch in the history of mankind - the Stone Age- (in Ukraine - about 1 mln -10 thou years ago), which was the basis for development of the world civilization and culture. At the end of Paleolith period almost the whole territory of Ukraine had been developed. Cultural objects of note of that period testified to the rise of art and origin of first primary religious beliefs (Kamiyana Mohyla in Zaporizhia region, Mizyn site of late Paleolith period in Chernihiv region).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the insert ring and against the background of rye ears there is depicted of a symbolic wheel of history with a falcon sitting on it, underneath it there is depicted a snake; above and to the left there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine; within the outer ring, there is depicted a human being (to the left) and a stone structure (to the right), as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint and the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА / 2000 / 20 / ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 20/ hryvnia/ 2000).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the insert ring there is depicted a carved Mizyn bracelet made of mammoth tusk; within the outer ring there are petroglyphic drawings of primitives and the conventionalized inscription: ПАЛЕОЛІТ (Paleolith).

name: Trypillia
category: Monuments of ancient cultures of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Trypillia culture, one of the brightest agricultural and cattle-breeding cultures of Neolithic (4th - 3d century B.C.). Archeological finds of this culture are the important historical sources for those who study Old European history. The name originates from the settlement of the same name in Kyiv region, investigated at the end of 19th century
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the centre of the insert ring and against the background of rye ears there is depicted of a symbolic wheel of history with a falcon sitting on it, underneath it there is depicted a snake; above and to the left there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine; within the outer ring, there are depicted a herdboy (on the left) and a girl with ears in her hands (on the right), as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint and the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА / 2000 / 20 / ГРИВЕНЬ (Ukraine/ 20/ hryvnia/ 2000).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the insert ring there is depicted a clay antroph-amorphous statuette from Volodymyrivka (a settlement in Kirovograd region); within the outer ring there is depicted specimens of ware of Trypillia culture and the conventionalized inscription: ТРИПІЛЛЯ (Trypillia).

name: Kateryna Bilokur
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the birth centenary of Kateryna Bilokur (1900-1961), the glorious daughter of Ukrainian people, People`s artist of Ukraine, who devoted all her life to flowers, immortalizing them on her canvases, regarding them as eyes of the Earth, as her children
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine, a floral field, made to the motives of artist`s canvases, as well as the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, (Ukraine) 2000, 2, ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia) and the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is an artist`s half-length portrait, created to the motives of her self-portrait and circular inscriptions: КАТЕРИНА БІЛОКУР (Kateryna Bilokur) and 1900-1961.

name: 55 years of Victory in the Second World War
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 55th anniversary of the Victory in the Second World War of 1941-1945.
averseDescription: On the obverse of coins of both types there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine set in the wreath of soldier glory with Georgian ribbon and the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ, 2000 (Ukraine/ 2/ hryvnia/ 2000).
reverseDescription: On the reverse of coins of both types there is a symbolic depiction of Victory - a female figure with a olive branch against the background of the terrestrial globe framed with laurel branches and the circular inscriptions,: 55 РОКІВ ПЕРЕМОГИ У ВЕЛИКІЙ ВІТЧИЗНЯНІЙ ВІЙНІ (55 years of Victory in the Second World War) and 1941-1945, separated by solar marks.

name: the Lviv Opera and Ballet Theatre
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Lviv National Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre named after Ivan Franko, one of the outstanding centers of Ukrainian opera and ballet school
averseDescription: On the obverse coins of both types there are depicted: the small National Emblem of Ukraine, engraved the lyre between the Comedy and the Tragedy sculptors decorating the theatre interior, on the right there is the logotype of the NBU Mint and inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the reverse of coins of both types there is a depiction of the theatre building and circular inscriptions: ЛЬВІВСЬКИЙ ТЕАТР ОПЕРИ ТА БАЛЕТУ (the Lviv Opera and Ballet Theatre) - above, and 100, РОКІВ (100/years) - below.

name: (the Lviv Opera and Ballet Theatre
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Lviv National Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre named after Ivan Franko, one of the outstanding centers of Ukrainian opera and ballet school
averseDescription: On the obverse coins of both types there are depicted: the small National Emblem of Ukraine, engraved the lyre between the Comedy and the Tragedy sculptors decorating the theatre interior, on the right there is the logotype of the NBU Mint and inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the reverse of coins of both types there is a depiction of the theatre building and circular inscriptions: ЛЬВІВСЬКИЙ ТЕАТР ОПЕРИ ТА БАЛЕТУ (the Lviv Opera and Ballet Theatre) - above, and 100, РОКІВ (100/years) - below.

name: Baptizing of Rus
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the official establishment of Christianity as the state religion in Kiyv Rus. Volodymyr the Great and his nearest milieu adopted Christianity at the beginning of 988. In spring that year the kievites were baptized. It initiated the process of baptizing of the whole country.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine between two figures of angels and the following legend:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the foreground there is placed a cruciform composition depicting the Prince Volodymyr the Baptist (Volodymyr the Great) against the background of the scene of kievites baptizing and the conventionalized inscription: ХРЕЩЕННЯ РУСІ (Baptizing of Rus)

name: Baptizing of Rus
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the official establishment of Christianity as the state religion in Kiyv Rus. Volodymyr the Great and his nearest milieu adopted Christianity at the beginning of 988. In spring that year the kievites were baptized. It initiated the process of baptizing of the whole country.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine between two figures of angels and the following legend: on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА and 5 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2000, (Ukraine/ 5/ hryvnia/ 2000), as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint is placed
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the foreground there is placed a cruciform composition depicting the Prince Volodymyr the Baptist (Volodymyr the Great) against the background of the scene of kievites baptizing and the conventionalized inscription: ХРЕЩЕННЯ РУСІ (Baptizing of Rus)

name: Baptizing of Rus
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the official establishment of Christianity as the state religion in Kiyv Rus. Volodymyr the Great and his nearest milieu adopted Christianity at the beginning of 988. In spring that year the kievites were baptized. It initiated the process of baptizing of the whole country.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine between two figures of angels and the following legend on the silver coin - УКРАЇНА and 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 2000, (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/ 2000), and indication of the metal, its fineness - Ag 925 and the coin weight in fineness 31,1, as well as the logotype of the NBU Mint is placed.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the foreground there is placed a cruciform composition depicting the Prince Volodymyr the Baptist (Volodymyr the Great) against the background of the scene of kievites baptizing and the conventionalized inscription: ХРЕЩЕННЯ РУСІ (Baptizing of Rus)

name: Volodymyr the Great
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Great Kievan Prince and statesman, during whose reign the formation of the old-Rus state was completed and the Christianity as the state religion was introduced.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the frame of old-Rus ornamental pattern there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the conventionalized inscription: 2000 / УКРАЇНА / 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ, (Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia/ 2000), as well as indication of the metal, its fineness - Ag 925 and the coin weight in fineness 31,1 and the logotype of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the foreground there are depicted the Prince Volodymyr against the background of the scene of baptism of the the prince himself and the conventionalized inscriptions: 978 ВОЛОДИМИР (Volodymyr) 1015 (above), КНЯЖА УКРАЇНА (Princes of Ukraine) - below

name: 125 Years of the Chernivtsi State University
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to one of the leading high schools of Ukraine - the Chernivtsi State University named after Jurii Fedkovich.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine framed with the ornamental cartouches depicting stucco ceiling of the main university building, the logotype of the NBU Mint and the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2000, 2 ГРИВНІ. (Ukraine/ 2000/ 2 /hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of the main university facade (architect Joseph Hlavka) within the vaulted opening and two lines inscriptions: ЧЕРНІВЕЦЬКИЙ ДЕРЖАВНИЙ УНІВЕРСИТЕТ 125 років (125 Years of the Chernivtsi State University)

name: Freshwater Crab (POTAMON TAURICUM)
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the relic species - the only representative of Potamon Tauricum in the fauna of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a freshwater crab, a snail in the seaweeds and the circular inscriptions: ПРІСНОВОДНИЙ КРАБ / (Freshwater Crab) and POTAMON TAURICUM.

name: Freshwater Crab (Potamon Tauricum)
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the relic species - the only representative of Potamon Tauricum in the fauna of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted a freshwater crab, a snail in the seaweeds and the circular inscriptions: ПРІСНОВОДНИЙ КРАБ / (Freshwater Crab) and POTAMON TAURICUM.

name: Oles Honchar
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the distinguished Ukrainian writer and public figure Oles Honchar (1918 -1995).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there are depicted sunflowers, the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the logotype of the NBU Mint and inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ, 2000 (Ukraine/ 2 /hryvnia/ 2000)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a bust of the writer, on the left - a cathedral and the conventionalized inscriptions: СОБОРИ ДУШ СВОЇХ БЕРЕЖІТЬ! ОЛЕСЬ ГОНЧАР (protect/ your sole/ temples/ Oles/ Honchar (facsimile) 1918 -1995

name: Calisthenics
generalDescription: Commemorative coins of 2 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the 27th Olympic Games held in 2000 in Sydney (Australia).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine against the background of the unfolded banner crossed with ribbon depicting various sports and the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА / 2 / ГРИВНІ / 2000 (Ukraine/ 2000 / 2 hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a female gymnast and the inscriptions: СІДНЕЙ 2000 (Sydney 2000) and XXVII / ЛІТНІ / ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ / ІГРИ (27th Olympic Games)

name: Sailing
generalDescription: Commemorative coins of 2 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the 27th Olympic Games, which were held in Sydney (Australia). in 2000
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine against the background of the unfolded banner crossed with ribbon depicting various sports and the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА / 2 / ГРИВНІ / 2000 (Ukraine/ 2000 / 2 hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a yachtsman and the inscriptions: СІДНЕЙ 2000 (Sydney 2000) and XXVII / ЛІТНІ / ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ / ІГРИ (27th Olympic Games)

name: Bilhorod-Dnistrovskyi
generalDescription: The coin of 5 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the 2500th anniversary of the city of Bilhorod-Dnistrovskyi. It was founded in 6th century B.C by ancient Greeks as the city-state Tyre which became the principal economic and cultural center of the Northern Black Sea Region.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the frame of the old Greek ornament and the heraldic cartouche there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine and the conventionalized inscriptions: 2000, УКРАЇНА, 5, ГРИВЕНЬ, as well as the first logotype depiction of the Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine Mint.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse at its upper part there is the picture of Akerman fortress of the 15th century from the Citadel and Commandant Tower side. Below there is the semi-circular depiction of Akerman`s emblem among the coins of Tyre of the 4th century B.C. - 3d century A.C., there are the conventionalized inscriptions: БІЛГОРОД-ДНІСТРОВСЬКИЙ (Bilhorod-Dnistrovskyi) and 2500 / РОКІВ (2500 /Years).

name: Triple Jump
generalDescription: Commemorative coin Triple Jump is dedicated to the 27th-Summer Olympic Games in Sydney (Australia) in 2000.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the silver coin against the background of an unfolded cloth there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a five line legend: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), CITIUS ALTIUS FORTIUS, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1999 (10 Hryvnia/1999), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins there are depicted a jumping sportswoman and the inscriptions: СІДНЕЙ (Sydney) 2000 and XXVII / ЛІТНІ / ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ / ІГРИ (XXVII/Summer/Olympic/Games)

name: Parallel Bars
generalDescription: Commemorative coin Parallel Bars is dedicated to the 27th-Summer Olympic Games in Sydney (Australia) in 2000.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the silver coin against the background of an unfolded cloth there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a five line legend: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), CITIUS ALTIUS FORTIUS, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1999 (10 Hryvnia/1999), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are a depiction of an athlete on parallel bars and a five line legend: XXVII ЛІТНІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ, СІДНЕЙ 2000 (XXVII/Summer/Olympic/Games/2000)

name: 55 Years of Victory in the Second World War
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 55th anniversary of the Victory in the Second World War of 1941-1945.
averseDescription: On the obverse of coins of both types there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine set in the wreath of soldier glory with Georgian ribbon and the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ, 2000 (Ukraine/ 2/ hryvnia/ 2000
reverseDescription: On the reverse of coins of both types there is a symbolic depiction of Victory - a female figure with a olive branch against the background of the terrestrial globe framed with laurel branches and the circular inscriptions,: 55 РОКІВ ПЕРЕМОГИ У ВЕЛИКІЙ ВІТЧИЗНЯНІЙ ВІЙНІ (55 years of Victory in the Second World War) and 1941-1945, separated by solar marks.

name: Vikentii Khvoika
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 150th birth anniversary of Vikentii Khvoika (1900-1993), an outstanding Ukrainian archeologist, the discoverer of Trypillia (4-2 milleniums B.C.), Zarubynetska (3 century B.C.- 4 century A.D.) and Chernyakhivska (2-7 centuries A.D.) civilizations, as well as Scythian and Eastern-Slavic artefacts. He is one of the founders of the Kyiv Municipal Museum (now - the National Museum of the History of Ukraine).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the concentric circles separated by solar marks there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine set in the ceramics of the Trypillia culture discovered by Vikentii Khvoika during his archeological investigations. On the coin there is a conventionalized four-line inscription: УКРАЇНА, 2000, ДВІ, ГРИВНІ . (Ukraine/ 2000/ 2 /hryvnia).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a bust of the scientist and the circular conventionalized inscriptions: ВІКЕНТІЙ ХВОЙКА (Vikentii Khvoika) and 1850-1914.

name: Ivan Kozlovskyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the birth centenary of the outstanding Ukrainian and Russian opera singer, Ivan Kozlovskyi (1900-1993).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a lyre against the background of a flower design and the legend: 2000, УКРАЇНА, 2, ГРИВНІ. (2000/ Ukraine/ 2 /hryvnia). Above there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a profile portrait of the singer and the circular inscription: 1900, ІВАН КОЗЛОВСЬКИЙ, 1993 (1900/ Kozlovskyi/ 1993)

name: Petro Sahaidachnyi
generalDescription: Commemorative coin is dedicated to the Hetman of the Ukrainian Registered Cossacks in 1614-1616 and in 1620-1622 Petro Sahaidachnyi, an outstanding military leader, diplomat, advocate of the national culture and education.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the composition similar to the whole Series of coins which embodies the National idea of the Unified Ukraine: next to the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the emblematic figures of Michael the Archistrategos and crowned lion are located, which are symbols of Kyiv and L`viv Cities. Circular inscriptions are split by baroque ornamentation: УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 2000, (Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnia/ 2000), the designation of precious metal - Ag 925 and its weight in fineness - 31,
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are depicted a battle scene on the Black Sea, oval Hetman`s portrait, date of his death and the circular conventionalized inscription: ПЕТРО КОНАШЕВИЧ САГАЙДАЧНИЙ (Petro Konashevych Sahaidachny)

name: Olha
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the princess Olha (about 910-969) - the governor of the Kyiv state in 945-964. She carried out the state reform and organized strong points of Kyiv central power and legal procedure throughout the country which contributed to the formation of the Old-Rus state. In foreign policy Olha continued the course initiated by Ascold. She was baptized in Constantinople in 955. She used to invite European priests to Kyiv to spread Christianity. Princess Ohga was canonized by the Orthodox church (Christian name Olena).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the frame of the old-Rus ornament of the Princess Olha`s sarcophagus from the Tirth church there is the depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions: 2000 / УКРАЇНА / 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ , (2000/ Ukraine/ 10/ hryvnia), аs well as designation of metal, its fineness, and the coin weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of the historical scene depicting the reception of the Princess Olha by the Emperor Constantine, there is a ceremonial portrait of the Princess Olha and the conventionalized inscriptions: ОЛЬГА and 945-964 (945, Olha, 964) - above, and КНЯЖА / УКРАЇНА (Princes of Ukraine) -below.

name: Christmas
generalDescription: The coin of 10 hryvnia denomination is dedicated to the 2000th anniversary of Christmas
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine between two figures of angels and the following legends: УКРАЇНА 10 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 1999, (Ukraine/ 10/hryvnia/1999, as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the frame of symbolic geometric figures there is pictured the birth of Jesus Christ according to the Bible. The Blessed Virgin with the baby in the aureole of the Bethlehem star is surrounded by the domestic animals and The Three Wise Men with gifts

name: Christmas
generalDescription: The coin of 50 hryvnia denomination is dedicated to the 2000th anniversary of Christmas
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine between two figures of angels and the following legends: УКРАЇНА 50 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 1999 (Ukraine/ 50/hryvnia/1999, as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the frame of symbolic geometric figures there is pictured the birth of Jesus Christ according to the Bible. The Blessed Virgin with the baby in the aureole of the Bethlehem star is surrounded by the domestic animals and The Three Wise Men with gifts.

name: Christmas
generalDescription: The coin of 5 hryvnia denomination is dedicated to the 2000th anniversary of Christmas
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine between two figures of angels and the following legend: УКРАЇНА 5 / ГРИВЕНЬ / 1999 (Ukraine/ 5 /hryvnia/1999).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse within the frame of symbolic geometric figures there is pictured the birth of Jesus Christ according to the Bible. The Blessed Virgin with the baby in the aureole of the Bethlehem star is surrounded by the domestic animals and The Three Wise Men with gifts.

name: Garden Dormouse (ELIOMYS QUERCINUS)
generalDescription: Commemorative coin is dedicated to the only species of dormouse (Eliomys Quercinus) in the fauna of Ukraine, which is occasionally met in pine and deciduous forests of plains, mountains and in the gardens Woodlands and Forest-steppes (Rivno, Kyiv and Cherkasy regions).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a picture of a garden dormouse sitting on a raspberry twig and the circular legend: СОНЯ САДОВА (Garden Dormouse) and ELIOMYS QUERCINUS.

name: Garden Dormouse (ELIOMYS QUERCINUS)
generalDescription: Commemorative coin is dedicated to the only species of dormouse (Eliomys Quercinus) in the fauna of Ukraine, which is occasionally met in pine and deciduous forests of plains, mountains and in the gardens Woodlands and Forest-steppes (Rivno, Kyiv and Cherkasy regions).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of an enlarged orchid flower, to its left there is a flower stem with two leaves and inflorescence; to its right there On the coin reverse there is a picture of a garden dormouse sitting on a raspberry twig and the circular legend: СОНЯ САДОВА (Garden Dormouse) and ELIOMYS QUERCINUS.

name: 500 Years of the Magdeburg Right in Kyiv
generalDescription: Coins are dedicated to the 500th anniversary of introduction of the Magdeburg Right in Kyiv. Kyiv had been governed by the Magdeburg Right from the early 15th century. One of the charters of the Grand Lithuanian Duke Olexander of 1499 confirmed the effect of legal municipal regulations, in accordance with which the towndwellers were governed by the members of the elective self-government and the court. The Magdeburg Right was effective in Kyiv till December 23, 1834
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine in the ornament created on the motives of the designs of official seals of Kyiv city council of the 17th century.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of the monument to the Magdeburg Right in the city of Kyiv by the architect A.Melensky (1802-1808). There are the following inscriptions: МАГДЕБУРЗЬКЕ ПРАВО КИЄВА and 500 РОКІВ (Magdeburg Right in Kyiv

name: 500 Years of the Magdeburg Right in Kyiv
generalDescription: Coins are dedicated to the 500th anniversary of introduction of the Magdeburg Right in Kyiv. Kyiv had been governed by the Magdeburg Right from the early 15th century. One of the charters of the Grand Lithuanian Duke Olexander of 1499 confirmed the effect of legal municipal regulations, in accordance with which the towndwellers were governed by the members of the elective self-government and the court. The Magdeburg Right was effective in Kyiv till December 23, 1834
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine in the ornament created on the motives of the designs of official seals of Kyiv city council of the 17th century.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of the monument to the Magdeburg Right in the city of Kyiv by the architect A.Melensky (1802-1808). There are the following inscriptions: МАГДЕБУРЗЬКЕ ПРАВО КИЄВА and 500 РОКІВ (Magdeburg Right in Kyiv).

name: 55 Years of Liberation of Ukraine from Fascist Invaders
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to commemorate 55 Years of liberation of Ukraine from Nazis, to honour those people who took part in military operation, disabled veterans of the war of 1941-1945, labour veterans, to remember the blessed memory of those perished in the struggle against fascism.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine framed with wheatears and the semicircular inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, 1999. (Ukraine/ 1999 / 2 hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a laurel spray - symbol of glory, blade of a sword, salute stars and the inscription: 55, РОКІВ, ВИЗВОЛЕННЯ, УКРАЇНИ, ВІД ФАШИСТСЬКИХ, ЗАГАРБНИКІВ (55 / Years/ of Liberation/ of Ukraine/ from Fascist/ Invaders)

name: Anatolii Solovianenko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Anatolii Solovianenko (1932-1999), a People`s artist of Ukraine, one of the best opera singers of the XX century.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine framed with cranbery sprays and inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, 1999 (Ukraine/ 2 /hryvnia/ 1999).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of a singer`s profile portrait. Around the coin circumference there is an inscription: АНАТОЛІЙ СОЛОВ`ЯНЕНКО, (Anatolii Solovianenko), 1932-1999.

name: Petro Doroshenko
generalDescription: Commemorative coin is dedicated to Petro Doroshenko, the outstanding hetman of the Ukrainian Cossack state
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the composition similar to the whole Series of coins which embodies the National idea of the Unified Ukraine: next to the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the emblematic figures of Michael the Archistrategos and crowned lion are located, which are symbols of Kyiv and L`viv Cities. Circular inscriptions are split by baroque ornamentation: УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1999, (Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnia/ 1999), the designation of precious metal - Ag 925 and its weight in fineness - 31,1.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the circle made of a string of beads, there is a depiction of a riding hetman dressed in a festive military attire; on the right there is the Coat of arms of Doroshenko`s family (artist H.Narbut, 1914). There are conventionalized circular inscriptions: ПЕТРО ДОРОШЕНКО (Petro Doroshenko) and 1627-1698

name: (Butterfly Orchid) and PLATANTHERA BIFOLIA
generalDescription: Commemorative coin is dedicated to a rare species of European orchid in Ukrainian partially-wooded steppe zone, which is entered to the Red Book of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of an enlarged orchid flower, to its left there is a flower stem with two leaves and inflorescence; to its right there are the circular inscriptions: ЛЮБКА ДВОЛИСТА (Butterfly Orchid) and PLATANTHERA BIFOLIA

name: Butterfly Orchid (PLATANTHERA BIFOLIA)
generalDescription: Commemorative coin is dedicated to a rare species of European orchid in Ukrainian partially-wooded steppe zone, which is entered to the Red Book of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of images of plants and animals there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of an enlarged orchid flower, to its left there is a flower stem with two leaves and inflorescence; to its right there are the circular inscriptions: ЛЮБКА ДВОЛИСТА (Butterfly Orchid) and PLATANTHERA BIFOLIA.

name: Askold
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Prince Askold (?-882), the ruler of the Kyiv state.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within a frame of an old-Rus pattern ornament there are depicted the sall National Emblem of Ukraine and the conventionalized inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, 1999 (Ukraine/ 10/hryvnia/1999) and the designation of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a roll there is depicted the Prince, who leads his men at armsto a sea campaign. There are the following conventionalized inscriptions on the coin: АСКОЛЬД ІХ ст.( Askold / ІХc.) and КНЯЖА, УКРАЇНА (Princes of Ukraine)

name: 900 years of the Novgorod-Siversk Principality
generalDescription: The coin of 5 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to 900 years of the Novgorod-Siversk Principality founded at the Liubetsk convention of old Rus princes. The campaign of the Novgorod-Siversk prince Igor against Polovtsi in 1185 was famed in the `Legend on Igor`s Regiment`, the outstanding work of the old-Rus and world literature
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the sun circle there are depicted the Small National emblem of Ukraine, disturbed birds and the conventionalized inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 hryvnia), 1999
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against an old Rus fortress there is the chronicle depiction of the prince`s troops during the march and the conventionalized circular inscription: НОВГОРОД-СІВЕРСЬКОМУ КНЯЗІВСТВУ 900 РОКІВ ( 900 years of the Novgorod-Siversk Principality)

name: 100 Years of the National Mining Academy of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 100th Anniversary of the National Mining Academy of Ukraine in the city of Dnipropetrovsk, which was founded as Katerynoslav High Mining School
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine in the circle made of beads, set in cranberry bush sprays and the conventionalized inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, 1999 (Ukraine/ 2/ hryvnia/ 1999).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is depicted the Academy main building`s facade (architect Olexander Beketov, 1900) and the following inscriptions: 100 РОКІВ (100 Years) and НАЦІОНАЛЬНА ГІРНИЧА АКАДЕМІЯ УКРАЇНИ (the National Mining Academy of Ukraine)

name: Panas Myrnyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 150th anniversary of Panas Myrnyi (P.Y.Rudchenko, 1849-1920), an outstanding democratic writer, author of the well-known realistic works: `How Can Bullocks Bellow while a Manger Full is?` `Lymerivna`, `Hungry Freedom`, `Streetwalker`, etc.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine in the centre of the circle made of beads, set in cranberry bush sprays and the conventionalized inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, 1999 (Ukraine/ 2/ hryvnia/ 1999).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of the writer`s portrait surrounded by the conventionalized inscriptions: ПАНАС МИРНИЙ (П.Я.РУДЧЕНКО) (Panas Myrnyi (P.Y.Rudchenko), 1849 and 1920 and his facsimile

name: Parallel Bars
generalDescription: Commemorative coin Parallel Bars is dedicated to the 27th-Summer Olympic Games in Sydney (Australia) in 2000.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the silver coin against the background of an unfolded cloth there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a five line legend: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), CITIUS ALTIUS FORTIUS, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1999 (10 Hryvnia/1999), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are a depiction of an athlete on parallel bars and a five line legend: XXVII ЛІТНІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ, СІДНЕЙ 2000 (XXVII/Summer/Olympic/Games/2000)

name: Triple Jump
generalDescription: Commemorative coin Triple Jump is dedicated to the 27th-Summer Olympic Games in Sydney (Australia) in 2000.
averseDescription: On the obverse of the silver coin against the background of an unfolded cloth there are depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a five line legend: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), CITIUS ALTIUS FORTIUS, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1999 (10 Hryvnia/1999), as well as the designation of the metal, its fineness and its weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the reverse of both coins there are depicted a jumping sportswoman and the inscriptions: СІДНЕЙ (Sydney) 2000 and XXVII / ЛІТНІ / ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ / ІГРИ (XXVII/Summer/Olympic/Games)

name: Dmytro Vyshnevetskyi (Baida)
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Dmytro Vyshnevetsky, the orthodox Prince and Cossack ataman, who in 1556 built a fortress on the Dnipro River island of Mala Khortytsia and founded the Zaporizhian Sich
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the composition similar to the whole Series of coins which embodies the National idea of the Unified Ukraine: next to the small National Emblem of Ukraine, the emblematic figures of Michael the Archistrategos and crowned lion are located, which are symbols of Kyiv and L`viv Cities. Circular inscriptions are split by baroque ornamentation: УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1999, (Ukraine/ 10 Hryvnia/ 1999), the designation of precious metal - Ag 925 and its weight in fineness - 31,1.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a figure of Vyshnevetskyi, with a bow in his hand; on the right inscribed are his Family Coat of arms and his date of death - 1563 . The conventionalized circular inscription says: ДМИТРО ВИШНЕВЕЦЬКИЙ (БАЙДА) (Dmytro Vyshnevetskyi (Baida).

name: 80 Years of Declaration of the Integrity of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 80 Years since the historic event of the declaration of Zluka (Unification) of Ukrainian People`s Republic with the Western Ukrainian People`s Republic of January 22, 1919
averseDescription: The coin is dedicated to 80 Years since the historic event of the declaration of Zluka (Unification) of Ukrainian People`s Republic with the Western
reverseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine, ornamented like folk murals. Around the coin circumference, there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, 1999. (Ukraine/ 2 hryvnia/ 1999)

name: Steppe Eagle (Aquila Rapax)
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to Aquila Rapax, the rare species of falcons which inhabits virgin Ukrainian steppe. The largest number of the birds are kept and bred in Askania Nova Zoo. Since 1980 Aquila Rapax is on the endangered-species list of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of the images of selected species of Flora and Fauna there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the four line inscriptions: on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, 1999 (Ukraine/ 2 /hryvnia/1999)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the image of Aquila Rapax in Askania steppe. Around the circumference, there are inscriptions: ОРЕЛ СТЕПОВИЙ and AQUILA RAPAX.

name: Steppe Eagle (Aquila Rapax)
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to the rare species of falcons which inhabits virgin Ukrainian steppe - Aquila Rapax, the largest number of birds are kept and bred in Askanya Nova Zoo. In 1980 Aquila Rapax has been listed in Red Book of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse set in the wreath made of the images of selected species of Flora and Fauna there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the four line inscriptions: on the silver coin: УКРАЇНА, 10, ГРИВЕНЬ, 1999 (Ukraine/ 10 /hryvnia/1999), and the designation of the metal- Ag 925, its fineness, and 31,1, the coin weight in fineness; on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, 1999 (Ukraine/ 2 /hryvnia/1999)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the image of Aquila Rapax in Askanya steppe. Around the circumference, there are inscriptions: ОРЕЛ СТЕПОВИЙ and AQUILA RAPAX.

name: Kyiv-Pechersk Assumption Cathedral
generalDescription: coins are dedicated to restoration of the Assumption Cathedral of the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra monastery, the outstanding historical and cultural monument of Ukraine of the 11th-18th centuries.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of all the coins from this series within the frame of a baroque ornament decorated with seraphim`s heads there is a depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend: on the gold coin - УКРАЇНА, 100 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 100/hryvnia/1998) and the designation of the metal- Au 900, its fineness, and 15,55, the coin weight in fineness; on the silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 10/hryvnia/1998) and the designation of the metal- Ag 925, its fineness, and 31,1, the coin weight in fineness; on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ 1998 (Ukraine/ 5 /hryvnia/1998)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of all the coins from this series there are depicted the Assumption Cathedral destroyed in 1941 and its ruins, as well as the inscription: УСПЕНСЬКИЙ СOБОР КИЄВО-ПЕЧЕРСЬКОЇ ЛАВРИ Х1 СТ.( the Kyiv-Pechersk Assumption Cathedral of the 11th century)

name: St.Michael Golden-Domed Cathedral
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the restoration of St.Michael`s Golden-Domed Cathedral, historical and architectural monument of Rus-Ukraine of the 12th-18th centuries.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within a frame made of a vegetal ornament of the Eucharist mosaic from the cathedral, there is a depiction of the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against a background of the picture of St.Michael`s Golden-Domed Cathedral, there are the silhouettes of the twelve apostles from the symbolic communion scene of the Eucharist mosaic. On the coin there is a legend: МИХАЙЛІВСЬКИЙ ЗОЛОТОВЕРХИЙ СОБОР XII СТ. (St.Michael`s Golden-Domed Cathedral, 12th century)

name: St.Michae`s Golden-Domed Cathedral
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to the restoration of St.Michael`s Golden-Domed Cathedral, historical and architectural monument of Rus-Ukraine of 12th-18th centuries
averseDescription: On the obverse of all the coins from this series within the frame made of a vegetal ornament of the Eucharist mosaic there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions: on the gold coin - УКРАЇНА, 100 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 100/hryvnia/1998) and the designation of the metal- Au 900, its fineness, and 15,55, the coin weight in fineness; on the silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 10/hryvnia/1998) and the designation of the metal- Ag 925, its fineness, and 31,1, the coin weight in fineness; on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ 1998 (Ukraine/ 5 /hryvnia/1998)
reverseDescription: On reverse of all the coins from this series against the background of the picture of the St.Michael`s Golden-Domed Cathedral, there are the silhouettes of the twelve apostles from the symbolic communion scene of the Eucharist mosaic. On the coin there is the circular inscription: МИХАЙЛІВСЬКИЙ ЗОЛОТОВЕРХИЙ СОБОР XII СТ. (St.Michael`s Golden-Domed Cathedral of the 12th century)

name: The Kyiv-Pechersk Assumption Cathedral
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to restoration of the Assumption Cathedral of the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra monastery, the outstanding historical and cultural monument of Ukraine of the 11th-18th centuries
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of all the coins from this series within the frame of a baroque ornament decorated with seraphim`s heads there is a depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend: on the gold coin - УКРАЇНА, 100 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 100/hryvnia/1998) and the designation of the metal- Au 900, its fineness, and 15,55, the coin weight in fineness; on the silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 10/hryvnia/1998) and the designation of the metal- Ag 925, its fineness, and 31,1, the coin weight in fineness; on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ 1998 (Ukraine/ 5 /hryvnia/1998)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of all the coins from this series there are depicted the Assumption Cathedral destroyed in 1941 and its ruins, as well as the inscription: УСПЕНСЬКИЙ СOБОР КИЄВО-ПЕЧЕРСЬКОЇ ЛАВРИ Х1 СТ.( the Kyiv-Pechersk Assumption Cathedral of the 11th century)

name: 50th anniversary of Declaration of Human Rights.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 50th anniversary of the Declaration of Human Rights.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the center there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine encircled by the inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 1998, 2 ГРИВНІ (Ukraine/ 1998 / 2 hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against a background of the terrestrial globe there is a depiction of the logotype of the 50 anniversary of the General Declaration on Human Rights. Around the picture, there are inscriptions separated with dots: ЗАГАЛЬНА ДЕКЛАРАЦІЯ ПРАВ ЛЮДИНИ (General Declaration on Human Rights) and ВСІ ПРАВА ЛЮДИНИ ДЛЯ ВСІХ (All human rights for all the people)

name: The Kyiv-Pechersk Assumption Cathedral
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to restoration of the Assumption Cathedral of the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra monastery, the outstanding historical and cultural monument of Ukraine of the 11th-18th centuries
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within a frame of a baroque ornament decorated with seraphim`s heads there is depicted the Small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), 5 ГРИВЕНЬ (5 Hryvnia), 1998 (on the German silver coin).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are depictions of the Assumption Cathedral, destroyed in 1941, and its ruins as well as the inscription: УСПЕНСКИЙ СОБОР КИЄВО-ПЕРЕРСЬКОЇ ЛАВРИ Х1 СТ. (the Kyiv-Pechersk Assumption Cathedral of the 11th century)

name: St.Michae`s Golden-Domed Cathedral
generalDescription: The commemorative coins are dedicated to the restoration of St.Michael`s Golden-Domed Cathedral, historical and architectural monument of Rus-Ukraine of 12th-18th centuries
averseDescription: On the obverse of all the coins from this series within the frame made of a vegetal ornament of the Eucharist mosaic there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the inscriptions: on the gold coin - УКРАЇНА, 100 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 100/hryvnia/1998) and the designation of the metal- Au 900, its fineness, and 15,55, the coin weight in fineness; on the silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 10/hryvnia/1998) and the designation of the metal- Ag 925, its fineness, and 31,1, the coin weight in fineness; on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ 1998 (Ukraine/ 5 /hryvnia/1998)
reverseDescription: On reverse of all the coins from this series against the background of the picture of the St.Michael`s Golden-Domed Cathedral, there are the silhouettes of the twelve apostles from the symbolic communion scene of the Eucharist mosaic. On the coin there is the circular inscription: МИХАЙЛІВСЬКИЙ ЗОЛОТОВЕРХИЙ СОБОР XII СТ. (St.Michael`s Golden-Domed Cathedral of the 12th century)

name: Aeneid
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 200th anniversary since the first publication of `Aeneid` poem by Ivan Kotliarevskyi (1769-1838), the founder of the new Ukrainian literatureT
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the Small State Emblem of Ukraine, surrounded by the antique and Cossack attributes: two lyres, a helmet, a sabre, a flask and a quiver with arrows. On the coin there are the following inscriptions: УКРАЇНА and 1998 ( above); 100 ГРИВЕНЬ, Au 900, designation of precious metal and 15,55, its pure weight (underneath, in two lines)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the composition, consisting of grotesque images: Aeneid and Didona, the heroes of the poem, standing near the central figure of the Cossack playing bandura (a folk Ukrainian instruments) on the background of a landscape. On the coin there are the following inscriptions: ЕНЕЇДА - above; І.КОТЛЯРЕВСЬКОГО and 200 РОКІВ - underneath, in three lines.

name: 100 Years of the Kyiv Polytechnical Institute
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 100th anniversary of Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, today the National Technical University of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine in the centre of the ornament interpreting the interior decorated the ceiling of the main institute building. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 2 /hryvnia/ 1998.)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of the main institute building (architect I.S.Kitner, 1901). Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: КИЇВСЬКИЙ ПОЛІТЕХНІЧНИЙ ІНСТИТУТ, 100 РОКІВ (the Kyiv Polytechnical Institute/100 Years)

name: 100 Years of the Kyiv Polytechnical Institute
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 100th anniversary of Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, today the National Technical University of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine in the center of a ornament interpreting the interior decorated the ceiling of the main institute building. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 2 ГРИВНІ, 1998 (Ukraine, 2 Hryvnia, 1998)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of the main institute building (architect I.S.Kitner, 1901). Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: КИЇВСЬКИЙ ПОЛІТЕХНІЧНИЙ ІНСТИТУТ, 100 РОКІВ (Kyiv Polytechnical Institute, 100 years)

name: Danylo of Halych
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Danylo of Halych (1201-1264), the Duke of the Grand Duchy of Halytsien and Volynien
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within the frame of an ornament of the capitals of 12th century Halych stone church with the emblematic figures of a bird and a lion which are the symbols of the cities of Halych and Lviv, there are depictions of the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the conventionalized four-line inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 and the indications of the precious metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of a roll there is a three-view composition, consisted of the portrait depiction of Prince Danylo, wearing the ceremonial attire of a warrior, as well as old-Rus buildings and Prince`s troops. On the coin there is a legend: ДАНИЛО ГАЛИЦЬКИЙ 1205-1264 (Danylo of Halych) (above in two lines) and КНЯЖА УКРАЇНА (Princes of Ukraine (underneath in two lines).

name: Kyi
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Prince Kyi, a legendary founder of the city of Kyiv and Kyiv state at the end of 5th-beginning of 6th centuries
averseDescription: On the coin obverse within a frame of an old-Rus ornament made in the form of an arched talisman of the 12th century, which represented the universe model among eastern Slavs, there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine and the conventionalized four-line inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 10/ Hryvnia/ 1998) and the indication of the precious metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against the background of an roll there is a three-view composition, consisted of the depiction of the Prince Kyi, figures of three brothers-riders and a woman (Kyi, Shchek, Khoryv and their sister Lybid) and a fortress upon the hill. There is a conventionalized legend on the coin: КИЙ (Kyi)(above) and КНЯЖА УКРАЇНА (Princes of Ukraine) (underneath in two line).

name: The Liberation War in the Middle of 17th Century
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 350 Years of the Liberation War in the Middle of 17th Century for independence and creation of the national state. T
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, there is the composition general for the whole series symbolizing the national idea of Unification of Ukraine: near the Small State Emblem of Ukraine there are the emblematic figures of the Holy Michael Archistrategos, the patron of Kiev and crowned lion, symbol of Lviv. Around the composition, there are conventionalized inscriptions, separated from one another with baroque ornaments and griffins depictions: УКРАЇНА and 1998 (above), 20 ГРИВЕНЬ, (underneath in two lines) and the symbol of the precious metal, its fineness and weight.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the beads circumference against a background of a sand-glass, symbol of heredity of ages, there is a depiction of a fight of Zaporizhzhia Cossack and a Polish winged Reitar. Aside of the battle scene there are rider figures: Hetman Bohdan Khmelnitsky, leader of the liberation movement and a Bandura-Cossack, bard of heroic campaigns. Around the composition there is a conventionalized inscription: ВИЗВОЛЬНА ВІЙНА СЕРЕДИНИ ХVІІ СТ.

name: Askania-Nova
generalDescription: The coin of 10 Hryvnia denomination is dedicated to the centenary of foundation of Askania-Nova, the first in Ukraine steppe reserve founded by Friedrich Falz-Fain.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the Small State Emblem of Ukraine against a background of a steppe landscape, combined from some species of local flora and fauna. Above the State Emblem, there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА and 1998. Under the picture,on the silver coin there are the following designations: 10 ГРИВЕНЬ - coin face value (in two lines); 31,1- coin weight (at the left); Ag 925 (at the right). On the coin made of German silver, there is a two line inscription: 2 ГРИВНІ beneath the picture.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a composition, made of a depiction of a stone steppe idol and a dynamic group of animals-inhabitants of the Reserve. Above the picture, around the circumference there is an inscription: АСКАНІЯ-НОВА (Askania-Nova). At the composition lower part, there is a depiction of Falz-Fain`s family emblem and an circumference inscription: 100 РОКІВ. (100 Years)

name: Askania-Nova
generalDescription: The coin of 2 Hryvnia denomination is dedicated to the centenary of foundation of Askania-Nova, the first in Ukraine steppe reserve founded by Friedrich Falz-Fain.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the Small State Emblem of Ukraine against a background of a steppe landscape, combined from some species of local flora and fauna. Above the State Emblem, there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА and 1998. Under the picture,on the silver coin there are the following designations: 10 ГРИВЕНЬ - coin face value (in two lines); 31,1- coin weight (at the left); Ag 925 (at the right). On the coin made of German silver, there is a two line inscription: 2 ГРИВНІ beneath the picture
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a composition, made of a depiction of a stone steppe idol and a dynamic group of animals-inhabitants of the Reserve. Above the picture, around the circumference there is an inscription: АСКАНІЯ-НОВА. At the composition lower part, there is a depiction of Falz-Fain`s family emblem and an circumference inscription: 100 РОКІВ. (100 Years)

name: Ascania - Nova
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the centenary of foundation of `Ascania Nova`, the first in Ukraine steppe reserve, the founder of which was Fridrich Falz-Fain.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine against a background of a steppe landscape, combined from some species of local flora and fauna. Above the National Emblem, there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and 1998. Under the picture, there is the following inscription: 2 ГРИВНІ (2 /hryvnia).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a composition, consisting of the stone steppe idol and a dynamic group of animals-inhabitants of the Reserve. Above the picture, around the circumference there is an inscription: АСКАНІЯ-НОВА. (Ascania-Nova). At the composition lower part, there is a depiction of Falz-Fain`s family emblem and a circumference inscription: 100 РОКІВ (100 Years)

name: the EBRD Annual Meeting of the Board of Governors in Kyiv in 1998
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Annual Meeting of the Board of Governors of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine within a square, made by the following inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above), 2 ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnias) (underneath), 1998 (on the left).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a logotype of the Annual Meeting of the Board of Governors of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) in Kyiv in 1998, consisting of a depiction of the monument to the legendary founders of Kyiv and the EBRD logotype within a frame of inscriptions: EBRD ANNUAL MEETING (underneath), BOARD OF GOVERNORS (at the right), KYIV MAY 1998 (at the left).

name: the EBRD Annual Meeting of the Board of Governors in Kyiv in 1998
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Annual Meeting of the Board of Governors of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) held in1998 in the city of Kyiv
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is a depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine within a square, made by the following inscriptions: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above), 2 ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnias) (underneath), 1998 (on the left).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a logotype of the Annual Meeting of the Board of Governors of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) in Kyiv in 1998, consisting of a depiction of the monument to the legendary founders of Kyiv and the EBRD logotype within a frame of inscriptions: EBRD ANNUAL MEETING (underneath), BOARD OF GOVERNORS (at the right), KYIV MAY 1998 (at the left).

name: 80 Years of Declaration of UPR Independence
generalDescription: The commemorative coin of 2 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the 80th anniversary of Declaration of Independence of Ukrainian People`s Republic by the 4th Central Rada Universal
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine. On the left and on right from the National Emblem, there is a depiction of a worker with a hammer near forge iron and a peasant woman with a sickle and sheaf against a background of a tree crown; they hold a baby - symbol of the young state. This three-figured composition is an adapted version of Heorhyi Narbut`s graphic works. Above, there is a two-line inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) 1998; underneath, there is a two-line inscription 2 ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnias).
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse at the center, there is a depiction of the Pedagogical museum - the headquarters of the Central Rada in 1917-1918. In front of the building at its both sides there are figures of two gunner-guards with rifles. Under the depiction, there is a four line legend: 80 РОКІВ З ДНЯ ПРОГОЛОШЕННЯ НЕЗАЛЕЖНОСТІ 1918. Above, around the circumference there is an inscription: УКРАЇНСЬКА НАРОДНА РЕСПУБЛІКА. All inscriptions are made with a print, developed by H.Narbut, the artist of first Ukrainian banknotes of 1917-1920

name: 80 Years of Declaration of the UPR Independence
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 80th anniversary of Declaration of Independence of the Ukrainian People`s Republic by the 4th Central Rada Universal
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small National Emblem of Ukraine. On the left and on the right from the National Emblem, there is a depiction of a worker with a hammer near the forge and a peasant woman with a sickle and sheaf against a background of tree crown; they hold a baby - a symbol of the young state. This three-figured composition is an adapted version of Heorhyi Narbut`s graphic works. Above, there is a two-line inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) 1998; underneath, there is a two-line inscription: 2 ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the centre there is depicted the Pedagogical museum - the headquarters of the Central Rada in 1917-1918. In front of the building at its both sides there are figures of two guards with rifles. Under the depiction, there is a four-line legend: 80 РОКІВ З ДНЯ ПРОГОЛОШЕННЯ НЕЗАЛЕЖНОСТІ 1918 ( 80 Years since Declaration of Independence). Above, around the circumference there is an inscription: УКРАЇНСЬКА НАРОДНА РЕСПУБЛІКА (the Ukrainian People`s Republic). All inscriptions are made with a print, developed by H.Narbut, the artist of first Ukrainian banknotes of 1917-1920.

name: Biathlon
generalDescription: The commemorative coin of 10 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the 18th Winter Olympic Games in Nagano (Japan), the participant of which was the Olympic team of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse at the center, there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine; at its sides there are depictions of snow-flakes and designations of Ag 925, the symbol of precious metal, and its weight 31,1. Above the National Emblem, there is the year of coin issue -1998. Around the circumference there is a two line legend: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10 Hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a picture of a biathloner with a gun against a background of decorative tracks. Around the circumference there is an inscription: ХVІІІ ЗИМОВІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ НАГАНО, split with snow-flakes

name: Figure Skating
generalDescription: The commemorative coin of 10 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the 18th Winter Olympic Games in Nagano (Japan), the participant of which was the Olympic team of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse at the center there is small State Emblem of Ukraine; at its sides there are depictions of snow-flakes and designations of Ag 925, the symbol of the precious metal, and its weight 31,1. Above the State Emblem there is the year of coin issue - 1998. Around the circumference there is a legend: УКРАЇНА and in two lines -10 ГРИВЕНЬ.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a picture of a figure-skater, doing a jump against a background of decorative tracks. Around the circumference there is an inscription: ХVІІІ ЗИМОВІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ НАГАНО, split with snow-flakes.

name: Ski
generalDescription: The commemorative coin of 10 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the 18th Winter Olympic Games in Nagano (Japan), the participant of which was the Olympic team of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse at the center, there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine; at its sides there are depictions of snow-flakes and designations of Ag 925, the symbol of precious metal, and its weight 31,1. Above the National Emblem, there is the year of coin issue -1998. Around the circumference there is a two line legend: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) and 10 ГРИВЕНЬ (10 Hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a picture of a skier against a background of decorative tracks. Around the circumference there is an inscription: ХVІІІ ЗИМОВІ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКІ ІГРИ НАГАНО, split with snow-flakes.

name: The 80th Anniversary of the Battle of Kruty
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 80th anniversary of the Battle of Kruty (29 January 1918), the event that came into the history of Ukraine as a heroic deed of three hundred Kyivan students, who defended the Independence of Ukrainian People`s Republic against the Bilshovyk troops.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine against the background of a multifigured composition, personifying the idea of the shot revival of the statehood: a column of the armed young people is moving through the target center, designated with three concentric circles. At the right and at the left of the picture there is an inscription: 1918-1998. Around the coin circumference there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine)(above) and 2 ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnias)- underneath in two lines.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a two-part composition, which reflects the historic moment of two forces withstanding : static figures of young heroes as personification of defense of the Independence of the Ukrainian the - at the left and a stretched arm which directs attacking mounted troops as an allegory of the Bilshovyk intervention - on the right. Around the picture there are inscriptions: 80-РІЧЧЯ БОЮ ПІД КРУТАМИ (the 80th anniversary of the Battle of Kruty) and 29.01.1918, split with a solar mark

name: The 80th Anniversary of the Battle of Kruty
generalDescription: The commemorative coin is dedicated to the 80th anniversary of the Battle of Kruty, the event that came into the history of Ukraine as a heroic deed of three hundred kyivan students, who defended the Independence of Ukrainian People`s Republic against the offensive Bilshovyk troops.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the Small National Emblem of Ukraine against the background of a multifugured composition, personifying the idea of the shot rebirth of the statehood: a column of the armed young people is moving through the target centre designated with three concentric circles. On the right and on the left of the picture there is the inscription: 1918-1998. Around the coin circumference there is the inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) - above and 2 ГРИВНІ (2 Hryvnia) - underneath in two lines.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a two-part composition, which reflects the historic moment of two forces withstanding: static figures of young heroes as personification of defense of Independence of the Ukrainian People`s Rebuplic - on the left and a stretched arm which directs attacking mounted troops as an allegory of the Bilshovyk intervention, - on the right. Around the picture there ate the inscriptions: 80-РІЧЧЯ БОЮ ПІД КРУТАМИ (80th anniversary of the Battle of Kruty) and 29.01.1918, split with a solar mark.

name: Severyn Nalyvayko
generalDescription: The commemorative coin of 20 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the memory of Severyn Nalyvayko (? - 1597), leader of Cossack-peasant uprising of 1594-1596 in Ukraine against Polish domination
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, there is the composition symbolizing the national idea of Unification of Ukraine: the emblematic figures of the Holy Michael Archistrategos, the patron of Kiev and crowned lion of Galitch and Volhyn principalities hold the Small State Emblem of Ukraine-Trident on the shield. Over the composition, there is the year of coin issue -1997. Above, around the coin external circumference there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА and - underneath in two line - 20 ГРИВЕНЬ, coin`s face value
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse at the center there is a depiction of Severyn Nalyvayko on a horse with a sword at his right hand and a torch at his left. Underneath and at the right, there are figures of armed insurgent people. At the left mat segment there is an inscription СЕВЕРИН НАЛИВАЙКО (Severyn Nalyvayko) between the external edge and the beads semicircle. At the right mat segment there is a two line inscription 1594-1596 - years of uprising under Severyn Nalyvayko`s leadership

name: Volodymyr Sosyura
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the centenary of Volodymyr Sosyura, an outstanding Ukrainian poet, State Taras Shevchenko Prize-winner (1898-1965).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem, there is the year of issue - 1998. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - above and 2 ГРИВНІ - underneath in two lines. The inscriptions are separated from one another with ornamentation.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against a background of sheets of paper with guelder-rose sprays between them, there is a portrait of Volodymyr Sosyura. Inscriptions: ВОЛОДИМИР СОСЮРА - at the left around the circumference, 1898-1965, years of poet`s birth and death - at the right in two lines and ЛЮБІТЬ УКРАЇНУ, a replica from the poet`s well-known poem - underneath, in two lines.

name: Kyiv Psalmbook
generalDescription: he coin is dedicated to the sixth centenary of the outstanding monument of the national culture (1397).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse the Small State Emblem of Ukraine is depicted over an open ancient book. Above, along the circumference, there is a stylized inscription УКРАЇНА; underneath, there is a two line inscription 100 ГРИВЕНЬ. At the left and at the right there is a legend: 1997, coin issue year, Au 900, metal and its standard and 15,55 g, gold pure weight.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse against a background of a three column arcade, the following is depicted: Jesus Christ within a circumference with abbreviations - IC - XC, the biblical King David, the Kyivan scribe Spyrydoniy - protodeacon, and a fragment of a Church Slavonic text. Above, along the circumference there is the stylized inscription: КИЇВСЬКИЙ ПСАЛТИР, beneath - the date: 1397.

name: First Anniversary of the Constitution of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the principal Law of Ukraine, adopted on June 28,1996 at the 5-th Session of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guilder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue - 1997. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - above and two line inscription 2 ГРИВНІ - underneath. The inscriptions are separated from one another with decorative signs
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of octahedron with a three line inscription: 28 ЧЕРВНЯ 1996. Above the octahedron there is a heraldic ornamentation. The whole composition is framed with beads ornamentation. Around the coin circumference there is inscription: ПЕРША РІЧНИЦЯ КОНСТИТУЦІЇ УКРАЇНИ.

name: Solomiya Krushelnytska
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 125th anniversary of Solomiya Krushelnytska, an outstanding Ukrainian singer (1872-1952).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue - 1997. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - above and 2 ГРИВНІ - underneath in two lines. The inscriptions are separated from one another with decorative signs.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a depiction of Solomiya Krushelnytska`profile portrait. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: СОЛОМІЯ КРУШЕЛЬНИЦЬКА (Solomiya Krushelnytska) - above and 1872-1952, years of birth and death-underneath.

name: Kyiv Contract Fair
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 200th anniversary of opening in Kyiv (in 1797) the Contract Fair - an important yearly event for commercial and social-political life of Ukraine at the end of 18th - beginning of 20th centuries
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the center of the composition made with conventionalized depictions of four crosswise located rolls of paper against a background of horizontal lines. On the rolls there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА, above and 20 ГРИВЕНЬ, underneath in two lines; 1997, the year of coin issue - on the left and designations of Ag 925 and 31,1, coin`s pure weight - on the right.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the center, there is a depiction of Kyiv City Council building, in which the first Contract Fair took place (from the drawing `The Facade of the old Kyiv fortress` by M.Razhen (1775-1786). On the foreground, there is the Podil embankment from Dnipro side and a moored-two-mast ship. Above on the left, there is a depiction of scales.
