Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: КИЇВСЬКИЙ КОНТРАКТОВИЙ ЯРМАРОК (Kyiv Contract Fair) - above and 200 РОКІВ (200 years)- underneath

name: Orante
generalDescription: The coin of 250 Hryvnia denomination is dedicated to the icon of the Holy Mother called Orante in the St.Sophia Cathedral in the city of Kyiv
averseDescription: On the obverse of all the coins from this series, in the center, there is a depiction of St.Sophia Cathedral, the temple of Kyiv Rus period, the pearl of the old Russian architecture of 11th century. The depiction is framed with beads decoration. Under it there are inscriptions: the period of cathedral foundation - 11th century, respective face value and the year of coin issue year. Above, around the coin circumference there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of all the coins from this series in the center of the circle made of vegetable ornament, there is a depiction of the Blessed Virgin Orante, the Cathedral`s main mosaic. The figure of the Blessed Virgin Orante splits the horizontally located inscription: Orante. Below, above the vegetable ornament, there are inscriptions of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness.

name: Orante
generalDescription: The coin of 125 Hryvnia denomination is dedicated to the icon of the Holy Mother called Orante in the St.Sophia Cathedral in the city of Kyiv
averseDescription: On the obverse of all the coins from this series, in the center, there is a depiction of St.Sophia Cathedral, the temple of Kyiv Rus period, the pearl of the old Russian architecture of 11th century. The depiction is framed with beads decoration. Under it there are inscriptions: the period of cathedral foundation - 11th century, respective face value and the year of coin issue year. Above, around the coin circumference there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of all the coins from this series in the center of the circle made of vegetable ornament, there is a depiction of the Blessed Virgin Orante, the Cathedral`s main mosaic. The figure of the Blessed Virgin Orante splits the horizontally located inscription: Orante. Below, above the vegetable ornament, there are inscriptions of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness.

name: Orante
generalDescription: The coin of 50 Hryvnia denomination is dedicated to the icon of the Holy Mother called Orante in the St.Sophia Cathedral in the city of Kyiv
averseDescription: On the obverse of all the coins from this series, in the center, there is a depiction of St.Sophia Cathedral, the temple of Kyiv Rus period, the pearl of the old Russian architecture of 11th century. The depiction is framed with beads decoration. Under it there are inscriptions: the period of cathedral foundation - 11th century, respective face value and the year of coin issue year. Above, around the coin circumference there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of all the coins from this series in the center of the circle made of vegetable ornament, there is a depiction of the Blessed Virgin Orante, the Cathedral`s main mosaic. The figure of the Blessed Virgin Orante splits the horizontally located inscription: Orante. Below, above the vegetable ornament, there are inscriptions of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness.

name: Orante
generalDescription: The coin of 500Hryvnia denomination is dedicated to the icon of the Holy Mother called Orante in the St.Sophia Cathedral in the city of Kyiv.
averseDescription: On the obverse of all the coins from this series, the center, there is depicted the St.Sophia Cathedral, the temple of Kyiv Rus period, the pearl of the old Rus architecture of the 11th century. The depiction is framed with beads decoration. Under it there are inscriptions: the period of cathedral foundation - 11th century, respective face value and the coin issue year. Above, around the coin circumference there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine)
reverseDescription: On the reverse of all the coins from this series, in the centre of the circle made of vegetal ornamentation, there is a depiction of the Blessed Virgin Orante, the Cathedral`s main mosaic. The figure of the Blessed Virgin Orante splits the horizontally located inscription ОРАНТА (Orante). Below. Above the vegetable ornament, there are indications of the metal, its fineness and the coin weight in fineness.

name: Cossack Mamai
generalDescription: The coin is the first one from a series `Heroes of Cossack Age`, presenting a gallery of characters of glorious sons of Ukraine and most important events in the country`s history of 16th-18th centuries
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted a common for this series scene which embodies the idea of Ukraine`s integrity: the small National Emblem of Ukraine supported by the stamped figures of Saint Michael Archistrategos in a knightly attire and with a spear, the patron of Kiev and a crowned lion (the symbols of the Grand Dutchy of Halytsien and Volynien respectively) and the conventionalized inscriptions: УКРАЇНА and 20 ГРИВЕНЬ, coin`s face value-underneath in two lines. All inscriptions are separated from one another with baroque ornaments and griffins depictions. On the left from the figure 20, there are designations of Аg 925 and 31,1, coin weight in fineness
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the circle made of a string of beads, there is a composition popular in 18th-20th century folk art of Ukraine: Cossack Mamai dressed in a rich coat edged with fur, sits in a Turkish way, smokes a pipe and plays the bandura. Around him there are traditional attributes of the Cossack military life of that period: a horse with a good outfit, tied to a spear with a small flag on its top, plunged into soil; a green oak-tree with a hanging sabre; a pistol and a stone powder case; high Turkish hat and a bottle of `okovyta`(Ukrainian vodka). Around the coin external circumference there are inscriptions: КОЗАК МАМАЙ (Cossack Mamai) - on the left and ЛИЦАР ВОЛІ І ЧЕСТІ (paladin of freedom and honor)- on the right. Above these inscriptions are separated with a small flag at the spear top, underneath - with a conventionalized highbush cranberry spray.

name: The Savior Cathedral in Chernihiv
generalDescription: The is dedicated to the Saint Saviour`s Cathedral, the outstanding architectural monument of Kyiv Rus, erected in 1033-1034 during the rule of Chernihiv Prince Mstyslav, a son of the Great Prince Volodymyr
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the circle made of a conventionalized vegetal ornamentation there is a fragment depiction of `Holy Teklya` fresco of 11th century. Above, there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine. Around the coin circumference there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА. Underneath - the year of issue - 1997 and in two lines: 20 ГРИВЕНЬ, the coin`s face value. The word ГРИВЕНЬ is located around the coin circumference. On the left and on the right from the figure 20 there are designations of Аg 925 and 31,1, coin weight in fineness
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in centre there is depicted the Savior Cathedral`s western facade. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: ЧЕРНІГІВ (Chernihiv)- on the left, СПАСЬКИЙ СОБОР(the Savior Cathedral`s)- above and ХI ст (11th c.)- to the right. The inscriptions are separated from one another with solar signs. Underneath, there is a ribbon with the inscription: ДУХОВНІ СКАРБИ УКРАЇНИ (Spiritual Treasures of Ukraine)

name: Yuri Kondratyuk
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 100th birth anniversary of Yuri Kondratiuk (Olexander Sharhei), an outstanding Ukrainian scientist in the field of space exploration and wind energy, one of the pioneers of rocketry and theory of space flights.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse against the background of the zodiacal star map there is the small National Emblem of Ukraine. Above the National Emblem there is the year of issue - 1996. Above, around the coin circumference there is an inscription: УКРАЇНА (Ukraine), below 2 / ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia). On the right there is the year of issue:1997.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of the scientist and the so-called `Kondratiuk` route`, the scheme of spaceship flight to the Moon, its landing on the Moon`s surface and return to the Earth. Above the portrait and on the left from it, there are conventionalized star depictions, under the portrait there are inscriptions: 1897-1942, the years of the scientist`s life. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: ЮРІЙ КОНДРАТЮК(Yuri Kondratiuk) - above and ОЛЕКСАНДР ШАРГЕЙ (Olexander Sharhei)- underneath in brackets.

name: Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra
generalDescription: The commemorative coin of 200 Hryvnias denomination is dedicated to the outstanding architectural and historical monument of Kyiv Rus and the world known center of Ukrainian spiritual culture.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, there is the depiction of Trinity Gate Church of Lavra ensemble and a fragment of its main Belfry. To its right there is a depiction of the Small State Emblem of Ukraine. Underneath around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: 200 ГРИВЕНЬ - in two lines and 1996, year of issue - above it. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - left and КИЕВО-ПЕЧЕРСЬКА ЛАВРА - right.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse at the composition upper part there are fragments of murals of the Trinity Gate Church: БОГ ОТЕЦЬ, БОГ СИН, БОГ ДУХ СВЯТИЙ with relative inscriptions in old Slavic print. Under it there is the depiction of God Mother, the patroness of Zaporizhzhia Cossacks. All images are depicted upon clouds. Underneath there is the Lavra panorama from L.Tarasevich`s engraving, first printed in the book Pateryk Pechorskiy (1702). The picture is framed with the beads circumference decoration. On both sides of the picture there are designations of Аu 900 and 15,55, coin`s pure weight

name: T.H.Shevchenko
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Taras Shevchenko, the outstanding Ukrainian poet, artist and thinker (1814-1861).
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue - 1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - above and 200 ГРИВЕНЬ - underneath in two lines
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the centre there is a portrait of T.H.Shevchenko with a poet`s autograph under it. Near the portrait there is a singing Kobzar with a guide boy near a village house. Above, around the coin circumference there is an inscription: Т.Г.ШЕВЧЕНКО 1814-1861, underneath there are designations of Аu 900 and 15,55, coin`s pure weight.

name: Coins of Ukraine
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the currency reform in Ukraine and putting into circulation the national currency - the hryvnia and kopiika - 1/100 of the hryvnia.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is depicted the small National Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with cranberry sprays. Above the Emblem there is the year of coin issue -1996. Around the coin circumference there is the inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ (National Bank of Ukraine). Under the National Emblem there is a two line inscription: ДВІ ГРИВНІ (2 hryvnia)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there are depictions of change coins of 1, 2, 5, 10, 25, 50 Kopiyka - and 1 Hryvnia denominations. Above there is a two line iscription: МОНЕТИ УКРАЇНИ (Coins of Ukraine)

name: Petro Mohyla
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 400th anniversary of Petro Mohyla (1596-1647), an outstanding Ukrainian ecclesiastical, cultural, educational and political figure of the first half of the 17th century, the Metropolitan of Kyiv and Halych, one of the founders of the first higher school in Ukraine and Eastern Europe - the Kyiv-Mohyla Collegium (later-Academy).
averseDescription: The coin is dedicated to 400th anniversary of Petro Mohyla (1596-1647), an outstanding Ukrainian ecclesiastical, cultural, educational and political figure of the first half of the 17th century, the Metropolitan of Kyiv and Halych, one of the founders
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of Petro Mohyla, made by an unknown artist of 18th century (now preserved at the National Museum of the History of Ukraine). Above the baton there is a three line inscription: ПЕТРО МОГИЛА and 1596-1647.

name: The Tithe Church
generalDescription: Jubilee coin of 2 denominations is dedicated to 1000th anniversary of the Tithe Church foundation in Kiyv, the first stone temple in Kiyv Rus
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with conventionalized vegetal ornament, there is a depiction of the God Mother Odyhitriya with a baby -a bas-relief fragment over the church portal, preserved until now. Above the God Mother depiction there is the State Emblem of Ukraine. Around the coin circumference there is an inscription УКРАЇНА, underneath there are inscriptions: 1996, the year of coin issue and in two lines: 2 ГРИВНІ, the coin face value. The whole composition is framed with the beads circumference decoration
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the centre there are the contours of the Tithe Church reconstructed after professor J.S.Aseyev to underline, that the structure does not exist in reality. These contours are presented with mirror lines on a mat background; they give an impression of emerging from the really existed foundation. On the upper coin mat surface around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: КИЇВ, ДЕСЯТИННА ЦЕРКВА, 996 , separated from one another with a conventionalized birds depiction. Underneath on the glass background there is a ribbon with an inscription: ДУХОВНІ СКАРБИ УКРАЇНИ

name: The Tithe Church
generalDescription: Jubilee coin of 20 Hryvnias denominations is dedicated to 1000th anniversary of the Tithe Church foundation in Kiyv, the first stone temple in Kiyv Rus
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with conventionalized vegetal ornament, there is a depiction of the God Mother Odyhitriya with a baby -a bas-relief fragment over the church portal, preserved until now. Above the God Mother depiction there is the State Emblem of Ukraine. Around the coin circumference there is an inscription УКРАЇНА, underneath there are inscriptions: 1996, the year of coin issue and in two lines: 20 ГРИВЕНЬ, the coin face-value. Left and right from figure 20 there are designations of Аg 925 and 31,1, coin pure weight. The whole composition is framed with the beads circumference decoration.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the centre there are the contours of the Tithe Church reconstructed after professor J.S.Aseyev to underline, that the structure does not exist in reality. These contours are presented with mirror lines on a mat background; they give an impression of emerging from the really existed foundation. On the upper coin mat surface around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: КИЇВ, ДЕСЯТИННА ЦЕРКВА, 996 , separated from one another with a conventionalized birds depiction. Underneath on the glass background there is a ribbon with an inscription: ДУХОВНІ СКАРБИ УКРАЇНИ

name: Sophiyivka
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 200th anniversary of Sophiyivka, the Uman dendrological park-reserve of the of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guilder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue - 1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - above and two line inscription 2 ГРИВНІ - underneath
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse at the field`s left part there is a fragment of the so-called Levkadia rock- huge granite cliff at the top of which Belveder observation platform is located. When looking at Levkadia rock from the side, its edge reminds on a male profile, which according to the legend is that of the Count Felix Pototskiy, the founder of the park.

name: Mykhaylo Hrushevsky
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 130th anniversary of Mykhaylo Hrushevsky (1866-1934), an outstanding Ukrainian scientist, historian, academician, public and political figure, first president of the Ukrainian People`s Republic in 1917-1918.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue -1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - above, and three line inscription 1 МІЛЬЙОН КАРБОВАНЦІВ - underneath. On the silver coin beneath the guelder-rose sprays there are designations of Аg 925 and 15,55, coin`s pure weight.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the centre there is a portrait of M.Hrushevsky, left on the background - the Central Rada House (now the Teacher Club), where the first president of the Ukrainian People`s Republic worked in 1917-1918. Around the coins circumference there are inscriptions: МИХАЙЛО - to the left, ГРУШЕВСЬКИЙ - to the right, and 1866-1934 - years of Hrushevsky`s birth and death.

name: Mykhaylo Hrushevsky
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 130th anniversary of Myhaylo Hrushevsky (1866-1934), an outstanding Ukrainian scientist, historian, academician, public and political figure, first president of the Ukrainian People`s Republic in 1917-1918.

Around the coins circumference there are inscriptions: МИХАЙЛО - to the left, ГРУШЕВСЬКИЙ - to the right, and 1866-1934 - years of Hrushevsky`s birth and death.

name: Independence
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 5th anniversary of the Independence Act adoption by the Verkhovna Rada on August 24, 1991
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue: 1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions:УКРАЇНА - above and three line inscription 2 МІЛЬЙОНИ КАРБОВАНЦІВ - underneath. Under the State Emblem there are designations of Аg 925 and 31.1, coin `s pure weight.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse at the field `s left part there is a figure of a young woman in national dress, holding a blossoming guelder-rose spray at her right hand and a wreath of laurels - at her left hand, which she holds over the relief map of Ukraine located at the coin right part. The state flag of Ukraine is depicted at the point of the map, corresponding to the capital location. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: НЕЗАЛЕЖНІСТЬ - above and 24 СЕРПНЯ 1991- underneath

name: Centennial of Modern Olympic Games
generalDescription: Jubilee coin is dedicated to Centennial of Modern Olympic Games.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the in the middle the Small State Emblem of Ukraine. To its both sides, there are conventionalized depictions of the stands and leaves of laurels. Above, there is УКРАЇНА inscription, underneath - 1996, the year of issue. Underneath, around the coins circumference there is an inscription: 2000000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ. On coin both sides from the issue date, there are designations of Аg 925 and 31,1, coin pure weight
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a fragment of ancient column with Olympic flame over its capital. Above the flame there is an inscription 1896-1996 - dates of the І and XXVI Modern Olympic Games, as well as the emblem of the National Olympic Committee of Ukraine. Above, to the column left, there is a four line inscription 100-РІЧЧЯ ОЛІМПІЙСЬКИХ ІГОР СУЧАСНОСТІ, underneath - conventionalized leaves of laurels. Coin ground is made up of lines, symbolizing stadium tracks.

name: Centennial of Modern Olympic Games
generalDescription: Jubilee coin is dedicated to Centennial of Modern Olympic Games.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the in the middle the Small State Emblem of Ukraine. To its both sides, there are conventionalized depictions of the stands and leaves of laurels. Above, there is УКРАЇНА inscription, underneath - 1996, the year of issue. Underneath, around the coins circumference there is an inscription: 200000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ

Coin ground is made up of lines, symbolizing stadium tracks.

name: First Participation in the Summer Olympic Games
generalDescription: Jubilee coins dedicated to first participation in the summer Olympic Games
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the in the middle the Small State Emblem of Ukraine. To its both sides, there are conventionalized depictions of the stands and leaves of laurels. Above, there is УКРАЇНА inscription, underneath: 1996, the year of issue. Underneath, around the coin circumference there is an inscription: 200000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the octahedron in the centre, upon which a profile of a young woman with a flower wreath is depicted - symbolic image of Ukraine, taken from the Hryhoriy Narbut banknote of 1918. Above there are figures of five ancient athletes, underneath - figures of five modern sportsmen. To the octahedron right - there is the emblem of the National Olympic Committee of Ukraine, to its left - two line inscription АТЛАНТА XXVI.

name: First Participation in the Summer Olympic Games
generalDescription: Jubilee coins dedicated to first participation in the summer Olympic Games.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the in the middle the Small State Emblem of Ukraine. To its both sides, there are conventionalized depictions of the stands and leaves of laurels. To the octahedron right - there is the emblem of the National Olympic Committee of Ukraine, to its left - two line inscription АТЛАНТА XXVI.

name: Hrygoriy Skovoroda
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to Hryhoriy Skovoroda, a great Ukrainian philosopher and scientist of the 18th century. (1722-1794)
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue -1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - above and 1 МІЛЬЙОН КАРБОВАНЦІВ - underneath in three lines. Left and right from figure 1 there are designations of Аg 925 and 15,55, coin`s pure weight.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a portrait of the outstanding Ukrainian philosopher and educator of the 18th century Hrygoriy Skovoroda. The imprint of Skovoroda`s personal seal is to the portrait`s left. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions ГРИГОРІЙ СКОВОРОДА - to the left and 1722-1794 - years of Skovoroda`s birth and death - to the right.

name: Bohdan Khmelnytsky
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to 400th anniversary of Bohdan Khmelnytsky - the Hetman of Ukraine, outstanding statesman, political and military figure of 17th century, who made significant contribution to the formation of Ukrainian statehood at one of the most dramatic periods of the liberation war of Ukrainian people in 1648-1654.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue -1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - above and 1 МІЛЬЙОН КАРБОВАНЦІВ - underneath in three lines. Left and right from figure 1 there are designations of Аg 925 and 15,55, coin pure weight
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the center there is the photographic picture of Bohdan Khmelnytsky monument at the Sophia square in Kyiv. Around the circumference there is an inscription БОГДАН on the left, ХМЕЛЬНИЦЬКИЙ - on the right, 1595-1657 - against a background of the pedestal.

name: 10 years of Chornobyl Disaster
generalDescription: The coin is sued to mark the 10th anniversary of the disaster at the Chornobyl Nuclear Power Plant.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse on the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue:1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА at the upper part and in two rows: 200000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a bell depiction in the coin centre with the inscription ЧОРНОБИЛЬ upon it. Beneath the bell there is a strip with the inscription 1986-1996. On the background there are flying cranes: three - left from the bell and two - to its right. Around the coin circumference there is an inscription: ТРАГЕДІЯ ПОДВИГ ЗАСТЕРЕЖЕННЯ. Words are separated with dots from one another and from the strip.

name: 10th anniversary of the disaster at the Chornobyl Nuclear Power Plant.
generalDescription: The coin is sued to mark the 10th anniversary of the disaster at the Chornobyl Nuclear Power Plant.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse on the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue:1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА at the upper part and 2 МІЛЬЙОНИ КАРБОВАНЦІВ at the lower part in three rows . Under the State Emblem there are designations of Аg 925 and 31.1, coin pure weight.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is a bell depiction in the coin centre with the inscription ЧОРНОБИЛЬ upon it. Beneath the bell there is a strip with the inscription 1986-1996. name: Lesya Ukrainka
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 125th anniversary of Lesya Ukrainka (Larysa Petrivna Kosach) - the outstanding Ukrainian poetess and public figure.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue -1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: at the coin upper part - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ and at the coin lower part:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Lesya Ukrainka portrait is depicted. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: ЛЕСЯ УКРАЇНКА - to the left and 1871-1913 - years of poetess birth and death - to the right

name: 50th Anniversary of the United Nations
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 50th Anniversary of the United Nations
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue - 1995. Around the coins circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - at the coins upper part and 2 МІЛЬЙОНИ КАРБОВАНЦІВ or 200000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ - at the lower part. On the silver coin under the State Emblem of Ukraine there are designations of Аg 925 and 31,1, the coin pure weight
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the globe with flags of world states upon it and UN-50 - emblem. Around the coins circumference, there are inscriptions: NATIONS UNITED FOR PEACE - at the upper part and НАЦІЇ, ОБ ЄДНАНІ ЗАРАДИ МИРУ - at the lower part.

name: 50th Anniversary of the United Nations
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to 50th Anniversary of the United Nations
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue - 1995. Around the coins circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - at the coins upper part and 2 МІЛЬЙОНИ КАРБОВАНЦІВ or 200000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ - at the lower part. On the silver coin under the State Emblem of Ukraine there are designations of Аg 925 and 31,1, the coin pure weight.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is the globe with flags of world states upon it and UN-50 - emblem. Around the coins circumference, there are inscriptions: NATIONS UNITED FOR PEACE - at the upper part and НАЦІЇ, ОБ ЄДНАНІ ЗАРАДИ МИРУ - at the lower part.

name: Lesya Ukrainka
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to 125th anniversary of Lesya Ukrainka (Larysa Petrivna Kosach) - an outstanding Ukrainian poetess and public figure.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue -1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: at the coin upper part - НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ and at the coin lower part:
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse Lesya Ukrainkas portrait is depicted. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: ЛЕСЯ УКРАЇНКА - to the left and 1871-1913 - years of poetess birth and death - to the right.

name: Hero-City of Kyiv
generalDescription: Jubilee coins of 200,000 Ukrainian karbovanets denomination dedicated to the Ukrainian hero-cities Kyiv.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. There are per five leaves and three bunch of berries on each spray. Upper bunch consists of seven berries, middle - of five, lower - of six berries. Above the State Emblem, there is the year of issue -1995. Beneath the small State Emblem, there ia a two line inscription 200000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ, the coin face value (200000 number is split by the beads ornamentation). Around the coin circumference, between the external edge and the beads ornamentation, there is an inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ split with rhombic separative marks from the word КАРБОВАНЦІВ.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the center, against a background of the Dnipro river and the left bank city district there are a depiction of the main fragment of memorial complex Park of Eternal Glory - Obelisk of Glory at the grave of Unknown soldier and the part of the Path of Perished Heroes with graves of defenders and liberators of Kyiv. There are depictions of the Savior Church at Berestovo, Great Belfry of Kiev-Pechersk Lavra, of trees and decorative bushes to the Obelisk right side. To its left there is a chestnut spray with three floscules. Around the circumference there is the inscription: МІСТО - at the upper part and 1941-1945 - at the lower part.

name: Hero-City of Sevastopol
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Ukrainian hero-city of Sevastopol
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. There are per five leaves and three bunch of berries on each spray. Upper bunch consists of seven berries, middle - of five, lower - of six berries. Above the State Emblem, there is the year of issue -1995. Beneath the small State Emblem, there ia a two line inscription 200000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ, the coin face value (200000 number is split by the beads ornamentation). Around the coin circumference, between the external edge and the beads ornamentation, there is an inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ split with rhombic separative marks from the word КАРБОВАНЦІВ
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the center there is depicted an Obelisk to the Hero-city of Sevastopol, erected on the high bank of the North Bay in honour of the perished warriors of Special Prymorsk Army, seamen of the Black Sea Navy, emergency volunteers and fighter battalion warriors , who had heroically defended the city against German-fascist invaders for 250 days - from November 1941 till July 1942. To the obelisk left against a background of sea waves, there is a monument to ships, sank when defending Sevastopol in 1854-1855. To the right there is a depiction of three rows of sea waves with a modern warship silhouette above them. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: МІСТО-ГЕРОЙ СЕВАСТОПОЛЬ - at the upper part and 1941-1945 - under the Obelisk.

name: Hero-City of Kerch
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Ukrainian hero-city of Kerch
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. There are per five leaves and three bunch of berries on each spray. Upper bunch consists of seven berries, middle - of five, lower - of six berries. Above the State Emblem, there is the year of issue -1995. Beneath the small State Emblem, there ia a two line inscription 200000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ, the coin face value (200000 number is split by the beads ornamentation). Around the coin circumference, between the external edge and the beads ornamentation, there is an inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ split with rhombic separative marks from the word КАРБОВАНЦІВ
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the center there are depictions of an Obelisk of Glory at the top of the Mitridat Hill, erected in honour of the perished warriors of Special Prymorsk Army, seamen of the Black Sea Navy and Azov battle fleet, as well as, citizens of the city, who perished when defending the Crimea against German-fascist invaders. On the background, a sea is depicted with two wavy lines, split by the Obelisk. Above the sea level, to the Obelisk left there is a light cloud, to the right on the skyline -a sea tanker with a sea-gull above it. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: МІСТО-ГЕРОЙ КЕРЧ - at the upper part and 1941-1941 - under the obelisk.

name: Hero-City of Odesa
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the Ukrainian hero-city of Odesa.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. There are per five leaves and three bunch of berries on each spray. Upper bunch consists of seven berries, middle - of five, lower - of six berries. Above the State Emblem, there is the year of coin issue -1995. Beneath the small State Emblem, there is a two line inscription: 200000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ, the coin face value (200000 number is split by the beads ornamentation). Around the coin circumference, between the external edge and the beads ornamentation, there is an inscription: НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ split with rhombic marks from the word: КАРБОВАНЦІВ.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the centre there is a depiction of the monument for an Unknown Seaman erected at Shevchenko Central recreation Park in honour of the perished warriors of Special Prymorsk Army, seamen of the Black Sea Navy, Odesa division of emergency volunteer corps who defended Odesa for 73 days against regular troops of Hitler Germany and its allies in August-October 1941. Left and right from the monument, against a background of sea waves there are depictions of a fragment of seaport with port cranes, a ship near the moorage and Odesa lighthouse, respectively. At the coin upper part there are silhouettes of three flying sea-gulls: one - to the obelisk left side, another - to its right. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: МІСТО-ГЕРОЙ ОДЕСА - at the upper part and 1941-1945 - at the lower part.

name: Bohdan Khmelnytsky
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to 400th anniversary of Bohdan Khmelnytsky - the Hetman of Ukraine, outstanding statesman, political and military figure of 17th century, who made significant contribution to the formation of Ukrainian statehood at one of the most dramatic periods of the liberation war of Ukrainian people in 1648-1654
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue -1996. Around the coin circumference there are inscriptions: УКРАЇНА - above and 1 МІЛЬЙОН КАРБОВАНЦІВ - underneath in three lines. Left and right from figure 1 there are designations of Аg 925 and 15,55, coins pure weight.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the center there is the photographic picture of Bohdan Khmelnytsky monument at the Sophia square in Kyiv. Around the circumference there is an inscription БОГДАН on the left, ХМЕЛЬНИЦЬКИЙ - on the right, 1595-1657 - against a background of the pedestal.

name: 50th anniversary of Victory in the Great Patriotic War 1941-1945
category: Перемога у Великій Вітчизняній війні 1941-1945 рр.
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 50th anniversary of Victory in the Great Patriotic War.
averseDescription: On the coin obverse there is the Small State Emblem of Ukraine in the middle of the beads circumference decoration, framed with guelder-rose sprays. Above the State Emblem there is the year of issue -1995. The two-line inscription 200000 КАРБОВАНЦІВ, the coin face value, is beneath the small State Emblem (200000 number is split by the beads ornamentation). Between the external edge and the beads ornamentation, around the circumference there is an inscription НАЦІОНАЛЬНИЙ БАНК УКРАЇНИ split with rhombic separative marks from the word КАРБОВАНЦІВ.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse there is in the center the Sophia square ensemble in Kiev - St.Sophia cathedral and the Bohdan Khmelnytsky monument. Against a background of the Cathedral, to the right there is the figure of a young woman with flowers in national attire - symbol of young independent Ukraine, who is bending her head in front of eternal flame of peoples memory on all perished at the Great Patriotic War. Around the circumference at the coin upper part there is an inscription ПЕРЕМОГА У ВЕЛИКІЙ ВІТЧИЗНЯНІЙ ВІЙНІ. Beneath the horizontal line there is the inscription 1941-1945
